Reviews.Title: “Superior Location!”
Reviews.Author: littlefilly15
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. Totally pleased with location....safe and quiet yet still very convenient to LOTS of stuff...not just the parks, but places like Publix (for food) and Walmart (for those forgot to pack necessities)... Newer condo with all the amenities you need...washer/dryer/fridge with ice/water dispenser...dishwasher, coffeemaker, DVD player for movies... CLEAN. Highly recommend this resort - easy to get in and out of condo -plus supplied with a notebook with handy tips and phone numbers.... Wifi worked great. Can't think of a thing I would change. Did not have the added amenities package -so no access to Pool or the free brunch... not a problem for us as we are mature ladies with no small children to entertain! We could see the pool area from our room and it looked very nice - not too crowded with lots of chairs.... (tried to upload some photos of room but this site would not work)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: recman1515
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th year my family and I have stayed at WorldQuest Orlando Resort. We have found the three bedroom condos to be spacious, clean and very comfortable. They units though very nice are beginning to show some age as the tv's are old and not a lot of choices for stations. They now have added free WiFi which is a bonus. The room rates are in the top 90% for affordability. Every year we check rates and find that WorldQuest Resort has the best price hands down. My family and I though we do travel to the local Disney parks find WorldQuest so appealing is because the pool area is not over crowded during the day. We love just to relax by the pool and take in the warm weather. The pool area is large and our favorite place to hang out. However, we have noticed each year that we return the pool does not seem to be as well kept as it use to be. The management staff should pay closer attention to having the pool cleaned more often and the paint is chipping all around the edges. For a family who comes to Florida from New Hampshire where it is cold, we want a nice pool that is clean. Our first night we were put in a condo unit on the ground floor. For the first time we witnessed three very large mice running near our screened porch and one was outside our front door. That was very unsettling for my wife and daughters and requested a move. To the staff's credit, they moved us. The management needs to address the mice problem on the grounds as we were not the only guests who noticed. Mice were seen running around the pool area on several ocassions. Don't get me wrong, my family and I would recommend this resort to anyone and we would not hesitate to return. We will pay close attention to the pool area and mice issues next year. We believe WorldQuest Resort deserves the chance to address these problems and correct them before we decide not to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: RedirectedNLife
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Worldquest Resort on April 15-20th. Our family was composed of me, my husband, and my two sons, ages 2 and 9. I really appreciated the security guards that were in place. It did make me feel a little safer for them to actually have to check my name off of an incoming guests list, to make sure that I was supposed to be there. The grounds and complex are beautiful. We had a two bedroom and two bath suite. It was more than enough room for the 4 of us. We stayed in building 7, with a view of the lake. All of the tvs were flat screens. The screened in patio was very nice with ample space to move around. My only complaint was the amount of hair that was in our suite. It was very evident that the floors had not been swept or vacuumed in a while. When our sheets were pulled back, there were strands of long black hair them. I called the front desk and told them that I had hair on my sheets, and asked them for more. Approximately 30-45 minutes later, the security guard brought more sheets to me. There were also strands of hair on the floor of the bathroom, on the walls of the shower, and on a few towels . Perhaps the person that cleaned was in a hurry and took some shortcuts? Anyway, the next morning, I swept and vacuumed the floors, washed the sheets, and washed the towels. Once we got past this issue, everything else was very nice. We did not partake of the breakfast. We elected to make breakfast in the suite each day. The kitchen utensils were quite adequate. We did not elect for housekeeping during our stay, but they did pick up the trash daily. Even though I had read about how close the hotel was from Disney, I was still surprised when we got there so fast. We were also one exit away from Downtown Disney. All in all, this is a very nice place. There were just a few minor issues that could have easily been fixed. We wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Central Hotel with great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Ceirion P
Reviews.Content: Having been to Orlando a couple of time we thought we would try Worldquest resort. As there was 5 of us we went for the 3 bedroom suit which I have to admit was very impressive. Big bedrooms with a large corner spa bath. Full kitchen with dishwaser, washing machine and dryer. Yes some of the paintwork could of been refreshed and the TV's were not flat screen but had cable, but this was not an issue at all. The resort itself was a great size, not to big as some can be and the pool was lovely with a hot spa outside. The staff were all very friendly and as it was off all the main roads was nice and quiet. The free breakfast buffet was a pleasant start of the day, it was a cold buffet and included, fruit, cakes, toast, bagals and cereals with tea and coffee, although some guest did like to take advantage of this and were leaving with boxes full of stuff, I guess you always get them. There is a lack of a restaurant although there was a pool bar which sold snacks and the shop is very limited but with the location being so close to everything shops were close by. The position of the hotel was great only 2 km from Disney and one easy road made it easy and simple. We have stayed in more expensive Orlando hotels but next time we will be returning to this one.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Hoped and More”
Reviews.Author: Badgfan
Reviews.Content: Like many others who are scrambling to make ends meet, I worked a 2nd job to fund a long overdue vacation with my grown children. With that, comes an even heavier pressure to choose the "perfect spot". I am not usually very lucky, but I hit it "perfectly" by choosing the WorldQuest Orlando Resort. The condo was perfect from the cleanliness and size to the view and location. The service was as close to flawless as I have ever experienced. Staff from the front desk to the helpful onsite Disney connection were never without a smile in their voice and genuinely happy to assist you. The pool was absolutely gorgeous and HUGE-no one was ever tripping over another. The setting was off the main roads which was an added bonus but not too far off that you had to think too hard when venturing to/from Orlando and Disney. I was so happy and relieved that I found a place that I didn't have to worry about anything and one that would make our long awaited vacation a very memorable one!! Thank you to all at Worldquest! We will definitely be back! Stop spending even more time searching for the perfect place and choose Worldquest. This is it!! You WON'T be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING ACCOMDATIONS”
Reviews.Author: Arlene T
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the World Quest April 20, April 21, and April 22. We hated to leave. We had a two-bedroom, two bath suite. There was two adults and three children. There was plenty of room. We even had a washer and dryer. We left on Sunday, wishing we could stay. My only complaints are the fee for maid service. There is a $39.00 per night fee, plus an additional fee if you want extra toiletries. I think this should be standard as in all other hotels. One other complaint are the TVs. No flat screens.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family vaca”
Reviews.Author: FLway
Reviews.Content: The hotel is made up of 2 or 3 bedroom suites great way for groups to vaca together and save money without giving up luxury decor very nice with great amount of space

Reviews.Title: “Really completes a great vacation in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: soekotjo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WorldQuest Orlando resort for 9 nights this April 2012. It was a great stay, couldn't complain. We got a 3 bedroom, and it was really roomy and well appointed. The beds are somewhat soft for our taste, but comfy nonetheless. The kitchen comes complete with utensils, plates and pans. It's really like coming home, except tidier, ha! The master bathroom with jetted tub is awesome, and our kids really love taking turns in it. Having a washer and dryer is really convenient, we only had to pack half of what we would have if we didn't have a washer and dryer. The units are air conditioned, and the patio is completely covered by bug screens, so we can leave the patio door open anytime we're in the unit and it's not too hot out, instead of turning on the AC. They charge a per-day resort fee and end-of-stay fee, which, as far as I know, is standard for resort type accommodations. They also gave 4 different options to have daily cleaning, from just removing the trash for no charge, to a complete hotel-like service for about $40 a day. Pretty expensive for a full service, but we went for a middle-of-the-road option. Parking is plenty and free. Wireless internet is pretty fast and reliable, didn't have any dropped connection while we were there. They have free breakfast, and it was great. The food is great, although not too varied. Bread, bagels, muffins, cinnamon rolls, apples, oranges, coffee, juices. But they always quick to restock whenever any of the food runs out (except for the fruits which they seem to sometime run out of, but rarely). Breakfast runs from 6:30 to 9:30, and even though you get there at 9:29, they'd still have food for you. Location is great, but every other reviewers have already said that :) What can I say, it really made our vacation complete.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay with a large family”
Reviews.Author: Mirggus
Reviews.Content: We were welcomed by friendly staff. Room was clean and large enough. Beds were ok. Pool area is very nice. Staff in pool bar could have been more interested in their work.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Large Family”
Reviews.Author: Tosca3
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with 4 children. Our condo was spacious and sufficiently clean. Loved the large kitchen. Some of the small appliances were not working and when we complained, housekeeping brought us a new appliance! Great service! The price was so right - compared to what we would have had to pay in something comparable in WDW. The drive to Disney was super short. We would definitely return, esp now with 5 children!

Reviews.Title: “Best thing for families.”
Reviews.Author: monikajanul
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at Worldquest,but my first spring break.Even tho parks were packed we didn't feel it at the hotel.Pool wasn't crouded at all.The only thing I wish is that you could reserve specific room.The hotel tells wich suite you going to get,but I will stay in this hotel any time I'm downthere.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Family Resort”
Reviews.Author: WTMADCITY
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the 3 bedroom suite, arrived 2 hours early and were able to check in & get right to the pool with the kids. Suites are spacious, incredibly clean and the pool area was very nice; towels and kids toys provided. The resort is close to Disney, shopping and restaurants - we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a three bedroom unit which was very nice and comfortable. The coffee pot wasn't working properly and I needed a robe, both which were brought promptly. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value accommodation”
Reviews.Author: lazyboy52
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a few places of this type in the area and they are very similar in terms of the living space and equipment. The negatives were minor ones really and did not detract from the holiday. We do make use of the kitchen and therefore the equipment side is important to us. The actual facilities (cooker, oven, fridge etc) were fine and of the same standard as experienced elsewhere. The actual cooking utensils and similar items were not so great and there were some items like serving spoons that were simply not there. However if all you want are the very basics to heat up and serve prepared stuff and so on it is fine. We had a 3 bedroomed apartment for the extra space although we only needed two bedrooms for the extra space which worked well and we were at the far end of the resort which was generally very quiet and worked well for us. We had the full service option which was fine, on reflection we probably could have reduced the days we had this and saved a few dollars but the fact there are options is good. We thought the pool area was nice and well maintained and I have to say all the staff we dealt with were very helpful and responded to requests in a positive fashion, it had a much more laid back feel than similar places we have been to. There was a maintenance problem with a toilet that took two visits to fix but in fairness the response was prompt on both instances. As mentioned there were some items missing from the kitchen but these were speedily attended to. The wi fi worked great and again a minor gripe was having to buy business centre time to simply do an online check in and print boarding cards when many hotels offer this service for free as a customer service perk now. Great location for the Disney Parks and well located for the shopping outlets and easy route to Orlando International Airport, but a car is essential as nothing else is really close by. There are some similar properties at the southern end of I drive where the Lynx and I trolley just provides another option rather than driving. If it just had the I trolley/Lynx connection as well that would be really great. Overall, I would definitely consider it again as a good option for a flexible place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: jkg3602
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while visiting Disney and Universal. Great location! We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit. Absolutely fantastic. It was spotless (my son actually ran into the slider thinking it was open- ouch) It was so spacious. The screened in balcony was fantastic! Truly a great place to stay. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, spacious apartments close to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: Hanne S
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest Orlando Resort is a resort with spacious, clean, well equipped, but also affordable apartments. We have been travling with two small kids, and the only thing the resort is missing is a litle more child-friendly outdoor area. There is no children's pool, and no playground, but the kids had a good time in the pool that are 3-5 feet deep. The apartments were equiped with vacuum cleaner, dishwasher, washing machine and tumbledryer, and it is possible to stay for weeks without housekeeping, witch is opitonal. This time we stayed at a two-bedroom-apartmetent, and there really was a lot of space! The only negative about the rooms, are the noise from the ac. Service is very good, 24-h-open front desk, smiling and helpfull staff! It's a short drive to the Disney parks, but Seaworld and Premium Outlets aren't too far away either. We have been at this resort several times before, and might come back again.

Reviews.Title: “So close to Disney - Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: 2BOYSMOM44
Reviews.Content: WOW! Were we thrilled with this resort! The rate was awsome, the room was spotless and it was about a mile from Magic Kingdom. Our room was a 3 bedroom with 2 baths, kitchen, dining table, sitting area and balcony with table and chairs. You can bring whatever you like if you want to cook. There is a full refrigerator/freezer and many cooking implements. We did not partake in the breakfast. Although we did not use the pool it was very nice looking. We stayed one night and would definitely stay again. The rate was extremely reasonable compared to Disney resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great location”
Reviews.Author: FamilyFun9920
Reviews.Content: Located near all of the Disney resorts and Seaworld, we loved the location. It took only a few minutes each day to get to and from the major parks. Food at the pool is slow and below average if you need to eat, but rooms are a nice size and well equiped and appointed for a family vacation. The "free" breakfast is limited but enough to get you started on your busy day. We would go back especially at the huge price discount they offer relative to Disney resorts for example. The lovation was so close that we did 7 different parks and only ever needed a half a tank of gas for the entire trip!

Reviews.Title: “Return stay to World Quest”
Reviews.Author: boilerbetty
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at World Quest Orlando. Our first stay here a year ago was more pleasant than the second. The place is nice enough and the 3-bedroom condo has plenty of room. They have a free continental breakfast but it is the same everyday. Also there is no water to drink or ice at breakfast. The pool was dirty the entire week and was never cleaned during our stay, it was spotless during our stay a year ago. I reserved months ahead of time and asked for a room close to the pool in building 1 or 2. We got building 3 and were as far from the pool as possible in building pool having a pond view. The cleaning crew does a good job when you can get them to come to your room. There were several days I had to call multiple times to the front desk to ask for the service because housekeeping didn't come by that day. I did get hurt while in a public area at the hotel and it was the hotel's fault. The manager took over 30 minutes to come and see me and then demanded I fill out an incident report, when I just wanted to return to my room and lay down. She treated me as if I was a nuisance and it was my fault I was nearby when something broke. I wasn't offered ice for the rapidly swelling bruise or anything, my husband ran to the bar by the pool and got ice for me. Very rude. All in all, we might return someday but only if we couldn't find somwhere better first.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly L
Reviews.Content: Went to Orlando with my parents, husband and two kids last week. Had read some shady reviews about the Calypso Cay Resort and didn't want to take any chances. I found WorldQuest online by doing a little research and was so glad we switched. First of all, the facility is beautiful and the pool was a huge highlight for our boys. Staff was very pleasant and check-in and out was a breeze. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit which suited all of our needs and having the kitchen and our own separate bathrooms was a joy! Very quiet facility. Nice to not hear the noise from the other rooms and nice to be away from the crowds of people after a full day at disney. The shuttle service was superb and free! Insiders tip - we had an amazing taxi driver on the days we did not take the shuttle. His name is Van{not sure how to spell it} and he drives a van! He was one of the highlights of our trip. He was a super driver and took such good care of us. Drove us out to the Space Center{45 minute drive each way} and was there promptly to pick us up. Took us to a great restaurant for dinner{Golden Corral} great food and cheap! He is such a nice, hard working man. Taxi drivers must pay to lease their vehicles and he pays $1500.00 per week for his van. Gas not included. He works over 18 hours a day. So if you are going to Orlando, please request him. He is a sweetheart!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney vacation can't get much better!!”
Reviews.Author: gfsmonteiro
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at the WorldQuest Resort, and we couldn't be happier about the experience. First of all are the great room rates. Very competitive in comparison with other resorts in the same vicinity. Secondly was the proximity to Disney and other attractions. A five minutes drive to the Disney gates, and 15 minutes to Universal Studios. Thirdly, the convenience: There's a Seven Eleven, a CVS and a big Walmart, just around the corner at Vineland ave. There's also an Outlet Mall very close by, plus the big Orlando Premium Outlet a short drive away. Finally, the room and amenities: We stayed at a 3-bedroom 3-bathroom in building 4 of the complex. The room was amazing and as a special touch there was a handy welcome kit in the apartment when we arrived, which included four bottles of water and snacks. The staff was always very nice and the breakfast very efficient, although at times the breakfast area was really crowded. Kudos also for the apartment location, right in front of a lake and with a side view to the pool area. the apartment was very private and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Disney vacation home away from home”
Reviews.Author: bjuniper
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay with family. We were travelling with our daughter, son-in law, and 2 grandsons, 7 and 11 yrs. old. The 3 bedroom unit was perfect- bathroom for everyone, lots of room in the kitchen and living room area, clean, and convenient to the pool after walking around Disney World all day. Both pool and hot tub were clean, and heated, so even in the cool of the evening they could be enjoyed. Pool was open till 11 p.m. unlike many other resorts. Great shuttle service as well. I would certainly return on another visit to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax after long days at theme parks”
Reviews.Author: Cindy K
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest Orlando was the perfect property for our family trip to Orlando. I found them on Facebook while I was looking for places to stay in Orlando, and saw that their guests gave them a lot of positive feedback on there, and they offered 15% off for booking through that page. We were even happier once we arrived and saw the beautiful resort atmosphere. The condo style units were perfect for our family because our two teenagers had their own rooms to retreat to after long days at the theme parks together! Having a full kitchen not only saved us a lot of money, but allowed us to have relaxing quiet dinners on our private patio. We spent a day and many evenings at the pool and enjoyed the Tiki Bar and the friendly staff. It was so nice to be so close to Disney, but be able to escape and relax from the hecticness too. We can't wait to return, and would highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very roomy and great location”
Reviews.Author: VRBWestRiverMaryland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the World Quest Resort for three nights with our 9 year old grand daughter. This is a condo property and our two bedroom unit was very roomy and clean. Our unit had a large screened in balcony and full kitchen. We were on the fourth floor and overlooked the lake. The large pool was in a great location and was gated as was the front entrance of the property. We did know there were neighbors upstairs but nothing bothersome. We did have to ask for house cleaning after our 2nd day there. This property is located within a couple miles of the Disney Parks and there are many restaurants within a couple miles of this property as well. To sum it up the condo is in good shape,nicely appointed, has great views of the lake, roomy bedrooms, baths, kitchen and living space and is in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: ClevelandOHLisa
Reviews.Content: The room was so large & very very clean. They respond promptly to needs - like clogged toilet & extra pillow. We were very pleased to find the pool was heated this time! It was wonderful!! It is unbelievably close to everything Disney. Noticed at breakfast - there is a tremendous amount of international travelers staying there. Must be because of all the positive TA reviews Its not a resort that offers organized activities -but it doesn't need to - you are in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: Gill B
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed here for two weeks ,it is a great place! We were on the 5th floor in block 7 ,had a great view over the lake .The condo was huge and very clean ,any thing we requested the staff were so helpful ,The breakfast was so handy ,eat and go to the parks, there were cakes , toast fruit etc just enough to start the day. We will recommend this resort to our friends it is great value . The one thing that would improve it is if there were maybe a table tennis and a pool table near the pool area ,We timed it to Disney it takes 6mins by car ,from the balcony you can see the fireworks at Epcot . The condos are extremely good value for money no need to stay in Disney !

Reviews.Title: “Great Condo Property”
Reviews.Author: WebBrown
Reviews.Content: I was stunned when I walked into my 3 bedroom condo. There was more than enough space to accomodate me, my wife, my mom, and my two daughters. The condo was very up to date and included a screened in patio which was a great touch. The master bath was gigantic and modern. The 2nd bathroom tub could have used some TLC but this would have been my only criticism. I stayed in building 6, unit 101. I did not use the continental breakfast or pool, so I can't comment on those items. The property is literally right down the road from the entrance to Disney, so location can't be beat. The staff were very professional and accomodating as well. I think people are crazy if the pay Disney prices to stay on property when then can have a spacious condo at Worldquest right down the road. And the prices are rediculously low for the condos as well when compared to Disney I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “March 19 - 23 2012 spring break”
Reviews.Author: KetchieThoughts
Reviews.Content: We had room 303 in Building 1 @ WorldQuest. The view from the balcony was awesome overlooking the interior courtyard of the pool.Our room looked just like the pictures, very happy with the suite. One room had twin beds (very comfy mattresses) and the master bedroom had a king bed. Nice. Good: The accomodations were great. acceptable small "hotel gym". HUGE beautiful pool, well maintained. Gave us the room we requested. Everything we needed for kitchen was there. Good shuttle times to the disney property. Make sure you know where exactly the pick up is. After a full day at park easy to get confused, who knew there were two parking lots #35? Not-the-best: Food prices there are horrendous...but Walmart is within 15 minutes, so is SuperTarget. Bring your own shampoo/conditioner theirs is awful. The breakfast food was all bread-type. Coffee was so-so. Good juices though! We would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great lodging for your DisneyWorld trip”
Reviews.Author: TeamLee
Reviews.Content: If you have a family of four, especially with little ones, then this resort is for you. For practically half the price of Disney resorts, you can get a spacious, 1200 sq. ft. condo (2 bdr/ 2 bath) with a full kitchen. Whether you're a budget traveler or not, this resort maintains a high standard for quality. Here are the main advantages: * Great price compared to Disney resorts: value, value, value. * Just a 10-minute car ride to the Disney theme parks. * Daily continental breakfast (bagels, muffins, cereal, juice, coffee, tea) * Close to Publix and WalMart for all of your grocery/ misc needs * Heated swimming pool for some great down time away from Disney (although it wasn't heated enough...still a little chilly) Be aware that daily housekeeping is extra. They will empty out your garbage though everyday. Also, just an FYI: the TVs are not flat screen. That was the only thing that was not updated. Tips: * If being close to the pool is important to you, stay in bldg 1 or 2. Be warned, however, that if you do stay in either bldg, it might get a little noisy esp when it's hot and everyone is lounging around the pool. * If you will be cooking in the kitchen, then you will definitely need to bring a few extra items. See the picture of the kitchen inventory. Some of the things that you may want to bring are a good chef's knife, a 12" skillet, and kitchen shears. Other items include aluminum foil, saran wrap, extra dishwasher detergent, laundry detergent, dishwashing liquid and sponge. We really enjoyed our trip and will definitely stay here again on our next Disney vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: RobertNorwalk_CT
Reviews.Content: Just spent four nights at Worldquest Resort in Orlando. Biggest upside(s) are the size of the accomodations and general air of luxury. Biggest downside (for me) was proximity to a busy highway whose noise put a big dent in the enjoyment of the screened deck.Be sure to try to secure a space that faces interior of the property. Buildings are beautifully archetected in a Mediterrranian style, with exceptionally high ceilings that add to the feeling space. Apartment (mine was a 3-bedroom, 2-bath) was spotlessly clean, and grounds are meticulously maintained. Overall cost (net of two bar drinks) came to $170 per night all-in, which was reasonable for the space this time of year. Swimming pool is large and elegant, with plenty of lounge chairs and shade umbrellas. Water too cold for my taste, but adjoining hot tub was just right. Pool-side bar is pricey, though. Small details worth considering: A vent port above the master bedroom door transmits both sound and light from the adjoining living room. For some, this could raise a comfort and privacy concern. Also, there's no closet in the master bedroom--the closet is in the incredibly large bathroom. Bedroom could use a more commodious dresser. Also, be warned that the apartments are cleaned so completely that you'll need to bring certain essentials, most notably paper towels, coffee-maker filters (flat basket type), laundry soap and dishwash detergent. Wouldn't hurt to bring your own bath soap and shampoo either. Although the web site brags about their onsite convenience store, they didn't have anything I needed (realy it's just a tiny commissary). Shopping is a two-mile drive away, at least. Biggest location advantage is proximity to Disney World (without having to pay the freight of a Disney hotel). Note though that while disney world property is less than three miles away, actually getting to a parking space is a good half hour trip from your start at Worldquest, and getting into the park is another half hour after that. Plan accordingly. (Universal is about 25 minutes away, plus the usual entrance delays.) If you're planing to visit the parks, buy your tickets online to save time and money, and be sure to get an early start to make the most of your (large) investment.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest Orlando - home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Chris H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the World Quest Orlando resort several times over the past few years. We have 3 children and love visiting Disney World and the surrounding attractions. Although we normally travel later in the summer, we got "Spring Fever" early this year and decided to to take a long weekend to visit our favorite escape from Atlanta in February. As usual, we had a top-notch experience at World Quest. The staff is very friendly, and the rooms have always been impeccably clean. We especially like the tiled floors and always select a 3 bedroom unit. We had stayed at more traditional hotels in prior years but found that for essentially the same price, we are able to stay in a condo unit and have a much more comfortable experience. It is essentially a "home away from home", complete with a full kitchen and washer/dryer. The kids especially like the large pool. It's kept very clean, and my wife and I like to sit in the shade and sip drinks from the Tiki Hut bar. I highly recommend World Quest to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Felt as if we were badgered to leave”
Reviews.Author: Joni010
Reviews.Content: I want to provide both the pros and the cons of the resort: Pros: 1. The rooms were lovely and spacious. 2. Well decorated 3. Felt as if you were in an apartment or condo 4. The kitchen was well stocked if you had a desire to cook or have meals without going out. 5. The pool area was nice. 6. A gated property where your parking tag as displayed to enter and exit the facility 7. Breakfast was provided. 8. Excellent proximity to the parks 9. A safe for valuables. 10. Screened in patio that allowed our granddaughter to be outside without the fear of her falling over. Cons: 1. I requested an early check-in. I called upon landing at 10:30 and was told to call again at 2:00. I arrived at the property at 3:00 and waited in a rather small lobby with several other disgruntled families waiting for their room. Was not assigned a room until closer to 4:00. There was only one person checking in a line of people. When he asked the person behind me to go to the next window I informed him I was already told by her that she was "busy." 2. I asked to be in a building near the front of the property since my husband has a health condition and I am always concerned about an ambulance. We were placed in Building 6 near the back of the property. 3. We had a two bedroom unit. The toilet in one of the bathrooms did not work properly, and the other bathroom's toilet had a broken handle. I called, but they were never fixed properly. 4. One evening we came back rather late to find our door "unlocked." Our three year old granddaughter pulled on the handle before we inserted the key and it just opened. 5. I called about the lock but nobody showed up when we asked. The next day we called again and I was told they would send someone "right out." After waiting we left with the hope that our belongings would not be disturbed we left for the park as nobody arrived. 6. The day of check out, we were awakened at 9:20 to make sure we were leaving. At 10:50, another knock on the door asking if we were leaving. I said yes, within 30 minutes. I asked if I had to check out and she said "no, just leave the key cards." While waiting for my daughter to finish, I stripped the sheets from the bed, vacuumed the carpet, swept the kitchen floor, my husband emptied the trash, placed the towels in one area, etc. and took our bags to the van. At 11:20 the phone rang and a woman “check-out time is at 11:00.” By then, I was livid. I proceeded to tell her I was aware of the time and she was the THIRD person who asked when we were leaving and rattled off the requests that I had and were not fulfilled. I also told her I began cleaning the room while waiting to leave. She told me “quit taking it personally.” I replied I am not taking it personally but I am insulted that this is the third notice for a twenty minute delay. Two of the notices began prior to the check-out time, I said when I get home; I will post how I was treated on Trip Advisor. Her response was “do what you have to do.” She was unapologetic the entire time. She also asked how she is supposed to know that I had been contacted twice before, I suggested they improve their communication system.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, great value”
Reviews.Author: FWBFlorida
Reviews.Content: This resort was very accurately represented. The room was clean and spacious. The location was great for disney world and while somewhat out of the way, we were still close to restaurants and attractions. The staff was friendly. The distance from building 3 was not as far as others have suggested. The breakfast was your standard fare items, but very good quality. Family friendly and very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the price and location”
Reviews.Author: celiatripp
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at this resort 3x's and love it every time. You can not beat the price or the location. The first time we stayed we were located in the 3rd building and on the third floor which was too far away from the pool for my taste but in the end it didn't matter because we didn't end up using the pool. The 2nd and third time we stayed in building 1 with a ground floor room. This location is perfect for access to the pool and the main building for continental breakfast. We like this hotel because each child gets a bed. We have a room for the kids, grandparents and ourselves. My kids go to bed early and we have a living space to hang out and relax. The hotel also sells tickets to the parks which is convenient and quick. They also offer great prices and deals for the park tickets. Make sure you ask for the AAA discount if you have a membership. You will receive a 10% discount on your room rate. Around the corner from the resort is a giant Super Walmart which is where you need to go for all your food and water. Quick trip and money saving. You will also find all your rain ponchos and Disney souvenirs at a drastic discount! One problem we did run into this trip was with a Pizza Delivery service. There were flyers placed strategically throughout our room when we arrived. My husband called and ordered a pizza for $16.95 as stated on the flyer - while I went to Walmart to stock up on our food for the trip. The pizza arrived and my husband was charged $26.50! The guy said was taxes and delivery fees. When I spoke to the front desk about the terrible rip off - the girl raised her hand and said the hotel is not responsible for the delivery service (which I was not holding them responsible) they do not sponsor any delivery services in the area. Then why did we have three flyers in our room! The cleaning staff strategically placed them in my kitchen, dining room and by the phone in the bedroom! That is the only complaint I have to date about this resort. Other than that - we love it. If you are coming here, prepare to bring small bottles of dish soap and laundry detergent. We now plan ahead and bring these things along.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay if you are traveling with Family”
Reviews.Author: lajababu
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in November for thanksgiving ... the pool was very nice, there is also a hot water and lots of changing room... we stayed in a 3 BR condo, there were lots of towel, enough dishes, utensils for all of us 6 people for 4 days, it was very well maintained.. there was a Jacuzzi tub as well... location was okay because we had a car.. I think if they can arrange a complimentary shuttle to the parks , and have a flat screen TV (we had a monster CRT) I would always stay here .. Nice easy checkout by phone was nice ..I would highly recommend for a big party

Reviews.Title: “As beautiful as the website shows!”
Reviews.Author: sfloridasunshine
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed 2 nights. LOVED IT! I'm very particular where I stay. Kinda sick of staying at LaQuinta but didn't want to break the bank either. Got a great deal at TravelZoo. Did my research, compared this resort to some other similar ones and it paid off. ONLY drawback is low level signage at entrance - we completely missed it....ended up getting sucked right into the Disney property. What a mess gettin out of there! It's located directly behind Nickelodeon hotel. Love how it's tucked behind all the mainstream hotels. Surrounded by wooded area and a little lake out back. The pool is beautiful and well maintained. Great Italian "to go" spot close by called Gourmatoes! Another plus was the complimentary continental breakfast w/Maxwell House coffee. Only cold items, no waffles - but free is good so why complain. Saved us from driving somewhere for breakfast and spending an addtl $35-40 for food. We had 2 br suite w full kitchen. Kids loved jacuzzi tub. Honestly if I didn't know better, I could have sworn we were in Ga or something bcause of the woods.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price and distance to Disney parks”
Reviews.Author: frombaritomiami
Reviews.Content: A great value for those with extended family who need 4 or more beds to stay in and around Orlando. The location is very close to the Disney parks, Downtown Disney and Seaworld. It is a little out of the way to find but not too bad. The landscaping and pool area as well as the reception are very pleasing, the staff is very welcoming and they were gracious to offer me a lower rate than the one I booked with, additionally I was offered a 3 bedroom/3 bathroom apartment instead of a 3/2, which helped a lot. The rooms are new and clean, beds comfortable, kitchen spotless (even though we did not use it). We had a couple of small things not perfect (toilet did not flush and one broken lightbulb) but they fixed the toilet within minutes, which was very appreciated. Breakfast was good for being included in the price, true there were no meats or pancakes/waffles/cooked eggs but I think it was reasonable and hey had fresh fruit available. The only minor weak point is that quality of construction is not super high, so I could already spot rusted A/C vents and some scoffed furniture and peeling paint in one of the bathrooms, plus one of the towel racks was almost coming off, it would have needed to be secured again. It did not make a difference for our group because the price value of the room far exceeded these small things. I would recommend for anyone with more than 3 people in a group, would return here.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: Ahlona B
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay and will be back. Convient to Walt Disney World and other local attractions. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Bad time”
Reviews.Author: Tracy39A
Reviews.Content: Have always loved staying here and have multiple times, however, our last visit infer 2012 left my daughter with bedbug bites!!! She had them on her arms, neck, face and legs! We did get moved at 3am the first night when she found them, however, since being home I have spent money at the doctors, for cream, medicine and I had to throw out a suitcase and duffle bag! Lots of money and embarrassment we endured!

Reviews.Title: “WorldQuest Stay”
Reviews.Author: Lucille P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed with WorldQuest of Orlando for the last 3 years on our February snowbird vacation. We found all employees to be very pleasant, efficient and helpful in every aspect. The grounds were well kept up with constant maintainance. The condos are very roomy with three bedrooms and baths, the master bath very large. The beds are comfortable and we slept well. Walls are well insulated so that no one never hears any noise and one would think you are alone there. This year free internet was added and that was wonderful. Security is handled well. My only complaint was that there were too many very young children 3 and 4 years old swimming in the hot tub and playing with pool toys mading it difficult for adults to relax. The pool is large and always enough chairs to relax in. It is a very good price for the room and comfort. We would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay at World Quest Resort”
Reviews.Author: graham m
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our two children and six grandchildren to Orlando for 14 days. We stayed in the World Quest Resort, We had a three and a two bed unit which were excellent, Four TVs in one three in the other, Each unit had a fully fitted kitchen c/w dish washer, washing m/c and tumble drier. The furnishings and fabrics were of superior quality. The staff were friendly and efficient. With Disney and Universal only 10/20 mins away,it is an ideal place to stay. We would strongly recommend it The Miller family from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: pkleinJersey
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night with our married kids as they were getting into Orlando International late in the evening and we were planning on going to Disney the next day. We checked in at 3 PM and thoroughly enjoyed the beautiful pool and patio. Each had a drink and a snack at the tiki bar by the pool...quite expensive...but enjoyable. Three bedroom condo was more than large enough for us, was very clean and for the price, could not be beat! Add in the fact that they have a decent continental breakfast in the lobby and World Quest is probably the best value in Orlando for anyone looking for more than a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Great bang for the buck.”
Reviews.Author: elee099
Reviews.Content: Our family recently spent nine days at WQR. We had booked a two bedroom unit and an upgrade to a three bedroom unit was easily accommodated by the front desk staff. They also accommodated our request for a unit in building 1 or 2 because we wanted to be close to the pool and the administration building where free continental breakfast was provided daily. Pros * screened balcony allows you to enjoy the balcony at all hours without worrying about pesky bugs getting into your unit * close to EVERYTHING, e.g. Walmart, restaurants, SeaWorld, Disney, Premium Outlet (Vineland Ave.) * free breakfast (which you can take up to your room) * big pool (albeit a bit cold) * quiet units * heater that worked (it dipped to -6 Celsius one evening) * great for families or big groups Cons * perhaps because we were in one of the original buildings (building #2), it was a bit "tired" ... but this wasn't a deal breaker given the value proposition (we used a Facebook promotion code) * two lightbulbs burned out and we twice requested that maintenance come up to replace the bulbs but they never did make the trip to our unit Would I stay again? If we were to get the same price ... for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat it for your Disney visit!”
Reviews.Author: melisbaz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December 2011 based on a recommendation from a friend. I had asked (via Facebook) for any recommendations for a condo to stay while in the Disney area. We were traveling with our two young children, my mother, and my sister, and thought a condo would be a better option than the two hotel rooms we had booked nearby. After speaking to my friend and thoroughly researching the property here in tripadvisor, we decided to give it a shot. I am glad we did - we stayed three nights in a three bedroom in Building 3 and were very comfortable. We had a couple of minor issues - the kitchen sink was emitting a strange smell and there were some items under beds and the couch that likely could have been cleaned up with a more thorough cleaning crew. We didn't make a big deal of the sink since we were rarely at the condo, though I am sure they would have at least checked it out if we had called it in. We just returned from a second three night stay yesterday and again had a very pleasant experience. This time it was just us and the kids, though we did have a three bedroom again (Building 2 this time, on a high floor - nice view) because it was a last minute trip and evidently the two bedrooms are booked early. No matter, the nightly rate was still more reasonable than just ONE room at any of the hotels (at least any that we would want to stay at) nearby and we saved money just by having a kitchen and washer/dryer. Additionally, our sanity was saved thanks to our kids being able to have a separate room. I noticed a similar cleanliness issue on this trip - trash was found under one of the beds that really should not have been there - makes you wonder what else is missed. Additionally, the bathrooms seem to be showing some wear and tear and could have used a good caulking - but this is typical for the humidity of Florida (we live in the state as well and have similar issues in our bathrooms). We did not take advantage of the pool on either trip, but it looks like a great place to have some fun. We also did not do breakfast - I have seen a lot of people complaining about the lack of variety, but this is a continental breakfast that is included in the room rate, I don't see why that warrants a complaint. It is just as easy to drive to the Publix that is five minutes away and get some healthier options and eat in your own condo, on your own time, without being crowded. Additionally, after reading the negative reviews on the park shuttles, we opted to drive ourselves to the theme parks and felt that this really was the way to go. Bottom line is that this is a very affordable place to stay, generally clean, and extremely convenient to the parks, without making you a slave to the Disney property. We will never stay anywhere else when we go to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem and best value”
Reviews.Author: trekkinggal
Reviews.Content: I just finished my second stay at WQR and was just as happy as the first time. This is an excellent complex to relax and unwind after a day of hyper activity in the surrounding Theme parks. Located a mile outside of Disney, Sea World and Universal, it is a 10-20 minute drive to the parks depending on traffic but is amazingly clam and serene around the hotel and pool. The condos are spacious and clean (I've stayed in a 3 bdr both trips) and the grounds immaculate. Besides the full kitchen, large screened balcony and ensuites in each bedroom, the huge sparling pool and jacuzzi are my favorite. The sun loungers are sturdy with thick cushions, umbrellas drink tables and the hotel provides a free pool towel service, pool shower, on site bathrooms, a tiki bar and pool toys for the kids and young at heart. The management doesn't mind if you bring your own cooler of beverages to the pool, just be considerate and clean up after yourself and don't bring glass into the pool area. The pool is large enough that even with lots of people you never feel crouded and never have to fight over a sunbed. The kids love the pool and spent every possible moment in it. The staff is courteous and quite responsive to any requests or issues. The continental breakfast includes bagels, toast, pastries, fruit, cereal, coffee and juice, cream cheese, peanut butter, jelly and other condiments and was always wells stocked at 0730-0800 when I ussually arrvied. With the full kitchen we also were able to keep eggs and yougurt to suppliment breakfast and we cooked for ourselves a few nights as a break from restaurants. You can choose from different housekeeping services during your stay and the condos have a vaccum, brooms and mops and complimentary cleaning supplies and dishwasher and dish soap. We opted for the towel exchange and had fresh towels waiting for us every afternoon on our return. The complex is a 5 minute drvie to Walmart, grocery and liquour stores outlet malls and any kind of restaurant you could desire. The rooms are very clean and spacious with very comfortable beds and wonderful showers and soaking tubs. My only complaint is that the lighting is not very good in the bedrooms or bathrooms and always seemed to dark and dreary. However, that gave me a good excuse to grab a cup of coffee and sit on my balcony while applying my makeup. We've always stayed at one of the buildings by the pool which is highly recommeded. Building 6 and 7 have quite a hike to the club house and pool. You won't be disappointed if you stay here. All of the photos do it justice.

Reviews.Title: “4.5 out of 5!”
Reviews.Author: Ferferks
Reviews.Content: We will definitely come back if we return to the Orlando area! Would give it a full 5 if not for a couple minor issues...We had a few (very few) sugar ants...resolved by keeping zero food on the counters. After two attempts of using the hotel transportation, we decided to just drive ourselves & save some cash on the Disney food by coming back to the hotel on our own schedule. The rooms were very nice and very quiet. We chose the $5 towel only housekeeping option & took the trash out/made our beds ourselves. Use "Facebook" promo code for 15% off. Highly recommend Building 1 (Building 2 if 1 is full). Ask for the top floor (each building is 5 stories) so you don't get any noise from people above you. Master has king size bed, TV, large shower, jacuzzi tub, double sink, huge area. Additional room has two twin beds, TV, it's own bathroom with a tub/shower. Washer/Dryer are included in the room, as well as everything you need in the kitchen. Also included is a large sitting area with TV, couch, arm chair, dining table, screened porch. I've lived in an apartment much smaller than this!

Reviews.Title: “Another stay at World Quest Orlando with the family”
Reviews.Author: BTJV
Reviews.Content: We came back to World Quest Orlando on Feb 5th - Feb 11th, 2012. We were happy to enjoy the February rate of $89/night, This made our trip back to Orlando easier knowing we were going to get a great rate for a 3bedroom suite. We arrived in the morning but tried to check in at 1pm but our room was not ready yet. We were travelling with our 1 1/2 yr old and 4 yr old and I'm 6 1/2 mths pregnant so it was a long day already. (Note: I requested if we could get our room earlier by email 2 days before our arrival but did not get a response). I thought we would be able to get our room early again when we had visited back on June 2011 with the 2 kids. We showed up at 4:30pm and the room was not ready yet. My husband waited 10 mins and we got our cards. With groceries already in the SUV from 1pm, we were anxious to get inside and settle in. We were extremely happy with our stay as usual. The 3 bdrm suite was amazing and wish we were able to enjoy this with another family. We stayed at a 2 bdrm suite last time. The girls enjoyed the extra space and rooms to play in and it worked out great. The pool was a little cool but my 4 yr old enjoyed it and didn't bother her at all from going almost everyday if we were not at the Disney parks. Breakfast is always great. We knew of the continental breakfast and what they served so we bought eggs and waffles to add to our breakfast selection which worked out great. Bagels, toast, pastries, fruits are always nice to have and we always appreciate the free continental breakfast provided at WQO. We took advantage of the washer/dryer as it saved us from bringing extra luggage so we packed less clothes with us. Garbage was collected everyday as we opted for no housekeeping services. Our stay was wonderful and the people working there and staying there were nice. Its nice to stay at a resort when we are not too far from the Disney parks. Overall, we will definitely be coming back to WQO. We already have friends planning to stay here when they come to visit. Thank you World Quest Orlando!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property at a very attractive price”
Reviews.Author: D N
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the WorldQuest after missing the cutoff to get a room at the Marriott World Center for a business convention. With a rate that was $100 cheaper than a room at the Marriott, I wasn't expecting much. I was shocked when I walked into an enormous, pristine two bedroom, two bathroom suite with a full kitchen and a private, screened outdoor patio and a lovely view. I couldn't recommend this more highly for business travelers who want to bring family along.

Reviews.Title: “A great home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: JLimAustin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the WorldQuest last week and it was such a great home away from home for my family! It was very close to Disney, Walmart, and local eateries. The staff was very nice and friendly! My husband, mother, and kids told me I hit a "home run" on booking the condo - they all loved it. If you like a nice place to stay with lots of room, plus a kitchen and washer/dryer....this place is perfect. I was uncertain if I was making the right decision staying offsite when we decided to go to Disney, but now after our week long stay I can tell you it was the perfect decision for us and we will do it this way again. The rooms onsite are 1/4 the size of this place, but 3-4x more money. Yes, you will spend about 20 minutes more coming and going versus onsite proper, but it really wasn't bad at all!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect price and beautiful suites”
Reviews.Author: Claireallie
Reviews.Content: The three bedroom three bathroom suites are the perfect with large soaking tubs and well appointed kitchen. I suggest heading out to pick up breakfast options. The coffee at the continental breakfast was not good and the options of pastries or cereals was the offerings not to mention the crowds. Save yourself the headache and do with out the daily towel option. I had to call everyday to remind the front desk and the towels never came. This is a$5.00 a day charge. You are so close to Disney for a quarter of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at WorldQuest”
Reviews.Author: NDM76
Reviews.Content: Hosted a business meeting at WorldQuest at the beginning os February 2012. The staff was extremely accommodating. The rooms are very spacious especially for the price. The pool area is very well maintained and spacious as well. You always saw either landscapers or housekeeping cleaning the property. They keep it in very good shape. The only negative that I heard from our attendees was that the continental breafast was very sparse. But it is a continental breakfast and it is included, so minor issue.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our grandchildren on a short disney vacation and stayed here for four nights. The accommodations were clean, roomy and overall great. The pool and area is beautiful! We spent the first day at Epcot and the second day all the children just wanted to stay at the pool!! We had a great time and all of our needs were met with courteous and hospitable staff. Thank you for making our short vacation all that it could be:)

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: 17Cathy
Reviews.Content: For 3 nights we stayed in a 3 bedroom, 3 bath condo at WorldQuest Orlando Resort - very nice! This was the best accommodation that we had during our week in Florida. Would definitely recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet escape but close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Vickie C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took his mother and our 3 children to Disney World in January. We were driving to Orlando and needed a place to stay for one night before checking into our Disney resort. We had stayed at WorldQuest once before and this experience was just as exceptional. The property is very beautifully landscaped and very well maintained. I've never seen any trash in the parking lots or on the grounds. We were able to get a three bedroom suite with a full kitchen and dining/living area for much less than we would have paid for equal space at other hotels in the area. The bedrooms offered more than adequate space and were very well appointed. We had a screened-in balcony that overlooked a wooded area and pool beyond that. The screen was torn in spots, but that wasn't a huge problem as it was January and the bugs weren't out in full force yet. Our room was in one of the buildings furthest from the main building and had we wanted to access the pool or common areas we would have had to drive. The pool area is gigantic and beautiful! There is also plenty of parking available for each building. They offer complementary continental breakfast with your stay. It is a continental breakfast so expect plenty of starches and no proteins. The bagels and pastries are quite good for what they are and the staff works hard to ensure everything stays well stocked. The juices are dispensed from a machine much like a soda fountain and taste a bit watered down. There is very limited indoor seating, but more tables are arranged just out the door and around the pool area. The staff members are quite friendly, gracious and attentive. Check out can be accomplished over the phone or by electing automatic check out when you register. There is a mandatory $35 cleaning fee if you're staying fewer than 3 nights, but considering the low cost of the room it really isn't a big deal. We will absolutely be staying here again during our next trip to DW. I believe they offer shuttle service to the parks, but I've never used it. DW is only a minute or two down the road so its very convenient. Highly recommend this resort for larger groups need 2 or more bedrooms.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised!”
Reviews.Author: JMRogers
Reviews.Content: The 3 bed-3 bath condo at WQR was a pleasant surprise. We had a very good winter rate and we were concered that the property might be subpar...boy were we wrong! We stayed at the World Quest with our family from Ft. Lauderdale that had two 31/2 year old twins, and it worked out great! It was clean, fairly modern, with plenty of room. It had a full kitchen, large master tub, and a large screened balcony. There was a tv in each room (although not a flat screen) and a cd/dvr player. The pool was large with ample towels, and it even had a snack/beverage bar. We were minutes away from all Disney parks. A free breakfast and shuttle was included, however we would have liked it a little more if there was a little better breakfast choice and if the shuttle was more flexible. We would definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay Near Maingate of Disney”
Reviews.Author: Eagleray55
Reviews.Content: Very nice condo-like resort convenient to all Disney Resorts and other attractions. Exceptionally clean and well furnished. Continental breakfast included. Staff was accomodating and friendly. Resort was gated with a guard and felt very secure. We had a 3 bedroom unit which was spacious and comfortable. The grounds and pool area were well maintained and relatively quiet during off season. Looked forward getting back to the unit at the end of the day. Rates were excellant even given Orlando's discounted roomrates.

Reviews.Title: “A's, B's, and C's”
Reviews.Author: Monica R
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest grades as follows- A's: large, clean pool with comfortable lounge chairs, super clean bathroom, and lovely landscaping and fountains; helpful staff; spacious, clean, well-designed condo-style accommodations. The lovely kitchen had everything we needed to prepare meals and the bathrooms were fantastic. Great screened balcony with table and chairs. B's: located by a major highway. Rooms that face the pool, esp Building 1, may have been quieter than our Building 5 suite. C's: low quality bed linens; shabby couch and chairs; all the beds in our suite were saggy, lumpy, and generally poor quality/past their prime.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Resort, Great Location, Staff is so accomodating”
Reviews.Author: diamondgirl22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights with my husband, daughter, 2 children and her husband, and middle daughter and her 2 children. We arranged for 1 , 3bedroom and 1, 2 bedroom condo to accomodate all 9 of us. The resort was great at not only putting us on the same floor but right next door to each other. There is a full kitchen, dining room, breakfast bar, washer/dryer in addition to 2 full baths in each condo. There isn't a better more reasonably priced way to stay with your large family than here at WorldQuest Resort. There is free continental breakfast each morning and a concierge available to get your tickets to any of the attractions. We were 5 minutes to the Magic Kingdom/ Downtown Disney and about 15 to Universal Studios. The only drawback is the street noise from the traffic. Luckily I use ear plugs so it wasn't a problem. We stayed in the 3 bedroom and our master and the children's twin bedded room were on the traffic side. We would stay here again with our family. It was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: setpoppy
Reviews.Content: Large, comfortable, nicely decorated rooms. Large master bath. granite countertops. The only significant problem that we had was the oven didn't heat up to temperature. We tried using it the second to last night of our stay. By the time I realized it wasn't working, was too late to really try to get the problem resolved, so I didn't mention it until checkout. You do hear the people above you walking around. Although we were on the side near the highway, it didn't bother us. We didn't even go around the pool area so can't comment on that. Overall, a great place to stay and definitely a great value. Parking is right outside of the building, providing easy access to your car. Would be a five except for the oven issue.

Reviews.Title: “Worldquest 3 day stay”
Reviews.Author: pisces74
Reviews.Content: Was in Orlando for a convention. Requested a 3 bedroom/3 bath suite on the top floor and they had one ready for us when we arrived. Check in was quick, the suite was HUGEEE. Very very clean - we were in the 7th building which is the newest so everything looked brand new. Got a rate of 120 a night and that included the free continental breakfast. This was definately the best valued hotel I've ever stayed in. If you are staying here you will need a car, as it is not walking distance from the main roads. It is a very quick drive to Disney, we got to Magic Kingdom in 10 minutes. Absolutely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Large room but check the towels and linens!”
Reviews.Author: cr8zymike
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights for a stop over before heading to Port Canaveral for a cruise. The room was very large. We had a room on the 1st floor. I forgot the other hints that I should have asked for a high room. We were on the 1st floor facing the highway. We had rather noisy neighbors so there was a lot of chatter, moving of furniture, running and pounding. But this is a resort and I guess this is normal so I can't complain too much. Otherwise, it was big and spacious. The TVs are old and one of them actually flickered and changed colors. There was some mold on the bathroom floor. But the worst was a couple of the bath towels had very disgusting brown streaks. I don't need to be very descriptive for your imagination to know what it probably was. Don't get me wrong. It's a fairly nice place...but do check the towels and linens before you use them.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Smithcskr
Reviews.Content: I booked a 8 night stay based upon reviews on TripAdvisor and can honestly say it was everything I expected and more. Whilst Disney & Universal are quite close, we hired a car so we could travel when we wanted as we also went to the Kennedy Space Centre (about an hour away). We had a slight 'snafu' with the housekeeping service on the 1st night and they gave me a free day's service to compensate...very much appreciated. We were in building 1, close to the pool and the breakfast location. Except for some noisy neighbours in the room above (whose kids started running around the room at 4.00am most mornings) the whole stay was great. Would absolutely recommend WorldQuest to anybody considering a visit to Orlando. If we ever get back to Orlando, we'll stay there again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great family hotel, close to Disney, with great value”
Reviews.Author: thirstycanuck
Reviews.Content: You can't find a better deal than this! We stayed in mid December, and for $108 USD/night we had a 1 bedroom suite, with kitchen and laundry facilities in the Disney area. The room was very clean. The resort has a beautiful pool area, a 24 hour "mini-market" on site, and a free continental breakfast. There is a Walmart and a Target just a few minutes drive away. Pros: Having laundry in your suite, with kids, is always great! The kitchen has granite countertops, and a full size fridge, dishwasher, microwave and stove. Cons: If you don't have a car, the shuttle to Epcot has limited times (at least when we were there) - only 3 departure times from the hotel during the day. The continental breakfast area can be very busy during peak periods (no surprise, really). And there is nowhere close by to walk to if you don't have a car. We were a family of 4, and for the price we were very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer K
Reviews.Content: When we made our reservation at WorldQuest Resort for a 3 room suite, we had no idea that we were getting a 3-bedroom condo with an additional kitchen, family room, and dining room. We were very pleasantly surprised! Free continental breakfast was a nice plus. Everything was clean and well-maintained. Only down side: Mapquest does not give good directions to the resort. We missed it and drove way out of the way before realizing our mistake. GPS may be better. Our rental car did not come equipped with it, so not sure.

Reviews.Title: “Yet again, WorldQuest shines.”
Reviews.Author: AustinCane
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two days prior to our Disney cruise, and two days after. The front desk staff are absolutely outstanding. Location is 5-10 minute drive from MK gate. Breakfast is very good. Little market on site has everything you need if you get in late or want something quickly. Walmart 2 minute drive. Has everything you'll need for a short stay Beds are very comfortable. Ample pillows and all amenities are in excellent order. Will always stay here when we head to WDW, which is likely yearly for the next 7 years. We are very experienced travelers, and do not except mediocrity. These folks take pride, and it shows. Thanks again for a great stay...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tramp1
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic surprise !! This is a great place and you just can’t beat the price ! The staff was efficient, friendly and accommodating. Our three bedroom condo was spotless and spacious. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect !”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFoster
Reviews.Content: As with the majority of service related industries, when compared to the UK, they exceed in the alot of cases, and The WorldQuest Resort was no different. The location for us as a family was perfect, over the busiest period of the year. We decided not to stay at one of the resort hotels due to the fact they would be extremely busy and enough time could be spent in queues during the day at Disney. Although The WorldQuest Resort was full over Xmas, you wouldn't have known it. The standards were as high as the rest of the year. We did spend a couple of days by the pool, and this was fairly quiet as alot of people we at the theme parks. There is a small bar which has a limited menu, but for the occasional meal is fine. We didn't use the shuttle provided by the resort to get us to the theme parks, but used a taxi instead - we could then come and go as we pleased. Sweet cakes etc for breakfast didn't suit us, so it is worth ensuring you make a trip to the local supermarket for supplies if you are the same. The condo's are excellent. We had a two bedroomed suite, which had lots of space and made for a really enjoyable stay. All things considered, price, location and service - I would say that you would struggle to find better in the area. One last thing - the concierge service is available from 7am each morning where you can buy your park tickets. Emily - very helpful! We would definately consider booking again.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: Lotz2CnDo
Reviews.Content: First stay at the World Quest and it will now be our Orlando Hotel choice forever more when we visit Disney. The 2-bedroom condo we stayed in was comfortable, beautiful and well priced. The staff accomodated our request for and adjacent 3-bedrm condo so the entire family could be close. It really was a home away from home. An initial stop and the 24-hour Super Walmart down the street allowed us to stock the Kitchen for quick meals that saved us a bundle from needing to purchase park food. A 10-min drive to the Magic Kingdom parking lot gave us the ability to leave a cooler in the car, which saved us a bundle on purchasing park food. Only negative comment I can make was that the water pressure in the shower was a little weak. Nothing that I couldn't live with though.

Reviews.Title: “All additional expenses are clearly pointed out in contract.”
Reviews.Author: fhjp1
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the BEST place to stay. Beautiful pool. Beautiful room. BEAUTIFUL staff...always friendly and willing to help. I will never stay elsewhere... i am a mother of an 8 uear old girl and a 2 year old boy. Many more Orlando vacations in my future.

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: IA_Mom_Of_4_51652
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 (children ages 8, 16 and 20) stayed here for 1 week in a 3-bedroom superior villa for $135/night (including all fees and taxes). It was a wonderful place from which to base our Orlando vacation. Disney World was a very short distance away, yet this place seemed very secluded and away from some of the madness of the Disney resorts. Restaurants/shopping/Walmart were also very close. We loved having room for all of us to spread out, and having a kitchen and washer and dryer definitely saved us some money. The grounds are beautiful, the pool is big and warm enough to swim in in January, and the personnel were all very friendly, particularly our Jamaican friend who collected our trash daily. My only complaint would be the cramped and rather dull breakfast buffet, but that was a small problem to overlook compared to all the plusses of this resort. We would definitely stay here again. If possible, request buildings 1 or 2, as they are the closest to the offices/breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: jkryan2
Reviews.Content: This will be our new destination any time we're in the Orlando area. The resort and rooms are fabulous. It's like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “3 Bedrooms, nice view, just skip "Continental" breakfast”
Reviews.Author: kbris10224
Reviews.Content: First impressions, this is a great family option in Orlando. 3 bedrooms is fabulous when traveling vs. being all crammed into a standard hotel. On vacation to have 2 full baths, kitchen, and in room laundry fits my family perfectly. We stayed for 3 nights starting on December 26th and a few suggestions: 1) skip the "continental" breakfast. I have stayed at a lot of hotels, but have never seen such a poor display of continental breakfast, even at a $40 motel (back in the college days, blah, never again.) The kitchen/food pick up area is so small! This complex has multiple buildings so its just math. Way too many people, too small an area. And the options were just sad. In the "pastry case" they had ran out of everything but white bread. Slices of white bread in a luxury resort as the pastry? Sad. The kitchen only had cold cereal, coffee, juice, and milk. That's it and everything was running low. No english muffins, no yogurt, not even a Nutri Grain bar or piece of fruit. My kids, oh, I will never hear the end about how bad breakfast was that day. Mom picked a nice hotel, but dropped the ball on food. Just go out. Orlando has plenty of restaurants or if you feel up to it, cook in your room. The other suggestions are: 2) tell people in advance about the housekeeping fee. They have fee system for housekeeping. $5 for towels only all the way up to $39 per day for full service. 3) the shower heads - these are standard, many hotels have switched to the wider, waterfall version, but that's just a nice to have feature. Given the size and location, we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Recommendation”
Reviews.Author: Ben C
Reviews.Content: Add another top rating to this vacation property. Five of us shared a three bedroom unit over Christmas while enjoying a four day Disney World family experience. The Trip Advisor recommendations were "right on", as we were thoroughly pleased with all aspects of this condominium style property. Our unit was well furnished, modern, and very close to Disney World. Included in our rate were daily continental breakfasts, parking, and full use of the expansive pool/hot tub facility.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful condo in a fabulous location”
Reviews.Author: anthony r
Reviews.Content: We had 20 nights in a 3 bedroom, 2 bathroom condo in December 2011/January 2012. The bedrooms consisted of 1 king, 2 single and 1 queen bed - all very comfortable. Fabulous kitchen with full fridge freezer (including filtered water and ice dispenser), oven, stove top, microwave and dishwasher. TV in each bedroom and in lounge. The resort is very big, so I would recommend requesting a room in building 1, 2 or 3 if you want to be in close walking range to the pool, reception, breakfast buffet and gym. The pool is huge and heated in winter with lots of comfortable lounges and pool towells available. Location has been fantastic as we are only a couple of minute drive to DisneyWorld, 15 mins to Seaworld and under 1/2 hr to Universal Studios and Airport. 1 1/4 hrs to NASA Kennedy Space Centre. We ordered groceries online from Gardengrocer.com who were fantastic in delivering our order on time and much easier than shopping ourselves. I would suggest ordering soap and toilet paper if you are here for a while as the small amount supplied soon runs out. The breakfast buffet is very basic - cereals, coffee, juice, danishes and toast which really needs to be brought back to the room to eat as there are only a tiny amount of tables available. The rooms are clean, the complex fairly quiet, good facilities, brilliant location and is great value for money. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday Stay”
Reviews.Content: As a family of 8 that stayed in a 3 bdrm/3bath condo with full kitchen and great weather, we had a great experience and WorldQuest was a great value. We found our room in excellent condition, and did not have the issue of excessive noise from other tenants even being on the ground floor. We stayed during busy Xmas week and yes it was busy but the staff was polite and helpful. We had warm weather and our kids did not complain about the pool temperature, but we are northerners so are use to cooler temps. Only complaint was that the signage for the hotel was not easily visible, especially at night. Best to call resort directly for directions since Mapquest was insufficient for us. Nice having the option of taking the resort shuttle to and from the parks. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great 3 Bedroom villa”
Reviews.Author: jam05Ontario
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night as we were heading out of Orlando. After coming from Orange Lake where they had tons to do for families we were a little disappointed in the lack of activities for the kids. There is just a pool. That being said, if you are visiting the parks during the day and don't need a lot of things to do in the hotel then this is the place to stay! The rooms are perfect. The beds were comfortable and I finally slept after having horrible beds at Orange Lake. The rooms are upgraded and spacious. Don't think twice about staying here if you don't need the extra activities for the kids. It was worth it! Travelzoo had the best rate and they didn't charge me the $39.99 cleaning fee because we stayed under 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - Disney Trip”
Reviews.Author: Casey W
Reviews.Content: Our Family of Eight stayed at World Quest Resort from 25 Dec to 30 Dec. Plenty of room for all. The Location is great, not to mention the resort itself. We stayed in a 3 bedroom. The building and rooms are modern and very clean. It was like a home away from home but within minuted to walt disney! - Highly recommend- This is my Orlando top resort choice -- O Ye -- The price is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place spoilt by easily solved issues.”
Reviews.Author: JennyWren8192
