Reviews.Content: My family of four, including two teenagers, stayed at World Quest two weeks prior to Christmas. This is our 9th visit to Orlando, but sadly I would not consider the World Quest again unless they resolve some of the problems we found. The resort is very pretty and the basics of the condo's have been built to a high standard, but I can only think they then ran out of money, because simple mistakes spoilt the place. Why place heavy wooden dining furniture on a tiled floor without a rug or felt on the chair legs? From our ground floor condo all we could hear was the furniture being moved in the condo above (and if you were in 202 block 6 on the 17/18 December, why were you still dragging chairs around at 3.00 am??) The beds were so hard I had to buy a foam topper in Walmart. The only mirrors are in the bathrooms, but none in the bedrooms. When we arrived the tap was hanging off the sink and the blind missing in the kitchen, giving anyone in the car park a good view in. Surely the cleaning staff would have noticed this and got them repaired before we arrived. They were fixed promptly once reported, but this should have been unnecessary. There were food stains on the front of the dishwasher and front door and a can of beer left in a dresser, so the cleaning wasn't great. The condo's have the potential to be outstanding because the granite tops, lovely bathrooms and quality curtains and lounge furniture are all there, but are let down by other things. The pool area is beautiful, but the water in the pool was freezing! We were stopped at the entrance by security to show a pass, but If you came in after 11 pm the barrier was up and anyone could drive in! A security coded gate would solve this. The resort is in a good area for Disney etc but there is a lot of road noise at Block 6. The breakfast is as expected in an American hotel and perfectly adequate, but the greed of some of the other guests put us off going there. One woman filled a carrier bag with cinnamon buns while others were bringing baking trays over from their kitchens and filling them up to take back (sometimes still in their pyjamas!!). On this note, it seems people are getting ruder year by year. It used to be the case that, for example, when a Disney show was on, everyone would wait until the end and then applaud the cast. Now, the merest hint that the show is coming to a close seems to be a sign for many people to get up and leave to tear off to the next attraction, blocking the view of those who want to watch all the show and showing no courtesy at all to the cast or other people. The request to "move to the end of the row" in a theatre is ignored by many, who think they should sit in the middle of the row for the "best" view and expect everyone else to clamber over them. This is Disney - ALL the seats have an excellent view!!! Courtesy and consideration cost nothing, but the children of these people are not learning this at all.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas Visit”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 brm unit for a week over Christmas. We were so grateful for the space of this unit after 14 hours in the theme parks during the day. Usually, we don't like for the family to be held up in their own rooms, but after a full day of together time, we were grateful for our private retreat with a whirlpool tub to unwind and relax. We will stay here again! Our only suggestion for improvement would be to have better fitting fitted sheets on the king beds; it was a struggle to keep them from pulling off at night. The kids didn't seem to have the same problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at WorldQuest”
Reviews.Author: Patti E
Reviews.Content: November 2010 stayed in a 3 bedroom, Dec. 2011 stayed in a 2 bedroom. Both were very clean, everything worked, nice touch with bathrobes:-) Excellent location for both Disney and Universal-restaurants close by but nice and quiet in resort. Would stay here any time i am in Orlando. Cost for what you get compared to a hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ralleydancer
Reviews.Content: The employees were most abliging and helpful. The rooms are clean and neat. Everything worked. Very relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice...”
Reviews.Author: SSOhio4
Reviews.Content: You will not be let down. We used to stay on Disney property and felt couped up. Plenty of room at World Quest. Great location, easy access to Disney. Walmart very close and everything else you will need. A+ on value also, for what you spend at Disney for a room you can stay here for 4-5 days. We spent half our vacation in the park and half hanging out at World Quest. Very clean and well maintained property, friendly staff. We found this place on the recomendation of some Florida Residents who come here, and you bet we will be back on our next Disney visit. Greeeeeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tom P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at WorldQuest for about a dozen times. We live near Daytona Beach, about 70 miles away, and find that staying here makes for a much nicer weekend than driving back and forth. We get a very clean 3 bedroom fully outfitted apartment for our usual 4 adults and 2 children. The pool area is beautiful, there is a basic breakfast and the folks working there are extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: PandJBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 10 days at Worldquest and loved it. Stayed in buliding 3 with a beautiful quiet view of the lake from a huge screened balcony.The suite was enormous with a fully eqiupped kitchen,large T.V,sofa etc.The main bedroom was also very large with a ensuite bathroom with twin sinks,shower and jet bath.The pool and hot tub were immaculately clean and all the gardens well maintained and we could park right outside the building.The hotel has gated security and is situated well back from the highway making it very quiet yet is only a few minutes to Disney.All staff were very helpful and friendly.Thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience for the price”
Reviews.Author: PortlandOregonian
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Orlando, Fl, staying at the WorldQuest resort. My family and I stayed in the three bedroom condo for four nites. The condo was large, had three bathrooms (in the master bath it had two sinks, whirlpool tub,and separate shower), the condo also had a decent sized kitchen, and living room. I found the condo to be very clean. The condo that we were given was in building 6, which is somewhat close to a major road, towards the rear of the resort. The weather was beautiful in Orlando that week, so we wanted to open the balcony door to let in fresh air. Being so close to that road, the noise was loud with the door open, with the door closed the noise level was fine. I would recommend being closer to the entrance, maybe within the first three buildings. The pool was beautiful, we were so busy, we didn't have time to use it. So I don't know if it was heated or not. It appeared to be very clean and maintained. Overall, for the price, the resort was great. The location is perfect for Disney, although I would recommend renting a car. If I were to return to Orlando, no doubt that I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Runaustralia
Reviews.Content: We are seasoned travelers so hopefully the following helps. You will need to rent a car. It will allow you to have more time and choices. Do NOt waste your time on free Disney shuttles! Writing from the hotel on our last night of 7 nights.Our family of 5 loved it. Apartments are terrific and large.stayed in building 5 in a 3br. Position of the property is great it takes us 5 min to get to any of the Disney car parks. Also very close to plenty of dining options and shopping.Basically you get alot of value for your $.Breakfast is a basic US affair of sweet bread,sweet cereals and US coffee.(Gosh it's bad but that's what it's like in the US) Internet reception is excellent and at no extra cost. I recommend this resort with no hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “A lot to offer for what you pay but realize the rate is low”
Reviews.Author: livee84
Reviews.Content: My stay was average. I say average because certain things were amazing and others were very disappointing. The rooms are large and very impressive but could use some upkeep and love. Beautiful pool and property location was right next to i4 making it easy to access all the parks. Certain staff members were amazing! Karen and Emily and the concierge desk were knowledgeable, helpful and full of enthusiasm, making our vacation planning effortless. Brooke, I believe her name was, showed us how to navigate the hotel and she wasn't even working the front desk. She took time from her tasks and assisted us. Nighttime staff was extremely enthusiastic, even when our checkin was after 2:00am. We were extremely let down when we met the front desk manager. I believe her name was jan or janett. After such an accommodating front desk staff, meeting the head of the department was a let down. She was rude, short and didn't seem to want to be bothered. My husband and I felt as if she spoke to us like idiot children. When she let us express our opinions she would roll her eyes as if our concerns were an annoyance and a burden for her to endure. Not being demanding or difficult guests this caught us off guard. She was also rude to our children and seemed frustrated by their enthusiasm and excitement. All and all with a little more upkeep and a much better front desk manager the hotel has potential. The kind members of the staff are impressive enough to make up for the lack of room maintanence and rude experience we had with janett. Work on maintaining the rooms a little more and find a new manager and this hotel could be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: Fountain4
Reviews.Content: Our family of five would highly recommend WorldQuest Orlando Resort. We spent seven wonderful nights at the resort, and were very pleased. The three bedroom two bath suite was very spacious and comfortable. There was a tv in each bedroom and the living room. The full kitchen was fully equipped with plates, flatware, cookware, full size fridge/oven and even a dishwasher. There is also an insuite washer and dryer which is handy if you dont want to pay extra for daily room cleaning. We also enjoyed the screened in patio with table and chairs. The staff was friendly and prompt in addressing a minor problem we had in the suite. We have vacationed in the Orlando area many times and have stayed in other resorts and villas. We will definately be returning to WorldQuest Orlando Resort. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Stacey B
Reviews.Content: My family stayed in a three bedroom / three bathroom suite for five nights. Everything was wonderful! Prior to our visit, I contacted the resort by phone several times, and each time my questions were fully answered by friendly and knowledgeable staff. Even after we arrived, every time we had a questions or needed directions, someone was always available with a smile to help us find our way. I can't begin to say enough good things about this resort. I can't imagine staying anywhere else when we visit Orlando. I have never had such a positive experience in all of my travels. While I didn't use the pool, my siblings visited the jacuzzi and raved about it. The continental breakfast is exactly what you'd expect from a continental breakfast, and it's plenty for me (fruit, breads and rolls, cereal, coffee and juice). The Tiki Bar was also a nice touch. We aren't big drinkers, but it was nice to sit poolside and sip a drink in the evening. In sum, the condo was excellent, customer service was excellent, the people were excellent, and I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “There's nothing negative to say about our experience at WorldQuest. It was a great time for our family.”
Reviews.Author: plwCliftonPark_NY
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough positive things about our experience at WorldQuest Resort. Right from the beginning, when I made phone reservations, I was impressed. I called back a few times to inquire about particulars and was always treated with respect, patience and direct answers. Then when we arrived in person we received the same kind of treatment. Our unit was a 3 bed / 2 bath facing the pool area. I was immediately pleased with the cleanliness of our unit. The furnishings were new, updated & beautifully appointed. The location allowed us a bit of privacy with greenery reaching to our enclosed screened porch, with the sun rising up over the pond and pouring into our living room, topped off with a view of the pool area and hot tub. The spacious master bath with jacuzzi tub provided relaxation after a long day at the theme parks. Morning breakfasts at the club house were convenient and well-stocked. I particularly liked their sticky-buns! Although we did enjoy several breakfasts in our unit where we sat on the screened porch listening to the sounds of nature in the early morning hours. In the late afternoon we quenched our thirsts at the Tiki Bar. I can highly recommend the mud slide smoothie ~ delicious. Our grandsons enjoyed the non-alcoholic banana smoothies too. There really isn't anything negative about WorldQuest. It was a great vacation for our family and very affordable too. We all enjoyed the cheerful and helpful staff. ~ Priscilla W, Clifton Park, NY

Reviews.Title: “luxury experience at value price”
Reviews.Author: susan r
Reviews.Content: I came here last year with my family for my husband's business trip and we had such a fabulous experience that when my business national meeting was in orlando this year,we jumped at the chance to return to the worldquest resort. We even requested the same condo and the resort was able to oblige our request. The property is beautiful. The pool is architecturally beautiful and the entire property is well maintained and upscale yet extremely affordable. I liked the peaceful setting, yet it is very close to Disney and other entertainment options. We enjoyed the complimentary continental breakfast each morning and used the full kitchen in our condo to prepare some simple meals and ate out a few times if we desired. We have small children and the resort was very family friendly and yet my senior citizen mom travelled with us and enjoyed the property too. My husband was travelling for business last year and I attended a work conference this year and all of us had a great time. We would all enthusiastically recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go to another hotel in Orlando. This is it !”
Reviews.Author: gellis69
Reviews.Content: I have been going to WorldQuest Resort in Orlando for 3 years already. With all the family. We stay in a 3 suite apartment and it's lovely. One mile from Disney. Very near the 4 highway. With a complete kitchen and large spaces. The master suite has a big bathroom with a really bathtub. You can park the car at your apartment front and its very convenient. The price is fantastic. For my next vacation in january 2012 I paid less than 150 US a day for the 20 days I will be staying there. Don't miss it. You will love this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely comfortable and well equipped”
Reviews.Author: tribblex
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Worldquest for 5 nights this November and it was brilliant. Positives: Beautifully comfortable bed Massive room; the children's room was right the other end so we had relative peace and quiet early mornings! Really well equipped kitchen and washer dryer Cleaning staff were great and consciencious: They put our children's cuddly toys 'to bed' and put the heating on when it was a particularly chilly day. Hot tub! Two bathrooms Negatives: Appalling prices at the shop - $17 for a frozen pizza! It was cheaper to order out. Lack of evening entertainment and evening dining. After a busy day at the parks when you can't be bothered to go out again, an evening at the hotel with entertainment would have been the icing on the cake. But you cant have everything. Overall, a lovely place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Is this a condo or a house? It was huge”
Reviews.Author: StephandJohn32244
Reviews.Content: we stayed here for one night since they had two bedroom units. A three bedroom was available for the same price. It is located at the end of a dead end road near Nickalodeon Suites. In the dark, you may not find it. It's a large condo complex. Our three bedroom unit was almost as large as our house. The master bedroom and bedroom was huge. The bathroom had both a jacuzzi tub and a walk in shower. The other bath had a walk in shower. The rear screen porch was nice as well. Avoid the continental breakfast and eat somewhere else. It was a basically a zoo. Someone even took one of our chairs when a member of our family got up to get a fork. Also, it is held in a very cramped room in the main building. But the gem of the property are the units for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal base for Orlando visit”
Reviews.Author: Moyglas
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Worldquest on a recent trip to Orlando. This is a great location close to Disney and Universal. You need to have a car as it is a little bit away from the trolley service. Parking is plentiful and free. The apartment was spacious and clean. Personally I thought the breakfast selection was very limited when compared to a continental breakfast in Europe. The pool area was good. The wifi was also poor after 7am in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CooperOntario_Canada
Reviews.Content: We had an exceptional time at WorldQuest staying in a 3 bedroom condo...great price, clean, and comfortable. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for Orlando holiday”
Reviews.Author: Miss087
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to visit the Worldquest having stayed there two years ago, again we had a great time, the apartments are great, they have everything you need and even if something does break, reception send maintenance to fix it very promptly. If you are having a day of the pool area is great, fresh towels, toys for the kids plenty of sun chairs and vey comfortable. The one thing the worldquest doesnt have is a resturant, but the reception and informations booklet can offer you great choices of places to eat. The staff are friendly and helpful. I would have no problem recommending this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: mejorcredito
Reviews.Content: Nice apt, fully loaded with everything you could get only @ your own house. Excellent price. If they would get this hotels in every major city in the US, they would be the best.

Reviews.Title: “Believe everything you read!”
Reviews.Author: brisbaneTinka
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on here, and being a very picky traveller, I can honestly say that the Worldquest Resort is perfect. I have visited Orlando on many occasions, always opting for a private house with pool, but living in Australia with a house and pool, I wanted to feel like I was staying in a resort, and I was not disappointed. The pool is just beautiful, a haven to relax after long days in the theme parks. All the reviews you read on here sum the property up perfectly. I can not fault the resort, and would have no problems recommending this resort to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “WorldQuest Resort”
Reviews.Author: Edward S
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay,when you are going to orlando.Rooms were big,and clean.Loved the whirlpool tub,after walking all day.Would stay at Worldquest again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect home base for exploring DisneyWorld and beyond”
Reviews.Author: BuntzenTrekker
Reviews.Content: Three of us girls did a week long trip to Florida and spent most of our nights at World Quest. We loved it! We were in building 2 overlooking the pool (3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms). We felt so spoiled each having our own bedroom and bathroom for such a fantastic price. The huge kitchen allowed us to stay in for many meals saving us a lot of money. We opted for the no-charge, complimentary garbage removal and didn't pay for additional housekeeping. We were very happy with this choice. The grounds are very clean without sand, so you're not tracking any dirt into the place and there's a washing machine and dryer, a dishwasher, cleaning supplies, etc so its easy to stay tidy. I would recommend this resort for families, couples, singles, etc. The resort does attract a lot of families though, so be aware that you'll be sharing the pool and deck with lots of kids. I can't say enough good things about this resort, but thought hard to come up with a few potential negatives: Positives: Friendly staff and accomodations are superb. Free WiFi. Free shuttle to Disney World. Large and clean pool with comfortable loungers. Free breakfast (bagels, danishes and fruit). Suite was massive, clean and well stocked. The resort is on a dead end road and over looks green space so its very quiet. We booked 3 months in advance and got an amazing rate for advanced booking. Potential negatives: You're not really within walking distance of anywhere, but rental cars are so cheap in Orlando so it doesn't need to be an issue. End of stay housekeeping fee of $39 if you stay less than 4 days (but you won't want to leave before then anyways). On-site store has basic items, but you'll need to shop elswewhere if you want fresh produce. Styrofoam cups at the water station and breakfast (personal pet peeve). Lighting in 1 of the bedrooms was very dim and we had to move in an extra lamp from the master suite.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: OSullFamily
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a great 14 night stay in Orlando. We picked WorldQuest Resort based on the good reviews on Tripadvisor and weren't disappointed. We had a three bed, three bath condo (Block 6 room 305)which was very spacious and very well equipped. We had a lovely view of a small lake from our balcony which was very relaxing. We didn't opt for any housekeeping as there was a washing machine/dryer in the apartment and it was very easy to keep up with washing towels, bed linen etc. Very quiet complex with great pool and very comfy sun loungers alongside. Had the complementary breakfast a couple of mornings which was perfect before getting started on a busy day at the parks. Other days we simply grabbed a bite in the apartment. I think a car is a necessity for getting to and from the resort (specially with shopping etc). Would certainly love to stay here again and would have no hesitation in recommending it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, nice location, decent value.”
Reviews.Author: OldPine_8
Reviews.Content: Our three bedroom, fourth floor condo worked out very well for our two couples and one child. The unit was in very good shape and had a nice screened balcony suitable for dining and TVs in every bedroom and the living area. The pool and hot tub were very nice. Security is good. Housekeeping services are a la carte and we opted only for fresh towel exchange at $5/day. As we stayed only 3 nights we had to pay an end of stay cleaning fee of $39. The complementary continental breakfast was fine with four cereals, muffins, danish, bagels, toast, coffee. Seating was scarce at times. We found all the staff to be accommodating and cheerful throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for families to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ninabel
Reviews.Content: I found out about this place from a friend. The rooms are clean with essential items for traveling with small children (kitchen and laundry). I was disapointed that I had requested rooms together for a family reunion several weeks in advance and they said they would be able to accommodate us but did not. However I was happy that they moved us to the same building the next day when a room opened up.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome price & value, perfect place to stay for visiting Disney!!”
Reviews.Author: aliciaq
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom, 3 bath condo in Bldg. 6 for a 6 day stay. We were extremely happy with the resort. The condo was a good size and was furnished nicely. The pool area is beautiful and the pool is huge. We didn't take advantage of the complimentary breakfast so I cannot comment on that. We went to Disney each day and the hotel is VERY close to all of the Disney parks -- just a quick 5 minute car ride (straight shot, no traffic). We did not use the hotel shuttle to the parks. Their shuttle will only take you to Epcot and it only departs 3 times in the morning and then does 3 set pick ups at Epcot in the evening. (We had small kids and didn't want to be 'stuck' at the park with a tired kiddo so we opted to drive ourselves.) If you stay in Bldg. 6, it is a 5 min walk up to the resort pool and clubhouse -- so if you are going to swim a lot then you probably want to stay in Bldgs 1, 2, or 3. The only things we didn't like about the condo were lack of lighting & limited seating in the living room. The bedrooms did not have enough lights in them -- they were very dark, in fact in the small bedroom it was so dim even during the day that you could barely see to pick out your clothing for the day. WorldQuest needs to install additional lighting in the bedrooms (i.e. and overhead fixture or can lights) In the living room, there was only a couch and 1 chair. We had 4 adults and 2 kids staying in the condo, so there wasn't enough room for all of us to sit. It would be good if they could add a loveseat in the living room for the 3 bdr units. Overall though, these complaints are very minor and would not stop us from staying at Worldquest again. For the price of a basic hotel (i.e. Hampton, Fairfield) we got 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms, a full kitchen, washer dryer, a dining room, living room, and balcony. And we were incredibly close to all of the attractions at Disney. We would highly recommend this property!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and close to Disney and shopping”
Reviews.Author: LyndaCR
Reviews.Content: We booked online and were not sure what to expect as we don't normally book condos for our vacations but the price was so great we decided to try it out. We arrived late at night and the staff was friendly and helpful. The unit was large...3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms with a screened in patio and comfortable living/dining area. There is a fitness room, large pool and a jacuzzi on the property and our condo had a great view of the lake/pond. We were happy to be so close to Disney yet away enough to provide a mental break for us. The property is also very close to a grocery store, restaurants and a WalMart for those odds and ends we always seem to forget. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great little resort close to all parks and in a quiet little area.”
Reviews.Author: Dandlbuckley
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 3 bedroom apartment. Excellent, very clean and well equipped. Free breakfast very nice and tasty bonus. Would definitely come back. So close to Disney but far enough away to be nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Bad Everything Else”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: We booked a 3 bedroom, 2 bath condo for a 3-day Disney vacation with 4 adults and 3 kids on a recommendation from a friend. While the rooms were very nice and clean initially, there were many things about our stay that completely turned us off to this hotel. After our first night we realized that we were only provided with 4 bath towels. In a condo of this size that is just ridiculous. We called housekeeping for more towels, which they brought up very quickly, but were surprised at checkout with a $40 housekeeping fee. This upset us because that was the only thing housekeeping ever did for us. They never even came in to make the beds. Speaking of beds, the sheets barely fit the beds and we found ourselves having to completely remake them every morning. What they call a continental breakfast was laughable. They only provide food in carbohydrate form (cereal and pastries), although there was some fruit. They never refilled the 2% milk and left it empty after 8:30. They claim that they have shuttle service, but it is only available a few times a day. It's NOT a constantly running shuttle service that you would expect, so you have to plan around the shuttle schedule if you want to use the service. After using the shuttle on the first day and realizing how inconvenient it is, especially for a family with young children, we ended up driving ourselves to the parks and paying for parking for our own convenience. The shuttle was also late to pick us up in the morning and we nearly ended up missing an appointment for one of our prepaid activities at Disney. So overall, the condo itself is very nice. It is kept up to date. The rooms were beautiful and held our group very comfortably. It is the (non-existent) amenities of this hotel that make it a "never again" for us. All 4 adults agreed that we would never be staying at WorldQuest again.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: ron l
Reviews.Content: very clean and good appartment. very helpfull staff. Wifi is very quick also in your appartment and is a good location for transport to disneyworld, seaworld, discovery cove and universale studio's (we went to). Also is 3,5 drive to Miami.

Reviews.Title: “Great value very close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: jeannettevidal
Reviews.Content: We had unit 3-102, a 3 bedroom very roomy indeed. The resort is about 2 miles to Disney entrance but hidden away so you need a car or reliable transport. The breakfast was good enough: cereals, bread, bagels, pastries, coffee, teas, juices, etc. I highly recommend based on value, however make sure you know all the fees you will have to pay so you are not surprised. Our bill was exactly what we expected. Toiletries: shampoo, face and body soap bars, tissue. Dishwashing liquid and sponge for hand washing dishes (none to run the dishwasher or to use the clothes washer). Everyone was friendly and the grounds were well kept. We did not use the pool or gym. If you are a Florida resident make your reservation online and input FLORIDA in the code and you get a % off but they will ask you for id.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible value”
Reviews.Author: lovetocruise74
Reviews.Content: This resort is seriously good value. Our 3 bedroom suite was massive, with all the comforts and facilities of home. The pool area is huge, and exceptionally clean and beautiful. The workout room was small and rather limited and I imagine when the resort is full it may be difficult to use, however I went very early in the mornings and didn't have a problem. Really appreciated that it was available 24 hrs. We appreciated having our own cooking facilities, and washing machine/drier. My only comment would be make sure you have a car. You definately need one to get to restaurants, shops, theme parks etc. Highly recommended, and would stay here again in a flash.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Accomodations at Awesome Price, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: 545MinnieW
Reviews.Content: Totally and pleasantly surprised after booking site unseen on the web, photos on internet describe the units to a tee and very well maintained. We had 3 adults, 4 children (ages 12 to 1) in a 3 bedroom, 2 bath condo and it worked perfectly and we saved money as well. We have definetly found the perfect spot for us and will highly recommend WorldQuest Orlando to all our friends, family and acquaintance. We left one night early due to weather so we are going back this week-end and have reserved our stay there again. Convenient to everything!

Reviews.Title: “best value for the price”
Reviews.Author: jerome n
Reviews.Content: I have visited Orlando on vacation six times and thsi is the most spacious quiet and wonderful hotel of all. The staff was very courteous and helpful with tips regarding wher to go etc. It is located within a ten mile radius of all major attractions. The rooms are well maintained and spacious. The area is very quiet which is a plus after a hectic day at the parks. The pool is large and very clean. The management of this hotel must be commended on how well run this place is and I will recommend this place highly, and on my next trip to Orlando I certainly will be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “5 star accom at a 3 star price”
Reviews.Author: Chris T
Reviews.Content: This is the best value for money resort in Orlando. It is 5 star quality, clean, friendly, convenient (especially to the theme Disney World, Universal, Sea World etc ), spacious, quiet, well appointed and terrfic value for money. The contninental breakfast as part of the deal was ideal. Far better than paying the Disney Resort prices. In any case, you have to travel each day to each of the parks. Hire cars are very cheap and far more convenient than shuttle buses. This allows you to go to some of the great local dining and get stuck into Premium Outlets. The kids loved the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “orlando conference”
Reviews.Author: Charity F
Reviews.Content: There were 4 of us from my office that needed to attend a conference in Orlando and we work for a non-profit organization so price and qualitiy are at the top of our list when travelling. When we checked into this resort we were greeted warmly and everything was in perfect order. Our room, which was 3 bedrooms and 3 baths, was BEAUTIFUL! Clean and fresh. Everything met our expection and then some and I would absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, especial for family stay”
Reviews.Author: Hong L
Reviews.Content: very good fecilities and very nice staff. I have recommended my friends to stay this hotel when they visit Disney Land in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: tomkat65
Reviews.Content: We are here right now, it is a three bedroom/three bath condo, right down the road from all disney things! Great specials, good breakfast, CLEAN'!!!!!!!!! Will definately stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: FourOverFiveOntario
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this place! The location is perfect, especially if you are planning to visit the theme parks such as Disney, Universal, Sea World, Gatorland, Discovery Cove. We were no more than a 10-15 min drive from all of these parks. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit and it was very spacious. Both of our girls had their own room and we had a big master bedroom with an ensuite bathroom that had a jacuzzi and a huge shower. There is even a spacious closet with a safe in the ensuite bathroom! Other amenities include a washer and dryer, dishwasher, full fridge, stove, microwave, a t.v. in every bedroom and a flat screen t.v. in the living room. We loved the fully screened in balcony that had a table and chairs so that we could enjoy our meals out there, bug free. We had a view of a lake from our balcony-it was so quiet and peaceful. There is also a huge heated pool, big hot tub and tiki bar that guests have access to as well. The tiki bar offers drinks and delicious food. If you forget anything, there is a little store in the main lobby where you can purchase all sorts of travel size items, as well as snacks and frozen pizzas. For a small fee, you can have a cleaning service where they give you fresh towels, and make your beds. They really have thought of everything to make your stay most comfortable. Because we had so many amenities and everything was so clean, we felt relaxed, comfortable and it felt like home away from home. We look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: NaveenDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 days on a trip to Disney with family and I enjoyed the stay here. The rooms were neat and clean. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Condo Resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: DanlinIL
Reviews.Content: I chose this resort based on the feedback of past guests and I'm glad I did! We needed a room for six people just for one night before we got on a Carnival cruise ship out of Port Canaveral. It was cheaper to book one condo instead of two hotel rooms. This three bedroom, three bath condo was almost as big as my house! Tons of room, very clean, beautiful decor, friendly staff! Very comfortable beds, centrally located, close to Disney and Kissimmee. We will definitely be back when we can stay longer. I can't believe how affordable it was!

Reviews.Title: “What a surprise!”
Reviews.Author: LikesComfortTraveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this property after reading reviews on Trip Advisor.... after having spent the money to be "on Disney" last year we thought we would try spending a full 7 days doing the parks "every other day" and enjoying a pool in between to make the trip a bit more relaxing. Positives: + clean and spacious condo with elevators available to take. (we were on the 3rd floor) + A nice sized Master Bedroom/Bathroom with jacuzzi tub and glass shower + Kids bedroom had 2 twin beds, a very large sized closet and a television with cable + curtains that blocked all the sunlight + air conditioning worked very well although the front bedroom (queen bed) got extremely cold compared to the back rooms and the kids bedroom with twin beds got the least amount of AC. + full kitchen with electric stove, microwave, coffee pot (ours needed to be replaced), toaster (ours only toasted one side of the bread at a time), pots and pans and dishes. +nice tile floors + Washer and Dryer + daily trash removal and maintenance came to fix a few a toilet and replace a light bulb for us quickly. + Quick drive to Disney and tons of stores, restaurants, Sea World etc. Walmart and Publix are both very close by + The pool area is very nice with very cozy chairs (very cushiony) and a bar with frozen drinks/beer/wine/food.. they provide the towels for you. There is also a hot tub. They also put out some balls for people to play with in the pool area and pipe in fun music + Really nice screened in porch which was great to watch the sunrise or sunset. A table and seating for 4. Negatives: - the appliances needed to be upgraded in our unit. - you have to pay to have your condo cleaned so we simply bought stuff and cleaned ourselves - no kiddie pool (our son is 3 and can't swim so we had to go purchase a Coast Guard approved life vest at a nearby Walmart) Overall I would highly recommend this condo for someone visiting the Orlando area. We had to drive to the various parks but it was not an issue at all. We paid about $15 a day to park in the parks but didn't have to wait for a bus or train at all....... and had the freedom to go eat at the nearby restaurants too with ease. In addition, I should add that my parents rented the condo right next to ours for 2 nights. The appliances were much more updated and the layout a bit more open with the kitchen directly open to the family room (ours had a wall). Theirs was a 2 bedroom. We were in 1307 and the condo right next to it. We really had no need for the cleaning service as we did our own towels etc easily.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE! Clean. One bad experience during stay.”
Reviews.Author: Steph W
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous resort. We stayed in building 7 which was only opened in June of this year. It was extremely clean and a a great size. We stayed in a 3 bedroom for 8 nights. With a family of 5 ,we would be killing eachother normally within 2 days. But this place is like a home away from home. There were 4 large flatscreen tv's. The pool was beautiful and probably one of the biggest pools we've stayed at. Even with other families in the pool, no one seemed to get in anyones way. The only downfalls to this resort is that it is so big. Being in building 7, the pool is quite a long way away. You don't want to really walk it in the heat. Also the breakfast was pitiful. We went down in the beginning but ended up just making breakfast in our room because even the toast there was nasty. Also, there was a lady down in the breakfast area working who pretty much had no personality and a wicked attitude. It surprised me that she was working there considering absolutely everyone else that worked there was very friendly and more than helpful. We did encounter a little problem while we were there. On our 2nd day at the pool there was a bit of a fuss because there was a snake in a bush. The resort manager and other worker were trying to find it and had a net so we thought that they would catch it and release it in the open lake area right beside the pool. To make a long story short, thats not what happened. The RM caught it and whipped its head to the ground killing it instantly. My 3 daughters watched the entire thing and my 11 yr old was devasted. She cried for 2 hrs and the next day refused to go to the pool. I got her to write a note to the resort and dropped it off before going out later on. When we came back there was a letter from the resort manager saying he was sorry that he did that but most people were pleased that he did. He then said from now on they would "shoo"them away and she saved the lives of future snakes. She was happy with that. All in all, it's a great resort, great location too.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest”
Reviews.Author: navtej b
Reviews.Content: Good Location. Nice big apartment with balcony, the pool is a good size and my children loved the hot tub! The staff are friendly and helpful, the only negative thing I can think of is the breakfast is quite limited and unheathly, lots of sugary things!!. The apartment itself has a good sized living area, master bedroom with en-suite is great, the kitchen has everything you need. However, I went for the 3rd most basic cleaning option (clean towels and empty bins) everyday, however I found halfway through our stay the floor was getting a bit messy and the sheets needed changing, unfortunately the apartment didn't have a hoover or even a broom and no clean sheets, so I ended up having to pay $39 for a full clean. All the major parks are within 20 minutes driving time( I hired a car). Overal would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular! Close, but away from it all!”
Reviews.Author: MontyBiggs
Reviews.Content: What more can Monte say than what was posted as a title. Great, large condo style units. Full equipped. Beautiful location and grounds. A fabulous pool. Even a free "breakfast". Nice touch. Well done Worldquest! You will not be sorry if you book this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Home from home - lots of space and a great location”
Reviews.Author: HoultFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights in august. Good, large well equipped rooms, great location for Disney and fantastic pool. The breakfast was ideal for us - cereal, pastries, toast, juice and coffee. The only disappointments were that the onsite shop was very expensive and we also "lost" a limited edition Disney cars toy in the room - we believe it was taken from the room whilst we were out, but no proof. These disappointments, however did not manage to spoil a good holiday.

Reviews.Title: “This was the best resort in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: Jill B
Reviews.Content: We recently had a convention in Orlando and needed to stay 2 nights and 3 days. We go every year and usually stay in a hotel with 2 beds, 1 bathroom and sometimes have to pay for a small fridge. Its always cramped, we have No privacy and have to share one bathroom. This year a friend told us about World Quest Resort. It was awesome! The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The place was immaculate and had everything we could possibly need and more! We had a huge 3 bedroom,2 bath unit,decorated beautifully and did I mention HUGE. My sister said she wished she could live there! The only downside was we wished we could have stayed longer! We will definately be back next year or anytime in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and very spacy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Franshuys
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Always a pleasure to stay at this resort when visiting Orlando. This time we had family members at World Quest and they enjoyed there stay as we did. Thank you ( staff and housekeeping ) for making our visit again so nice

Reviews.Title: “Exactly like the Photos”
Reviews.Author: wmsrav4
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 3 bedroom, 2 bath unit. When I booked my reservation over a month before my travel date, I requested a room in building 2 on a high floor so we could be near the pool and clubhouse. When I arrived, I had been assigned a room in building 7 on the 2nd floor, at the end of the property next to the swamp lake area. Although you are only about 3 minutes away from Disney, this place is very isolated. There was a lake in the back of the building 7 with warning signs about alligators. Although everything was clean and the unit was modern, well-equipped and only minutes away from disney, I would think twice before I would book it again because of the isolated swamp area it is located in.

Reviews.Title: “Customer service and location”
Reviews.Author: GlobalTravel13
Reviews.Content: Nice location close to downtown Disney and Disney parka. Pool a bit far from Building 3and up. Poor breakfast and rushed staff. Pool bar staff not engaging. We found her sleeping a couple of time and she did not apologize.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing and a great resort for families.”
Reviews.Author: Oscar C
Reviews.Content: Best resort I have stayed at in a while. Will definitely come back if ever in the area. Wish there where more places like this at other vacation destinations. Family had a great time and enjoyed each day of the stay. A little remote but that was one of the best features. Quiet and private, but still close to everything. I booked the room the day before check-in and still got an excellent rate and no issues at check-in.

Reviews.Title: “It more than exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: audrea s
Reviews.Content: World Quest was amazing from the moment we pulled in. Everything was very clean and all the staff was very welcoming! The rooms and the view were amazing as well! We are a family with 3 teenagers and even they were extremely impressed. The condos were very spacious and clean. We stayed in a 3 bedroom which was perfect because it allowed for everyone to have their own bathroom as well. The pool was amazing as well! There is not one bad thing I can say except they were experiencing internet troubles but it was handled immediately. The breakfast was perfect! It consisted of assorted pastries, bagels, fruits, and cereals. We don't eat very heavy in the morning, so it accomodated us just right. My only tip is to clean your own room and don't pay for the housekeeping. They take your garbage everyday for free and the room has a broom and vacuum. There is a washer and dryer in the room so you can wash everything you need to. There is also a little pond on the property which was fun to explore when the sun went down! This resort is great value and I won't stay anywhere else when we are in Orlando!

Reviews.Title: “Return visit was a pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: lunasatcc
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our second stay at WorldQuest immensely. Our huge three bedroom suite was clean and extremely comfortable. Having a kitchen and a washer / dryer is a huge plus. It's proximity to Disney World (only 10 minutes away) makes it an ideal resort to choose. I booked our suite online, two months in advance. When we arrived we were assigned a suite in building seven, which is far way from the pool area and hotel entrance. The room reeked of smoke. I returned to the front desk to request a room change since the smell of smoke was so unpleasant. The hotel staff was exceptionally gracious. They apologized for the smoky suite and immediately assigned us a room in building two, next to the pool and main building. I would definitely stay at World Quest again, although I would make sure to request, in advance, a smoke free room that is close to the pool. The only complaint my family had was the outdoor pool. My three daughters complained that the pool was not as clean as could be. They swim with goggles and they commented that there were lots of band-aids and other matter at the bottom of the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would book here again”
Reviews.Author: Adair K
Reviews.Content: Our stay at WorldQuest Disney was FANTASTIC - definitely exceeded our expectations. I was burned once before booking on the internet (the hotel looked fantastic in the pictures - but the rooms were disgusting and dirty and service terrible) - which is why I relied heavily on other reviewers this time around and why I am posting my own review (really never do this). The resort is very close to all things Disney and not far from Universal as well - gated community so safe. We did not take advantage of the shuttle - rented a car for convenience and to see other sites (be fore-warned that parking at any of the parks is anywhere from $13-$15/day) We were in building 7 (the newest building :) - yes far from the pool (but not too far for our 3 teenagers to walk). The pool facilities were great - lots of equipment to play with as well, with a Tiki bar and whirlpool. Complimentary breakfast was a nice bonus (don't know what others expect of a COMPLIMENTARY breakfast - it was danishes, toast, bagels, fresh fruit, cereal, coffee, juice - lots of it and replenished often). Our room was very spacious (3 bedroom suite) - absolutely wonderful to return to after a day at the parks to relax. With 3 teenagers, it was nice for each bedroom to have a flat screen TV to retire to and get a little down time. The whole place was VERY clean (I am picky!) - nice to have the amenities of a kitchen and washer/dryer. We mostly did pre-assembled meals - pizza, appetizers etc. - this cut down on restaurant costs and it was nice to sit and relax in the room. The surroundings were beautifully maintained and quiet as this resort is at the end of a large piece of land and not too populated. Contrary to what others have said, I found no "hidden" costs - we booked through Expedia and everything was clearly laid out (some travellers may be confusing this with hotels - it was a condo and yes we paid a one-time $39 cleaning fee at the end of our stay). Other housekeeping options were also offered at time of check-in and CLEARLY explained. The staff was responsive and friendly. Everyone in my family agreed that we would definitely book here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to call home when visiting!”
Reviews.Author: SandyWB
Reviews.Content: We were taking a long-awaited trip to Orlando to visit Disney World and the Wizarding World of Harry Potter. Traveling with two teenage girls, Gramma and Mom and Dad meant we needed space. World Quest offered modern amenities, ample space for everyone and quick access to the tourist locations. The condo was spotless and nicely furnished with modern appliances, flat screen tv's and a dvd player. wireless connection was quick (did I mention the two teenage girls?) Having laundry in the unit was wonderful. We had two small issues with the kitchen and bathroom sink that were literally resolved within a half-hour both times. Stay at World Quest and avoid the chaos and expense of the bigger hotels without sacrificing the service.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! What a resort!”
Reviews.Author: SweetNCrazy
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort from Aug 14-Aug 19th, 2011 and we loved it. The rooms are incredible, the staff was really nice and the pool was nice and warm. We got a room by the pool on the forth floor and it was great. We didn't have much to walk to get to the pool or go for breakfast. The pool is opened early in the morning and closes late at night which is great when you have plans during the day like visiting Walt Disney(which is close by). The breakfast includes lots of carbs, no hot breakfast but it was good and they have fresh fruit every day. They should not allow people to take food to their rooms because sometimes it looked like people were taking food for the day. The pool was nice. They have very comfortable chairs and always fresh towels. The staff was very friendly. The resort is gated and there is a guard to let you in so you have a better sense of security. The rooms, the bathrooms, the kitchen, the balcony, the decor,... WOW! Loved it and would definetely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort at a very good price”
Reviews.Author: Daniel R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Worldquest for our 10 days family vacation in Orlando. We were very pleased with the unit. It's very well located (5-10 minutes to WDW). They gave us a 3 rooms unit even though we booked a 2 rooms. Everything was very clean and in perfect condition in the room/kitchen/bathroom. The staff was friendly and the site is very safe. There was plenty of free parking spots. Breakfast was good but the breakfast room is a bit small. We got a 50$ Wal-Mart gift card as part of our package so we decided to buy breakfast items have breakfast in our room. This is our fifth stay in Orlando and we prefer by far this resort. Would definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with your family.”
Reviews.Author: robertedgerton
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay. We had three adults and three small children. With three bedrooms and two large bathrooms it was perfect. A great kitchen, living room, and dining area too. Even a washer and dryer. Great with small children. The staff was very accomodating and courteous. It was also close to all the parks. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A SECOND HOME”
Reviews.Author: LouiGalicia
Reviews.Content: The flight to Orlando from Washington took place on a very windy day making it a very bumpy, tiring ride. But WorldQuest has definitely cured my feeling very sick from that flight. The resort is about 25 minutes away from the airport and around $50 by cab. As soon as our cab entered the private road leading to the resort entrance, one can already feel the tranquility of the place. At the entrance, a security staff greets you and you can just marvel at the mediterranean feel of the place. The pastel-coloured buildings are very European. It's like you have just made your way to a Spanish town. We arrived in the evening and 24/24 staff at the reception was very friendly. The surprise comes as soon as you open the door to the villa. We had a 3-bedroom villa on the ground floor. It was huge. The master bedroom even has a huge bathroom with whirlpool bath and a separate shower. A definite treat for adults and kids as well. The place felt like a cozy second home away from home. An ideal place to crash during stressful times. I forgot about jetlag immediately. However, if you are coming from Europe or have taken a flight, it’s useful to rent a car in advance. There is no restaurant at the resort. There is a mini-mart that sells chips, drinks, sweets and items of necessity but that’s all. Even if the resort is very near the different Disney parks and other attractions, they are not readily accessible by foot. Even if the villa is designed to do some home cooking, one still needs to drive to nearby groceries or Walmart to get food supplies as one has to locate and drive to the nearer restaurants. Breakfast is plain American breakfast of toasts, bagels, Danish and muffins. Coffee and juices are from machines and everything’s eaten on disposables. The pool is cleaned early everyday and swimming starts around 10:30 if you like. There’s a separate cabana for towels so you don’t need to bring towels from your villa to the pool area. The pool is nice and there’s also a Jacuzzi. If you plan to stay at the poolside for the whole day, you can also order snacks like pizza, hotdog, cheesemac but that’s all. Nothing fancy. The cleaners are all speaking primarily in Spanish but are very friendly. Wi-Fi is free and available even in your own villa. This is very important especially if you want to stay in and just order food delivery. February is a quiet month because there are no tourists and traffic. Most of all, the weather and temperature are perfect for this time in Orlando. I never had to bring a jacket with me, except on the last day which was a little bit cloudy when I felt the need to wear a hoody. WorldQuest is definitely an ideal resort for a family who wants to relax after a hectic day in the Disney parks. It’s just a big waste to use such a homey place as a bed and breakfast as what we have done because we were mostly out after breakfast and only coming back when it’s almost bedtime. Definitely coming back here.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Days @ Worldquest”
Reviews.Author: Kennyboy777
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3-week stay @ Worldquest for our vacation this July(2011). We ahd a 3-bed 3-bath condo for 3-adults, excellent. Block 7 where we were located was the only drawback. After the first couple of days going back & forward to the pool and main building where the excellent complementry breakfast was served daily wasn,t a problem. Pool area was great,plenty of loungers & parasols for all, in this large complex.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to say again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: momof4onthego
Reviews.Content: My stay was last year, but I am writiting now because I realize that I only post for bad stays at hotels. I traveled and stayed in 2 condos because I had a family of 12 (3 bedroom and 2 bedroom condo). We had an amazing time. We are Disney fanatics but it is difficult for my mother to walk from our hotel room to the transportantion when staying on Disney property. THis is why I thought to try something new. I can say we were extremely impressed. We walked a short walk to the elevator. The room was beautiful and up to date. It was a 10 minute drive to the parks. The three bedroom suite was so beautiful. I loved having 3 bathrooms. I was able to purchase my park tickets there so another convience!!! THe only thing I did not like was that there wasn't a kiddie pool at the time, especially because we had 3 under 6 but oh well. We are leaving for Disney soon and I have to break it to the family that we are not staying there. They are not going to be happy. Hopefully hubby and I can make a trip and stay at Worldquest this November.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved It !!!”
Reviews.Author: Sarah34997
Reviews.Content: We loved this property, the villa was beautiful and spacious, the furniture was modern and up to date, the pool was huge,nice and clean,the location was great it is in town but tucked away in a corner so it's quiet,but the hustle and bustle of the city is just around the corner, my only complaint is that the snacks in the 24 hr shop is expensive a small microwave pizza cost $10 dollars, bag of chips $ 5 dollars and one 16 oz soda $3 dollars so go to wal mart which is around the corner or cvs for your snacks or food to stock your room. Otherwise it is a wonderful proprty to stay at and at a very good price.I will return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Nice spacious appartements, good beds, quiet, great pool, central location, very good value”
Reviews.Author: RuckstuhlC
Reviews.Content: Nice spacious appartements, good beds, quiet, great pool, central location, very good value

Reviews.Title: “Gem of a Find”
Reviews.Author: ukienomad
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful classy resort. Went with a friend and two children (8 and 3). The accommodations were great (we got a two bedroom). It was so much better than we expected. When you first walk into the reception area to check in, they have water flavored with fresh lemons, and apples and oranges to eat. The master bathroom had a jacuzzi tub, there was an enclosed lanai, it just had everything you wanted and then some. The continental breakfast was okay and could have been better but it was ample. The pool was large with cabanas and fresh large towels for you to use. All in all, it was a classy place to stay. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: sapphireambition
Reviews.Content: My family and I drove down for our wedding and some theme park fun, and made reservations at the recommendation of a friend who loved the resort. From the moment we opened the door to our suite, we were blown away. The suite was HUGE (1500 square feet for a three bedroom), the master bathroom was the size of most bedrooms and sported a jacuzzi tub and giant walk-in shower, and the pool and hot tub were wonderful to wind down in after a long day of amusement parks. Additionally, the front desk staff went above and beyond to help us secure limos for the wedding, and they were so wonderful and friendly. We couldn't believe the value we got, especially considering the price! We were so sad when we had to leave, but we eagerly anticipate our return! Kudos to WorldQuest on a fabulous resort!

Reviews.Title: “In general a good resort”
Reviews.Author: eric_qu
Reviews.Content: We choose this resort after seeing many positive review, basically I'm satisfied with my 10 days stay, it's quiet, clean, roomy, all room facility work well. If they can improve the following area it will be perfect. - Check in is slow, we arrived at 1am and waited about 15 minutes, there is only one front desk staff handle everything. - The convenient store food price is too expensive, after buying too bottle water with $5 each, we decided to go other place in the stay, it's not convenient to us anymore. - Breakfast food choice is too limited, we tried one day then decide to make our own with other options. - The bed is not comfortable, the sheet is not fit and always move, I have to adjust it myself everyday but still can not sleep well, this is the biggest issue for my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better experience - definitely will stay again”
Reviews.Author: rachface78
Reviews.Content: The resort was so inexpensive that I was worried about what it would look like when I actually arrived. It far exceeded my expectations. The property is beautiful and the rooms are every bit as nice as pictured online. The cleaning fee is clearly spelled out in the reservation section so it was not a surprise. We chose to straighen up ourselves and we washed our own towels since there was a washer/dryer and soap in the suite. Being located in Building 6, there was quite a distance to the pool. However, we drove up there the night we used it and easily found a parking spot close by. There were pool toys provided by the hotel that the kids enjoyed playing with. I appreciated the safety features to keep small children from entering/exiting the pool area. My only real complaint was that there weren't enough parking spaces in front of the building. We often had to park around the corner from our building. Coming in at 1 am from Disney and not being able to find a spot nearby was a little inconvenient. The hotel feels like it is very isolated and yet it is centrally located. We were only 1-2 miles from the entrance to Disney and there was also a Wal-Mart and Publix grocery stores within short driving distance. The market located at the hotel was open 24 hrs but didn't have some of the first aid supplies we ended up needing.

Reviews.Title: “Great place.”
Reviews.Author: vteixeira66
Reviews.Content: We liked our stay very much. It is a huge apartment, with all the amenities necessary. The pool is pretty good, the staff was very helpful, the location is wonderful. From my balcony or my bedroom window, I could keep an eye on my kids at the pool, it was safe and fun. I'd definitely stay there again and I would, most certainly, recommend it to anyone, specially friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it and would go back again!”
Reviews.Author: Darlenesweet22
Reviews.Content: We had 7 people in our party and we all had plenty of space. The 3 bedroom 3 bath unit was so spacious and very clean. The pool area is beautiful and very relaxing. The grounds are perfectly maintained and the entire staff was very friendly. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant apartments, great location”
Reviews.Author: moss3
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 2 week holiday at this resort, and I would recommend it. We had a 2 bed apartment in block 3 that was ideal. We were very impressed with the room facilities - dishwasher, full cooker, fridge/freezer, microwave and best of all, washer and dryer! I've read one of the reviews that said their kitchen utensils were poor and limited. We had good china and glasses and more pots and pans than you can shake a stick at. They must have been very unlucky. The beds we found were good also. We did struggle to find it initially, despite having a sat nav. It sent us slightly wrong when we were nearly there, but we managed to find it in the end. Be aware though, it's not in walking distance of any restaurants, so you will need to drive if you are eating out. There are plenty of restaurants within a 5 minute drive, and a big Walmart nearby (opposite the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall). My recommendations would be - don't take too many clothes, that's what the washer and dryer are for and I would recommend a sat nav if you are driving - we would have been struggling if we didn't have one. The Tiki bar only stays open until 9pm, which we thought was a shame, it would be nice to have a drink after a hard day at the parks! All in all, great value for money - we booked with Jetsave and it was just as cheap as arranging it all ourselves for our particular requirements.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Tonifermanagh
Reviews.Content: We are just back from Orlando, and stayed in WorldQuest Resort for 8 nights. We had difficulty finding it and seemed to be driving around for ages, before venturing past the sign. Our check in was slow. There was only one girl on the desk, dealing with all the checkins, purchases from the shop, answering the phone etc. Our 3 bedroom condo was spacious. We had only 2 bathrooms, as opposed to other reviewers saying they had 3. The master bathroom was huge! There was no separate utility room. The washer and dryer were in a cupboard beside the bedrooms, and were very noisy when you put your washing on after coming back late from the parks! The windows from two of the three bedrooms looked out onto the internal corridors. Other guests walking past can look straight into your bedroom if your curtains are open. We kept them closed all the time for security. I think blinds would have been a better option for the hotel, for privacy. Most of the rooms seemed to be like this. The beds were quite uncomfortable. The sheets seemed too small for the bed, and kept springing off during the night, revealing a very lumpy mattress protector! We selected the clean towels option for an extra $5 per day. I think this is very good value. We stayed for 8 nights but were never left clean bedlinen to change the beds. I wonder how long you would have to stay to get clean linen? We have stayed in Vista Cay several times, but picked World Quest this time due to the location. While World Quests location and proximity to the parks is fantastic, Vista Cay is a far more superior resort. We would have no hesitation selecting Vista Cay over World Quest next time!

Reviews.Title: “will not return””
Reviews.Author: jonny043
Reviews.Content: Spent two days at the WorldQuest with friend and we find a snake in are 3 room condo...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodations and location - we will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Hopb4
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at WorldQuest! Our 2 bedroom accommodations were spacious, clean, well-appointed, and a welcome respite after busy days at local amusement parks. Our boys (ages 3 and 1) loved the jacuzzi tub the most. The resort was beautiful, the pool was refreshing, and the continental breakfast was a nice way to start each day. We were impressed with how friendly and helpful the front desk staff members were, greeting us each day and taking the time to talk to our boys. The daily housekeeping service was delightful - loved not having to do dishes while we were on vacation! The location was perfect - close and convenient to Disney, as well as area eateries, yet once we drove through the gates, we felt like we left everything behind us. The only downside we could find was the free resort shuttle to Disney, as it offered limited pick up and drop off times that did not coincide with our boys' nap schedule. While we ended up driving to Disney each day, it was a very easy drive and truly wasn't a big problem for us. Driving allowed us to come and go as we pleased, which in the end worked out better. Overall we were very impressed with WorldQuest, and highly recommend it! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: vegaslover2010
Reviews.Content: Arrived on 8th June for 2 week stay with other family members. Stayed in building 1 which overlooked the pool so great location. Had a 2 bed condo per couple which we could not fault apart from the patio door having no safety sticker and therefore an accident occurred when husband walked into closed door causing nose bleed. Did point this out to reception staff who agreed and said they too had walked into the doors but didn't appear to be concerned of possible injuries to children. Having said this our stay was brilliant. Breakfasts were as expected for the price paid. As other reviewers have commented the staff maintained the cereal, bread and pastries stocks. Was made aware of the cleaning services available and chose only to have bins emptied and extra towels which we thought were fairly priced. The complex was a good Taxi ride from any attractions but between 4 of us worked out fairly well. Would hire a car next time. One criticism would be the taxi company the complex uses. USA transportation. Our son who was with us had stayed at the complex in Sept 2010 and once ordered the taxi arrived within 5 - 10 minutes. This stay we were waiting for over 25 minutes most days. Again the front desk staff were helpful and tried to address this. In the end we called for the taxis well before we wanted so the wait time was reduced. Wifi access was free but service was slow at times, unsecure and connection dropped considerably but really didn't matter as we didn't come on holiday to spend all day on the web.

Reviews.Title: “great place for a family”
Reviews.Author: famfun6
Reviews.Content: World Quest was very accommodating. We missed our flight due to weather so I called to let them know we would be late (next day) and when we arrived the next day and they had a room (condo) available for us and did not charge us for the night before. The room was great and very spacious and clean. We have 4 kids so it i was very nice they each had a place to sleep - not on a pullout. The pool was great - good place for small children.

Reviews.Title: “This is a beautiful condo hotel. We loved it and will stay there on our next trip to Orlando.”
Reviews.Author: mmnestor
Reviews.Content: We booked this condo hotel after viewing pictures and the tour online. I did not check any reviews at all. We were concerned that once we got to the hotel that we would be disappointed because the hotel presented itself as too good to be true, as has happened to us a number of times at other hotels. We could not have been more wrong. This place is beautiful. We love the Mediterrean style buildings, the colors used throughout our unit. The furniture was attractive and firm (no sinking feeling here), the kitchen more than met our needs (we cooked breakfast and dinner on most nights we were there. Our master bedroom and bath was beautiful and the kids (while they had to share the two other bedrooms) spent alot of time in their rooms when we were not doing something or going somewhere. Finally, while we cooked our breakfast, some of our kids opted for the continental breakfast in the clubhouse - they loved it and the spread/amount of food was impressive. The hotel did not go cheap on the free breakfast. The pool was fantastic. It is a 10,000 square foot pool. It was never crowded and other guests were considerate. The pool furniture was plentiful and we never had any problems getting loungers for the six of us. The only regret we have is that we did not use it often enough. The landscaping around the pool and the buildings was very attractive and well maintained. The hotel management had plenty of employees makng sure that the property looked beautiful. This was our return to Orlando after a 6 year hiatus and we wanted our children (and ourselves) to get to Disney one more time. We have stayed at the Polynesian (great but prohibitive) and at the Nick Hotel (which is about a half mile from World Quest ). Never again will I pay hotel rates for one room and one bathroom. So long as this place is around, we will go there. We even had some excitement on our last night. We had just returned from Animal Kingdom and were relaxing when an electrical storm came to our area. Lightning and thunder struck at the same time and our son ran out of his bedroom to tell us that there was fire (not on hotel property) but just outside the parking lot area in an wooded area. I called the front desk and then saw her running to the area of the fire. The fire department (about 3 fire trucks came) was there in about 10 minutes and took care of the fire. We had to evacuate our building (Building 2) but were allowed back in after an hour or so. Overall, we still talk about World Quest and how much we like our stay there. I have offered to take the family back there if we skip our trip out west. So far no takers but I have 3 more weeks to make it happen (I already have one convert to my cause).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, lacks service”
Reviews.Author: sitraveler_11
Reviews.Content: The first impression I got when I arrived at Worldquest Resort was: Wow! What a great place to stay. The grounds are amazing, well mantained. We were assigned a very nice 3-bedroom room, quiet and with a wonderful view. The rooms are spacious, you feel just like home! The only complaint we have about worldquest is: 1) they charge you for cleaning; 2) the breakfast is very modest and is offered only until 9:30. If you book a hotel, what you expect, at least is cleaning service. Not only they don't provide that (only removing your trash, what is done, but not very effeciently, and that's all), but they charge you an expensive amount to have your towels changed and your room cleaned. Not only that, they do not refill soaps and toilletries. Be prepared to bring them from home, or be prepared to buy some at Orlando once you arrive because the soap they provide you with lasts 1 day. And the breakfast, well.. it's very modest. Don't expect much here. And often very crowded. And in my opinion, should last at least half an hour longer. You're on vacation, after all! All things considered, we loved the hotel and its ground, but expected more when it comes to service. If you overlook that, surely you'll have a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will gladly go back!”
Reviews.Author: linds6424
Reviews.Content: Great Resort! Tucked away into a nice quiet and private area, yet only 2 miles from Disney. All parks were very easy to get to from this resort. The resort was very nice and clean. Condo like setting made our vacation very comfortable and felt like home away from home. The staff is very friendly and willing to help! Breakfast staff was very attentive and did a great job making sure tables stayed clean, trash emptied and food filled. We definitely recommend this resort and will definitely be back next time we go to Disney!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jane5979
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at World Quest in Orlanda. The location was great - just a mile from Disney. We stayed in Building 7, condo 102. I had read where others had described the space but I was still shocked at the large rooms. The master bath was very large and the 2nd bathroom was good. The condo was very clean and the beds were comfortable. We had a three bedroom condo with a king bed in the master, 2 twins in the 2nd room and a queen bed in the 3rd bedroom. The swimming pool was nice but it was a fairly long walk from our condo so if you have little children, you would need one closer to the pool area. We did experience a few problems: 1) we had to constantly call and ask for towels; we ran out of toilet paper and had to run down a housekeeper to get it; 2) the furniture in the living room was not comfortable like you would expect-there was a formal, stiff plastic/leather couch and one "fancy" chair; the drapes were very formal; 3) the kitchen was poorly stocked - one frying pan that looked like it came from the Dollar Store, a toaster that did not work, one or two bowls, and very few utensils to cook with; 4) very poor lighting in the living and eating area - three track lights and 2 were burned out. There were no replacement bulbs and no extra blankets or bedding in the condo. However, I would go back to this place. It is much better than the Disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Baroniestad
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in Worldquest resort. Appartments are very spacious. Kitchen has all amenities you need. TV with many channels. Large bathroom with seperate tub and bath. Washing machine ... Free internet. Beds are a little bit to soft but some people may like that. Every day free newspaper. Free breakfast is nothing special but if you just need a bit and some coffee it is sufficient. We however prepared in most cases breakfast in the appartment Swimmingpool is very nice. There are enough chairs throughout the day so you can lay down whenever you want. Private road to the property is also very nice. In the evening we often saw racoons or armadillos.

Reviews.Title: “Love, Love, Love”
Reviews.Author: LoveFloriday
Reviews.Content: This place looks just like it is pictured on the internet. I will say that I was skeptical when I booked at such a great rate. Thought it was too good to be true, and it was! We will stay here next time we go to Orlando, and I have spread the word to other families from Minnesota that are planning a vacation, you just can't beat the place and the price. There is a Publix grocery and a Walgreen just 5 minutes away. The location is just a short drive to the Disney properties and not much traffic. Cannot wait to get back to sunny Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: Eugene2359
Reviews.Content: Spent three days at the WorldQuest with a large family, and their accomodations were spacious and very well maintained. The proximity to all Disney parks was perfect, one road in and then back out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay would come back again!”
Reviews.Author: BTJV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WQR during June 5-12th 2011 with our 2 kids 1yr and 4 yrs. The resort is beautiful and nice. We were not too far from Disney so that was convenient. Our 2 bdrm condo was large enough for 2 more adults by great from our kids to move around in. We made use of the kitchen and washer/ dryer. We opted out of using the extra services and saved. The nice part about staying here instead of a Disney resort is the large space and extra rooms for the kids to sleep while the adults stay up. In addition, it's also nice to come back to a quiet resort without all the craziness from a Disney resort. We were happy with the Free Continental breakfast each day which was stocked up when low.
