The pool was huge and   not busy at all. Fresh towels provided by the pool area. The only complaint we had was small bugs (still not sure what they were) on the kitchen counter. Seem those in other resorts too. Maybe they showed up because of the food. It didn't bother us as they were super tiny. The other thing was our fridge did not want to stay closed so we just put a chair there to keep it shut and everything stayed cold. We had a great time at WQR and have already recommended it to our friends and family. Would definitely come back. Thanks for a lovely week!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: wab7093
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to attractions yet still able to enjoy peace and quiet. Very large two bedroom with two bathroom and large screened patio gives the feeling of "home" rather than "hotel".

Reviews.Title: “You should read this review!”
Reviews.Author: turbonitrous
Reviews.Content: We booked this resort 2 months in advance for our Disney Vacation and stayed 8 days. I read many of the reviews on trip advisor and some of them made me nervous before the trip. I am happy to say that all my fear was gone 15min after arrival! Absolutletly outstanding!! We stayed in building 1 in a 3 bedroom suite, and let me tell you it has all the room you need. We have stayed in Disney before and this was our first experience outside the park...Completely worth it, especially when you have a larger group so you don't have to be sitting on top of each other like in the disney resort....and for half the cost. The staff was very friendly and happy to help us anytime we needed anything. We opted to decline the daily room service...we were perfectly capable of washing our own towels and keeping it tidy. The pool was beautiful and never overcrowded..great music playing all day long. We stayed on the ground level and you would think there would be some noise...nope! very quiet. Something you definetly want to have is a car. Super Walmart is a couple of miles away and you can stock up on food (there is no restaurant at the resort) and supplies. All the Disney hot spots are literally only 5-10min drives from the resort (the resort does have shuttles but we loved the flexibility of coming and going as we pleased). The complimentary breakfast was nice so you could get up and get a quick bite and be on your way. I would also suggest you stay in building 1,2,or 3 just because they are closest to the pool. I have nothing but good things to say about this resort and while everyone is entitled to their own opinion I found some of the negative and pretentious ones on trip advisor to be unfounded. Bottom line is we loved it and would stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice for the Price”
Reviews.Author: hike337
Reviews.Content: 2 families 4 adults 4 kids - 2,5,7, & 9 We just returned from our first trip to Disney World and we stayed at WorldQuest for 7 nights. We enjoyed our stay at the resort and would recommend it to anyone looking for a good price and convenient location. We stayed in the 3 bedroom condo with another family and it was plenty of space. The resort seems to be fairly new but don't expect top notch appliances or flat screen TV's. The rooms were clean and we had no problem with noise. The pool was also very nice but nothing special. I would give this place 3 1/2 stars if I could, but I don't think it's a 4 or 5 star resort. We paid about $150/ Night. Divide that by 2 families and that equals a very affordable trip. With all the places to stay in that area, we will be trying another resort for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disney World”
Reviews.Author: KristiB_11
Reviews.Content: This property is great for families or groups. We had plenty of room to spread out, and we cooked breakfast every day in the full kitchen. This property is only minutes from Disney World, lots of restauants, and a grocery store. Also the staff was friendly. We will stay here again if we vacation in the area again.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of room. Nice pool.”
Reviews.Author: kcjayhawk11
Reviews.Content: My two sons, ages 8 and 10, my husband, and I stayed here for a family vacation. We had a two bedroom suite. The rooms are very spacious and nice. Having a kitchen and a washer/dryer was very convenient. The pool is nice and has a bar. It is very close to DisneyWorld and not far from SeaWorld/Universal Studios. Kathy, in Guest Services, is very nice and gives you detailed information. This is a no-frills hotel. But it has some great benefits. There is one pool and it doesn't have a slide or anything. You can't rent movies on your tv. There is no room service or restaurants on site. However, it has a good size pool and we always had plenty of space and cushioned chairs when we were there. The rooms are wonderful with the screened in patios and the spaciousness. The kitchens are well equipped and the hotel is in a good location. For the money, it was an excellent deal. I only had one minor complaint: our sofa looked as though people had been sitting in ever since it was built. The cushions were very thin and it seemed very worn out. Other than that it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, fab value”
Reviews.Author: tsquaredChicago
Reviews.Content: we rented the 3 bedroom 3bath unit, it was myself, my 2 sisters and my 2 daughters. this location allowed us a ton of room to spread out after long days at the parks. the convenience of having a full kitchen and plenty of bathrooms for getting ready in the mornings/evenings was huge! every request/question we had was answered/serviced in a timely manner. the pool area is gorgeous and comparable with many upscale resorts I have been to in mexico. if I had to make any suggestions it would be to improve lighting/lamps, mattresses esp in twin bedroom. sheets did have a tendency to come off at the corners. also the free breakfast could have more kid friendly items, cereals... again small details and for this value I cannot say these are big enough to cloud my opinion of this resort. you will be crossing under the disney world welcome sign in a few minutes tops, you cannot get this amount of space unless you pay many times more than this on property and even at that point you may be just as far away from the magic kingdom. we did not use the shuttles, we rented a car for more flexibility. if you are a family or bigger group looking for homelike accomodations close to everything this would be a great choice

Reviews.Title: “Great Orlando Resort”
Reviews.Author: lawdog5702
Reviews.Content: Positives were great, great price, super clean, nice pool and friendly staff. Need maybe onsite restaurant and gameroom for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful to return to after a day at Disney”
Reviews.Author: cookpb
Reviews.Content: Our young family of 4 had a 3 bedroom condo. A lot of space,full kitchen, washer/dryer, screened in balcony. Pool was large, great for younger kids, pool loungers nice and tiki bar open. Music played at the pool was odd at times. breakfast included( continental style) room was clean. no cleaning service daily unless you pay a fee. $5 /day for just clean towels daily. within a mile is super target/walmart/starbucks etc.. Disney a short 5 min car ride. For the price this is an excellent value, we liked the spaciousness of the 3 bedrooms and nice pool area. downside: bed linens irritated my skin- washed pillowcases with my own laundry detergent and it was better. bedding was a low quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: doxiemom006
Reviews.Content: Worldquest is near everything! Our condo was very nice. My only complaint is the we could hear the people in the room above us constantly! I would stay there again, but would request the top floor

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will recommend it”
Reviews.Author: Pursemustmatchshoes
Reviews.Content: Our suite was lovely. We had a 2-bedroom, 2-bathroom suite with full kitchen and living room. The pool and pool house were beautiful, too! We swam every day. The location of the resort was close to Disney World, especially, and not far from Universal Studios. The only negative is that the continental breakfast was great for most people but not for 3 family members who are gluten-free. We could only eat the apples and oranges. Of course, "continental breakfast" does normally mean bread, so I can't say we were misled. This was a very minor disappointment, all in all, and it did not detract from our overall enjoyment of the resort and the vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: higandhug
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at World Quest Resorts. We love it! We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo with 3 adults and 4 kids and enjoyed how spacious it was. For the price, you just can't beat this resort!!! We visited Sea World, Aquatica, and Busch Gardens and found this location still very convenient. It is right outside of Disney but not a bad drive to any other park. Having a full sized refrigerator and a kitchen helped us eat in a couple of times which saved us money. We got bagels from the continental breakfast some mornings but never really went down to eat. We had a couple of minor problems while we were there (shower curtain fell down, door lock needed to be reset), but it was literally less than 5 minutes from the time I called to report the problem to the time the handy man was in our condo! Awesome service! He could not have been nicer! We were supposed to go to Blizzard Beach one day during our trip, but the pool was so inviting and the Tiki Bar so convenient that we stayed at World Quest instead. It was a wonderful and relaxing day! The food and drink at the Tiki Bar was very nice as well! The only complaint is that the beds are a little cheap and slightly bouncy. New mattresses at some point would make a huge difference in sleep quality. I highly recommend World Quest Resorts!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, great pool but will not return”
Reviews.Author: CaptinEO7
Reviews.Content: I must state from the start that our apartment at the Worldquest Resort was booked via a third party & the cleaning company used to maintain the property we stayed in was not the resort's regular staff ... we booked through Sky who I understand look after the nearby Lake Buena Resort. We've stayed in and around Orlando approximately a dozen times & this was the only time I've been truly disappointed with our accomodation. We're not overly fussy, always look for the good in things as opposed to hunting out negativity & in fairness had arrived at Worldquest after a wonderful Disney Cruise so we'd gone from being pampered to looking after ourselves but ultimately, we just couldn't settle at Worldquest. The location is very good, whilst the nearest stores or restaurants are a couple of minutes drive away it is incredibly close to Walt Disney World & sits very much on it's own in a wooded area at the end of a quiet road. I think this was a small part of the problem with the resort in fact in so much that due to it's location & position around the lake there were far more bugs around than any other place I've visted in and around the area. I'm very aware that the whole area has ultimately risen from swampland but it's the first place we've ever stayed where we felt it a nuisance. Whilst we never spottted any cockroaches or larger bugs in the apartment itself, the public areas around our block were constantly teeming with insects & we'd wished we were staying closer to the pool & further from the lake which may perhaps have led to less bugs (and itching !). The single worst problem with our stay was the level of cleanliness in our apartment but as already stated, this may well have been down to the alternative cleaners. Whilst it wasn't dirty everything felt like it needed a proper clean & the bedroom drawers, kitchen cupboards, etc were dusty. We took to cleaning all cutlery & tableware prior to using them which we would not normally do on vacation. There was a cigarette butt smack bang in the middle of our balcony which again isn't the worst thing in the world but shows the total lack of care when the apartment must have been cleaned. The apartment itself was a good size & nicely laid out but the level of furnishings & fixtures were mixed. Whilst the washing machine, tumble dryer were top notch & beds & sofa comfortable, we had leaking taps, torn bed linen & pathetic water pressure in the shower. Large unsightly stains on the cream-coloured bedroom carpet also meant you couldn't help but think the place needed a bit of a refresh which is a shame as generally it didn't need a lot of work. The pool area & main buildings were truly lovely. Well kept, beautifully laid out & extremely spacious, all adjacent to a lake (in which we enjoyed spotting the resident alligators). Overall we got a good deal on a 3 bedroom apartment at the WorldQuest but soon wished we'd booked into a similarly priced hotel as the quality & upkeep of the apartment meant we'd have foregone the benefits of a larger accomodation in favour of a well kept hotel with regular cleaning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: flgator99
Reviews.Content: World Quest always exceeds our expectations! If you have a large family, you can't beat the price for the size suites available. I have stayed at World Quest twice. The 2 and 3 bedroom suites are huge! I will be staying at this hotel again in the future. The only aspect of the hotel that needs improvement is the lack of shade out at the pool. The umbrellas are small and not very many. MORE SHADE AND LARGER UMBRELLAS ARE REQUIRED!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay with the Family!”
Reviews.Author: mariela1116
Reviews.Content: I definitely will be back soon. !!! Simply <3 it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hidden family resort”
Reviews.Author: 8solstice
Reviews.Content: It's the best place I've stayed in Orlando so far. I liked that the master bdrm separated from the other two bdrms. Hugh kitchen & bthrm. I'll definitely come back here with family.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful suite with all the amenities without paying a high price.”
Reviews.Author: MBeaulieu
Reviews.Content: Making a reservation online is seamless. The website is a great depiction of the resort and the rooms. The price is a great deal for this resort and all that is has to offer. When we arrived, we were informed they sold out of the two bedroom suites and they had upgraded us up to a three bedroom suite. We were so impressed with this offering. The rooms are spacious and the layout is amazing. The kitchens are equipped with everything you need to cook or entertain. You just need to supply the food. We enjoyed sitting on our balcony overlooking the nature preserve. It is beautiful and you don't have to worry about getting attacked by bugs as the balconies are completely screened in. The master bedroom is beautiful but my absolute favorite part about the suites are the master bathrooms. They are so open and spacious with a beautiful jacuzzi garden tub in the corner and a huge open shower with a double sink granite vanity. This bathroom is as large as a bedroom. The pool felt wonderful at the end of the day. The tiki bar by the pool is a wonderful addition to make it more of an enjoyable time. The grounds are kept clean. The continental breakfast was really nice. We would pick up our breakfast and come back to our room and sit on the balcony to enjoy the outdoors. I recommend this resort to all my friends. It is a great find and is wonderful for families with kids because the spacious suites allows for everyone to have their own rooms as well as spend time together in the living room or dining area. You aren't stuck in one large room. It is like a home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation resort - True value for money and more”
Reviews.Author: Sarveshi
Reviews.Content: Your perfect vacation to Orlando should start with Worldquest resort. I travel a lot and stay at diverse categories of hotel. After a great deal of research we finalized on this resort and I am so glad we did. Right from the entrance, I was pleasantly surprised. The plush resort is just a short 10 minutes drive from Disney parks. The security standards of this hotel are high and I am glad the scecurity team was alert without being rude. The reception was warm and very friendly. Our double bed suite was very beautiful, well maintained and had all the amneties. I liked the layout, color scheme and quality of the facilities present in the room. The bathrooms need a special mention for being extremely clean and the kind I love since I am extremely finicky about them. The breakfast served was good quality too and the staff overall was very efficient. They have shuttles to disney parks and also sell some discounted packages to these theme parks and they have people at the conceirge helping you find the best deal to these parks. We had people of all ages in our group, from my 2 year old niece to my parents who are 55 and we all had a wonderful stay at this resort. I highly recommend this resort to anyone planning a trip to Orlando..... You would be pleasantly surprised to see the amazing services you receive at the price you pay for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Top Noch Resort, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: kkg78
Reviews.Content: With 3 bedroom and 3 baths this condo was great! It was more than I expected. Each person had their own space to get away. The pool area was very nice and the view from the patio was great. The location of the condo was great also. It was in the heart of Orlando, but the set up made it seem like you were in your own area. Security is also at the gate to view parking passes. I liked that feature too.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Extrudrep
Reviews.Content: Great value. Great comfort. Great fun. We would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Great - did exactly what it promised”
Reviews.Author: JPR69
Reviews.Content: We had a 2 bed, 2 bath condo - v spacious, clean, modern, air conditioned with balcony. Great kitchen gave us the option of eating in. Breakfast included - cereals, tea/coffee, fruit, bagels, pastries. No parking fees (some Orlando hotels now charging). Friendly, helpful staff. Large pool. Our children are 6 & 7 and we were there for a Disney holiday. Close to Disney parks and not far from SeaWorld etc. We would go back. We were not there in high season. Free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 4 star worthy resort. Upset and suprised by our stay. It Sucked. Run.”
Reviews.Author: orlandoauction
Reviews.Content: Im a big traveler, and a resort expert here in my hometown of Orlando, Florida, Ive been to almost every one. Please read carefully. My mom and her husband, both seniors, booked this resort as part of a package deal from Expedia. They stayed 5 days 4 night. My young daughter and I stayed 3 of the nights with them. We had a 2br suite, with kitchen, washer dryer, all the stuff you would expect from a resort. I looked up the resort here on Tripadvisor, and saw overall excellent reviews, so was happy for my folks. That was short lived. The place was built 5 years ago. It is a Mediterranean style complex with 5 separate 5 story buildings. Half face the massive pool in the center of the complex. The ceiling fan in our living room did not work. The rooms were dark, not enough lighting, and we don't use alot of light. The dryer did not work, and that sucks for families with kids as us. The 2 single beds in the guest bedroom were of the lowest quality I have ever slept on in a resort. Most regular hotels are far superior in bedding. The plastic mattress wraps did not fit the light weight, cheapo mattress and platform. the wheels were not lockable. There are no blinds on the windows, which is VERY odd for Florida. Only curtains, and not even a light blind on the curtain rod. The windows themselves are cheap, and the whole building had a feel of super cheap construction and materials. I know that line of work well. The window in the guest bedroom was literally falling apart, we attempted to open it, and the entire window came out of the frame. You cant make this stuff up. The doors were louder than one would expect, the elevators were unacceptably slow, 2 minutes in one example for only the 3rd story. The TVs were old school massive units with crappy pictures, all 3 of the,. All TVs had mismatched remotes, which barely worked. Breakfast was below poor. No waffle machine, Only 2 types of semi stale cereal. None for the kids. A weak assortment of ultra small bread items that were all obviously past their freshness. Old fruit, a not much of it. Very small, luke warm yogurts. Just not cutting it. It was an embarrassing breakfast. We had to go eat out every day, so that alone takes a ton of time, and value, away from this place. The dining area was woefully small, more than half the people who came down to eat this pathetic cont. breakfast left, or stood up sipping coffee, which thankfully was adequate. The coffee that is. There were plenty of towels at the pool area however, a plus. The pool cabana has drinks, but they are way over priced, even for a tourist corridor resort near the attractions. Simply not an option. The jacuzzi was massive, uncomfy, luke warm, and not bubbly. The pool is a walk if you get placed on the parking lot side of the pool , there are no walkways through the building, so you have to walk all the way around the building to get to the pool, again, simply not practical for families, or anyone really, what were these designers thinking? Finally, the place is located on a dead end street which is poorly lit, and in the middle of the woods, it is VERY hard to find, and I'm a local. I cant imagine having to GPS your way to this place. Considering the overwhelming assortment and quantity of resorts near Disney, this place strikes out on all levels. It is the first unpleasant surprise for me regarding an undeserved rating here on Tripadvisor. I have ever had. I cant explain how other guests have enjoyed this place unless they simply do not stay at many resorts. This place sucked, and bad. Over all, this place is a huge, disappointing thumbs down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: ginermom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WorldQuest Orlando for four nights. Two teenagers, two college students, and two parents. Three bedroom with three bathrooms provided the perfect amount of space. Rooms were clean and spacious. Pool area was beautiful. Resort is less than 5 minutes from Disney Magic Kingdom; 10 minutes from Universal. Many, many restaurants are seven minutes from resort. Perfect for a family, and reasonably priced. Will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous...”
Reviews.Author: gagaxua
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Worldquest was simply unforgetable, beautiful rooms , great pool area .I sure recommend it to all my friends and anyone willing to spend quality time with family and friends .We loved it .....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, convenient, affordable, and friendly staff...will return!”
Reviews.Author: Laurdan16
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay at WorldQuest resort. The resort was nice and hidden away from traffic but convenient to all parks and shopping. Rooms were clean and attractive. We are a family of 5 and had plenty of room. Screened in patio was a nice touch. Pool was clean and the Tiki Hut serving alcoholic and non-alcoholic drinks was a plus as well as having music. Toiletries were provided and it was well worth the $5 a day to have fresh towels brought in everyday and trash removed. All dishes to eat and cook were also provided. We lucked out and were placed in building 1. If planning on staying, one may want to request to stay in building 1, 2, or 3. These are closest to the pool and club house where they serve a complimentary continental breakfast which we took full advantage of. Some state not much space to eat but it was okay with us since we chose to bring the food back to our room. They served bagels, muffins, danishes, toast, cereal, applies and oranges, juices, milk and coffee. Could never hear any of the other visitors. Could only hear the chairs being moved around from time to time. However, being close to the pool there were a couple of nights you could hear those swimming until 11pm which is when the pool closes. The only complaint I have which should be taken in stride since you are in Florida and there are bugs no matter where you go, there were these little bugs, something like no-see-ums, on the counter tops looking for food. I told the front desk and they responded promptly with spraying down the counters to get rid of them. The rest of the place was bug free. With all of the positive things to be said and had with World Quest, we will definitely will stay here again the next time we travel to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Orlando, would definately go back to World Quest”
Reviews.Author: benso010
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, clean and great service. Beds were very comfortable. Scenery was awesome and the pool area was great fun for the kids after a hot day at Disney parks.

Reviews.Title: “Everything needed for a wonderful, relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: bradleylady
Reviews.Content: The 3-bedroom Suite provided everything we needed to be comfortable. World Quest is close to everything yet you have a sense of being away from it all at the end of a fun-filled day. The pool is inviting and there are plenty of deck chairs available. The Continental breakfast was nutritional and plentiful with fresh fruit, cereals, fresh coffee and much more available each morning. I will definitely go back again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Worldquest Oversold Rooms and Moved Us to another Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CAD4321
Reviews.Content: We made reservations for a 7-night stay at Worldquest in Orlando. Even though we had made our reservations in January, I called Worldquest a week before our vacation, just to confirm our room reservation. I was told there was no problem. We arrived at 10 PM at night and were told that the hotel had been oversold and we would have to locate to another property for the evening. They sent us to Mona Lisa Suites with a voucher so that we would not have to pay for that room. We were told to call the next afternoon to see when a room might be available that day. We had no other choice (due to the lateness of the hour) but to stay at Mona Lisa Suites. While we were there, we actually ran into another family group of 6 that had also been 'bumped' out of Worldquest that night. The next day we called the hotel and were told that our room was ready and that we could check in. We checked in about 1 PM. This incident was inexcusable and ruined the first day of our 7-day stay in Orlando, as we had to wait around to see what Worldquest was going to do about our room, and then get settled in all over again after moving over there. Very disappointing. One more side note is that the pool was very cool at Worldquest. Several people began complaining about it, and only then, did they increase the temperature of the water in the pool. This took about 2 days. Once the water had warmed up, the pool area was nice.

Reviews.Title: “Scared to book this resort”
Reviews.Author: ballst3
Reviews.Content: Word to the General Manager: Folks have good things to say about this resort. But your reservations department sucks. Really the only bad complaints is overbooking. I am getting ready for a trip to Orlando, FL. My husband and I have to drive to Alabama (6 hrs drive) pick up father (wheelchair bound), Mother, and Grandmother (82 yrs of age) and drive to Orlando (8 hrs drive). If I got there and didn't have a room (like the family from Canada) I would be toooo put out. I love a nice, clean, quiet resort. But this one scares the hell out of me, no rooms after my reservations have been confirmed. I would definitely fire the reservations person.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Place To Stay For Our First Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: TreborV
Reviews.Content: I could write pages and pages about our wonderful experience with WorldQuest. Wonderful place to stay for an unbelievable price. We stayed in a huge, 3 bedroom condo that had all of the comforts of home. The pool was extremely well kept and spacious. The daily continental breakfast (included) was great!! Fruit, bagels, danishes, toast, coffee, tea and different juices. We were less than a mile from Disney. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We left our 3 year old son's "blankie" behind and housekeeping found it and mailed it back to us. We will never go anywhere else when we get back to Orlando. I spoke with people who have stayed on the Disney resort, payed a ton of more money, that said they'll never go back to staying at Disney after staying at the WorldQuest resort. I don't understand how World Quest in not in the top 5 on trip advisor. We highly recommend it for your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt believe what a great deal this place was!”
Reviews.Author: haschemeier
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried that this place was soo cheap. However we needed a 3 bedroom place and didnt want to spend alot. we walked in and couldnt believe our eyes!! It was beautiful and had everything we could of imagined!! even a wine opener! The pool was incredible and we wish we would have had more time to spend there. The location is perfect! close to everythign but in a nice quiet undeveloped area! The only complaint would be the twin beds were not very comfy. the mattresses were falling off the bed for some reason.. We would DEF stay there again!!!

Reviews.Title: “You won't find a better resort with such a great value near Disney Parks”
Reviews.Author: surfingforstuff
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort from March 29-April 4 and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a 3 bedroom suite in Building 1 on the 5th floor which had a very nice view of the pool area. The room cleanliness was outstanding. You could walk around the rooms without even seeing a mark of dirt on your feet. The continental breakfast we had each morning was a great start to the day. It was quick and efficient, as we were excited to get on our way to the parks. Parking is plentiful. The grounds and pool area are kept immaculate. The kids really loved the pool which is kept at a good temperature.. The pool lounge chairs are very comfortable and never had any problem finding one. There are abundant pool towels along with a change room. My only complaint was with the inflated price of drinks at the Tiki bar even though there was a so called happy hour. The only complaint about our suite was with the somewhat uncomfortable bed in the master bedroom, as it sagged in the middle. Each room has a TV and bathroom which is very handy with a family of 5. The close proximity to the Disney parks was a treat, as within 10 minutes you're already there! We ate at some restaurants and recommend Logan's Roadhouse on West Irlo Bronson Memorial, Kissimmee, which is about 5 min from the resort following International drive South to the intersection of 192. It is right on the corner. They serve peanuts at your table and you get to throw the shells on the floor. The dinner buns that they also serve come right out of the oven and are very delicious. The BBQ ribs were absolutely incredible as well. I would highly recommend the resort to anyone looking for a more quiet area around the Orlando area that is less congested. Thanks to the staff for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations, Beautiful Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: Allin220
Reviews.Content: Arrived at WORLDQUEST RESORT on April 4th 2011 and am currently here. Let me start by stating that this resort is absolutely gorgeous in all aspects. A large, private, wonderful place with a massive pool and surrounding area. Friendly staff, full amentities and a great atmosphere. A very spacious and relaxing resort to spend time at when not visiting all the great attractions and shopping Orlando area has to offer My Family is beyond impressed and can't wait to spend the remainder of our Vacation here!! Thanks WORLDQUEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Value”
Reviews.Author: JACKLEGSC
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this resort from the moment we arrived. The room was immaculate and the rooms were very large and well stocked. The pool was also absolutely beautiful and very relaxing. Our family needed two separate bedrooms and a comparable room on Disney property was running around $600 a night- which is about 3 times the price of these rooms. Also, the hotel seems to be on a new road that leads directly to the Disney gates. We NEVER hit traffic until we got right to the gate and our vacation was during a very busy time of year. No more than 10 minutes in the car to get to any area in the Disney property. For the price, you absolutely can't beat this resort. If I was being picky, I would comment on a few of the things I read about it in trip advisor before our vacation because they are correct. 1). You can hear the cars on the interstate nearby at night. They are relatively far away, so I think it's more bad windows than anything else. Sounds a little like ocean waves if put your mind to it. 2). Breakfast is crazy! People are wild about free breakfast and they ravage the buffet in the morning. We didn't even attempt breakfast after the first day. 3). Shuttle hours don't work for people who have small children and need to come back throughout the day. So if you have little ones, plan on driving. All in all, I would stay here again and again. The rooms are gorgeous and truly the cleanest I've seen in almost any property. If I were on an unlimited budget, of course, I would choose to stay on Disney only to be able to take the ferry to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “excellant resort!!”
Reviews.Author: eastend05
Reviews.Content: This resort was a fantastic place to stay. Very clean and friendly staff. I would most definately stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: cheapocharlie
Reviews.Content: Perfect for my Family. Much more room than the Disney hotels for a fraction of the price. The location was also excellent. Only took us 5-10 mins to get to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it at all”
Reviews.Author: jonesytunes
Reviews.Content: The rooms are large, but this is an overpriced and noisy resort. We stayed for one night prior to departing Orlando. As we were not staying for at least three nights, they slapped on an extra $40 cleaning fee. Thus, we ended up paying over $200 US for a single night stay. Most importantly, the resort is located beside the 417 highway (to the airport). If you can't sleep through highway traffic, you won't get any sleep here. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Do not book here - completely incompetent- you won't have a room when you get there!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rcrtoronto
Reviews.Content: After reading hundreds of reviews on trip advisor, I choose this resort. I booked a three bedroom suite 3 months in advance of our trip. I confirmed the reservation by phone and email three weeks before arriving. I received an additional confirmation from the resort three days prior to arrival. We travelled from Canada for two days with two chronically ill teenagers and grandparents in tow, arriving at 11 p.m. Upon arrival we were told that they had "overbooked" and they gave us mapquest directions to another hotel. The night clerk couldn't even produce a proper business card for the Worldquest manager, instead he crossed the name out on someone else's card and handed it to me. I was told that they had made arrangements for us to stay in a 3 bedroom suite in another hotel. When we arrived at the other hotel there were only 2 bedroom suites. I travel frequently for work and I have never experienced such a ridiculous lack of professionalism. At the very least I would have expected the hotel to contact us with an apology and some form of compensation. If you want to be guaranteed to have a room when you arrive in Florida, Worldquest Resort is NOT the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you want a lot of room”
Reviews.Author: ksprott
Reviews.Content: My husband and teenage son and daughter stayed here over spring break 2011 in a 3BR/3BA suite. We'd originally booked this hotel mostly because I saw a good deal on the rooms and figured it would allow us to take other friends or family. It ended up just being the 4 of us and it was really almost like being at home - as soon as we'd get back from the parks the kids would disappear into their own rooms to watch tv. That may or may not be a good thing for your family vacation, but after full days at Disney or Universal, we were all pretty tired anyway. The hotel is low key and a huge complex. We went to the breakfast buffet the first morning but found it way too crowded for us so we stocked the kitchen and made our own breakfast the rest of the week. The shuttle to Disney runs a few specific times a day to/from Epcot. I was told you need to reserve ahead of time. We like to be pretty unscheduled on vacations, so we just drove to the parks ourselves, which was fine. I took our wifi base station and Apple tv and we didn't have any problem streaming video on the room's ethernet. I didn't check to see if the hotel has wifi or if it was available in our room. Overall, it is a very nice, clean, spacious hotel in which to base for the Orlando theme parks. I'm not sure I would classify it as a "resort" based on the number of common-area amenities, which was fine because we don't go to Orlando to hang out at the hotel. It does have a nice, large pool The reason to stay here is for the rooms themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Total incompetence -- Do NOT stay at this resort!”
Reviews.Author: KF2246
Reviews.Content: Our family of five had a reservation for a 4 night stay. Arrived at 1pm, check in is at 4pm so the room was not ready but the woman said it might be in 45 minutes so we opted to wait. Had lunch by the pool, the food was good. Went back to the desk to check on the status of our room...another woman called housekeeping and told us the suite was still not ready so we decided to head to WDW. Even told the woman at the desk that we would not be back until 10-11pm and she said "no problem". When we got back at 11pm, THEY HAD GIVEN OUR ROOM AWAY AND WERE COMPLETELY BOOKED!! We had been up since 5am to catch our plane and had three children in the car ready to go to sleep. WorldQuest had found us a place to stay at a hotel 10 minutes away...a two bedroom suite rather than the three bedroom suite we had booked with them. So, we had no choice but to go to the other hotel and eventually settled in at 1am!! What a start to our vacation and needless to say, we never went back to the WorldQuest Resort. Why would we want to stay at a resort that does not honor their reservations...and we had even checked in (with two different people)! They did pay for our first night at the alternate resort but that did not make up for their front desk and management's incompetence. I cannot say enough bad words about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra3418
Reviews.Content: lovely clean, well appointed rooms. Resort was easy to reach from Disney World. Quiet location. Cordial staff. Will come again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for large families! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: BookMamma
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a stay at WQR and I can't say enough nice things about it. We were traveling with our two sons, ages 4 and 6, and my parents who are in their late fifties. The resort was very conveniently located to the WDW parks,as well as a Publix, WalMart, and Target. A variety of restaurants are also close by. The kitchenette was fully stocked with cookware, the unit was super-spacious, and the grounds and pool area were beautiful! I was surprised to find a washer/dryer unit there and would have packed lighter had I known - I looked online before the trip and didn't see it listed. Some reviews mention thin walls and uncomfortable beds - we experienced none of that. We stayed in building #4 on the ground floor. Besides the occasional chair scraping from upstairs during the day, our neighbors were either absent or completely silent. The beds aren't as firm as I usually like it but I had no trouble sleeping on them. My parents slept soundly too, and they usually have problems away from home. TIP: We found we could drive to Downtown Disney, then catch a shuttle to the Contemporary Resort, and the monorail to Magic Kingdom to avoid paying $15 for parking. We will definitely be coming back to World Quest! I can't recommend it enough for larger families.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Management”
Reviews.Author: mlevin11
Reviews.Content: I tried to reserve a 3 bedroom villa with 3 baths and they would not let me. They told me I could request one but that I could end up with a 2 bath villa. It is a deal breaker for my family. When I asked why they would turn down my business they said that the room MAY be occupied by someone in the room ahead of us. I guess they would rather take a chance that the room MAY be occupied then guarantee my reservation!.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice place--super condo w/lovely pool”
Reviews.Author: kirsti2011
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay here, I think our daughter enjoyed the pool as much as going to Disney! The condos are very nice, I had high expectations because of the pictures on their site and was not disappointed. We loved walking to breakfast and eating poolside. We didn't end up using the shuttle to Disney but it did seem to have a lot of convenient times and runs. Disney really is very close and we just drove with our rental, there is shopping and restaurants right around the corner (by car, not an easy walking distance), walmart and publix grocery are also probably around a mile or so away. Would stay here again, and bring friends along next time :)

Reviews.Title: “Like a home while on vacation”
Reviews.Author: flossie2011
Reviews.Content: Loved the place so much in 2009 had to bring 51 students back in 2010. The rooms were awesome and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were clean and the party felt very safe at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “VERY impressed with rooms”
Reviews.Author: katefm
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Was so impressed with the size of the room. We had a family of four plus grandparents and we had plenty of space to spread out. I wish I would have stayed here our entire time (we spent the first week at a Disney resort). The free wireless worked well and the breakfast was decent. Free parking was also an asset as I would recommend renting a car if you're going to be here for a while. The shuttle service is only offered 3 times a day to both Disney and Universal. Although, we found with the expense of renting a car, it was cheaper (for six of us) to cab it. We will definitely be returning, the resort was super clean and we had one small issue that was resolved INSTANTLY by the wonderful people at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JABorborema
Reviews.Content: At this rate, this is probably the best hotel choice in Orlando/FL. Rooms are spacious and very clean and the hotel is close from theme parks, outlets, supermarkets, pharmacys, restaurants and fast foods.

Reviews.Title: “A place that's close to theme parks, shopping and dining, that gives you a special family environment.”
Reviews.Author: spphire
Reviews.Content: My 3 kids, ages 21, 18, and 14 have spent several vacation stays here. It's a lovely place. The service, accommodations , pool , parking, security features, free continental breakfast and proximity to area theme parks is fantastic. We like the 2-3 separate bedroom availability. The master bath has a wonderful jacuzzi type tub. The pool area is beautiful. The area surrounding the hotel is serene and quiet. One drawback is that internet is only available in the lobby area.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful alternative to a resort hotel”
Reviews.Author: edobernig
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed 10 day stay utilizing the pool and surrounding. Nice tiki bar by the pool and plenty of lounge chairs. Three bed/three bath was large and living room was very open area. Washer and dryer in room a plus. House keeping is extra. Daily towel service is five dollars. Unit is fully equiped along with vacum and iron. Lovedit

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location for Disney”
Reviews.Author: Scott987654321
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at World Quest on our recent trip to Disney. Brief Description World Quest is more like a timeshare or condo than a hotel. All of the "rooms" are multi-bedroom and bathroom units with a living area, balcony, and full kitchen. It is great for large or extended families, or people who want to save money by cooking some meals. It is also located extremely close to Disney -- probably equidistant from Magic Kingdom as some of the Disney value resorts. Pros: - large, modern, clean living space with multiple rooms. - very nice heated pool area and hot-tub (although there is no kiddie pool, which would have been nice). - free, basic continental breakfast (bagels, toast, muffins, pastries, cereal, fruit, coffee, tea, juice, and milk). - very close to Disney theme parks in a low traffic area (10 min drive to most). - very well located -- near other restaurants, shopping -- nothing is right there, but most can be reached in a 5-10 minute drive. - value - we paid $109/night + taxes and resort fees with AAA discount for a 2 bedroom unit, which was plenty big to house 2 grandparents, 2 parents, and 2 small kids (sleeping in sleeping bags on the floor). There was also a sofa bed, which we did not use. - full kitchen - we used it mainly to store and make snacks to bring with us to the parks, but could have saved some money if we wanted to make some meals. Cons - Housekeeping - you must pay extra for housekeeping, and their website lists the fees. We elected only the trash and towel service. On the first day, they completely neglected to do both, and it took a couple of calls to get the service done. On the subsequent days, it was done in a timely manner. - We had a noise issue with one of our neighbors one night around 2 am. We called, and the security desk took care of it, but it took a little while. - I would rate the beds as only moderately comfortable -- I found them to be a bit mushy. All in all, I would stay here again, and definitely recommend it to families that want more of a condo feel than a cramped hotel room. That being said, I am still on the fence as to whether you really save any money here vs. one of the Disney resorts where you don't have to pay for rental car or parking at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “A quiet oasis near Disney”
Reviews.Author: SteveByrne
Reviews.Content: Quiet, well appointed rooms, helpful staff and well situated for most attractions and good choice of nearby restaurants. Bonus continental breakfast that can be taken by the pool. Would definitely go back. Lived up to it's excellent trip advisor rating. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Fab stay - loved the resort”
Reviews.Author: golfchic46
Reviews.Content: I agree with most things other have said. Picky things: I agree with the review of the cold pool, we only braved it once during our stay, the children managed it twice! Breakfast basic - and lack of area to eat it, we were lucky and managed to sit outside everyday - but I think that was luck. Hubbie couldn't sleep he said the bed was terrible. Internet access only by wire but wireless in reception - it had stated wireless and I had assumed it was in room. Good things: Location - although hard to find initially, easy to get everywhere. Food at breakfast, always fresh and varied (different bread, pastries). Excellent Things: Staff, had a couple of problems and the maintenance staff beat us from reception to our room on both occasions. Reception staff and breakfast staff lovely, so cheerful and welcoming. Facilities in the suite - amazing, truly huge suite, with everything you can imagine. Cleaniness - very clean (and I am fussy). Overall holiday was fab and the Worldquest made it fab - I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “The quest begins and ends with World Quest!”
Reviews.Author: glo7102
Reviews.Content: We stayed at World Quest Orlando with two other couples all of whom were giddy with delight about every aspect of the resort. From the pool and hot tub to the manicured grounds to the large, comfortable accommodations, to the affordable rates, to the convenient location, World Quest met our needs and far exceeded our expectations. We stayed here last year as well and had the same experience. I would not hesitate for a moment to recommend this facility. In fact, we are in the initial stages of planning a vacation there next April at which time we will have our daughter, son-in-law, and 4 grandkids in tow. We know their experience will be the same as ours.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing pool !”
Reviews.Author: happyclare
Reviews.Content: One of the reasons we chose this resort was it states it has a heated pool. Infact it does have this facility but for the 10 days we were there it was icy cold. We knew after our long journey we would want to spend the first few days in the pool so our four year old could adjust to the different time zone. When we complained about the pool temperature they said they would adjust it and it would take a couple of days to heat up. All the other families huddled arround the hot tub as no one could endure the pool. One time I counted seventeen people in the hot tub.Two days later it was still freezing and they informed us they had it all turned off so they could change the filters and give it another couple of days and it should heat up. We were unable to switch hotel as everywhere was busy for Presidents day weekend and did not want to waste our time packing and searching for a more suitable hotel.We were given passes to use the pool in the Nickeleoden hotel down the road but they had no shower faciltiies so it was not ideal. My husband pursued them and the temperature improved a degree or two. Families actually ventured in to the pool for short periods but still complained of the cold. The pool never got to a comfortable warmth for the whole ten days. We had occasion to visit one of the Hiltons nearby and their pool was lovely. Location of resort is fantastic. Short drive to Disney, shops and restaurants. Three bedroom unit was very spacious. As reported in other reviews there are maintenace issues, bed just ok, sheets do not fit beds well but reception staff very friendly. Block 1 and 2 are next to the pool but as the numbers get higher the distance to the club house increases. I will never return to WorldQuest and can not recommend it. The first few days of our holiday was ruined.

Reviews.Title: “Great February Vacation”
Reviews.Author: February_travers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was extremely clean inside and out. It was very close to the hot spots for Disney, Sea World and International Drive. The only recommendation would be to rent a car to stay. We didn't rent one and ended up using Taxis to get everywhere except Disney (at the time it was cheaper then renting because we didn't book the rental ahead of time). You will do a lot of walking if you stay in the further buildings, we didn't mind, but for fun our daughter mapped our front door of the suite to the pool and it was a 1/4 mile walk. Our family enjoyed the exercise.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location, clean”
Reviews.Author: timily524
Reviews.Content: Stayed at WorldQuest Orlando for 6 nights in February for a Disney vacation and we would stay here again. I suspect that this resort is closer or as close as many "on-property" Disney resorts as it took only 5-10 minutes to reach the entrace to Disney World. The kitchen was fully equipped (and clean) so we were able to save time and money by eating breakfast in and packing lunches. For a family of five this was a super value!

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough - Don't Let This One Pass You By ...”
Reviews.Author: OxfordReb22
Reviews.Content: I took my wife and young daughter to Orlando, FL for a Disney trip a few days after a business conference in Jacksonville, FL. When I began to look for rooms in Orlando, I scoured (literally) the internet up and down (for days) on this site and sites such as expedia, travelocity, etc. looking for the best bang for our buck. How did I end up choosing WorldQuest? I decided that I wanted us to have a play to relax at night where we could cook in the room, relax, and have plenty of room for my daughter to be a kid. Some of the other hotels I considered booking were Parc Soleil Hilton, Blue Herron, Doubletree Guest Suites, and Embassy Suites, but in the end I put faith in what I saw online in World Quest. Overall impressions: A true diamond in the rough among TONS of Orlando hotels in and around Downtown Disney/Lake Buena Vista. The rooms were actually a little bigger and nicer than I even expected based on the pictures I viewed online. Check-in was extremely easy, and the price quoted online was the exact price I ended up paying the resort. The pool was great (and the hot tub) and very clean. As for safety, I felt VERY safe on the property with my wife and young daughter. I give WQ 5 stars and would absolutely book there again when I go back to Orlando in the future with my family. Pros: - great band for your buck - extremely spacious and clean rooms - easy check-in and check-out - great pool and hot tub - fridge, oven, microwave, dishwasher, etc. in room - whirlpool tub in room - washer and dryer in room (but bring your own detergent) - awesome screened in outdoor porch with 4 chairs and a table - free parking - no resort fee charged (just an end of stay housekeeping charge of $35) Cons (if you want to call them that ...) - location (some reviews said the place was a little hard to find - and it is, it's just tucked off on a side road that your GPS may not pick up very well); however, it's still in a very prime and central location for theme park goers - $5/day charge for fresh towels (which we opted for, and they did deliver clean ones) - no cleaning service unless you opt to pay a little daily extra - you are on your own to unload bags and take to room, since it is a resort I'm a picky guy and I'm picky about hotels I stay at (not easily impressed) - BUT this is one GREAT hotel if you want extra space, in a safe place, for a good deal! Book It!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Value and only 7 mins from Disney/Downtown Disney”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_2_Future
Reviews.Content: In our opinion, this is one of the best vacation resort values in Orlando, whether you are going to visit Disney or not. Although this Resort is only 5-7 minutes from Disney World and a broad range of Restaurants like Bahama Breeze, Golden Coral, etc, and 4 minutes from Downtown Disney. WordQuest has 7 Buildings, each 5 stories high and each building has both 2 and 3 bedroom suites. There is a Free Shuttle from the Hotel to Disney. All rooms have central heating/cooling and ceiling fans. All rooms have free internet wired connections and wireless in common areas like the club house and pool area. There is a medium-size workout room with Elliptical/Treadmill and some weights. The facility is under 7 years old so the rooms are very modern (granite counter tops and modern tile), with the exception of the TVs, which are tube-type; not a huge deal since they all worked well. There is a huge resort-style pool, cabana for dinks (4pm- 7pm), and pool house with changing rooms/bathrooms. Each of the suites has a well-placed screened-in porch (entrance from Master Bedroom or Great Room) that all have great views of either the pool or a serene pond. We were in Bldg. 4 on the 4th floor. Ted checked us in and was very courteous and helpful in every way. They have different levels of room service so you get to choose what works for you. We were only there for 2 days so we choose the trash removal option only. When we got to our room it was clean, tidy and feature-rich. We had the 2 Bed/2Bath Suite (AAA rate of $105 before fees/taxes – Awesome Deal). The master bedroom had a King size bed and huge bathroom with a Jacuzzi Tub and a separate shower stall. The other bedroom had two twin beds and a nice size bathroom with tub/shower combo just outside the room. The Kitchen was huge and had a full-size fridge, stove, dish washer and high counter (w/chairs) for eating. The great room had a nice round table for eating, and comfy sofa and love seat. Each room and the great room had a nice size TV, and the great room also had a DVD player. The site has good security features (gated/staffed entrance) and the included continental breakfast was good; the only advice I would offer to WorldQuest would be to add a waffle maker, it would have made my little one very happy for breakfast. On a scale of 1 to 5 our experience was a 5+. We definitely will be back again a fw times this year, in fact this is where we plan to stay when in Orlando. The price-point is awesome considering what you get, especially if you have a large family and can get the 3 bedroom suite. We have already begun spreading the word on this tremendous value to neighbors and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Team Location”
Reviews.Author: formularumrunner
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort for all your needs. Stayed with My daughters cheer team and a number of other parents. Met all of our needs wonderfully and the girls loved the resort. They want to come back again next year. Iris in group reservations was fantastic to work with. All in all a ver positve experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: Pianocarol
Reviews.Content: Wonderful roomy apartments with all amenities. We had a wonderful stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Toyota111
Reviews.Content: Worldquest is a fantastic place to stay. We got the 3 bedroom supreme and it was gorgeous. The master bedroom was huge and had a view of the lake. The bed was extremely comfortable. The 2nd bedroom also had a private bath. The 3rd bedroom had a bath right next to it. Everyone had their privacy. The patio was large enough for a round table and 4 chairs and made sitting outside nice. Very nice furnishings in all of the rooms. I do think some better lighting in the bedrooms is needed. We had to take the shades off of the lamps. The pool is large and the kids loved it. The Tiki bar is convenient and large enough to give everyone room. the price of the room compared to hotels was a super value. We will probably never stay anywhere but here from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort but....”
Reviews.Author: 2wdstkgals
Reviews.Content: We really liked the WorldQuest Resort - the property is beautiful! The condos, the pool area, the Continental breakfast are all GREAT! The location is great to all the parks and restaurants on International Drive. Our only confusion came with the beds - the property is beautiful, the condos are decorated beautiful but they stopped at the beds. The beds are hard and uncomfortable and the pillows are worse. It was amazing to all 5 of us (in a 3 bedroom) that they did not go all the way and make the beds wonderful and luxurious too. After long days at the Parks it would have been made for a more restful night sleep, instead of sore necks the next morning. The pool/hot tub area with the Tiki Bar is great and night time Happy Hour was nice. The Front desk girl was great and so friendly. We would definitely go back, but remember to grab at least a few pillows from home.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous retreat in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: DeborahNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at this resort after reading all the wonderful reviews on tripadvisor. It was so affordable that we decided to stay for 10 days intead of 1 week. Check in was easy and we were put in a newer building, building #5. This put us further away from the morning continetal free breakfast but it was no problem because I preferred the newer building. I chose to not pay extra for maid service and it was fine. They still come change your trash daily and will bring you whatever you need. There is a vaccuum in the condo so I did tidy up a bit one lazy raining morning. We washed our own towels. The pool is awesome! You feel like you are at a luxuary 5 star hotel. Towels onsite. The hotel has a gated entrance so we felt safe at the resort. You also have to have a room key to get into the gated pool area. There is a nice small fitness area that I went to a few times. We ran out of dish washing detergent and shampoo about the middle of our trip, so I called down for some more. They brought it up within 10 minutes. They provide hair dryers and bathrobes. I could have saved room in my suitecase. The TV in the den played DVDs. The master bathroom couldn't have been nicer. It had a huge double sink vanity area with huge mirror. The large tub was jetted and the large shower had wonderful variations of water pressure. The kitchen was modern, clean, and had all of your practical kitchen items in it. We couldn't think of anything that we needed that it didn't provide. Our beds were very comforable. The CVS on the way to Seaworld is where we picked up some groceries as that is all we saw other than the hotel shop. I am sure they are all over the place but we didn't venture all around Orlando. We mainly went to the parks, restaurants, and outlets. For a change of pace, it was fabulous to come home to WorldQuest where it was calm and tranquil. It was not very crowded in January, so I am not sure if it would be as fab if it were really crowded. If we return to Orlando, I will definitely stay here again. The three bedroom and 2 bathroom suite of ours could have easily slept 8 comforably with the pull out sofa.

Reviews.Title: “We just made" Parents of the Year" thanks to World Quest Resort.”
Reviews.Author: red3star
Reviews.Content: When we arrived our children were so excited about our resort. They started screaming and running to claim their rooms. Each day they found some new active. The heated outdoor pool was the best.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Accomodation Close to Attractions”
Reviews.Author: PETE89Adelaide
Reviews.Content: The 2 bedroom apartment was exactly as described & displayed on the World Quest Website. Plenty of room to have both Family & adult time. Concierge staff Karen & Emily are outstanding, helping to plan our trip which was a little daunting coming from Australia. Basic store provided necessities when we didn't have tome to go shopping. Pool & Tiki bar are great if you want to laze around. The resort is kept extremely clean & front office staff are helpfull. We required some maintenance in our apartment which was rectified within 2 hours at 10:00 PM. This is a beautiful resort tucked away from the hustle & bustle & easy distance from Disney & Universal & International Drive.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest is not world class; but it's very nice and a good deal”
Reviews.Author: CodgersontheMove
Reviews.Content: Our party of four adults and three young children (ages 4, 6, and 8) enjoyed our stay at the WorldQuest Resort over MLK weekend, while visiting--What else?--Disney World. The location is superb--about 2 miles from the Disney entrance! It is a bit of a jaunt, however, to shopping; I'd guess about 4 miles to the nearest supermarket and restaurants. There is traffic noise from the Osceola Parkway less than 100 yards from the front of the units; however, the soundproofing kept most of the noise outside. The unit itself (which we rented through VRBO) was quite nice--living/dining area; kitchen; 3 bedrooms; 3 baths; 4 televisions (important with young children). I would strongly suggest to the owners that they supply some of the simple necessities (screwdriver, scissors, toilet plunger, hooks in the bathroom for swimsuits, towels), since most guests do not carry these items in their car. The large pool outside was a big hit with our "water rat" grandchildren; they used it every day. The value was superb--just a fraction of the cost of staying at a Disney resort. All in all, a 5 for spaciousness, value, location. I would not, however, call it "luxurious," just quite nice, and for most travelers spending their days at Disney that should suffice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: DenverRoadtripper
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay at WorldQuest after scouring the internet and reading the mostly positive reviews for this place. It is really just as advertised (although I don't know if I'd call it luxury--that label seems to be applied whenever granite countertops are involved). We were in a 3 bed/2 bath condo with plenty of room for our family of 5 plus my parents. It was clean and the kitchen, though scantily equipped, was certainly adequate for less than a week. The hot tub was nice and large but it was too chilly to use the pool while we were there. The pool deck was very attractive and the pool furniture was very nice. We booked through VRBO so really had no contact with the staff. The best part of this condo was its very close proximity to DisneyWorld. It really is as close as they say. Be aware that signage in this part of FL is extremely poor--we aren't idiots (at least, I don't think so!) and we got lost coming back to the resort the first 2 days. Make sure you consult a map--it's as though Disney wants to keep you trapped in their World and Orange County, despite the millions of dollars that Disney visitors pour into their economy, can't invest in adequate signage. It was a nice vacation. Would I stay again? Maybe--there are many, many condo complexes just outside Disney and I might try one of them next time. But due to location and value, I'd have no problem recommending this place to anyone. One more thing, read a lot of reviews complaining about the beds. They were fine! No, they weren't hotel quality, but what do you expect? We all slept perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY, GREAT VALUE”
Reviews.Author: Doug8637
Reviews.Content: This condo resort was wonderful. The rooms, service and location were great. Location is about one mile from entrance to Disneyland, and close to other attractions such as Sea World. We will definitly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation, close but not too close to the main attractions”
Reviews.Author: DickyMuns
Reviews.Content: We found the place very clean, tidy and the reception staff extremely helpful. The little shop is very expensive but handy to have. Pool and hot tub were superb and again clean with plenty of towels and sun loungers. Overall a great place to stay, car is needed though.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: richyp101
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel for 17 nights after reading the initial Trip Advisor reviews, the review were spot on. As we stayed elsewhere in Orlando for the first two days I phoned the day of our arrival to ask what time we could check in at World Quest. The Front Desk said they had rooms ready and we could check in Straight away (10am) which was great as normally check-in is at least after 2pm. The hotel itself was exceptionally clean, Fridge & Microwave was spotless. Pool area immaculate. Ours was a 2 bedroom, two nice bedrooms, 2 bathrooms and large pleasant living, dining, kitchen area with nice balcony. The hotel has a small Gym which was used regularly and a big pool which wasn't possibly because the temperature outside was a little on the cool side. Nevertheless they had a nice Hot Tub which kept you warm. Breakfast was simple but good, couple of cereals, Coffee, Tea, Fruit Juice, Bagels, Bread and Cakes. As it was cold most Mornings in December could have done with a bigger room to eat Breakfasts in as it was a bit cold sitting outside. Free wireless available in the lobby. The location was excellent, two minutes drive from a large Walmart, large Premium Outlets just around the corner and close for Disney & I4. Not much noise from the floors above or below which was a bonus (obviously good sound proofing), the front desk was Excellent any queries which we had were handled straight away with no problems. On the whole couldn't fault this place it made our holiday a relaxing enjoyable stay and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome accomodations with many pluses”
Reviews.Author: smallworldcalgary
Reviews.Content: After finding this place on Trip Advisor I booked our family in for a two week stay over the Christmas holidays. I've not yet been disappointed with Trip Advisors recommendations from travelers and once again this place exceeded my expectations. It was reasonably priced for the amount of space we enjoyed (even with the addition of my brother, his wife and daughter for a few days) and the place was set up for living (unlike a hotel room) with a fully equiped kitchen, laundry facilities, dining/living room space, two bathrooms (one very large with a jetted tub) and three spacious bedrooms. We loved our stay here and with easy access to DisneyWorld (our main entertainment destination) we felt we were close enough to the action but still tucked away from too many hotels and main streets. The staff were exceptional with friendly prompt service. The pool area was huge too with lots of lounging area. Our whole family would easily stay here again any time.

Reviews.Title: “Jem, Oasis, Fantastic.. BUT...”
Reviews.Author: pieboy
Reviews.Content: We are a party of 5 and we stayed in a 3 bedroom suite in August 2010. Overall, we could not fault the actual hotel. The location is superb. It is minutes away from the Disney parks, seconds from the I-Drive and very quiet. The pool complex is fantastic and open until very, very late. Late night swimming was superb. The rooms are clean and very modern with lovely stylish furniture, more european than American style. The only thing I would point out, is the ownership of the units... We rented through an owner who does not pay the management fees and opts out of the onsite management. As a result, when the TV was not working we had to wait for the managment compnay form Lake Buenavista to visit. We also had a minor issue with wasps, which again, the onsite managment would not deal with. We also could not use the Gym facilities or the breakfast, or open a tab at the bar..... Would I stay there again... 100% YES! It is great value for money and simply fantastic resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: 0puns
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom/2 bath unit in Building 1. The unit is huge and of course has a full kitchen, washer, and dryer. The grounds are well kept and there is a security guard at the point of entry onto the property. Disney parks are no more than a 10 minute drive away and there is a Publix grocery store about a 5 minute drive away. We saved about two thousand dollars staying and eating in versus a Disney deluxe resort. Granted there is no Disney magic. The beds weren't in the greatest of shape and you can hear your inconsiderate neighbors upstairs dragging their chairs on the tile floor. If and when we do stay off property again, we will certainly choose Worldquest.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelteam1234
Reviews.Content: The pros: Clean and new with modern kitchen and bathrooms and a decent value overall. The cons: Very noisy, you can hear the passing traffic very clearly but worst of all is that you can easily hear the people in adjacent units and also from units above - from people talking down to chairs being dragged around. The walls are very thin and each night we stayed we were disturbed to the point where we had to complain twice. The beds were not comfortable and the bedding was outdated and old looking, like from an old spare room at somebody's house. The pillows were cheap and filled with batting and the spreads were those old 70's looking ones. The sheets didn't fit and constantly popped off - a problem in all three bedrooms. The unit was clean for the most part but one of the rooms did have some remnants from the last occupants. The living room furniture also was worn and looked like it was from a thrift store. The issues with the bedrooms and furniture were surprising since the kitchens and bathrooms were very updated with granite countertops and nice cabinetry. It was very out of place. We paid the extra money for fresh towels each day, which we sometimes got. The bedrooms could also use some ceiling fans since the unit felt very stuffy and dry at night. The staff were very nice and attentive to our complaints and did make an effort to rectify. This resort is in a great location and if they could update the bedding it would be a home run but as it is now, I would not come back. It was just too uncomfortable at night. Also, an easy fix to hearing chairs being dragged around would be to add felt pads to the legs.

Reviews.Title: “For the price of two normal hotel rooms, our family of five stayed in a spacious suite with three private bedrooms!”
Reviews.Author: DarrellReedy
Reviews.Content: What a bargain! For the price of two normal hotel rooms, our family of five stayed in a spacious suite (1300+ square feet) with three private bedrooms! The kitchen, living and dining areas added to the home-away-from-home feel where we could REALLY relax. And it was less than ten minutes from the Disney attractions. The staff were very friendly and helpful. You won't find a better value than World Quest Resort!

Reviews.Title: “WorldQuest Orlando Resort is the best deal around for value, service, and rooms”
Reviews.Author: CABW
Reviews.Content: Our group of 24 stayed there for 3 days and loved it! The rooms, pool, and general areas are beautiful. Clean, clean, clean! The continental breakfast was the best I have ever had at a hotel - and I have traveled a lot. The customer service was excellent. Within 2 miles of Disney. The value is terriffic!!!! This is the best deal around.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort off the beaten path.”
Reviews.Author: jcarroll131
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort during a cold spell in Florida so unfortunately we didn't have the opportunity to enjoy the pool very much. The resort is gorgeous and very well maintained. We stayed in Building number one and had a beautiful view of the pool and pond. The only downside to our stay was the beds. We found they weren't very comfortable and didn't offer much support. But other than this, the rooms were very well equipped and the continental breakfasts (which were included in the price) were great. The resort was a little tricky to find as it was in a remote area, but it was a nice break to be surrounded by nature after so much concrete at the malls and Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Will Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: Fruttiveg
Reviews.Content: Wonderful room, geat people, and very close to DisneyWorld. The facility at Worldquest has everything we needed during our stay from a store carry neccesities to a corkscrew in the fully furnished suite. You could not get any closer to DisneyWorld. We live about 20 miles away from Disney, but do not have enough room for the extended family. WorldQuest fit the bill, at a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient to Disney World, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: lynnbea
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest Resort is conveniently located close to the Maingate for Disney World. Spacious suites with kitchen amenities. Beds were only moderately comfortable. Flat screen TV in living area was difficult to watch from sofa and chair in living area. Overall, good value for the price. Internet available in rooms through network cable. Could use upgrade to wireless.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS ACCOMODATION, FABULOUS LOCATION & FABULOUS STAFF”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravellers19
Reviews.Content: This resort is an absolute gem - an oasis to relax in after the madness of Disney/Universal/Sea world etc. Any trip to Orlando is going to be non-stop as you try to cram in as many sights, parks, shopping etc as possible so you need to think about your accomodation carefully. World Quest Resort is fantastically placed for all the Disney parks (1 mile) and you approach from the quieter end so that you are not stuck in all the traffic coming from International Drive. As a family the location was great for Downtown Disney in the evenings too. International Drve, Universal and Sea World are a short trip up the I4 but we found the International Drive area of Orlando to be a bit tired, scruffy and VERY congested. The suites at the World Quest are truly spacious, great for dumping all that shopping, toys and souvenirs off. During the holiday our little boy bought a remote control monster truck from Downtown Disney and there was plenty of room in the suite for him to play with it - you wouldn't be able to do that in a Disney hotel room. Having a full sized kitchen meant that we could get the kids sorted out quickly in the mornings without having to waste precious time in a diner and we had the free breakfast available in the lobby on a couple of occasions when we had time. It was wonderful to put the kids to bed in their own room in the evenings and chill out in the lounge. A special mention must be given to the staff who were always friendly and willing to help - whatever the query was. If you want a cramped, overpriced accomodation with no facilities book a Disney Hotel but if you want home comforts; with space to move; in relaxing surroundings for a BARGAIN price stay here - it's too good to miss. Thank you World Quest!

Reviews.Title: “Best so far”
Reviews.Author: 57mike
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Orlando for many years this trip was to look for a property to have as home for next winter. Worldquest resort is the place to use if your a family or just if you want to be in the right place to visit all the best of Orlando.Worldquest was as good as they say on their site.The staff are so helpfull, apartment very clean rooms as good as they look in the photos that makes a change. I have read many repot like this one and said must be from the hotel itself but this one is from a real visitor that is had to please.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest fit the bill for exactly what I needed”
Reviews.Author: OregonMs
Reviews.Content: As frequent visitor to Orlando, I was seeking a roomy, quiet, secure, luxury condo hotel in the Disney area. This was not a "Disney holiday" but more of a family related trip. World Quest fit the bill, it felt like home away from home (with the addition of a nice pool and a conservation pond view). It was all good. The only (small) issues that I had were the traffic noise from FL 417 that I could hear from my balcony and the tired bedding. I'll happily stay here again at the right price but I might pick up a pillow at WalMart on the way. The location rocked, close to everything with a Publix (grocery store) not far away, quiet, clean. If I were doing a "Disney" trip I'd rather stay at Disney but this was not one of those trips. Not sure that I'd reccomend it for families with little kids.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: T11
Reviews.Content: This resort came highly recommended by friends from Chicago that had stayed there previously. Had large family group in town for wedding and had them staying at two different resorts. I have to say this resort was by far better and I like the fact it is not in the middle of a heavy traffic area but still in a central location to the parks. restaurants and malls.
