The rooms were spacious and very clean and we really enjoyed the pool area. While shopping at the Lake Buena Vista Outlet Mall down the road we noticed we could check-in for our flights leaving Orlando International Airport and this was a big help getting rid of our bags and not having to worry about getting to the airport early.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, Perfection...”
Reviews.Author: rickey-n-gina
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in Orlando, minutes from Disney, Downtown Disney and very close to the other attractions. It is secluded, gated and very quite. The staff/service is extremely friendly and really make you feel special. The rooms are top notch, clean, spacious, feels like home in every way. A TV in every room, a screen patio with nice furniture, and the noise from other guess is very quite. They have dishes for six in the two bedroom suites, the master bath is large with a walk in shower, jetted tub, closet and a large double sink vanity. The only drawback is there is only wired internet service, not wireless, so you can not go out on the patio and catch up on work etc... Out of many trips to Orlando and staying other places, this one is tops! And for the price, you can not go wrong. A tip, when we made reservations, we did it through the link from tripadvisor to the hotel, we received a discount that gave us the best rate of any online booking service. Tip: When leaving the resort, you can turn right on international, take the next left at the light and have a light to get onto the main drag (turning left) (going into Disney/Downtown Disney), if you simply cross International, you do not have a light in front of Nickelodian, which can be troublesome.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable way to stay”
Reviews.Author: sand74
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from 2 nights at the World Quest in Orlando. I had booked a 3bed/2 bath...and we were upgraded to a 3/3 because we didn't want to be on the first floor...NO PROBLEM! We are still talking about the convenience and comfort afforded us by staying at this resort....we were 4 adults and two little children....the price was very well worth it! We arrived around 7:30 on a Thurs. night...and everything was ready for us, including the crib. The grandsons loved the space, screen enclosed patio and view of the pool. Everyone had their own room...space was plentiful! We are clean freaks, to say the least. This place was (on a scale of 1-10) a 9.....only because there's no place as clean as our own home...That being said, I would recommend this place to anyone .... The night we arrived we ordered in from a pizza place...yuk!....the girl and the front desk didn't recommend the chinese take out.... Suggestions: If you live locally, bring some frozen dinners and have them defrost while you're at the park and make use of the kitchen....Restaurants are not right outside the resort....or at least we didn't see any. My hubby went 5 miles to pick up an order we placed at a chain restaurant...After 10 hours of walking our feet off, it would have been nice to pop something in the oven and just eat...without having to order/pick up. We will definitely return to this resort...We purchased 3 day passes and have one more day to use...but next time...we'll bring more of our own food... Way to go TRIP ADVISOR contributors...your comments helped make our weekend a success!!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: dpaworth
Reviews.Content: We were 3 adults with 2 teenagers going to Orlando for the theme parks. We booked these appartments through Jetsave, they were an alternative to a villa or hotel rooms. They were reasonably priced, so we weren't expecting too much. When we arrived the staff were friendly and proffesional. Our appartment was huge, it had 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms - the master ensuite had a massive shower, a jacuzzi bath and two sinks! The kitchen had everything you would need to cook and eat everynight if you wanted, with a washing machine and tumble drier.We also had a large balcony overlooking the pool area. This was very nice but the pool was open till 11pm and sometimes groups arrived late and headed straight for the pool, while we were in bed. We had some maid service included in our package, so the beds were made towels were changed and the dishwasher filled and started for us. We were disappointed to find out that the maid did NOT clean or bleach the toilets. It is ideally situated for all the parks, literally 5 minutes from Disney. (It's right behind the Nickelodeon hotel) The pool was always spotlessly clean, with clean towels always available. There was a complimentary breakfast thrown in, it is not up to much, but you could eat there every day for free, so who would complain about it? Overall this is a very good resort. Not as big and isolated as a villa, but with all the benefits of self-catering. I would stay there again- no question!

Reviews.Title: “great find!”
Reviews.Author: jualonsodorola
Reviews.Content: after serching the web for about to month for a well located hotel near disney with a lot of space for 7 people and a good rate, we diceded to stay here... if was the better within our search. and it was a great choice! hidden, but really near the parks, shoppings, dinning areas! i'll stay there again if i ever go back to disney!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere else but the World Quest”
Reviews.Author: aimerlesoleil
Reviews.Content: This was our third time at the World Quest, and my husband and I will not settle for less. It is a wonderful resort, all equipped, very comfortable, and so affordable. What a jewel! So close to Disney, yet so secluded, it feels like you are far away from the bustling crowds of a tourist town. The rooms are spacious, the beds cozy, and the condos have everything you will need. There are things that are not provided by the resort, like laundry products (unless you go to their little store), but, we went to the local Publix to buy what we needed. The pool is beautiful. The layout is such that you are never too close to the next person, it's quite spread out. The music played at the pool is great. I'm a big fan of 60s and 70s music, and it was great to hear those oldies. I loved that they had someone at the front gate to check who was coming in. All in all, I can't wait to go back and can't see myself staying anywhere else. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: zev0n
Reviews.Content: Worldquest Resort was perfect for our needs (travelled with small kids). We arrived in mid-October and were upgraded to a 3-bedroom condo at check in. The staff were very pleasant and the lobby was clean. The pool was beautiful, clean and the water was warm. Towels were provided by the pool. The 3-room condo was huge and conveniently situated near all attractions. I thought I would add some helpful hints: * Worldquest is located right behind the Nickelodeon Hotel and making a left turn at the intersection in front of Nickelodeon is a death trap. There was a 3 car accident (with one car flipped over) when we arrived. You can avoid this intersection entirely by using International Drive S (not to be confused with International Drive) which will take you to the Osceola Pkwy to Disney and the I-4 to Universal. * There are no street lights off Worldquest Dr so if you arrive at night, be careful not to miss the turn off to security * Breakfast consists of bagels, toast, 3 types of boring cereal and a pastry of some kind. The breakfast area gets packed so grab a box or bag and take your food up to your room. We would make our own bacon and egg breakfast but pack up some bagels to take to Universal or the waterparks for lunch. * Bring or buy laundry detergent because they don't supply this. You can buy a little one-use box of detergent for $2 at the hotel store. They also didn't re-supply the dishwasher detergent. * Our dryer didn't fully dry our clothes * Drinks are expensive at the Tiki-Bar, even with a happy hour deal. I'd recommend a visit to Walmart. I would definitely recommend this resort. There are no sales staff trying to get you to buy a time share & everyone leaves you in peace to enjoy your stay. Even the lady selling disney tickets was honest and helpful and didn't pressure us to buy anything. My family and I would go back to this condo.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem minutes from Parks”
Reviews.Author: Nathalie21
Reviews.Content: We booked a two-bedroom condo for a long birthday weekend at an incredible internet rate. When a family member from Europe decided to join us at the last minute, the fabulous resort staff (Brooke, Bianca, and others) immediately agreed to upgrade us to a three-bedroom at no additional cost. The condo was incredible--spacious, modern, luxurious, and impeccably maintained, with a huge fully equipped kitchen (even a dishwasher and a stock of detergent!), screened porch (we saw a raccoon family toddle by) and a huge living-dining room in addition to three big bedrooms. There is also a washer and dryer in the unit--no quarters needed. Our 13-month-old slept as well in the provided crib as he does in his bed at home--no crappy pack-n-plays here! World Quest Resort consists of several beautiful three or four-story condo complexes around a beautiful Mediterranean-style swimming pool, and the pond on the property gives you the feeling of being out in the Florida wilderness. However, you are about 600 yards from International Drive, with a Publix supermarket and other shopping and some restaurants exactly two miles away. The entrance to Disney is also less than three miles away, making World Quest's location extremely practical even if you decide not to take advantage of their courtesy shuttle to Epcot. We live in North Florida and visit the Orlando area at least twice a year. World Quest Resort is far and away the best overall value that we have found in Mickey's back yard, and we will now make this our home in Orlando. I don't know how this fantastic resort has stayed under the radar for the four years it has been there, but it will be discovered by the masses soon--book soon before you have to pay what it's worth!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: demigrog
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay at World Quest, and another good experience. I shared a 3-bedroom condo with my Sister's family, so four adults and two toddlers. The condos are huge, so it never felt crowded. We were in building 5 this time, and had very good bedding and furnishings just like last time in building 6. While a little further from the pool, Buildings 5, 6, and 7 are very quiet. The included breakfast was ok, pretty typical for a hotel. The breakfast area was crowded by 9AM, though not unreasonably so. The pool is nice, though we only got to swim late at night (9PM) when they were out of clean pool towels. The location is excellent, though they still need to work on their signage out front. It is bigger than it previously, but still way too small, and my Sister (their first visit) had trouble finding it. My GPS also still doesn't have WQ in its database, as its map file is old. I just enter the Nickelodian hotel across the street. We requested a crib in our reservation, and the Hotel provided a decent one with bedding. Checkout was easy even at 4:30AM. Internet access (wired) was good, though I'd bring a CAT5 cable (the one in the room was very short) or your own wireless router.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay,Convenient Location-Looking Forward to returning!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel4adventure
Reviews.Content: Stayed at World Quest with extended family and it worked out fabulously!!Loved the convenience - kitchen, waher/dryer, breakfast! The pool area was beautiful and the location cannot be beat! We were able to make it to the Disney Parks within minutes! The shuttles are offered, however tyhe times were not convenient for us. I will not even consider staying at a 'typical' hotel for an Orlando trip again after experiencing World Quest!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: brummy100
Reviews.Content: We had a difficult time finding the place as it is tucked away from the main road and no one in the area seemed to know where it was.There probably should be a sign or something up on the main street corner?? We finally located it and used the Nickelodeon hotel on the main street as our turnoff point onto the resort road. We were really happy with the resort, the check in was friendly and helpfull, the 3 bedroom condo was perfect for our party of 6 as it had two bathrooms, 3 bedrooms and a full kitchen, 3 TV's , a washer and dryer and everything that we needed for our stay. We took the daily towel service for a few $$'s per day and it was well worth it. The pool was a little distance to walk but was well worth the couple of minutes it took to get to it. It is huge, spotlessly clean and had a hot tub too, plenty of pool towels available at all times. The area is good for shopping and lots of restuarants if you want them within a few minutes drive.Disney is literally 5 minutes away and Universal was about 15 minutes. Overall very clean and comfortable, nice decor and well equipped, no doubt that this is the place that we will stay at on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for families visiting Disney”
Reviews.Author: CTTraveler30
Reviews.Content: When researching nice places to stay around Disney, I almost had a heart attack. But, TripAdvisor steered me right again. We shared a three bedroom suite with our friends and kids. The resort is less than 15 minutes from Disney, there is a Publix grocery store on your way back and a full kitchen in the suite, which really helps save money. I took full advantage of the washer and dryer in the room to wash both clothes and towels (they have a weird cleaning fee - but if you just have them empty the garbage daily and clean up after yourself, it is very reasonable). They do offer a breakfast but it is pretty much cereal and bagels, you may want to pick up fruit or yogurt at the Publix if you like a more rounded breakfast. I would definitely stay here again the next time I visited Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2nd time here!!”
Reviews.Author: europetraveler7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel!! We had a 3 bedroom apt. Each bedroom had their own bathroom. (Note: the first time we stayed here, our 3 bedroom apt had only 2 bathrooms.) It was clean, comfortable, a great place to relax. Lots of room for everyone. The full kitchen and the washer/dryer was very nice. We opted to avoid the cleaning service and to wash our towels ourselves to keep the price low. If you go for this option, they will come in and only empty the garbage on a daily basis. If you stay 3 days or less, there is a one time $40 cleaning charge. It was still a good value for the the 3bed/3bath space. Nice pool with a bar. Free continental breakfast is included. Publix Grocery store is only 2 miles away. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews were right.. great place, great value, great location...”
Reviews.Author: lynn821
Reviews.Content: I did extensive research on WorldQuest Resort, reading reviews every week. Everything that was written about this place was correct. It was in a great location: close to Disney, Downtown Disney and Animal Kingdom. I liked that it was a gated hotel, felt a bit safer. Yes the pizza flyers did arrive each night, but they didn't bother us (I was expecting it!!). The pool was great, not busy at all and very warm. It was wonderful to have a kitchen and washer/dryer in our room. We did have a problem with the toilet in the master bedroom, but someone came up right away that day to fix it. Also the TV didn't work in the master bedroom, but there were three others to watch, so not a problem. I would definitely recommend staying here. It's close to many different restaurants, but you will need a car to get places. Hotel was very inexpensive for all that we got (room/pool)!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, spacious, fabulous pool and location”
Reviews.Author: Imissba
Reviews.Content: Hotel room was a 2 bedroom suite. Master bedroom with a king size bed, master bath had a jetted tub and separate shower. Second bedroom with 2 twin beds. TV's in each bedroom and living area, which was very large. We loved the screened in balcony, pool view, very spacious suite. Kitchen was complete with all you need. Washer and dryier inside the unit. We did not like the mattress. You pay a housekeeping fee ($39) , that is a lot if you only stay for a night or 2 , not too bad if you stay for the week. The pool is gorgeous, huge. Tiki bar had only one attendant doing cooking and bartending, and it took a while to get our food. Breakfast included, was OK (self service), coffee, bagels, juice, cereal. Overall, very good expericence, no frills, family oriented place, with all the basics and lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: JimCayman
Reviews.Content: Found this resort at a very good price in VBRO direct from the owner. Three bedroom, three bathroom, 4th floor very nice view of pool, washer/dryer, full kitchen, 3 TVs, very close to everything - parks, shopping, cinema, downtown disney, old town. The best thing about this hotel was location. Overall everything was good, big rooms, clean well kept, fast check in and faster check out. Stayed with 3 year old and wife, lots of space good internet access. There is not much bad to say except there was not much to do at the resort if you wanted to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Spot On This Hotel.Way above our Expectations ;-) Happy Days”
Reviews.Author: martido1968
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at this Hotel for 2 weeks from 6th September 2010 .I can Honestly say its the nicest one we have stayed in.I read the reviews before booking & seen a few gripes ,but i could not fault it .People just being petty I think Expecting a 5 Star.It was Clean,well equipped with washing machine,tumble dryer,ironing board,Iron, 2 x Hairdryers,Dish washer.Microwave,hoover.Spa in the bathroom & 2 x showers .Dvd Player & Tvs in all Rooms .The apartment was very spacious.Grounds were very attractive & secure .Breakfast was decent enough,It was continental with a selection of Bagels,Cereals,bread etc .You could go up as many times as you like & if you could not make Breakfast ,we used to send one Person down & bring them back to the apartment which was great at night times if you were not that hungry .I would defo return to this hotel if I went back To Florida.I travelled with 3 x adults & 2 x Teenagers & we were ALL well Happy .Location was only 10 mins drive away from International Drive ,Nickleon Hotel is near It Looks Cheap & Tacky ..& it aint got a patch on Worldquest Resort..World Quest Hotel was AWESOME & made our holiday all the better .When I booked in i was given the option if I wanted a maid for extra charges...we did not as it was easy enough too look after & if you want plenty of clean towels ,go to the pool as tons & tons there you can use ,all foc or shove them in the washing machine . Loved it .loved it. loved it. Defo Recommend It ;-) Get It Booked

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel, fantastic rooms, and good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: longy7925
Reviews.Content: myself and my wife stayed at the world quest resort orlando for 8 days after leaving miami to come here due to bad hotel back in miami, we were hoping to stay in a good hotel with nice room, we got exactly that, the rooms are massive and have everything you need and more, its own dishwasher, tumble dryer, washing machine, iron board and more the location is excellent and they offer a free shuttle to the disney parks which is good, i personally next time will hire a car and drive as the taxis can be quite expensive everything in orlando is not walkin distance, therefore you need a car breakfast was excellent, toast, drinks, coffee , pure orange etc, some pastires and cereal, just what u need before u head to the parks downtown disney is a good place to visit at nite, with cinema, nice places to eat, we ate at bongos which was lovely, house of blues and the irish bar which is great downtown disney is $12 in taxi from resort each way, so bear that in mind when booking, on site there is a little shop for essential stuff you may need at short notice the weather was perfect and in the 90's all week, our last day was bit cloudy but nice to have a change i would definetley return to world quest and dont think there is a better hotel in the area

Reviews.Title: “Uncompromisingly Amazing. Home away from home, and more.”
Reviews.Author: RealMum456
Reviews.Content: I will definitely return to this resort for another holiday. From the moment we arrived there at about 2am in the morning, we were well received and the room blew me away. With 2 young children, the cleanliness and capacity of our condo was fabulous. I can be a bit of a cleanliness freak and I'm glad to say that World Quest did not disappoint. So much room and the bathrooms were very clean. The site is very close to local amenities, such as Walmart, Disney World and Internatinal Drive. The staff are really friendly, helpful and courteous; keep it up guys. Whether you just want to relax by the pool area, or you want to just stay indoors, there is the right amount of tranquil for every taste. There were no noise issues and we felt very secure during our stay. My family and I had a fantastic break and staying at the World Quest Resort made all the difference. I can't wait to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Family”
Reviews.Author: brouwerb
Reviews.Content: This resort was excellent. Very clean and modern. Pool was great to cool off from the August heat wave. Close to everthing. We'll stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding accommodation in an outstanding location”
Reviews.Author: PriceyfromLlanfynydd
Reviews.Content: Worldquest Resort is situated in a very private location, tucked away just off the main access routes for Disney/Universal/Seaworld, etc. The Disney site is five minutes away which was great for making multiple visits on hot days. The rooms at Worldquest resort are quite literally palacial - very well equipped and extremely comfortable. The pool area is large and well equipped - towels are provided for guests. Breakfast was very good with a choice of cereal/bagels/pastries and a large choice of fruit juice/coffee/tea, etc. Staff at the resort are courteous and helpful and on the one occasion when we experienced a minor electrical problem in our apartment, it was instantaneously resolved. If we ever visit Orlando in the future we would not hesitate to make a reservation at Worldquest Resort. I have never posted a review on line before but this resort is fully deserving of everything I have written.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely enjoyable stay...elegant rooms”
Reviews.Author: skeeziks
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights while visiting Discovery Cove and Aquatica. We had a lovely, clean and comfortable 3 bedroom condo on the 1st floor. It was quiet and we were able to watch deer and hawks in the backyard in the morning (building 7). The staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Breakfast was good...mostly bagels and pastry. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Our road trip to Orlando to see the gators and mickey.”
Reviews.Author: waterfallsusan
Reviews.Content: We made reservations on the web site and were impressed with the pictures of the rooms and property. However, we were cautiously optimistic, knowing that everything on the internet is not always what it seems. However, when we arrived, we were immediatly impressed with the facility. There is a gated entrance and a large nicely landscaped clubhouse with a circular drive. We entered the clubhouse and were immediately greated by the attendant who quickly checked us in and provided us with keys to our room and instructions, etc. We were impressed with the unit, specifically the size of the condo. We rented the two bedroom, and were relieved to learn that everything promised on the website was true. The condo was clean and nicely furnished. The kitchen was spotless, with granite countertops, and new appliances, all spotlessly clean. The cabinets and drawers were stocked with all the cooking and serving utensils we needed. The air conditioning system was quiet and kept all the rooms comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: TLSJH
Reviews.Content: Excellent place to stay, beautiful pool area. Staff very helpful. Would be happy to recommend and to return.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest is our second home”
Reviews.Author: lauradipreta
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at World Quest since they opened. We were a family with tweens to now a family with teens. We live 4 hours from Orlando so we make a weekend trip every couple months. It's a perfect location, perfect size and perfect resort for our family. We always have a smooth comfortable stay. Thank you World Quest. See you in September.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED this place! Highly recommended for families”
Reviews.Author: mmfoy
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest Resort is a super value for what you get. We had a 3 bedroom, 2 bath condo with a full kitchen (more counter space than my kitchen at home!) living room, dining area and screened in patio (which was large) For less than half of what a room at a Disney hotel or Universal cost, we got a beautiful condo. Condo was immaculate and we had a minor problem w/ hot water in one of the showers and it was fixed immediately. The pool area is gorgeous and large. Many lounges were available and it never felt crowded and was open until 11pm, which was great after spending a long day at Universal in the heat. Continental breakfast was fine for our group of 3 adults and 3 teens. Very close to Disney, but we did Universal this time and that was only 15-20 minutes north on Hwy 4, which is 2 min. from the condo. We will absolutely stay here again!! Stay in Bldg 1, 2 or 3 which is close to the pool. Bldgs 4-7 are kind of far and you don't want to walk all that way to the pool late at night or just to get breakfast in the morning. Perfect for several couples or family, enough room and privacy for everyone. LOVED IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “An extremely well appointed resort, a real pleasure to stay in.”
Reviews.Author: jamesland_so1
Reviews.Content: A brilliant location for the Disney Theme Parks, the furthest no more than 10 minutes drive away. Sea World a mere 15 minutes drive and Universal only 25 miniutes. That said the resort is tucked away from the hussle and bustle and gives a well needed oasis of quiet after a hectic day. Swimming pool is excellent for children of all ages and for the over-heated parent. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed and the staff always friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay again and will recommend to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “This was our second time to stay here and was very disappointed this time.”
Reviews.Author: unhappy87
Reviews.Content: The first time we stayed at Resort Quest, we loved it. We were very disappointed this time. First of all, we had noisy neighbors next to us who sounded like they were moving furniture all night. The dryer took hours to dry one load of clothes. We opted not to have cleaning service or linens replenished on a daily basis. However, someone did come into the condo and took out the trash. Someone took my sons cellphone and made over $1200 in calls to Honduras. The televisions were outdated and security was very lax, unlike our first visit. We love the location and the close proximity to stores and parks, but I don't think I will be staying there the next time.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: JHankins
Reviews.Content: We traveled to Orlando for vacation to Disney World. We compared prices of hotels, including the Disney properties and found the World Quest Resort to be about the same or less than the economy Disney Properities. And for three bedrooms, three bathrooms, a full kitchen and a washer and dryer we thought for the price this would be worth trying. We are glad we did. The World Quest was all it sounded like it would be. For the price it was definitely worth it. The only thing I would complain about the rooms were the carpet and beds. The carpet needed to be cleaned or replaced and the beds were not that comfortable. Probably need to be replaced too but I've stayed in places that were worse. Everything else was very clean. The washer/dryer was great. No dirty laundry when we left. Complimentary breakfast....be prepared to wait in lines and not have a place to sit. After the first day we noticed people were coming in with plates and boxes and taking food back to their rooms. That's what we did the rest of the week. Don't expect any variation in what is served either. Cereal, muffins, bagels and pastries is what they served every morning. It was free though. Shuttle service to the Disney Parks.......They do provide free shuttle service. They pick you up in the front of the hotel and take you to Epcot. From there you can catch the monorail to Magic Kingdom or the buses to the other parks. The only complaint I have about this is the times the shuttle runs. In the morning its 9:30, 11:45 and 1:30. The times for bringing you back are 6:30, 8:30 and 10:30. It will take you about 30 minutes to get from the parks back to Epcot so by the time the fireworks show and parades are over you are really cutting it close to make the last shuttle. There is taxi services at all the parks if you run late. It will cost you $16-$28 to get back to World Quest from Epcot. I have read in some of the comments that the water pressure is bad and the surrounding area isn't that nice...we didn't have that experience. We stayed in building #1. It was right up at the front of the complex just a short walk to the main building where breakfast is served and right next to the HUGE pool. The water pressure was better than we have at home. I would recommend if you stay here that you make a trip to Wal-Mart, which is about 2 miles away, and stock up on food/beverages and take advantage of the full kitchen, which is fully stocked with dishes and silverware, dishwasher, full refridge w/ice maker, toaster, microwave, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort, Great location at a Great Value!!”
Reviews.Author: billyb96
Reviews.Content: World Quest Resort is located within 5 minutes of everything in Disney.The onsite pool was excellent and very close to our room. We stayed in the 3 bed/3 bath room and it was enormous!!!! You cannot find a better value for this type of resort. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “I Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: jhowie321
Reviews.Content: From check-in to the checkout it, was way above expectations. The resort was very clean. Staff was very very nice and pleasant. The condo was spacious and beautiful. For breakfast there were donuts, bagels, juices and great maxwell house coffee. The food was replenished quickly with a smile and without a frown. All staff members deserve a raise!

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: vsmith51
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Orlando the second week in July and the resort looked just like the pictures. I've read a few comments from Marriott timeshare owners and I think those are separate from the condos that aren't owners. Our condo had tile floors, everything was new, three bedrooms and was very well lit. Even the washer and dryer was new. It was very spaceous and my sons had nice one each which was great. It was limited in amenities but shopping and restuarants were only a five minute drive away. There was a Super Walmart about a five minute drive also. You could get to all of the theme parks within minutes the backway. It was great not to have to deal with the traffic. The only issue we had and this was a major one was that there was a family from another country who could not get used to our timezone. They sleep all day and got up at 1030 at night. What can you really do at that time of night other than annoy the hell out of your neighbors. Their kids ran up and down the halls and through every room. As you can tell the walls are paper thin so if you can get through that you will be fine. I suggest getting a room near the front desk or get a end room on the second floor. No one above you and no one on either side. It kind of hangs off to the side by itself.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious accomodations.”
Reviews.Author: momof3Iowa
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Worldquest for 5 nights after staying at the Hard Rock Hotel. I got a great price for July 4th week. The place was huge with 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. We only used the pool once. It was very nice and big. We enjoyed the space. Everything was clean. One comment was about the bedsheets coming off which is true, but not a big deal. I requested no housekeeping and no towel exchange. I didn't know that they came everyday to remove the garbage which I don't like. I didn't want anybody in our place. They do have an in room safe which I used. Overall, it was a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “WorldQuest is home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: CortneyM
Reviews.Content: It was great having a place to call "home" for a few days while I was in Oralndo on business - that was so much more inviting than a hotel room. The condo was nicely sized and had all the amenities you needed such as: full service kitchen with a dishwasher, washer/dryer, internet, TV's in the LR plus all 3 bedrooms, plenty of towels, and my unit even had 3 full bathrooms! I noticed the condo also had an iron/ironing board, although I didn't need to use it. The amount of space was more than sufficient, and the amenities available were perfect. Even though I wasn't able to use the pool (too cold), I used the workout room which was just fine for what I needed. I traveled on my own, so it was important for me (a female) to have a check-in process much like a hotel where I felt safe getting my keys, etc. If my travels bring me back to the Orlando area (and I'm 100% positive they will), I will definitely be checking availability on this condo!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent, not fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Mauimama04
Reviews.Content: If my family did not always stay in timeshares or condos when vacationing, I'd probably rate this property higher. Unfortunately, I cannot help comparing it to other places (especially the bright, clean, updated condo we recently rented in Murrells Inlet, SC). We have been to Orlando nearly every summer and, as Marriott vacation club owners, have always stayed at one of Marriott's several timeshare properties there. This time, however, because of unexpected last-minute changes, we were unable to make an exchange for the exact dates needed. After considering several condo options, we decided to rent directly from the owners at World Quest. Although the exterior of the property is aesthetically similar to Marriott's Grande Vista (albeit considerably smaller), the similarities end there. Unlike MGV or other Marriott properties, there really are no amenities. Rather than a marketplace, there's a small overly priced convenience store (similar to what you'd find in a hotel lobby) with limited food selections. There's also no real fitness center but, rather, a minuscule room with four machines. There is only one pool, which gets constant full-sun exposure, with very limited seating in the shade. The biggest drawback, however, is that the resort is situated near the highway, which means there's constant road noise. As for the units themselves, they are rather dated and dimly lit at night. The living room area has a sofa that seats only two comfortably and two upholstered arm chairs. Fortunately, there were only four of us, but a larger group would not have adequate seating without dragging over one of the dining room chairs. The layout and placement of the television (which is bulky and old) also makes it difficult for anyone except those sitting on the sofa to have a decent viewing angle. Each of the three bedrooms, which also have outdated televisions, has a ceiling fan but no ceiling light, making them rather dark (even in the day when the draperies are drawn). In addition to the mattresses not being comfortable, the thin sheets are ill fitting and have to be repositioned every morning. Because the bathrooms, especially the shower in the master bath, are not well lit, they seem "dingy" even though they were clean enough. We also had to wash the towels after using them once because they felt as if they'd been washed in harsh institutional detergent and dried without fabric softener. In sum, while our three-bedroom unit gave us the space we prefer, it lacked many of the luxuries to which we've become accustomed.

Reviews.Title: “Everything about this resort was awesome and I would definately stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaWalk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week for my daughters wedding. Everyone there from the front desk to housekeeping and security were amazing! The condo was immaculate and made us feel like it was our home away from home. We were all sad to leave and hope to go back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “A Few Little Things Could Make This Resort 5 Stars...”
Reviews.Author: blckdimnd
Reviews.Content: Hold on tight this gonna be a long review about this place...We just got back from the Worldquest Resort, a family of 7. We stayed there for 10 nights. In my opinion, the only fantastic thing about this resort is 3 things: The distance from Disney parks, shopping, and the spaciousness of the rooms. We had a 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo,and it was gorgeous! Granite countertops in the full size kitchen, and it was stocked with silverware, baking dishes, pots, pans, cups, glasses, everything you can think of that belong in a kitchen, it was there. When I say full size kitchen, I mean microwave, dishwasher, coffee maker, toaster, stove, and refrigerator,.. I loved it. Now, on to the rooms..HUGE livingroom which connected to the diningroom, ceiling fans in every room except 1 and bathrooms. Flat screen TV, DVD player... there was no carpet on the livingroom floors, and bathrooms, only carpet in the bedrooms. Master bedroom had a king size bed with 2 lamps on each side with TV and a en-suite bathroom....absolutely BEAUTIFUL!! My mouth fell open when I walked into that bathroom..the jetted tub was so big it looked like at least 2 or 3 people can get in it. The walk in shower was humungous as well; about 4 people can get in that. Granite counter tops in the bathroom with two sinks. The second bedroom had a queen sized bed in it, it was nice, and the 3rd bedroom had two double beds with an ensuite bathroom. There was a washer and dryer that was very nice to use.. There was also a screened balcony with sliding doors off the livingroom that displayed a lovely view of the disgusting swamp in the back of the resort. Please, Please, Please if you ever think of staying here request a room by the pool because if the staff decides to put you somewhere else, you will be disappointed. Here is where my complaining comes in: We did not sleep that well at night due to the uncomfortable beds, and the noisy freeway. The beds are toooooo soft. My fiance and I bodies hurt every morning when we woke up. I know as individuals we all have our preferences on what types of beds we consider comfortable, and we as people do not have the same classifications..well it felt like we were sinking in the bed, that's how soft they were. The linen on our beds looked thin, worned and old. It needs to be replaced. Every morning or in the middle of the night we had to put the fitted sheet back on our beds because it wouldn't stay on due to us tossing and turning throughout the night. I hated that!! Our room was situated by a nasty, dirty looking swamp, and the noisy traffic filled freeway..it sucked. My fiance and I couldn't be romantic at night or during the day with that! The walls are paper thin and we could hear all the cars that drove on the freeway...I asked if can I be moved to another room, and I was told that buildings 1 through 4 were all booked. We stayed in building 5. Please run! We went to the "so called" game room, and fitness center. Both rooms were big enough to put a childs bedroom set in. (probably half the size).. The game room only had 4 games, sorry that is not a game room. They shouldn't advertise that. The fitness center only has 4 machines in there, again that is not a "fitness center." The water pressure in tub, and shower was scarce. I turned the knob on hot all the way, and I could put my entire arm to feel it, and it was mildly warm, almost cold!! I ran bath water for myself and it took almost a half hour to fill up, that's how slow the water was running out. And it was like that the whole time we were there. The staff sent someone to look at it, and I was told that the water is like that because other people in the building was using water too (WHAT)?!? For the whole 10 days? WOW...anyway Another complaint, the lighting in the bedrooms, oh my goodness, we had to take the lamp shades off the lamps to get accurate lighting because that was the only way to make it brighter in the bedrooms. I ordered towel service for 1 day which was 5 dollars. I made the order in the morning at 7:30am, we went to the parks, came back at 11pm, tired, sweaty and wanting a shower, there were no towels. I had to call again for towels and I was mad as hell! That lost points for me..The staff is not particularly friendly only courteous, because that's their job, there is a difference between the two. The elevator in our building (5) was very nasty. We would start our day, and notice garbage being on the elevator, and when it wasn't, no one cleaned the elevator after the garbage been on there, it was gross!! Major point deduction on this issue as well! The pool was nice, but the water was salt water..another gross thing! Another annoying thing, the small garbage can in the kitchen filled up pretty quickly, and they never gave us new garbage bags!! Solicitors would slide pizza notices under the door, and we would wake up and see 4 or 5 pieces of paper on the floor from them..that got on my nerves.. Note, I am picky, however I do not like spending my vacation in a smelly building overlooking a yucky swamp, noisy freeway, so-so service, have to go through drastic measures to get proper lighting, cold water that supposed to be hot, and uncomfortable beds with worn linen. If management or staff or whoever can look into these problems, and possibly add a restaurant to this resort, this place could be 5 stars. There isn't much for kids to do at this resort besides, swimming, so if you are looking for any activities for your children to do, this is not the place. They only have a limited selection of cable channels there, so bring some DVDs from home in case you get bored with whats on TV... Disney and SUPERWALMART is literally 5 minutes away, if that. The size of the rooms are very huge but these quirky things that I mentioned, they need to get that together, fast. I don't think I would stay there again, however if someone wanted to be close to Disney and the other parks, I'd recommend it, but beware! Oh I forgot to mention, they have internet service there as well in the rooms by the kitchen and they provided a ethernet cord to attach to my laptop which was free.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, however...”
Reviews.Author: earniealiduncan
Reviews.Content: If we didn't have to sleep, this would have been the perfect resort. The only major complaint I have is the lack of sleep. We stayed for a week in a three bedroom, with my husband and I in the master. The mattress was horrible! I felt like I was sleeping on springs alone and neither of us slept well at all the entire week. My daughters mattress literally slipped off of the box springs every night and we would have to pull the mattress back up. She is not a crazy sleeper or anything, but every time she would roll to one side or the other, the mattress would literally slide off the box springs. We only used our kitchen for breakfast, however it was well supplied for cooking any meal. Includes utensils, glassware, corkscrew, etc. You have to turn the ice maker on yourself, fyi. Bathrooms were well supplied with towels, etc... Every night when we came in, there would be several pizza delivery flyers. We did try one and it was terrible. Small, bare except for the hairs we found in it. Disgusting! The pool was amazing! I got a little irritated that other guests would come out early, claim several good chairs and then disappear for hours until afternoon but other than that it was great. Our rooms were not ready when we arrived and we were allowed to change in the poolside cabana which was very nice. Poolside bar is a little overpriced.... Three beers and a childs smoothie cost $21. We didn't try happy hour, we ended up buying our own alcohol at the local 7-11 and carried it down to the pool. The hotels little grocery store was outrageously priced. A small Ben and Jerry's pint of ice cream was $7.00. Not joking! After that purchase for our daughter, we did not buy anything else. We went to the local Wal-Mart to buy groceries and it was a madhouse! Worse than "Black Friday"! The cashier said it is like that every day and night due to tourists. I recommend finding a smaller grocery store if you want to purchase groceries, otherwise you will have to buy body armor in attempt to buy the last loaf of bread. Breakfast was mediocre. A few pastries, fruit, a toaster, cereal and juice / coffee. You have to go early if you want any food though. It goes fast. My husband saw a lady take an entire bowl of fruit and dump it in her bag. The place is gorgeous! Picture perfect! I did ask about the mattresses and was told "They are only four years old". We are planning on going back to Orlando but not World Quest. After a 22 hour drive, we really needed a good bed to sleep in and did not get that until we returned home. One more thing.... If you are planning a trip with family, don't expect any vacation romance. The walls are so thin... Makes for a very long week.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, with great value and location.”
Reviews.Author: bdmiller45
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort -- very clean, modern, spacious. Huge pool. Friendly and helpful staff. Nice full kitchen and screened porch for meals in with the kids. Great central location, close to parks, shopping and restaurants. Will definitely stay here again. Only minuses were (1) solicitors coming on the property and littering doors with flyers -- a nuissance and security concern; (2) not the best sleep due to chairs moving around on tile floors above us; (3) no business center or internet access (but did let me use their computer for a few minutes!).

Reviews.Title: “surpassed expectation”
Reviews.Author: thelmaandlouiseni
Reviews.Content: wonderful resort,so close to all amenities and although we hired a car shuttle service and taxis were easily available. The resort was beautifully maintained and really clean.Pool area lovely with high spec loungers ,plenty of spotless pool towels and good toilet facilities. Staff friendly and most helpful and we were moved to a condo nearer to the pool area after our first night with the minimum fuss and it seemed to be pleasure for the staff to be able to help us!! 2 bedroomed apartment was huge and all facilities perfect and clean.We declined housekeeping for the 2 week stay but maid service emptied bins and tidied on a daily basis anyway. As 2 middle aged fogies just in search of sun and relaxation it was marvellous but an in house bar with some entertainment would have been the icing on the cake

Reviews.Title: “Ideal choice for Orlando accommodation”
Reviews.Author: JDsale
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a 2 bedroom apartment and found it ticked all our boxes for Orlando. Plenty of car parking, spacious apartments with all we could require, effective air conditioning, lovely pool area, free continental breakfast and just ten minutes from most of the Disney parks and five minutes to all the restaurants etc down on the 192. Would recommend to those looking for self-catering for parties of four to six people who like to spend some time on resort as well as being handily located for the theme parks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lodging!”
Reviews.Author: cmmccla
Reviews.Content: Pictures and reviews were nice so we booked a great rate for a 3 br, 2 bath condo. Upon arrival, the desk clerk was so nice and super friendly. Changed the room to a poolside room upon request. No hassles or problems. The room was AWESOME. Had to be 1500 square feet condo and all rooms were clean and nicely decorated. You could see a part of the pool from the sunroom. The beds were nice and the bathroom in the master was very nice! Loved the huge walk in shower! The hotel is VERY close to Disney and other places, off of a quiet street. I truly enjoyed all parts of my stay. The breakfast IS cheap though... lol. Bagels, toast, cereal... boo. We didn't eat breakfast there. Everything else was nice!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The kids really enjoyed this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jesirec
Reviews.Content: Very nice place, Very clean and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps the best place to stay in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: SummerKesa
Reviews.Content: The two of us stayed some 7 days in this apartment hotel. The apartment had more space than what we needed, and for once it was great not having to worry about where to put our luggage. The kitchen was well equipped and we cooked most of our dinners. Breakfast was also included, but I wouldn’t recommend it: doughnuts, jelly and toast. Balcony was facing the pool where they had a nice pool bar. Location was perfect: close to all the parks and big Outlest. Hotel had a free parking. Staff was very helpful and solved our tiny problem with the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!Mgt & Owners in Nasty Dispute: Rent at Your Own Risk”
Reviews.Author: newenglandgrl27
Reviews.Content: We rented from an owner and the unit was no where near as nice as the one we rented in 2009 from Worldquest. We had to drive to another resort to get the keys. We arrived to find unit dirty,lacking promised welcome pack and many broken bits. (Ex) doors off hinges,shower pole held up with folded cereal box. The odor was disgusting. The next day we recieved a legal letter from Worldquest mgt under door stating we would be prosecuted to full extent of Florida law if we used the ameneties including the pool which we had PAID for already! The property manager Mark was civil but not at all helpful and informed me multiple times that I was not HIS customer. We argued with the other resort where we got the keys, the unit owner's representative and Mr. Smallwood whom we had rented from believing this was his unit. The manager at LBV was nice and apologetic. After wasting most of my son's birthday arguing and looking up our rights etc we finally got moved to another unit who paid thier condo fees. We had to drive to collect the new keys and move everything to another building on our own. Apparently the owner we rented from was delinquent so WE were punished for it. There are too many internal issues between management and owners which should have nothing to do with the guests. Unfortunately the Management seems to be taking the stance that if they hurt the customers the unit owners will stop renting out thier units privately. As it stands I would not recommend anyone rent any unit until this is resolved. it was not a nice way to spend our holiday. In fact with so many other similar places to stay within a mile or two, I seriously don't think I would ever risk staying here again. be sure to confirm the owner of the unit you will be staying in is current on his ameneity fees or you will be in for a nasty surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Best bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: mizun0fan
Reviews.Content: As it isn't a major chain, not well advertised but came across through TA. Agree with the other reviewers, very clean and new, well furnished 3 bedroom 2 br condo with excellent pool, patio, well maintained with plenty of maintenance staff observed and high end pool chairs and loungers. Friendly front desk staff, quick to help. Free breakfast (continental) albeit a bit limited but its free. All this for $100/night and just outside disney which is a steal. Walmart is really close, publix medium close and supertarget a little farther. No children's playground though and no barbeques, not a major issue for us though. My ipod touch wasn't able to connect with their wifi, they have ethernet cable/connection in the condo kitchens though if you bring your laptop. Again a great deal and value for the money, highly recommend though you will need a car to get around as no public transit nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney and a Great Deal!”
Reviews.Author: Cancun4
Reviews.Content: We rented a 3 bedroom condo at WorldQuest for a week in November, and were more than pleased with our experience. We had no problem finding our way to the resort from the airport with the directions given on the website. Although we arrived hours before check-in, our condo was ready, and was found to be in excellent condition. We had a beautiful pool view from our screened balcony. The pool looked very well maintained, but due to a cold snap we did not swim. This has go to be one of the closest resorts off of Disney property. We were driving under the Disney welcome sign within five minutes of leaving our parking space. And for the location you cannot beat the price! I highly recommend going to the WorldQuest website and signing up for their "Hot Deals" e-mail. Within minutes of signing up I received a code for 20% off! For the price of a budget room on Disney property, we had a 3 bedroom , 3 bath condo with a washer/dryer we really took advantage of, breakfast, 3 tvs, the list goes on... Actually, the breakfast was about a small as you could get and still claim it as breakfast. Coffee was good, juices were okay, and other than that, there were a couple of cereals and a small case of breads/pastry. I really am not complaining since most resorts offer nothing to eat, but I wanted to mention it because I am always curious about b'fast offerings when selecting a hotel. A down side to this resort would be that this is not within walking distance to anything. A Walmart and some fast food places are within a couple of minutes drive, and nicer restaurants and shops a little further. We were very pleased with WorldQuest, and will more than likely stay again on our next trip to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: shopper20
Reviews.Content: The resort was perfect. Suites were wonderful. Loved the pool. Resort was close to everything, GPS helped find the place from airport . Around the corner turning right and then right again was a huge Super Walmart then past the Walmart turning left down a toll highway of charging $1.75 was great resturants and shopping found it on our second last day only minutes away. Super close to the Resort. Recommending checking the shopping there out. Will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Travellers072
Reviews.Content: From Newfoundland, Canada! This is the best resort I have ever stayed, it was fantastic! Myself, huband, sister and our two kids, aged 6 & 8, stayed at World Quest on our 1st family disney vacation. We had originally planned to stay here for the 1st week and head to the beach for the 2nd week BUT our plans changed after day 1 at the resort. We loved it here so much, we extended our stay and stayed here for the full 2 weeks. We stayed in Building 1 in a 3-bedroom condo and loved every minute. Being so close to the pool was great and being next door to the club house was great. We availed of the continental breakfast almost every morning and the coffee was so good. At the time of our stay, the resort was at 80% occupancy but it honestly felt as though we were the only ones there, at times. The pool was fantastic - not too deep for the kids therefore I did have to worry too much when they were playing. The lounge chairs were super comfy, very plush and very clean! The whole place was spotless and the staff were remarkable - overall it was the best place I've ever stayed and I've travelled a lot, we will definately be back with bells on and will be referring this place to everyone we know. Oh, I forgot to mention the "Location" was perfect - close to everything. Disney was 1 mile away and Shopping Galore was just around the corner! You will not be disappointed if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Wonderful place!”
Reviews.Author: Szq15
Reviews.Content: Loved the facility. The continental breakfast was wonderful every morning. The rooms had plenty of space. We had a three bedroom suite. It was beautiful, plenty of room for our family of five. The access to Disney and other parks was quick and a handy. Walmart around the corner! Slept great every night. The facility is off the heavy traffic roads was very serene and comfortable. Highly reccomend it and I do every chance I get.

Reviews.Title: “Just Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Elaine0436
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a 3-bedroom apartment-great for my extended family. I didn't know what to expect and end up very satisfied. The price was just right, it was very close to all parks, and comfortable. Their continental breakfast was super-got us ready for a whole day at the parks. The staff were very responsive and friendly. I will go back to staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: bradleykim
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the WorldQuest resort. I was impressed with the condo-style rooms, large living area and kitchen. We (family of 4) had a 3 bedroom 2 bath condo and shared it with my sister's family of 5 and grandparents - so three families total. The condo was big enough for all, I only wish we had 3 bathrooms since we had to share with the grandparents. The kitchen was well stocked with at least one of everything we needed (except specialty things like rice cookers) and we cooked quite a few dinners there. It also had dishwashing detergent and dishsoap which was nice. The only problem we encountered was that with "limited housekeeping" they did not check toilet paper and replace it. This seemed to be strange and I wonder if we had called and requested if they would have supplied these necessities. My mother just bought replacements. The website lists a surcharge for wireless internet service. However, there was free internet access through a cable at the counter/bar area of the kitchen. This served our needs nicely and we thought this was a nice unexpected free service. The location was as good as any other we saw in the area. It was right behind the Nickelodian resort and easy to find after your first visit. The lobby area was nice and we enjoyed the free breakfast a few mornings. It was good quality food, but limited to starches (pastries and bagels), cereal and milk, and apples along with coffee and juice. My only suggestion would be to add filtered water - only water available was from the sink in the prep area. We were in building 6 which was a considerable walk (maybe 5 minutes) from the lobby - especially when you're trying to get everyone ready and out the door - so we only ate the free breakfast when we took the shuttle and were going to the lobby area anyways. I saw plenty of folks filling grocery bags with bagels and apples to take back to their rooms. We ended up buying cereal and milk and having that in our room most of the mornings to save time. I used the gym facilities a few times and while small it contained everything I needed for my workout including a few treadmills, free weights and yoga mats. It also had TV's available and towels. Filtered water was available here and I once I found that out I got my water for breakfast here - it's just down the hall. The pool itself was very nice. I wish the heat had been turned up since it was VERY cold when first entering. But we warmed up to it soon and had a blast! The hot tub was a little dirty in my opinion but much warmer then the pool (but not super hot). Tripadvisor was lacking any info on the free shuttle, so I kept our info sheet to post for posterity. Here is the info: - Reserve a shuttle and pick up a boarding pass from the guest services/ticket area in their "marketplace" at least 15 minutes prior to departure on the same day. This gives them the opportunity to try to sell you tickets which are actually a good rate (cheaper then gate prices when we checked into it). - Shuttles to Epcot depart at 9:20 am, 11:30 am, 1:20 pm. Then you have to use Disney's internal (free) transportation to the other parks. The free shuttle was "average" - a smaller bus that fit approx. 50 people. - Shuttle picks up right outside the lobby area - past the covered pull-through area - you have to be waiting and watching for it or it might not stop. They were mostly on time for the two days we used it. - Worldquest was their last stop so while you got a direct ride to the park, you also run the risk of having to stand or not being allowed boarding since it's full. We had an especially hard time taking a double stroller - there was just no room for it besides in the passenger seat at the front of the bus. The drivers were very nice but want to be tipped for their effort. One had the whole bus sing happy birthday to my 2-year-old on the way to the park which I thought was very nice - and of course he got a tip! - We found the free shuttle to be effective, however when taking the earliest available shuttle we still arrived in the parks one hour after opening - and anyone familiar with Disneyworld knows the first hour in the park is the most important since it's the least crowded. So most of the other days we just paid for parking to get full advantage of that extra hour. - Same for the return: you loose time in the park if you use the shuttle. Return from Epcot was 6:30 pm, 8:45 pm, and last shuttle was 10:30 pm. They made it clear that these were the DEPARTURE times and that if you weren't there on time they would leave without you. Since the Magic Kingdom closed after 11 pm each night, if you took the shuttle you don't get to see the night-time parade, the fireworks and spend that extra time in the parks. And remember that it takes at least 30 minutes to get back to the Epcot area from the other parks, taking away more valuable time. - Good thing about the return trip: you're the first hotel dropped off = short trip back. Which is nice at the end of a long day. - Another disadvantage of the shuttle is that you can't come back to rest in the middle of the day when it's very crowded and your kids need a nap. No return to hotel until 6:30 pm and no departures to Disney in the afternoon/evening. - Would I use the free shuttle again? Probably not. Unless: I didn't care about getting there at gate opening, I didn't have a large stroller, I didn't want to return to my hotel for a nap in the afternoon, and I didn't mind returning before the evening festivities. My mom was happy to use the shuttle since all of this applied to her. It just wasn't for my little "disney-crazy" family. Overall I was happy with our stay. I just won't factor in the free shuttle or free breakfast when doing the cost comparison with other hotels. If it's still a good deal without that stuff then I'd stay here again in an instant!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: ToneOslo_Norway
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest is a hidden gem, and it is the best place to stay. Its location is off the main road, but still so central you're in Disney in 8 minutes. Shops, malls, super markets - everything is around the corner. Still - it is a tranquil island in the middle of the hectic frenzy that is Orlando. The flats are so spacious and equipped with everything you need and even more. And everything is of the best standard. The staff are super friendly and welcoming, we have stayed at other places in Orlando and know a friendly face when we see one. The offered breakfast is what you need to start the day, or you can use it as a complement to what you have in your fridge in the flat. The shop offers you first aid if running out of something. The pool area is huge, and the water in the pool is great. Not even when the resort was close to fully booked did we notice any stress or hectic, the area surrounding the buildings is so huge you do not have to feel disturbed by anyone else. But you always have the pool bare if you would like someone to talk to :-) We will be back next year with an even larger group - can hardly wait!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort, Friendly Staff, Clean Rooms, Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: paulyd52
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th or 6th time that we had stayed at this resort. The receptionist Jackie was very accomidating to ensure that the room that we had requested stayed available upon our check-in. We went to go to Disney for the weekend. We had 4 adults and 2 children (age 8). The kids wanted to leave Disney to go back to the resort to play in their pool. We love this place. They have a lite breakfast in the morning (fruit, cereal,bagels,muffins,pastries,coffee &juice). The pool was very clean. The jacuzzi was nice and hot. We had an excellent stay and I know you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Great Location, Spacious, but fix the beds!”
Reviews.Author: pnw_traveler_10
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest Orlando Resort is a vast improvement over your typical resort hotel. Offering 2 and 3 bedroom apartments which are much more like renting a furnished condo than a hotel room. The facility is great: centrally located, secure and well-kept. Our kids loved the huge pool, and we stayed within our vacation budget by eating some meals at home... a task made simple by the well-equipped kitchen including full size fridge and dishwasher! The only drawback was the beds, and the bed linens. The mattresses were well-worn, more than a little saggy, and made-up with worn-out fitted sheets that wouldn't stay in place. The result was that every morning you would find the sheets pulled off at the corners, revealing some nasty stains on the mattress beneath. Yuck! All in all, the good still outweighed the bad, and I'd stay here again. I'd just ask for a room with newer beds and bedding next time!

Reviews.Title: “Fourt Stay at WorldQuest”
Reviews.Author: smack25
Reviews.Content: Wife and I and our 3 year old and 1 year old stayed once again at this great resort just a few miles outside of Disney. We were able to get an early check in and when we entered the room it was once again spotless and the crib we requested was already set up. The staff is great and the ammenities are excellent. Love hitting the pool after a 6-7 hour trip at the parks with little ones. Great place to stay with family due to the location, room sizes, pool and continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Single-Party ; Sleep Deprived”
Reviews.Author: SpectacularV
Reviews.Content: We are annual pass holders for Disney so we visit Orlando 6 times a year. World Quest is tucked away a quarter mile behind Nickelodean Hotels and it proximity to Disney is Superb! The two bedroom condo was clean, had plenty of room and all the amenities of home. The hotel staff were great and very nice. The pool was gorgeous but not close to us. We were in buikding 5 and it is almost a quarter mile from the pool. They have a nice complimentary breakfast that consist of toast bagels, and pastries. Grounds were emaculate and well kept. The resort is really not for foot traffic so you will need a car if you need to get to the store for anything, other than snacks. The resort is great for singles who like to party and do not need to sleep. The walls are paper thin and we could hear every door open and close above, below, and two rooms down from us. We could clearly here the couple next to us performing through the walls. In addition the resort sit parallel to the 417 highway so we could hear cars all night long; I advise to request a room for the other side of the resort so that you could eliminate the highway noise. There is a $13.00 resort fee and taxes per day. The beds are not for those that need halfway firm mattress to support their back; I way 160 lbs and I sunk into the bed. We booked the AAA offseason rate at $107 per night but it runs above the $170 mark at peak. AAA members were given a nice goody bag. If you are single and can deal with the nightly noise this is your place. If you have a 3 year old that naps during noon and sleeps at night you should strongly consider other options. We will not be back despite the number of nice things we mentioned, even at $50 a night because of the paper thin walls and ceilings; We like it quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort !”
Reviews.Author: MonctonAcadien
Reviews.Content: Great resort ,The resort had a pool and a bar , They had a continental breakfest . The room was BIG ! we had three bedrooms , large ktichen , big balcony , big living room and two bathrooms ! This resort is about 10 min. to Walt Disney World, there was also a shuttle to Walt Disney World . The grounds at the resort are beautiful , I highly recommend this resort to family's !

Reviews.Title: “Consider other resorts in the location!”
Reviews.Author: Sunnydk
Reviews.Content: The property we stayed in (a 3 bed unit) was dated; the kitchen equipment was totally inadequate. The air-conditioning was not working (fixed on the 4th day of our stay). There were seven burnt light bulbs, which made to apartment feel dark most of the time. Light is a real issue in these apartments, with very little natural day light on one side as well as inadequately serviced lighting. Access to the apartments is from lobbies that are open to the elements. Two of the bedrooms windows look onto this area, which because it is set back is very dark - you also have to keep the blinds shut all the time because of privacy. Furthermore, there was a constant level of noise that emanated from the traffic from the highway. The security is clearly non existence as anyone can drive into the complex - during our two weeks stay I only was only stopped asked for resident information. Because of this, you constantly see various people wondering around the lobbies posting flyers for the numerous pizza take away companies. The pool is well kept and there was plenty of sun beds, however the water is not heated. For the third week of our vacation, we decided to change accommodation and found an apartment in a much better resort that cost less and was truly superior in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort, convenient location... We stay here every time!”
Reviews.Author: AliDawn713
Reviews.Content: My family and I absolutely LOVE WorldQuest Resort! We have stayed here our last three trips to Orlando. It's a beautiful resort that is only one mile from the main gate of Disney World and within ten minutes of Sea World and Universal Studios (both are a straight shot up I-4 from the resort). It's all two and three-bedroom condos with everything you need to feel at home. The beds are incredibly comfortable, there's a t.v. in each bedroom (as well as in the living room), you have a full kitchen with everything from cookware to eating utensils; this really saves money on food because it gets expensive eating at restaurants and theme parks every day, when there is a Wal-Mart less than five minutes away and you can get a few groceries and make your own food. There is also a large screened-in balcony with a full-size table and chairs offering a great view (of either the pool, the lake or the pond; I prefer the pond view from Building 5 because we have seen all manner of wildlife in there, including alligators and countless bird species). The service is great. We had a problem on our first morning with bugs getting in through a rip in the screen on the balcony, but someone was sent up to spray the bugs and fix the screen and it didn't happen again. At the front desk they will try to accomodate room requests (we've always been able to get the building we wanted). During our most recent stay we hated the room we got because it was on the first floor and there were several air conditioning units beside the patio and the master bedroom window. It was very noisy and we asked if we could get a different room, the front desk said it was no problem and got us the best room we've had so far! Try to avoid getting a first floor room if you can as there are air conditioning units lined up along the patios that will block your view and be very noisy. There aren't a lot of recreational activities at this resort, but what they do have is great. They have a fitness center, a large pool and a large hot tub. The pool only goes to five feet deep, which is perfect for me. I don't mind them not having anything else because we spend most of our time out and about in theme parks and such, not at the resort. My only real complaints are about the poolside Tiki Bar and the towel service. The Tiki Bar makes fantastic drinks, but they aren't ever open as late as they say they will be. It's supposed to close at 9:00 PM, but it usually closes before 8:00 PM. I personally think it shouldn't close until 11:00 PM, which is when the pool closes. As for the towel service, they charge you $5.00 a day plus tax to pick up your dirty towels and bring you fresh ones, otherwise you have to wash them yourself (each suite has a washer/dryer combo). I really think this service should be complimentary. I don't have anything really bad to say about this resort at all. The rates are VERY reasonable for the amount of space and amenities you get, and you actually get a great discount if you book online 60 days or more in advance. If you are looking for something more than just a standard, cramped hotel room, you definitely need to give WorldQuest Resort a try!

Reviews.Title: “As Comfortable as Home”
Reviews.Author: FunInTheSun042
Reviews.Content: I was torn between staying on Disney property and World Quest, but chose World Quest. because of all the extra amenties they offer, The condos are very spacious and modern. My favorite "extras" included the romantic swans on the bed in the master bedroom (designed with towels), a full kitchen, washer/dryer, jacuzzi garden tub in master bath, extra bedroom space to allow for privacy , and 2 bathrooms. We paid the same price for the condo as we would have paid for the value resort inside Disney. It was very much worth the short drive into Disney. Staff was very friendly and courteous and the pool is amazing. I will tell all my friends about this place!

Reviews.Title: “"It wasn't too good to be true!"”
Reviews.Author: roslinridge
Reviews.Content: When making the booking, and given the excellent price we received, i was a bit worried that it was too good to be true. Upon arrival, we had one moment's worry when our booking couldn't be found, however, it was soon determined to be a simple clerical error. Our room suite was spacious, clean, and perfect for us. We had a beautiful view of the pool area, which our teens made excellent use of, including the hot tub. The breakfast was just fine to get us started on our day, and the resort property location was excellent. The overall physical property is lovely, and despite somewhat unseasonally cool weather, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay--we would definitely go back...I hope with the same deal!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsiderate neighbors, no help from staff”
Reviews.Author: MaineShores
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased overall on this condo. Clean, attractive and roomy. Then we tried to sleep. 10:30 at night children were stomping and bouncing balls in the unit above, this continued even after repeated complaints were made to the management. each time, after the family above was notified, the noise escalated to a point where it was unbearable. By the 3rd night (after it took 10 minutes for the desk to answer the phone, a definate safety issues since 911 doesn't work on the phone system) the pounding, bouncing balls and stomping was intolerable. Finally at 2:30 a.m. the family was finally moved to another unit. Discussion with the the "manager" indicated that he was not aware of any issue. I guess the night staff nor security go not keep an event log. The management in complete denial of the issue attempted to rectify the problem by reimbursing 1 night of our stay. small consideration for a sleep deprived vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel...loved it!”
Reviews.Author: capecodmom55
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week in Orlando - Dad, Mom, 15-year-old son and 10-year-old daughter. We travel a couple of times a year and WorldQuest is the nicest place we have stayed. The unit was spotlessly clean, well supplied, convenient to EVERYTHING, and surprisingly reasonable priced. I would strongly recommend it to anyone. The service was outstanding...we messed-up the room safe and there was someone there within 5 minutes. Stay at WorldQuest...you'll be so glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET IN FLORIDA - LOVED OUR STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: TMBrad
Reviews.Content: Just visited World Quest Resort Orlando the week of April 16th - April 21st 2010. 2 words to describe our stay... LOVED IT!!! We met 2 other couples with kids and all I can say is, it was everything we had hoped for and more. The Condo unit was very clean and modern. The grounds of the resort were well kept and maticulously landscaped. The pool was very nice and the kids loved it. The location of World Quest was so convenient, just minutes away from Everything. We went to the local Wal-Mart just minutes around the corner and stocked up on breakfast food, snacks and drinks. The resort supplied a Continental Breakfast but we opted to do breakfast on our own, which consisted of bagels and cereal. All the appliances in our unit were modern and up to date. The dishes in the cabinet were very clean. We felt right at home at World Quest in Orlando. We hope Management will continue it's up keep of the property. We hope to be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, very spacious and "warm"”
Reviews.Author: RobinWelch
Reviews.Content: We stayed a full week with our 4 children. We had so much room...it was great. But I would not recommend it for more than 7 people. The place is very beautiful! We had a great room overlooking the pool!.. Our room had everything we needed including a kitchen full of utensils, appliances, plates and cups, etc. Also, the staff was very friendly and accommodating. Once we had a problem with our dryer and the service man was there within an hour. It was also great that it was only a 5 minute drive to the entrance to the parks of Disney. I think it may be closer than some "Disney" hotels. Breakfast was perfect for our crew (they had danishes, apples, oranges, juices, milk, coffee, hot chocolate, bagels, 2 types of cereal..which was all we needed). When you eat all that junk in Disney it is nice to have a simple "free" meal in the morning :). The pool is very large!! And heated! The Tiki bar is great too. Happy hour is 4-7 everyday. And they do have towels at the pool so leave yours at home. If you want your room cleaned it is $39 for a full clean, $15 for towels, bed making and dishwasher and $5 for just towels. We just brought some detergent and did a couple loads of towels and opted out the fee....saved us some money. We would love to stay again next time. We loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, highly recommanded”
Reviews.Author: NoamA
