Reviews.Content: We stayed there with our 3 children (4,9,12) any my in-laws. The hotel is located 5 min drive from the entrance to Disney . Rooms are nice and big. Breakfast is simple but good. Price is great. The only remark is that the rooms do not have a wifi connection. Next time will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: disneyworld2010
Reviews.Content: World Quest Resorts was a very nice and spacious place to stay. The staff there was very friendly and helpful. The rooms were nicely decorated and had a warm comfy home feeling. The kids enjoyed the very large pool. I would recommend this palce and we WILL go back.

Reviews.Title: “A great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: paynerob
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 2 bedroom unit but were upgraded (no cost) to a 3 bedroom unit.. The units are large - 1400 su ft, and immaculate. Very near EVERYTHING. I don't think they offered shuttles to theme parks but we didn't care. Beautiful pool area which we didn't use because of cool weather- next year for sure. Only downside was the limited space and limited menu for the free breakfast, but we resorted to loading up plates and taking food and drink back to our full luxury kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Look forward to our stay at Worldquest”
Reviews.Author: snowbirdsChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: This is our third stay and find this resort to be the best. First for value and then for peacefulness. We like the location also. The rooms are so quiet and clean. Would recommend this to all and have done so in the past. Kudos to a great resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, peaceful, lovely!”
Reviews.Author: MarshallOhio
Reviews.Content: Our unit was spacious, clean, and well equipped. We had a screened balcony with a beautiful view of the landscaped pool. After taking four kids to the Disney parks, we really appreciated returning to this peaceful resort. It is also, by far, the best deal we have ever had in the Orlando area without compromising quality. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kavedas
Reviews.Content: I stayed there last summer with my family , booked the 3bedroom condo . it was HUGE and very comfortable . the master bathroom was very BIG , i never saw a big bathroom like this one . the staff was very helpful , the breakfast was delicious . The location was good . very close to Disney , but no restaurant or shops in Walking distance (that was the only negative) so you definitely need a car .... I will stay there again , i recommend this hotel for big group/Family ... more than 4 Adults

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever. Room was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bmw95
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at world quest. Wouldn't change a thing! The service, room, and pool were excellent! Thank you for an amazing experience.

Reviews.Title: “A very romantic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aimerlesoleil
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the World Quest in October of 2009, and I am happy to say that we are going back some time this year. The spacious rooms are beautiful, very comfortable, and oh so cozy! We enjoyed their breakfast on the balcony in the morning, and took advantage of the very warm evenings to use their magnificent pool. The staff was great, even helping me out with my broken luggage! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: MDHU
Reviews.Content: We´ve stayed in this hotel for our vacation and it was awesome. The staff was very friendly and helpful, the room was huge and extremely comfortable. I´d highly recommend this hotel for families that travel with kids.

Reviews.Title: “The only reason we would stay elsewhere is if the WorldQuest is booked”
Reviews.Author: tmh2599
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the WorldQuest resort several times over the past several years. When we arrived this time, I was greated by name at check in and was handed my paperwork, eventhough it had been 6 or 9 months since or last stay. Great value and Class A accomodations will keep us coming back, with a free breakfast to boot.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of positives, but also some negatives.”
Reviews.Author: PuckyHuddle
Reviews.Content: I'll not go into all the details already covered in other reviews. Here are some points to consider before planning your stay. First, the positives. This property is a great value for the money. The rooms are attractive, up-to-date, spotless and roomy. The location is ideal for Disney and Sea World. The staff were extremely pleasant. It's obvious that this place is doing all the right things (or trying) to keep your business. Now the negatives. The place is noisy. It's a function of location, design and customer base. Location. The hotel is comprised of 4 - 5 buildings. Buildings 2 - 4 border a noisy highway (about 100 yards away). If you are above the 1st floor, you will hear the traffic. This may be a problem for some. Design. The main living space flooring is tile. Great for cleaning, poor for sound. The dining furniture is wrought iron. The two elements together make for a lot of noise above. We had to switch our room since our upstairs neighbors were up at 5am. Customer Base. The majority of people there are going to the parks. This means everybody is up at 6:30 am and out the door at 8 am. There are about 8 units per floor, 5 floors total. That's a lot of people. Our family are the light sleepers that like to get up after 8am. So it was not the ideal spot for us. Also the pool claims to be heated, but was too cold to use. It's obvious when there's only 3 people in a huge pool, all under the age of 10. The hot tub was nice though. All in all, we probably won't be back. With young kids, sleep is key to a successful vacation. After the 1st night, we upgraded to a 3 bdr on the top floor of a less crowded building. Had that option not been available, we would have had a miserable time. One other point. The front desk was very clear about cleaning charges and upon check in offered a menu of 5 options and their costs (from $0 to $39). I was asked to initial my choice. They are not trying to get one by you.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded High Expectations”
Reviews.Author: TripMoreStressLess
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. Our family of four booked a 3 bedroom, 3 bath condo for our 1-week stay in Orlando, and couldn't believe how clean and amazing the space was. We needed separate bedrooms for the kids' different nap times...the room was around 1400 square feet and spotless. The pool was heated, though it was too cold outside for us to partake. Spotless grounds...Tile floors, granite countertops, full kitchen, awesome view... Ask to stay in the newer buildings, and ask for a view. Screened in balcony, and MINUTES from Disney!! We will definitely stay here again...got an awesome package deal through Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: PeskyMom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WQR for three nights. The staff is excellent. There were a few issues that came up, but as soon as we called, the problems were resolved. We had a 3BR condo, and the rooms were spacious. It was nice having a bedroom for everyone, and having a TV in each room. We were not here long enough to take advantage of the pool. We were here during President's week and it was very crowded. As others have said, the breakfast area is small, but we took our coffee and bagels/pastry back to our room so it wasn't a problem for us. The location to the parks is excellent. We also did not have problems with noise from the highway as others have mentioned, even though our unit was close to the highway. I would recommend this resort for extended families and or friends traveling together and wanting more space than a hotel room at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Home from Home”
Reviews.Author: bullyboyaby
Reviews.Content: Getting ready to depart for home after another months stay at this fabulous resort complex. Stayed last Oct/Nov 2009 for a month and liked it so much we came back again. The apartment has every single amenity you could need.Just bring washing powder and you are all set to go. A Walmart superstore is very local for food clothing etc etc. We bought a phone with 300 minutes time for calling home and on the road for 30 dollars. Unfortunately the weather was against us on this trip and we didnt get to use the heated swimming pool at the complex. We found the cost of the stay at Worldquest highly competative and the booking process a breeze with no hidden extras. Being a regular visitor to Orlando we will definately be booking again. The location is ideal for all the parks and major roads. Now back to freezing England.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest option for family in Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: Vezich
Reviews.Content: Traveling with two young children, we wanted something spacious, comfy, close to the theme parks, with the ability to have normal meals, do laundry, and all of that at a decent price. After looking at user comments from TripAdvisor, we decided to go for this resort. Staying 10 nights at the World Quest was the best decision of our 3-week trip. We had a huge three-bedroom, two-bath apartment, fully furnished, full kitchen including dishwasher, four TVs, wireless Internet. Like at home, but much better. I read many comments regarding the housekeeping topic. It's like being at home, but someone comes in to take out the trash every day. If you want hotel-type service, there is an extra fee, but we got by without that for 10 days (there is a vacuum in the room, should you need it). The place really is resort-like, with 5 or 6 building units and a huge pool. We were in building #3. If you are in buildings 4 and up, it's a bit of a long walk to get to the gorgeous pool, or to the club house where the continental breakfast is being served every morning. To get to all the Disney parks, we were in the middle of the summer, expecting a bit of traffic, yet it takes about 10 minutes to get to any of the parks. Should you need anything when you're there, there's a Wal-mart supercentre less than 10 miles away from there. The surroundings are gorgeous, the pool is fantastic. It is shallow, so great for kids starting to swim (between 3 and 4 feet deep). There was never an issue to find free long chairs next to the pool. I am not sure I quite understood the opening hours for the Tiki bar, but I didn't know there were so many different types of Martinis... Getting there is very simple, although I missed the road a couple of times, as it is not obvious - and a few street names are somehow very similar. No big neon sign, just a quiet gated resort on a small road. Just find the Nickelodeon hotel, and you're almost there. Something like half a mile from World Drive, which takes you right into Disney. Overall one of the best places I ever stayed at, and I will definitely stay there again the next time we treat ourselves to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest Resort = Excellence!”
Reviews.Author: NCNCPatty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, plus two adult children with spouse and friend (six adults) spent Christmas week at World Quest Resort. We found the 3 BR condo to be spacious, beautifully appointed, comfortable, elegant and satisfactory in every way. The grounds and staff were splendid as well. The location, while wonderful in its closeness to theme parks, restaurants, and shopping, was quiet and serene. We loved everything about World Quest, and hope to stay there again soon. I would give World Quest the absolute highest recommendation to anyone who wants truly superior accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Not satisfied with cleaniness and fees!”
Reviews.Author: disneygirl_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort many times in the past, but this time we were told there would be a $39.00 room fee added! After checking into the room, we found ants covering the kitchen counters and microwave. Needless to say, I demanded the room cleaning fee be removed from my bill as the room was not even clean upon check in. We will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but excessive fees.”
Reviews.Author: dsb66
Reviews.Content: The resort itself was convenient to Disney and very quiet when we were there. However, for a resort with very few amenities (pool not heated, no real restaurant on site (just a Tiki bar), poor selection at onsite 24 hr "market"... no beer, no milk), the resort fee seemed excessive. There are plenty of other properties in the area that are similar without the excessive fees. Especially ridiculous was the cleaning fee. It was $39 for a short stay (3 nights or less I believe) and it was truly unnecessary. It made me want to leave more for them to clean up just because I was annoyed at the charge. Staff was fine, but not particularly friendly. I shared an elevator with some of them and they ignored me and continued to talk to one another. Not a big deal, but definitely shows you the difference between this and the more upscale places.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best deal”
Reviews.Author: onecoolmomof4
Reviews.Content: Last year we stayed here for about $70.00 less. They've since added on a $39.00 cleaning fee and additional fees which puts them close to the $200 per night room rate. You can find better deals closer to the parks for this price. Also, sorely disappointed in the selection for breakfast. Very bleak. Again, would choose something closer and other hotels offer a full breakfast spread included.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location,Nice Price”
Reviews.Author: Jogger2852
Reviews.Content: Very nice location to Disney, nice rooms and good rate.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE!”
Reviews.Author: snyderman
Reviews.Content: Stayed there over Christmas and must agree with all the other reviews. This place is great! Quiet, clean and comfortable. Never got to use the pool because of the coldish temperature but it sure looked nice. Agree with the comments about breakfast, not only was it very busy over Christmas it was not the least interesting. Was good for grabbing a bagel and going back to your room. We also bought food, there's a Wal-Mart just down the road and made a good breakfast before we headed out. Very central location and it is really up the road to the gates of Disney and Downtown Disney where we spent most evenings. (We laughed at the size of the Nickelodeon resort just up the road thinking how glad we were not there as it did not look very peaceful) One other point. I thought the master bed at least in my room was very cheap and not at all comfortable... also the DVD player in the room didn't. If that's all I have to complain about I'd say we definitely got our money's worth. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: soarin86
Reviews.Content: Our stay at World Quest was excellent! It exceeded our expectations! We stayed in a 3 bedroom 3 bath condo. It was spacious, clean, and beautiful. Decor was updated and we had a great view of the nature reserve and pool. We could not get the coffee maker to work so we called the front desk and they sent a brand new one right up. We were in building 4 which was a short walk to the clubhouse and bus stop. We walked to the clubhouse daily for breakfast (muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, juices, coffee). You can also buy your park ticket there. We had no trouble with the bus. It was only a few minutes late on a few days. It really beat having to drive to the parks. The only negative about riding the bus is that we could not stay for the fireworks at each park because the last bus to the resort left at 10:30. All staff members we encountered were very polite and friendly. We enjoyed coming back to relax each night after a long day at the parks. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!”
Reviews.Author: LeslieW2
Reviews.Content: 3 bedroom condo. Perfect for all of us. Room to spread out.

Reviews.Title: “It Turned Out OK”
Reviews.Author: burnettld
Reviews.Content: When I first arrived I was amazed. We entered through a security gate which makes you feel like royalty. I got a 3bedroom for the same price as a 2bedroom. It was so spacious and I hate I forgot to mention I was suppose to have the birthday special when I booked room so it was a minor problem with my lenght of stay. I still would consider coming back. I wanted to take my jacuzzi home :) I would love to invest in one also. If your not hooked on HBO, your tv watchig will be fine. Another good thing, if your traveling with children, the master is on the other side of room so your away from any noise they might make :) Great Hotel, just make sure if you cancel its within the 72 hr timeframe or you will be charged a fine 2 days later. I would add my pics but trust me the place looks gorgeouse, more than the pics on the website :)

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME place”
Reviews.Author: peacefulvalley
Reviews.Content: After our very unpleasant experience with DOLLAR RENT A CAR in the MCO airport it was like heaven to get to the world quest resort...it was better than expected very clean,frendly and gorgous! if we ever get to orlando again we wll for sure stay there....

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and spacious accommodations...Excellent Value!”
Reviews.Author: CdnGal2009
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the World Quest Resort and it was great! Very spacious, clean accommodations (4 adults + 1 infant stayed in the 3 bed/2 bath suite). The room had everything you need and then some! Loved having optional housekeeping - as it really wasn't necessary on a daily basis (each day they do come and pick up trash). Large, beautiful pool area that was never occupied by more than a couple people. Staff were friendly. The location is great (provided you have access to a car) - close to Disney and shopping. Only downfalls were that the continental breakfast was very basic...plain bagels, fruit, coffee, tea and juice and the mattresses aren't very comfortable. Also - there weren't any options for dining on site. There is a 24 hour store on site that had a limited selection of frozen entrees, convenience items and toiletries. However, we had ordered in delicious pizza from a family owned pizzeria called Giarno's (or something like that sounds like that). We had a reservation at a Disney resort on day 4 of our vacation and were truly disappointed to leave the World Quest. Overall - this resort provided great value and we'll definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: ebonyheart
Reviews.Content: My family and I were very satisfied with our stay at World Quest. The room was very clean and spacious. The pool was very nice. Very close to parks. We highly recommed staying at World Quest and will definitely come and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: qtraveler99
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to the World Quest Hotel and my stay was great. The staff were friendly and accomodating and the rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is in a great location, although it is a little difficult to find, especially at night. I typically don't use the hotel amenities, but there is a nice pool area and a small fitness room. All in all, it was a great value for a nice stay, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice-but a Few Negatives”
Reviews.Author: weatherman70
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a couple of other times in past few years. They recentlt added this bogus $39 "Housecleaning Fee" and a $12 per day "Resort Fee". Sorry, but that is total BS in my opinion! If a hotel wants to charge more for a room- just raise the rates!! Don't surprise a guest with these bogus fees when they check in exhausted after a day in Disney! It's not right! The property is ideally located to get to disney in a hurry. The rooms are woefully under-soundproofed!. You can hear the highway noise, and every little noise from adjoining rooms. The other night when we stayed there- it was breezy. We were kept up by a rumbling sound on and off all night. Its sounded like a jackhammer. It turns out it was the wind vibrating the gutters that drain rainwater off the roof. When I was at the front desk the next morning, another guest was complaining about the same thing.The bedroom and bathroom doors all squeaked and would wake family members if someone had to go to the bathroom at night or woke early and tried to leave a bedroom. I don't care for these bogus add-on fees but my biggest gripe is the poor soundproofing there.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Secret.....Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Karin64_9
Reviews.Content: Enough space for family with five kids ranging from 10 - 24. They were able to accomodate our request of early check in and ground floor room. We walked in and were really impressed. we got a room with a pool view & right around the corner from entry to the pool. my younger kids stayed in the pool (morning & night) when we werent out at disney or universal. With Wal-mart right around the corner you cant go wrong, groceries, laundrysoap, forgotten bathing suits, & $12 disney brand disney T-shirts. I agree with other reviews that its nice to come to a nice quiet place after the parks This is truly a great place to stay. I hate to have to leave.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem --- and hopefully it will stay that way.”
Reviews.Author: MCASPETH
Reviews.Content: Yes, as other reviewers have mentioned it is hard to find but also hard to forget as we have just returned from our second stay and would definitely go back. It is off the main drag and is therefore quiet and very relaxing but ridiculously close to Disney without Disney prices!!! The reception staff were very helpful and the properties are well equipped and maintained. Minor criticism of the newer blocks concerns lack of lighting in the bedrooms and inability to swivel the flat screen TV in the living room. If you want to watch any TV you need to sit at the dining table. Small points but could so easily be rectified and enhance the visitor's experience. Full housekeeping service is very good but debatable if worth the amount charged at $39 per day! Still all in all a great place to unwind away from the hustle and bustle of ID. After visiting Orlando/disney for the last 25 years this is the one place I would go back to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Warning about short stays”
Reviews.Author: RXVoyager
Reviews.Content: Overall my experience with the resort was very good. The 2 bedroom suite was beautiful, large, and clean. We did have trouble getting the dvd player to work. I imagine they would have sent someone, but we didn't call about it since ours was a short trip. On that note, please be aware that you will be charged $41.54 ($39+$2.54 tax) for end of stay housekeeping if you stay for 1-3 nights. I did not see this fee mentioned on Hotels.com when I booked. I imagine it is buried in there somewhere, but it certainly wasn't mentioned anywhere that I read while researching the property. It was quite a surprise at check-in. Overall, between the taxes and fees added when I booked and the housekeeping fee the room cost 176% of the original price listed on the booking website... so it wasn't the great deal I thought I was getting. My family goes to Orlando about once a month for a quick weekend get away. Now that I know about the house keeping fee I won't be using World Quest for my short weekend trips. I will still keep it at the top of my list for longer family vacations.

Reviews.Title: “We live in Tampa and are looking for a place to stay for weekend getaways and found the WorldQuest to be a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: donnaearnhardt
Reviews.Content: I searched online and happened to come across the WorldQuest on Tripadvisor. My husband and I like to get away for weekends periodically and stay in nice places. We live a short distance away from Disneyworld in Tampa and enjoy getting in our vehicle and driving over. Since the economy took such a plunge, we don't hop on a plane to the Bahamas as much as we did in prior years. I recommend the Worldquest to the max. There's a selfish part of me that hopes people don't find it but know how happy I would feel if someone stayed there because of my review. Super place, great prices & terrific location. One other note, I found TripAdvisor to be the best place to find hotels & other travel information. I always go to TA for planning a trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, good rates, great location.”
Reviews.Author: btpaulk72
Reviews.Content: We were traveling with in-laws and child so we needed 3 bedrooms. This place was just what we needed. The shuttle service to Disney could have been a little more frequent, but other than that no complaints. Staff we interacted with was very nice and knowledgable.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice”
Reviews.Author: kirbytravel
Reviews.Content: I recommend WorldQuest Resort to everyone. The rooms are large, beautiful and clean. Don't hesitate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spacious and comfortable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: holsdude
Reviews.Content: We visited Orlando from the UK and stayed in one of the 2-bedroom condo units. Very impressed with the space and quality of the accommodation and would highly recommend this resort to future travellers. It cost less than a room in some of the Disney resort hotels and we had loads more space and facilities. The unit had a spacious sitting / dining / kitchen area, a master bedroom with a big en-suite and a twin room with en-suite. Also a balcony, washer and dryer and dishwasher is available. Unit had AC and fans. Main bathrooms had a jacuzzi bath + 2 sinks + shower. Twin en-suite had a bath over shower. Lots of hot water available. Kitchen was well equipped and had frige, freezer, oven, hob. Small quantities of coffee, washing up liquid/sponge and dishwasher crystals were provided. Breakfast was included - our condo was some way from the clubhouse so was a short drive or long walk. It was a limited spread but tasty and plenty of juice and coffee available. Free wi-fi internet access was available around the main clubhouse but not in our condo. Swimming pool - we tended to use it late in the evening having been out in the parks in the day and had the pool virtually to ourselves. Swim towels are provided. Coming from UK it was a fun to be swimming outdoors and being warm! Location - Convenient to get to from Orlando airport - under 30 mins. Close to I-4 and hence convenient for all the major theme parks. Road did not show up on GPS system we hired so we used a near road (Satay Drive) to locate.

Reviews.Title: “Closer to Disney than Disney's own hotel properties”
Reviews.Author: wearehavingfun
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the size of the room, cleanliness, and tasteful decor. We would love to come back to this property if it remains priced right. We were thrilled with the ease of access in and out of this resort to get to the theme parks...just make sure you know where you are going (read road signs carefully) since it is very easy to take wrong roads to get back to the resort from the parks. We have stayed at MANY Disney properties and we could not believe how much faster we got to main area of theme parks in comparison. We had a full working kitchen which helped us a lot since we brought in some groceries, even though they do offer a continental breakfast. Minimum stuff you see normally at some other hotels, but very nice. Staff is friendly and helpful! This is nicely tucked away, but in the middle of it all which was a big plus for us. We are Florida residents and travel to this area a lot and we will look forward to our next stay at World Quest Resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Good family alternative to Disney properties”
Reviews.Author: MNLefty
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the World Quest Resort in Orlando for a weekend in mid-October. Chose this property based on price, location, and the fact that we could fit our family of 5 in one room. Property is convenient to attractions -- we drove our car, but I think there is some shuttle service available. The property is a complex of 5 buildings with privately-owned condos that are rented like a hotel. There is a condo sales center in the lobby, but no sales pitch whatsoever. Center courtyard has a very nice pool with hot tub. Continental breakfast served daily, small workout facility and 24-hour mini convenience store int he hotel lobby. The property is new, and well kept. Rooms were very spacious -- we had a 2-bedroom suite with king and en-suite bath in the master, a second bedroom with 2 twin beds and another bathroom. Pullout queen couch in living room. Full kitchen, and laundry facilities in the condo. One unique thing about this property is that they offer you a choice of housekeeping options -- no service, towel service only, light cleaning, or full cleaning -- all at different rates. My only complaint is traffic noise. The property backs up to a highway, and it can be a bit noisy. We kept the air conditioner fan on all night, and that helped a little. But if you are a very light sleeper. it could be a problem for you. Building 1 is by far the quietest because it is across the courtyard from the highway.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: stephenpope
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the World Quest resort. It was everything we were hoping it would be. Very clean rooms and the property was beautiful. We stayed in the 3 bedroom condo and we had plenty of room. Our teens loved this place as well Location was great, not far from everything but it seemed secluded and peaceful. Looking forward to staying at this great place again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the family...close to Disney”
Reviews.Author: welovehotrods
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here 10/6-10/13 and it was wonderful. The 3 bedroom condo was spacious and clean. The staff was very nice. We were able to check in a few minutes before 4pm. *the master bedroom was by the poolside and even though the pool is open until 11 pm we didn't really hear anything. *we just had towel service for the week. we're neat people and at the end of the week the condo was still clean; 15-30 dollars a day for up keep a little much. *if you have young children you may want to rent a car as the shuttle to Disney only runs a few times a day. with a 1 yr and 4 yr old we still have nap times. *it isn't that difficult to find and some people complained about. (it is the last left before you hit Disney World...as we learned the first day :) ) *Breakfast is your typical continental breakfast. * the port a cribs aren't to bad...sturdy but a little small for a 1 yr old.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! We were very pleased with the Resort.”
Reviews.Author: SeashoreNL
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to FLorida, we travelled with our Daughter and her Family who have stayed to a number of different resorts during their vacations. We were very pleased that they picked WorldQuest for our vacation. We were extremely pleased with our space. It was definitely a memorable part of our vacation. We are already planning for next September, and will definitely be staying at WorldQuest! Keep up the good work....

Reviews.Title: “The Best by far,you just can't beat it!”
Reviews.Author: gbisbb
Reviews.Content: I am a traveller from the UK and this is the 6th time I have stayed here. It really is a gem and certainly worth the money, a cheaper hotel would certainly take the gloss off the holiday. Easy parking, some of the best people at all levels, nothing is to much trouble. If you have a problem with anything in the room the response is immeadiate. The furnishings are of very high quality and the kitchen is very well equipped. So nice to come home to at the end of a long day enjoying yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the level of accommadations”
Reviews.Author: ac0997
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the three-bedroom condos and it was very spacious and open. We had 5 adults and all of us were able to have our own bedrooms. Only downside is that you have to pay 'extra' for the level of housekeeping you require: full service, light housekeeping or towel change only. Since we were there for onlye 3 days we opted out of housekeeping but by the 2nd day we requested light housekeeping. You don't have to decide ahead of time when you check in you can see how you use the room and let them know when you need housekeeping done. Also, we went during a time when it was low season in Orlando so it was a bargin for three bedroom, with complimentary breakfast every morning. The pool was very spacious and grounds were very pretty.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: ATLTown
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Worldquest three times (twice on business and once on vacation) and will not stay at any other hotel in Orlando. The resort is beautiful and has large rooms at an exceptional price. I have referred several people to WorldQuest and they also loved the resort.

Reviews.Title: “The ONLY place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: DesignGrrl
Reviews.Content: WorldQuest is the only place to stay, whether you travel to Orlando alone or with others. I stay here almost once a month for business travel, because for the price, you get so much more than other places that cost more. It's easy to get to - right off I-4 on the Epcot exit - and easy to get to just about anywhere in Orlando, too. Having a full kitchen with cooking supplies, screened porch, washer and dryer, internet and jacuzzi in each unit is such a luxury for what you pay. There is a fee for daily housekeeping, but with a washer and dryer, I don't find a need for it and opt out of it. You also get a free breakfast, and the pool area is beautiful. Also, they have started a special for spa services at a local resort down the street. And to top it off, the staff are extremely helpful! There isn't anything not to love about WorldQuest!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: jstatik
Reviews.Content: My wife and I took our niece and nephew to Dinsey World. We drove down from Mass. and were looking for a suite/condo setup so the kids could have their own room. Since we were on a budget, any setup like that in the parks was out of the question. We chose Worldquest based on price, location to the parks and the overall ratings from previous guests. From check-in to check-out, all the employees were great to deal with. Anytime we had a question, they answered it with a smile and most thanked us for staying there. The room was huge, the pictures on their site do not do any justice to the size of the rooms. Everything was clean, the floors, bathrooms, bedrooms and kitchen. The kitchen was fully stocked with anything and everything you would need to cook and feed your family. As a point of info for anybody who needs ice for their coolers on the way back home, the freezer has its own ice maker and makes alot in one night. I was able to fill my cooler with 2 nights worth of ice making. We never used the hot-tub in the master bedroom or the dishwasher, but everything else worked good. The kids had their own bedroom with bathroom which worked out really good for us. And they loved it too because they were able to play with their toys or video games right in their room while we were able to take care of packing, cooking or just getting ready for the parks. The washer and dryer were a great addition to the room, we were able to wash towels and our clothes before we left so we didnt have multiple suitcases of laundry when we got back home. We stayed in building one. The room was very quiet, we never heard any or our neighbors. It was a short walk, only a couple of minutes over to the clubhouse for breakfast in the morning. We were there at 6:30 most mornings and all the food was out and ready to be eaten. Not a big variety of food but it tasted good and we didnt have to pay a small fortune every morning eating at a restaurant or buying more food to make in the room. The pool as pretty big and always clean. Every morning I would see a worker at the pool cleaning it. We never went to the tiki bar, the fitness area or the variety store, so I cannot comment on that. One thing if you need a luggage carrier, ask for it when you check in, there seems to be only a few around for the entire property and had to wait a little while for one to show up before we could unload our truck at check-in. The location is very close to Disney. We stayed in Disney about 5 years ago at Corondo Springs and at Worldquest we were closer to some of the parks. Unlike one of the previous guests I was able to use my gps and bring me to the front door. But off of the main st to turn onto their property, there is no streetlight, so we would look for the Nickelodeon hotel and we knew to turn from there. With the exception of a couple minor problems that the staff was able to take care of quickly, we had no problems and would easily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Roomy Resort”
Reviews.Author: Treasureme
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful resort...much better than staying at a hotel. Suites were very roomy. We stayed in Orlando for a week. Half of the time spent here the other half was spent at Nickelodeon (right around the corner). Although my kids loved Nickelodeon, I missed the space we had at World Quest. Very close to Disney; however, having a car is convenient!

Reviews.Title: “Made the Disney World trip tolerable.”
Reviews.Author: baileyplane
Reviews.Content: My family and I really enjoyed our stay at this resort. I loved having a nice screened balcony for some quiet alone time early in the mornings. I'll never stay in another resort hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you don't mind sleeping on mattress instead of sheets.”
Reviews.Author: destinynidisguise
Reviews.Content: Lots of little discrepencies we would have overlooked if they lack of sleep hadn't pushed me over the edge. From start the receptionist area was well appointed, clean, and moderately friendly. Newer 5-story building was 3/4 mile away. There were no luggage carts.Trip from cart wasn't bad unless, like me you are handicapped. There was oatmeal? turned upside down on landing outside elevator. It was there the next day when left despite informing housekeeping during bringing in our luggage. No blenders (really wanted a frozen drink). Matter-of-fact staff; could stand to be warmer on phone. In person they were better but rang fake. Beautiful room and pool area, both were like diamonds- enlarged to show details... Neither were as grand as pics on website depict. In all fairness, it was a beautiful warm environment in the room and quite. The patio was too tiny and noisy from nearby highway. The masterbath was simply elegant! The beds are we ALL had an issue. In three separate bedrooms we had no idea that everyone else is fighting with the sheets literally "popping" off the bed. The ladies in the twins beds commented they were small and felt like they were in cocoons when the sheets popped off. In the Queen bed, the individual fought tirelessly to get one side to stay on so she could get some sleep- to no avail. In the master bedroom, the King-size bed had a rough scratchy mattress and not even prayer kept those sheets on fo rmore than fives minutes. When I spoke with the front desk the next morning (Sunday), I was informed there was nothing they could do as their manager didn't work on weekends. I was told I should have called them at one in the morning so they could have someone bring me new sheets: 1) Each of us believed we were the only one fighting the human enveloping sheet monster and 2) my idea of a weekend getaway does NOT include changing sheets sometime around 2 in the morning when they finally got someone to our room. Remind me, when are most people traveling? In Orlando where tourism is the number one source of income, a hotel doesn't see fit to have a manager on duty....huh. In the end I would have considered staying at World Quest Resort again due to it's relaxing poolside and the attractive room, but the bed issue was too much and the staff to NO RESPONSIBILITY for making a comfortable sleeping environment. Regardless of whether one spends $39 a night or $2000 a night for accomodations, the one thing they have in common is the people are expecting a place to sleep that includes sheets on the bed!.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret on planet earth.”
Reviews.Author: nat2010
Reviews.Content: This resort is gorgeous, totally exceeded our expectations. Our family consisted of my husband, our teenage daughter and my mother-in-law. We requested and received the 3 bedroom/3bathroom which allowed everyone to have their separate quarters. It was awesome! We were able to prepare some of our meals and relax as though we were at home. Again, this resort is the best kept secret ever, keep up the good work!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Facilities”
Reviews.Author: threeas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 25th wedding anniversary vacation at WorldQuest Resort. My original choice of lodging was completely based on proximity to Disney World. Once we arrived and found our lodging to be extremely wonderful. Our room was huge, clean, with a whirlpool tub, and close to the pool. The pool is large and very well maintained. We chose to have only our towels replaced every day. They were changed and one day the cleaning staff asked if we needed more towels (we went the ocean). The additional room charge is based on the type of daily room cleaning you desire. As far as proximity to Disney. Epcot is 5-6 minutes and Magic Kingdom is 10-12 minutes. Based on the price and location, unless you are staying on Disney Property on the Monorail, I can't understand why anyone would stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: FlordaMickeyfan
Reviews.Content: We are fans of Worldquest resort, and are now regular guests. From all of our travels to Orlando in the last six years, this is the best value we have seen.

Reviews.Title: “Just excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: g_livas
Reviews.Content: It was an excellent choice to spent the first half of our honeymoon at Worldquest. The room, which by the way is a three bedroom flat, was quite luxurius and very clean. Our bed was king-king size, and our bedroom bathroom was so comfortable!! The only thing, I spend a lot of time to find it, because Worldquest Blvd is not registered on the gps, so it is advisable to make sure you know the way to reach it. I personally used the address of Nickelodeon hotel which is opposite Worldquest Blvd. Overall though it's just EXCELLENT!!

Reviews.Title: “love it !”
Reviews.Author: julie770
Reviews.Content: only place we stay when we're in orlando. what a great discovery. close to everything yet feele like your in the country. refer family and friends to stay here when i hear they will be in orlando and they're always happy that i did. never have been disappointed with anything from check-in to check-out. the kids love the pool and having their own room with tv, my husband and i love the privacy and space. rooms are always very clean like walking into a brand new home. super friendly and accomadating staff, we love this place and will be back again and again

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful accomidations for a low price!”
Reviews.Author: cyndilouwho1969
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for a ladies only birthday celebration in Orlando. We were pleasantly surprised at how spacious and luxurious the suite was. Updated decor, plenty of room, full kitchen, I could live there. Price was unbeatable. I will definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Looks like Paradise but ends up to be a BIG RIP OFF Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: SteveKeren
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Worldquest for 4 nights at the end of August. Everything started great. I was travelling already for 10 days with my wife and 2 twin girls of 4.5 years. We had been in a very fancy and expensive hotel in Miami Beach and in a cruise, and had found the WORLDQUEST after long researches on the internet, because: 1) It had separated rooms for my wife and myself and the Kids and Wasn't expensive 2) Had a full equipped kitchen, so we could save on restaurants 3) Had free internet in the rooms 4) Had a shuttle to Disney 5) Had free breakfast 6) Free Newspaper 7) Free Parking 8) Free Local calls Everything started great as we got upgraded to a 3 bedroom suite, when we ordered a 2 bedroom suite. The Room was in the resort far from the reception, so don't even think going to this hotel without a car! We had a car, so it wasn't a problem for us. When we got in the rooms we were astonished. It was even bigger that I was imagining. Only good comments about the rooms. Now when did it started wrong you asking me. 1) Internet wasn't working in my room. Technician came but couldn't repair it. So had to take my computer in the middle of the night (working with Europe) to work from the lobby where wireless internet was working. 2) Breakfast is served till 9:30!!! We got at the breakfast at 9:25, as one of the kids was'nt feeling well. I noticed when we arrived that the cleaning woman (VERY UNFRIENDLY) were already putting all the buffet back in the fridge and the cupboard. Every time I had to ask the person, where I could fine the milk, tea, coffee, juice ... And with a very negative attitude she was giving me the milk, before rushing to put it back in the fridge. TRAVELLED A LOT, NEVER, BUT NEVER, HAD SO RUDE SERVICE DURING A BREAKFAST. It was like they were telling you: " Breakfast is complimentary, so don't even think of eating too long, too late, too much or get service". 3) Shuttle service: Have been in other disney world hotels, where there was a shuttle service to disney every 15 minutes from morning till night. Very convenient and you don't need a car. HOWVERE AT THE WORLDQUEST there were 3 shuttle services in the morning (every hour) to Disney, and 3 shuttle services at night back. We didn't use it as it wasn't convenient, so used our rented car (thank god I hadn't returned it before, as I was thinking to do) and paid the disney parkings. 4) PHONE BILL RIPP OFF!! I normally never phone from hotels for local calls. But because I had to phone HERTZ RENT A CAR in Miami in order to bring my car back later than presumed and not pay an extra cost of 65$ as they told me , I had to phone them. For an hour I phoned Hertz to Miami, thinking it was a local call and free as promised by the hotel, as it is also in Florida. And as Hertz isn't either the champion of service, I had to phone 7 times (during 1 hour) till I spoke with the right person,and got the promise that I wouldn't be charged by Hertz for returning my car later. Now very happy that I saved myself 65$ , I went to check out the last day from the WORLDQUEST, not believing what would happen next. During the Check out process, that had to be very short as I wasn't expecting to get any extra costs, the receptionist turns to me and says with a big smile " WOW mister, where have you been phoning to?" And she hand me a bill of ....... 210$ of a phone bill (equals to more than 2 nights at the WORLDQUEST) . I ALMOST FAINTED!!! Told her that there must be a mistake as I only phoned Miami (300 km- 220 miles away, very short distance in the USA and still in the same state of Florida) and only for 1 hour. She told me that I shouldn't have used the hotel phone, as only picking up the phone is costing 12.5$/call, before even the minutes accounts( so 7*12.5= 87.5$ for only dialling a number + 2$ a minute for the max 60 minutes I used the phone). Immediately she cut the cost by 50%, to 105$, saying that the phone company they are working with are sometimes miscalculating the bill (smells like a rip off? You tell me). I spoke with the shift responsible, and she promised me that the Hotel Manager wasn't in but that he would definitely contact me by e-mail. Didn't get contacted till today, ONLY the 105$ bill was billed to my credit card. So my saving of 65$ with hertz, costed me 105$ (negotiated from 210$), 1 hour at the phone, and 30 minutes of stress at the front desk of the hotel. Started sweet, ended up SOUR!!! NEVER COMING BACK AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: maui63
Reviews.Content: Stayed there in February,kids loved the pool and the breakfast was great,the accomodations were spacious and staff was very friendly and helpful. Big kitchen ,in room laundry facility and publix down the street as well as many restaurants great hotel,service,easy checkout and clean ,stayed in 3 bedroom suite. We will stay again,kids loved the place!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: TheRock01
Reviews.Content: Stayed at World Quest in Aug/09. Very nice condos we stayed in building 6 which was a long walk to the pool. The condo was clean except for the floor the grout was black with dirt. The dishwasher did not clean the dishes, and the pool was dirty we found worms at the bottom. For the price it was good we had alot of space which is good if you are travelling with kids. I would stay there again for the room size and kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Family and large groups”
Reviews.Author: disneyrunners
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, our son, daughter-in-law and 4 grandchildern (2yrs-15yrs) stayed at WorldQuest in June, 2009. Of course it had to be one of the hottest Junes that area had experienced in years. The condo was warm, the air conditioner had to be set on 65 degrees to cool, and then the two front bedrooms were always a little on the warm side (the beds weren't that uncomfortable, bring your own pillows though). We decided not to have maid service, (with the washer/dryer we did our own towels)we thought to bring out own bath soap, but I'm sure they would have provided more if we had asked, and they did provide daily trash pick-up. The frig never got cold, but kept food.Everything was provided, from cooking utensils to a couple of pot holders. I had read that they would charge if you used their dish detergent/laundry detergent, so we brought our own. There is a Walmart not too far. Easy to get to, however, getting back is not, no traffic light, so go during the day or early morning to avoid traffic.The pool was great, clean considering we had two evening storms while there, the spa was being worked on the last couple of days we were there, however, we were there to visit DisneyWorld, so it wasn't that big of a deal. The daily breakfast was fair. Coffee, juice,milk, cereal, pastries, bagels and toast,with jam and butter. There was always plenty of room in the breakfast area, but then we got up and out early. However, one day we were a little late and noticed some guests would bring platters and really pile on the food to take back to their room. Not sure about the transportation to/from WDW. From the schedule it wasn't convienient for us with a 2 yr old needing down time. My real complaint is that the tile floors were dirty. I don't mean a little dirty, down right black. Not until the last night did we find a mop in one of the bdrm closets. All in all, it was a great place for the money, the distance to WDW (we had our own cars) and the spaciousness of the condo. We had the 3 bdrm ,and with as many people in our group, we had plenty of room. Even the teen liked it. I can't say how the staff was, though we did call a couple of times for assistance and was immediately helped. So I suppose they were quick to respond. For just my husband and myself, we wouldn't stay at WorldQuest, but would stay on Disney property, however, for a large family/group I would recommend WorldQuest. The rate was great, including park tickets, and it was really pretty. Looks just like the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a large family”
Reviews.Author: Cherly18
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay if you need more room than a hotel has to offer. We rented a three bedroom condo to accomodate 6 people. The condo was very nice for the price. The only thing negative thing I can say is that the bathroom towels were not very plush (more like a two star hotel) and you have to pay for clean towels. We only stayed for two nights so we did not have to pay for maid service which would have decreased the value. The pool area is beautiful. It definitely has a four star quality. We have probably stayed in more than a dozen places in Orlando over the last 20 years and there are some very nice places but rooms are usually very small. It worked when our children were small but when you start travelling with teenagers your choices are very limited!! This was a perfect place for us and you can't beat the price!

Reviews.Title: “Just like the virtual tour.. you get what you see. Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: shayla592
Reviews.Content: We checked in late (10pm) with no problems. The apartment was beautiful. Fully stocked with all utensils, flatware, dinnerware, very updated kitchen and comfortable feel to this place. Stayed in building 4 5th floor. The pool was opened on a great schedule 6:30am to 11pm. The bar close at 9pm. The jacuzzi wasnt bubbling but it was nice just the same. Staff was pleasant and helpful. Disney was a 10 min drive away. I really recommend this spot.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Travlin_famly
Reviews.Content: World Quest is perfectly located next to everything, but just off the beaten path. We completely enjoyed our spacious 3 bedroom condo/villa, which was tastefully furnished with a well equipped kitchen. We booked through Expedia and got an excellent rate. The resort exceeded all our expectations and we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay, great value, lots of space.....”
Reviews.Author: newtraveler70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the world quest in orlando in July. The condo was spacious, and worth every penny. Only downfall we found was that we were a little walk from the pool. We were put in building 5. Beds were comfortable, everyone had their own space. Walmart is just right around the corner so you can pick up necessary items and bring it back to the condo. We get tired of eating out all the time so we were glad we could cook a little in our room. It is a little hard to find but if you can find the nickelodean , it is right behind it. Continental breakfast is also a nice perk. Enjoy it, you won't be sorry you picked the world quest!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased”
Reviews.Author: momofmeleand
Reviews.Content: We have never been this satisfied with a hotel. We stayed in a lovely 3 bedroom suite that had everything we wanted and more than we could have imagined needing. The rooms were big, the facilities were lovely, and the people could not have been nicer if they tried to be. We cannot wait to return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean and value for money”
Reviews.Author: ScottJFletcher
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Do not stay at the Nicolodeon hotel across the road, its 3 times the price for 1/4 of the room space. We are back here now (August) and its still very good

Reviews.Title: “Someone Made Mistakes - Be careful”
Reviews.Author: cheungmeis
Reviews.Content: - We were supposed to check out on Friday. On Thursday, when we were in Seaworkd, we got a voice mail from the resort saying that we were supposed to check out on that day but we did not. We did not know what happened since this was shocked to us. We went back to the resort right the way. My husband spoke to the front-desk person, and at the same time, my husband saw 2 papers on the front desk (the sign-in slip and the billing statement). The front-desk person showed us the statement staying the Thursday was the last day, but she totally ignored the sign-in slip which clearly printed out the check out date was Friday. If she paid a little more attention, our day won't be screw up. She even expressed that it was not a big deal that everything could be fixed on the phone. It was not true! If we didn't went back to the resort and my husband saw the slip, we will be charged for a higher rate. We were also nervous with our belongings. Finally, a supervisor level personnel finally came out and apologized. -The kitchen was missing quit a few items. We informed the front desk that we only need a wine opener. Very bad experience to try to get one from the resort until we went to Walmart and bought one. -The DVD finally hooked up in the last day after speaking to a supervisor level personnel. - Madatory fee for the resort charge. - Our unit is in building 4, first floor. 2-bed room. The view around us is a cluster of central AC units.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room but carless front desk service”
Reviews.Author: flyall
Reviews.Content: As long as everything is in your room then you should not have a problem. I was missing bowl, corkscrew. The DVD was never connected to the TV until the night before checkout. Several attempt was made to the front desk asking to have an engineer look at the DVD and TV. I gave permission for the engineer to come and look at it while we are away. I do not want to wait in the room for someone to come for something that was supposed to be connected. No one came only until the night before I checked out. I checked in on 8/2 and schedule to check out on 8/7. I was in Sea World on 8/6 and around 4:30 pm, Front Desk called me and said that I was supposed to checked out already on 8/6. I ask them to checked and confirmed the check out date and they said it is 8/6. I had to leave Sea World and head back to World Quest to fix the problem. I showed them the parking passed which show departure date as 8/7 and apparently their is a paper that all guests sign during check in which show the check in and check out date. No one bother to look at that paper which is the first paper staple to the bill which they looked at. My building is also very close to the wetland so animal make sound in the middle of the night.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest Resort is the way to go for a family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: blondieNewYorkNY
Reviews.Content: The resort was everything we had hoped for and more. The 3 bedroom accomodations were spacious and and very comfortable. We had all the luxuries of being at home with a full kitchen , dining area and living room. The location was great because it wasn't in the middle of anything. It was situated on it's own grounds which are very well kept. It was also very close to all of the major attractions. Overall it was a great experience and one i would definitely recommend to friends. gave it more of a resort area.

Reviews.Title: “World Quest Is the Best in Orlando!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dreamline42
Reviews.Content: Just came back from the World Quest Resort. Was here July 16 -24 This resort out shines the rest. Had a three bedroom unit. The place is so clean and modern. From the furniture to the deocorations. The rooms were so big and spacious. Master bath is to die for!! Close to Disney and outlets and a super Walmart. Perfect in every way. Pools is big and it was never over crowded.. I booked this resort from the reviews from Trip Advisor. Thanks Would return................

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Rubberdam
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Florida and were all a bit apprehensive, however our feelings changed when we arrived at our Condo, the accommodation was the best I have stayed in for a long time. I especially liked all the facilities, especially the large fridge and the ice box. It was great having a dishwasher and made my life a lot easier when we had meals in on the spacious balcony. The bedrooms were very comfortable and the children loved the spa bath. The pool area was also great. I was delighted that I did not ever have to fight for a sun lounger, most people were very considerate and did not reserve their loungers all day if they were not going to use them. The pool area one day I thought was getting a bit dirty due to inconsiderate people leaving their rubbish, but within the hour of seeing it, it was all cleaned up. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and if we come back to Floriday one day it will definitely be to stay at Worldquest. My only negative point was the bread and bagels did tend to run out if you did not have breakfast early.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will definitely be back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmberRoyseCity_TX
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience, besides it was very budget friendly, as we were travelling with a large group. Loved the facility, the rooms, the parking....everybody was really impressed with the accomodations, price, being close to Disney, etc!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: shimkay
Reviews.Content: We had a five night stay at World Quest. The two bedroom condo was beautiful with plenty of space. The decorating was lovely and the king sized master bedroom bed was wonderful. The tile floors are nice but you can hear people above walking or moving their chairs but would still choose the tile over carpeting. The screened balcony was big and bug free. The girl at the front desk was very nice and helpful. They should enforce the closing time at the pool as it does get noisy. The pool maintenance facility is also noisy if you are facing the pool. The master shower could also use a bit more water pressure. The free continental breakfast is simple with muffins, cereal, coffee, juice etc. but nice touch. The place is very clean and well maintained. I hope that they keep it up through the years as we intend on going back.

Reviews.Title: “I will never go back to this resort!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: pocahontas1
Reviews.Content: I was looking forward to this vacation and all I can say is that I will never go back. First of all, the kitchen is a disaster is not fully equipped, the refrigerator was not working as well as the toaster and the pool was a disgrace it was so dirty that it was dirt floating around the pool. I will not recommend this resort to anyone, the only good thing about this place is that is close to the attractions but is not worth it in the long run. The New Yorker.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding value for family travel, clost to Disney and all the action”
Reviews.Author: Houston_TX_Dad
Reviews.Content: Summary We just completed an eight day stay at World Quest Resort, and I would definitely recommend it to anyone traveling with children or family. This hotel offers an outstanding value for anyone interested in a nice, clean spacious suite within easy driving distance to Disney. Room To call this a hotel is really a mis-characterization. It is more like a rental condo with hotel amenities. We loved the spacious suite with 3 bedrooms and over 1,400 square feet. The suite was very modern and nicely decorated. We traveled with 3 children and the extra space helped keep everyone sane. Our suite included a master with king-sized bed, secondary bedrooms with a queen and two twins and a fold-out couch, so you could sleep up to 8 people if traveling with a large family or small group. Although we didn't use the kitchen except to store a few snacks and drinks in the refrigerator, it was nicely equipped with a full size refrigerator and range, microwave, dishwasher, and all dishes and cooking utensils. You could definitely use the kitchen to prepare a full meal if you desired. Amenities The daily continental breakfast was a great way to start the day and saved us money we would otherwise have had to spend on an extra meal each day. It was not the most elaborate complimentary breakfast we have ever had in a hotel, but there was enough variety to keep us happy. We opted not to use the optional houskeeping service and used the in-suite washer and dryer to launder our own towels each day. The washer and dryer also allowed us to pack less and launder our clothes as needed. Definitely a plus when traveling with kids. Location The hotel is only 5 - 10 minutes away from all the Disney parks, and shopping is close by. We did not use the shuttle service they offer to the parks so I cannot comment on it, but I would definitely recommend a car for anyone staying here. There is shopping and dining nearby, but nothing within walking distance. Plus, the property is very large and if you are staying in one of the outlying buildings (5, 6 or 7) you will most likely drive up to the main building for breakfast. Value Our internet-reserved rate of $119 per night was an outstanding value. For this price the quality of the room was unbeatable. For a similar rate within WDW we would have ended up in a double room with a roll away bed and still have had to pay for breakfast each day. Other hotels in this price range outside the park don't offer the space or quality we found at World Quest. Service Check-in and check-out were smooth and uneventful. The rate we reserved was the rate we got. There was no pressure to accept the houskeeping charges. We opted out and that was that. The service provided by Karen, the concierge, was great. She was very helpful booking our theme park tickets and making and canceling dinner reservations for us. We had car trouble one morning and she was very helpful getting us in touch with the auto club and recommending a place to get the battery replaced. My only complaint is with the additional "resort fee." I think this is just an attempt to keep the advertised room rate low. We didn't receive any added services to justify a resort fee. Conclusion We were very happy with our stay at World Quest Resort, and would not hesitate to recommend it to friends. Thanks for a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: hayken
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney often and this is the best hotel thus far. The rooms were huge--great for teenagers because of the 3 bathrooms in the suites! Pool was warm and big-- not many people at any time of the day. This is the best value in Orlando. A great way to save money in Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: almeister6
Reviews.Content: This condo hotel is in a great location, close to Disney theme parks. We booked our trip on Expedia and got a great deal for a three bedroom/three bathroom condo. The kitchen/dining room/living room area is huge and the balcony was very nice with a table and four chairs. Plenty of parking right outside the rooms. The pool is HUGE and very enjoyable. Even though there were a lot of people in the pool, it's so huge it wasn't crowded. There is a Tiki Bar near the pool which has decent (but overpriced) food. The hot tub was not very clean and the temperature was about the same as the pool. The fitness room has two ellipticals, two treadmills, weights and a stationary bike. Each of the machines has it's own TV and earphones are provided. We enjoyed the breakfast every morning. They had coffee, bagels, pastries, two types of cereal, juice.... I was able to eat and then bring up pastries for my family. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “best condo hotel in usa”
Reviews.Author: usaholiday90
Reviews.Content: amazing condos, they have everything you need plus more. it is situated in a great place jus minutes for disney, seaworld, aquatica and 2 shopping outlets aswell as only being a short drive from falcons fire golf club. i have stayed in orlando many times but this is the best place yet. everthing is so clean with lovely staff. the pool area is one of the best i have seen with music being played all day and food available all day at a great price. i will be staying here from now on every time i go to orlando. it made my holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed, Not Worth the Money.”
Reviews.Author: dallcmartin
Reviews.Content: Came with a large group and rented 3 condo's. All 3 condo's had maintenance problems. The carpet got flooded in one room, because the plumbing pipe was disconnected. In our room the phones didn't work, the carpets were dirty, and the room had a foul smell of plumbing being backed up. Most importantly, the fire alarms had a short in it and went off for 45 minutes, during our stay. Thirdly, the breakfast was disappointing, I wanted something hot. The children got tired of cold cereal and breads/pastries. Maybe my expectations were to high, but I expected the maintenance of these condo's to be better than that. Nice Rooms, but poorly maintained. Beds were very uncomfortable. On top of that they charge you a lot for basic housekeeping, extra towels, and for Shuttle service other than Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “even better than expected”
Reviews.Author: calforniakid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at World Quest for 11 nights end of june. It truly was one of the best places on vacation that we have ever stayed in. I've read that a few people complain about the lack of free maid service,but a little common sense will tell you that how can you expect it. These are two and three bedroom condos, not small hotel rooms. Can you imagine how long it would take for a maid to come in and clean three bedrooms, one very large bathroom, one medium size bathroom, a full kitchen, and a dining room. All I know is that the rooms were beautiful, and the location was fantastic(close to super walmart,all the highways and one block from hyw536 which leads you into disneyworld(5 minutes away) without all the traffic of highway 4). The pool was very large,very clean,and the hotel provided beach balls and air mattresses for the kids to use. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful(especially Crystal at the front desk and Karen the concierge) We saved so much money by utilizing the full size refrigerator and full size oven. We were able to make sandwiches everyday to bring with us, and ate dinner in the condo 9 out of the 11 nights,not to mention the ice cream in the freezer for desert as well as the water bottles we froze each night to bring to D.W. We were also able to travel very lightly because we knew about the washer and dryer in the condo. Everynight we washed our clothes and dropped them into the dryer and in the morning we could wear them again. I feel that world quest is absolutely the best bang for the buck in all of Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice suits near Disney Word”
Reviews.Author: Swedee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort when we where visting Orlando and the theme parks. It was a perfect family hotel with large - very large! - suites with a high standard. We are a family of four with two kids, age 3 and 6 and we like to do our own house holding and for that WQR was perfect! A great kitchen in the suits with everything you need, (fridge, frezzer, oven, stove, micro, dishwasher, laundy, dryer) made it very convient to cooking and cleaning. Add to that the large suits with 2 bedrooms and 2 bathrooms, (incl. 1 with a jacuzzi which the kids just loved) it was a very comfortable living. The hotel also offered a large pool - kids friendly - so we could spend a couple of days sunning and bathing - resting from the theme parks. The hotel is close to the WDW - only 15 - 20 minutes with car wich makes it a perfect place for families who want's a "home like" staying in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort.....It was everything we expected”
Reviews.Author: vacation015
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort. I would recommend it to anyone. I booked this resort through Expedia and got a great rate for a 3BR, 3Bath unit. We stayed in Building #7 which is only 6 mos old. I am a clean fanatic, and WorldQuest meet my expectations. Everything in the unit was very clean and nicely furnished. The units has great space to move around and enjoy. The workers picked up the trash daily for free. There is a fee ranging from $4 - $30 for additional housekeeping. I did not use the additional housekeeping. We made our own beds and keep things tidy being that we do those things anyway. It was not a problem for us and did not take away from us enjoying this resort. All workers at the resort were very pleasant. Great swimming pool. Although there are no other activities at the resort besides the swimming pool, attractions, grocery shopping, restaruants and outlet malls are within 5-10 minutes away. I do recommend a car rental to get around on your own time. This is a great resort and this is where we will stay everytime we are in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: 4reads
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at World Quest a couple of weeks ago for 6 nights/7 days. Looking at the website, it looks fantastic. However, they fail to tell you that housekeeping only picks up trash daily. If you want towels or washcloths daily, there is a fee. Also, if you want your sheets changed, there is a fee. There is a fee for everything they do at the resort other than take your trash. While we were there, we had to call the front desk after being at the park all day, just to have someone come get our trash and bring us towels and washcloths so that we could take a shower!! And, we paid in advance for the service which is what made it even more frustrating. So actually, they didn't even do it with the fee until we would call. We were very disappointed with the service and the stay at the resort. If tyou plan on using the shuttle provided, be prepared. It only runs 3 times in the morning and 3 times in the evening. And, it drops you off at Epcot to catch the monorail. So, make sure you allow an hour just to get to Magic Kingdom or anywhere other than Epcot. We ended up spending so much money on taxis because of the inconvenient shuttle schedule. It is a beautiful resort, but the convenience and service is not worth the view! We are definately going to do our homework next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: overnightraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm still trying to decide if I had my expectations too high, or was being overly critical, but since I rely heavily on tripadvisor when selecting hotels/resorts I wanted to put in my two cents. Let's start off with the positives: * Location is terrific. Made it to all the Disney parks and Universal in about 15 minutes. Five minutes to Super Walmart. Five minutes to a variety of restaurants on US-192. * Every worker I encountered at the resort from front desk, maintenance, housekeeping, etc. could not have been nicer and was always happy to help if you had a problem or needed something. * Having the continental breakfast was convenient, although the same selection of two cereals and breads/pastries every day gets old fast. Would also have really liked to have more food available at lunch (Tiki Bar often closed and had very limited selection). * We were in a 3BR/3BA. Really liked each bedroom having its own bath and own televison. * Nice pool area with comfortable, padded lounge chairs. Now on to the negatives which were the source of my disappointment: * I found this resort to be exceedingly noisy. We were first placed in building 4 which backs to a major highway (I think 417 or Osceola Parkway). It was like trying to sleep next to the Daytona Speedway. Buildings 3 - 7 all back to this, with more space between building 2 and the roadway. When I alerted the front desk, they were happy to move us to Building 1 which overlooks the pool. Little did I know that this meant we'd be subjected to screaming kids and teens from 7AM - 11PM+ (closing time did not seem to be enforced) every night. There was also some noise coming through the walls at all times. It sounded like chairs scraping against a hard surface, but I don't know what it actually was since we were on the top floor. * Beds were super uncomfortable and I would not say that I'm particularly picky about this. Larger mattresses were so hard it seemed like you were sleeping on the ground. King in the master had a serious dip/broken box spring. Twin beds were so bouncy it was like being on a trampoline. Pillows also very hard and uncomfortable. Linens on all beds were of poor quality and had holes and stains. Pool towels also very small and poor quality. * Carpet in bedrooms was very dirty and stained. I definitely did not feel comfortable walking without socks. Housekeeping seemed pretty spotty with numerous cobwebs in unit. * Low water pressure in showers and not enough hot water to use spa tub. * Poor/low lighting throughout. No sheers on the windows so unless you're prepared to just leave the curtains open (and second and third bedrooms directly face public hallway), prepare for it to be dark. * We rented directly through the resort (be sure to sign up for Hot Deals password) and did not realize that no housekeeping was included. There were three choices given at check in. We opted for $4/day for towel exchange. Other options were $15/day for towels, beds made and trash take out, $30/day for regular housekeeping. This wasn't a big problem for us since we're naturally pretty neat and clean, but is something to be aware of. * Numerous maintenance issues. During our stay we encountered a broken dishwasher, clogged toilet (that was clogged at time of check in), clogged sink (also that way at check in), non-working television remote, etc. Staff was helpful on all of these issues, but I don't want to spend my vacation encountering problems and calling to have them resolved. * Limited selection of televison channels. This was a more leisurely trip for us and we weren't spending all of our time in the parks so it would have been nice to have more options. Overall, I'd still say that the value was pretty good at this resort since they have such good deals directly through the resort as well as periodically through other websites (expedia, travelocity, etc.). I think whether you'll like it or not really depends on your expectations and what you're looking for. We stayed last years at Floridays, which I'd say is a direct competitor and they had similar rates available this year. Personally, I'd choose to return to Floridays over WorldQuest due to the issues above. If you've stayed at other Orlando timeshares/condos, I'd rate WQ as a definite step below the Hilton and Marriott properties, but a step above of other budget properties like Cypress Pointe.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place/Excellent Price”
Reviews.Author: beechbum46
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 sons 14 and 18) and my oldest son's girlfried (17) stayed here from June 13 - 20, 2009. The condo was very spacious and clean. The beds were not like home of course, but we did not find them as uncomfortable as some reviews mentioned. The pool was very nice, but could have been cleaned a little more. We stayed in building 3, but when we arrived they wanted to put us in building 4. The higher the building number the farther away from the main part of the resort. My wife asked if we could wait to be put in a closer building so we ended up staying in 3. We had to wait 1 hour for the condo to be cleaned. The staff at the recepion desk was very courteous and helpful. The first night we were there one of the toilets got stopped up so we called for maintenance. It took about an hour for him to come. When he arrived at the room I also asked him if he could turn up the hot water and he did. He was also very courteous. Also, the hot tub looked great, but it was roped off with yellow tape the entire time we were there. Not sure what was wrong with it. We really didn't have much time for the pool and hot tub since we were at Disney World everyday. The breakfast was okay. Wish there would have been more fruits instead of just pastries. The fitness room is like a large closet...it is extremely small. The resort was very close to the parks and was also close to Walmart and many places to eat. Overall, for the price we paid ($129) per day plus the $12.00 daily fee, this was a really good bargain. We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great for Large Groups”
