Reviews.Author: disneyrunners
Reviews.Content: World Quest looks just like the photos on their web site. The master is large the secondary bdrms are small, without ceiling fans, we had small fans with us which came in handy since the weather was record high when were there, and we had to turn the air down low to get the secondary bdrms cool. We had 2 complaints. The tile floors needed a really good mopping. (We did not go barefoot after the first evening). We found the vaccum/broom/ mop on the last evening there. Our second complaint was that the woman replishing the breakfast food said something to our 12 year old grandson about being too early to get breakfast on the day we were checking out, which was 6 a.m. And she would not let him out of the beverage area until she finished putting beverages in the frig. We did not know this until we were walking out the door. But have put in our complaint about talking to a guest's child like she did. We opted not to have maid service. We brought our own laundry detergent and dish detergent. I believe they charge every time you use theirs. The washer and dryer was a stackable, we washed our towels, and there are pool towels at the pool, which was large and beautifully landscaped. The tiki bar has food and drinks and I believe the prices are fairly reasonable. We did not utilize the shuttle, it did not come back at an earlier time (we had a toddler with us), but the drive to WDW is smooth and easy. Since there is no early entry, don't go too early, you still have to wait until the parks open, but if you go early you get a better parking space (closer). The breakfast consisted of bagels/creamcheese, bread to toast, mufifns, pastries, jelly, juice and coffee. This is a great resort for families and large groups. They did not try to sell us a condo which we had worried about. So all in all, we would recommend this condo/resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: lajay01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful & Spacious Condo. Absolutely loved it. We stayed in 3 bedroom condo...5 Adults and 3 small children and never felt crowded. We read the reviews and brought plenty of towels although pretty sure we would have been accomodated if need be. Great having washer & dryer in room. It is quite and off the highway but a straight shot to Disney and Walmart around the corner. Very convenient. No playground or recreation for the little ones but that was what Disney was for and we were able to come back to the rooms and relax. Loved the screened in balconies...didn't have to worry about our toddlers and no bugs!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: kmthequeen
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at area condos, and this past year the rates went up. I shopped around and found the World Quest. It was a very nice resort- very close to the Disney properties. My daughters had their own room, which they thought was great. You have the option to have several types of housekeeping or none at all. There is a continental breakfast that is included in your room rate. The staff was very helpful at the front desk, they even helped me print up boarding passes. We're already planning to go back there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxorious, loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Hoocha
Reviews.Content: Sadly the four of us, 2 adults and 2 kids, only had one night here when we returned to the Orlando area having spent a week in a villa at the start of our trip before going off to Gulf Coast. I say sadly because we thought it was a lovely place to stay, absolutely huge and appointed to the highest standard. We had time to enjoy our dinner out on the balcony, listening to a cacophony of Florida wildlife after dark and had a (distant) view of the Epcot fireworks which was a great way to end our time in the area ! I would say if the pool is important to you ask to be nearby as we were in building 7 which is not even walking distance. I agree that the breakfast is nothing special and given the choice I would not pay $11.95 per day for this and other stuff I don't want, but the pool area looked gorgeous. I would definitely suggest this to people doing the parks, though renting a villa also worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “This is the only place I will stay in Orlando from now on...”
Reviews.Author: MissTonya
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on several occasions...it's my home away from home. Great quality for the price...very clean, quiet, and spacious. Highly recommended...you won't regret staying here.

Reviews.Title: “cleanest hotel I have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: bdancer
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a short trip to world quest/ orlando yesterday. Overall, I was very impressed with this place. I booked on line from their website and received a quote. I specifically asked if this was the total rate and I was told yes. So I wrote it in the comment section onthe on-line reservation form. We arrived around 1pm. Our room was not ready so we went out to the tiki bar and had a drink while the kids jumped in the pool. The room was ready in about an hour. I was pleasantly surprised. I am a clean freak. I always totally evaluate the room, curtains, baseboards, kitchen and beds. There was no dust under the beds a very good sign. The rooms are very nice with fully equipped kitchen and we ate two meals a day on our large balcony over looking the pool. the kids had their own room and bathroom and our master bedroom and bathroom were large and comfortable. Now the downside. The pool is not very ornate but I knew that ahead of time, however, the problem is that it was not clean the last couple of days. We didn't see anyone cleaning it at all. The spa was very dirty and not working either. Oh, also don't expect much from the breakfast it is sparse, better to make your own. At checkout, our account had extra charges. Totaling about 50 dollars more than quoted. They did credit me when I told them that I was guaranteed the rate (and I told them the name of the employee) so that was good. We really enjoyed staying here. It is incredibly close to Disney and Kissimmee. It is built on a nature preserve (don't know how they got the permit kind of sad actually), so there is plenty of wildlife around to enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: cabonna
Reviews.Content: This was a much needed vacation for my family. WorldQuest was the perfect place to launch all of our outings. The resort was clean. We rented a 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom unit. The mastersuite came equipped with a stand alone shower, 2 sinks and a jacuzzi tub. The balcony was accesible from the mastersuite. The unit was also equipped with a full kitchen. We had a washer and dryer as well. Our 19 year old had his own bedroom and bath. Our 10 and 14 year old, shared a room with their own bath as well. The pool located at the resort was FANTASTIC. The staff was very helpful getting us from one attraction to the next. All theme parks were within close proximity of the resort. I would highly recommend staying here. The only drawback for me was that you had to pay extra for cleaning services. I would stay at this resort evey time I visited Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Value”
Reviews.Author: Jagfamily
Reviews.Content: This is a very good value with an excellent location near all of the Disney theme parks and I-4. The location is very quiet (only thing built on the road currently) and the traffic is much better than other locations. We have stayed here three times so far. We travel to Orlando about six times per year. The rooms are very spacious with full kitchens and dining areas, if you prefer to eat in. There are no on-site restaurants but the Lake Buena Vista area and Downtown Disney are only minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: bhurd529
Reviews.Content: We found this condo/hotel on Expedia. The condo was beautiful and immaculate. The location is the best for Disney. You are so close yet far away from the hustle and bustle. The pool is lovely and the grounds are pristine. The staff is so pleasant and the concierge was particularly helpful with tickets and other arrangements into the park. This place is a hidden gem in Orlando. I would stay there again as soon as we can get back to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marty15
Reviews.Content: Last summer my family and I went to Orlando, staying at the hotel. The staff was really nice and placable. The rooms were clean, really BIG and had a nice kitchen. Everything at this hotel was absolutely great! It's a really great value for the price!

Reviews.Title: “This place was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: smcriv
Reviews.Content: I had read some negative comments about this place on here and decided to go ahead and stay hoping for the best. This place was awesome! Affordable and clean. We had a 3 bedroom condo with a pool view which was very nice. Everyone was really nice and you get breakfast in the am. I am planning on staying again this June!

Reviews.Title: “House Keeper Threw Away Our Shoes”
Reviews.Author: 9Traveler
Reviews.Content: Overall is a pretty good place to say but the house keepers threw away 2 brand new pairs of shoes thinking it was garbage!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Holiday”
Reviews.Author: AjSara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were amazed at how good a deal we got when we booked at this resort through Expedia.ca - the resort was beautiful, the condo was large, clean and spacious and everything we needed for our five day stay, was available to us in the condo. It is a great value for the price and a very nice place to stay in. A couple of problems we ran into were that the internet in our building did not work and no matter how many times the staff tried to repair it, the same problem recurred. I also felt the water pressure in the showers was very poor - but extremely minor problems compared to the wonderful stay we had at this resort. The pool was lovely - the staff extremely helpful and gracious and despite warnings I had about check in being a long and laborious process at this resort, I have to say, in our case, it was a breeze. We even got an early check in by a very cheerful member of their staff. However, I must point out that if you are looking for a resort with lots of activities for children, this is not the greatest place for you - there are several more child friendly places to stay in at Orlando. Our 5 year old just used the pool every evening but there were no other activities in the resort for her to enjoy. In our case, since we were on our first visit to disney, we hardly had to worry about entertaining ourselves at the resort - we were out the whole time. It is luxurious though to have TVs in every bedroom (we had 2 bedrooms) and one in the living room. My advise to those staying at this resort would be to make sure you have a car rental - everything is advertised as being really close by but honestly, you need a car to get you to the stores etc. There is a walmart rather closeby - not walking distance as I was advised earlier - you can get everything you need there including hot food from their food court. In all, I have to stay we had a wonderful stay at this resort and will definitely be back to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Value Value Value.........Large Group Delight!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Worldquest in eight months. Overall tremendous value and a place you will immediately love. We went this time with 6 people--myself, the wife, our two college age daughters and two of their friends. We had a three bedroom, three bath unit which was great for the size of our group. This is a condo hotel which caters to larger families and groups. Staff is excellent and grounds and rooms are immaculate. What do you give up versus a hotel?? No on site restuarant (but Hampton Inn quality continental free BF in the AM), that is about it. I would guess under 2 miles to Disney gates --- never hitting a traffic light between the Worldquest gate and the Disney Gate--under 15 minutes to each park (including the stop for the BF (if you are good)!!!). House keeping is a challenge as posted below me---both times we were there (despite repeated notes as well!!). We found in the AM we threw all our used towels in the washer in the AM when we left and when we returned from the parks moved them to the dryer--- If you go to this facility enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, clean, and spacious- perfect for our family's Disney trip!”
Reviews.Author: TeacherMomNJ
Reviews.Content: I found WorldQuest online, loved the website, and booked three nights in a 3 bedroom/2 bath suite, hoping for the best. We arrived late after a day at Disney, and from the guard at the gate to the manager at the front desk, everyone was friendly and helpful. Our suite was amazing- my kids had twin beds in their room, my parents had a king in the master suite- with a garden tub and separate shower in the bathroom, and we had a comfortable queen in our room. The second full bathroom was also very nice. The kitchen was well equipped- full fridge, range, microwave, dishwasher, and even a washer & dryer in the hallway. My kids counted a total of 4 TVs in the place. We had a nice view of the pool and grounds from the screened terrace. I wish maid service/ clean towel service was up to par; our multiple requests didn't get us far. Just don't leave your wet towels on the floor and you'll have a great stay!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, spacious apartments”
Reviews.Author: CardiffManc
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a week at one of these 2 bed 2 bathroom apts. We followed directions given on the WQR website and got there from the airport really easily. Check in was speedy and the staff very helpful (they have maps to the local area, so ask for one on check in). We were in building 6 on the 1st floor (called 2nd floor, but 1 up from ground). It was a short walk from the pool area/reception, but nice and quiet as a result. The apartment did not disappoint - one king master room with en-suite (separate shower, jacuzzi bath and 2 sinks) and one twin room with adjacent bathoom with shower over bath - perfect for the kids. Both bedrooms had tvs as well as the living/dining area. There was a DVD player in the living room. The kitchen had everything we wanted and more, all full size (I've never seen a microwave so big!). There was also a washing machine and tumble dryer, so we actually came home with some clean clothes for a change. There was a screened balcony with table and chairs with a view over a small lake. We found the location to be perfect - we knew how isolated the place was beforehand and this was what we wanted. We were a 5 min drive from the Disney area and about 10/15 mins to Discovery Cove/Seaworld. The noise and bustle of I drive is a short drive/taxi ride away. There was also a Walmart about 5 mins drive away. You really do need a car to stay here. The pool area was great - very clean and the pool was heated and open until 11pm. There's also a bar by the pool open until 9pm. Breakfasts were handy if you're in a rush - basic fare of bagels, cream cheese, pastries, muffins, coffee, juices. There are only a few tables inside and out, but we never had a problem getting a table. We were all very impressed with this place and would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for families or Singles”
Reviews.Author: Tingaling08
Reviews.Content: World quest is absolutely , the prime location for all your needs in Orlando. The resort its selft was beautiful, immaculate, and equipped with everything U would need to stay away from home. (including detergent to wash clothes) although it costs $1.00 . The rooms are very new , up to date with an eclectic feel, spacious with bathrooms and whirlpool baths in the master suites. Staff was very personable, rates were ideal, and concierge service even assisted with saving us money and meeting all of our needs for golfing , disney and dining. The children loved the resort as much as I did. Would definately go to this resort again. Better than home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Slow-Paced Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: eugene_huntley
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the spacious rooms. Staff was friendly and prompt. Quiet location for family get-away. One of the cleaniest properties we've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: vladoauliru01
Reviews.Content: We are a family with 3 kids, 14, 7 & 3, so we never get to have a good fare in the usual hotels and chains so we found this resort, a full equiped apartment with 3 rooms whichlet us enjoy our 14 day vacation at Orlando, and the fare was the same as we could have paid for a 2 kings at any other decent hotel and the same as 2 rooms in a low budget hotel so we had privacy for me and my wife but we still had control over our children. The swimming pool wasn't as the picture on the net but was Ok, and it was really close to Magic kingdom

Reviews.Title: “Superb through and through”
Reviews.Author: SegsOttawa
Reviews.Content: Our family of four stayed at your resort for a week and absolutely loved it. From the hospitality, superb accommodations, pool, location etc. we couldn't have asked for more. Close to Disney and all amenities it is situated in the perfect spot. I have and will continue to highly recommend your resort to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place and will definately stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: DirtraceDoug
Reviews.Content: We loved the condo, we have two little girls and the room was great. They were able run and play just like they were home. I was very impressed when I walked through the door and seen how nice it was. Location was perfect, close enough to everything but not in the middle of all the busy city stuff going on around you. The staff was very nice and the pool was wonderful. I would suggest this place to anyone and we will be back there again. We spent most of our trip at the theme parks and it was nice to come back to the condo and relax in such a nice place after a long day.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Jenan2000
Reviews.Content: I booked a 3 bedrooms, 3 bathrooms condo directly from the owner and it costs only $129 + TAX. It was more than a great condo....Very very spacious and very clean with a typical American furniture. It has jaccuzi in the master bathroom. You really feel you are at home. The location is very close to Disneyworld but it can be bit difficult to reach especially at night. If you get lost, just ask for Nickelodeon hotel and it is very close to it. They have a great swimming pool and a nice gardens. It has a small supermarket and there is an outlet just outside the resort. This is the ideal place to stay if you travel with your family and don't want to spend too much staying at the very expensive Disney resorts. It is the ideal place to stay especially for a long holiday in Orlando...You can use the internet for free from your condo and you will have a free parking outside your door.... I loved this place and for sure will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room, Beautiful Pool, Excellent Location! Would Stay Again.”
Reviews.Author: jondivito
Reviews.Content: The room was very nice. There were a couple of minor issues. The shower door in the master did not close well. But the place was beautiful. The room was clean and spacious. We had our family of 5 in the room. The pool was amazing. The grounds were well kept. We had a rental car, but you could get to Disney without one. The shuttle from the hotel only goes to Epcot. You then have to bus to the other parks. The breakfast was nothing special. But if you travel and are familiar with the Continental Breakfast, you will be fine. We fed our three children each morning with Muffins, Bagels, Cereal, OJ, Cranberry Juice, Milk. They also had Tea and Coffee. Loved it! We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Our Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: PhillySteeler
Reviews.Content: Wow! This facility was suggested by a family member who had stayed there. However, upon reading some of the past reviews, I was a little worried - needlessly I might add! The facility had everything we could have asked for! We had a 3 bedroom/3 bathroom/4 TV suite and it was huge! We were there for a week and we never got on each other's nerves! Usually, 3 kids sharing the same space with 3 adults (one being Grandpa), can be somewhat trying. However, there was extra room to spare! We had a TV in each beedroom as well as in the living room. There was a full sized dining room table and the kitchen had more than ample space and it came fully equipped with everything you could need to cook a family dinner. The dishwasher makes cleanup a breeze. The bedrooms were very spacious and comfortable. My kids were impressed with the fact that they had their own bedroom with their own beds, bathroom and TV. It made relaxing after a long day at Disney that much easier. My littlest one loved the jaquzzi in the Master Bath. My husband loved the huge walk in shower. I loved the 2 seperate vanities with their own sinks. With 3 bathrooms, getting ready in the morning took no time at all! The pull out couch gives you extra sleeping options. The screened in porch/patio is a wonderful touch too, the kids loved to eat out there. The room was clean, and pleasantly decorated. We loved the fact that no one came into the room to try to clean it up for we didn't have to worry about things going missing. The lack of detailed cleaning each day did not detract from the experience for us, in fact, it made it feel much more comfortable and like home. We quickly made the beds each day, put out the trash for pickup and were on our way to explore the parks. The washer and dryer gave us the option to bring less in the way of clothing and take more back home for gifts. We didn't have to pass up the light saber and stuffed animals. The iron and ironing board were handy, the shampoo and soap appreciated and the broom, dustpan and sweeper used! If the kids spilled something, we could clean it up immediately instead of waiting for housekeeping in the morning. If you really want to take time off from housekeeping chores, just pick the option available and they will do it all for you. Even with the extra fee, the room is still a "steal." The ease of getting to the parks is understated in their materials. You can be just about anywhere, at the door of all the major parks, within minutes. We averaged about 15 minutes max. door to door for all of the Disney parks including parking and taking the tram/monorail/ferrry. We ate at many of the local restaurants which thriled the kids because there are so many to choose from. SuperWal-mart is just down the road and you can purchase forgotten items, rain gear, umbrellas and any type of food and snack you could wish for. We stocked the refridgerator with drinks, fruit, lunch meat etc. and the freezer with icecream and the kids were happy and content. We were also able to refill the backpacks each day with water bottles and snacks which saved us time and money at the park. The breakfast options that they provide was more than what my kids eat at home each day. The kids wanted something fast and easy so that we could get to the parks faster! The heated pool was a hit with the kids. It wasn't the least bit crowded and you didn' t have to worry about loosing the kids. Dad and Grandpa loved the Tiki bar and the hot tub was apppreciated as well. The best part of the trip was the staff. They were all so pleasant and helpful, never hestating to answer our questions, provide suggestions for dinner or shopping, Googling info. if they didn't know and to top it off, they printed our boarding passes for our return trip home! We travel frequently with the kids and hands down, this was our best experience yet. I have been recommending this resort to anyone who will listen!

Reviews.Title: “A Very Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: GCMM
Reviews.Content: Wold Quest Resort is very convenient to Walt Disney World, it has well landscaped grounds, and the staff is friendly. The rooms are clean and nicely furnished. It is great to have a living room, kitchen, and a washer/dryer. (A role of paper towels, a small container of dish washing liquid, and a small container of detergent were among the basic supplies provided.) We were in building three and had a nice view of the lake from our balcony. The pool area looked good but it was too cold during our stay to use it. A few minor concerns: The bedding was comfortable enough but could be better. The continental breakfast area is too small. Also, some might consider buildings six and seven a little far from the main building if you regularly want to go to the continental breakfast or pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect upscale stay with large family group - Disney and more!”
Reviews.Author: wannabethegriswolds
Reviews.Content: We rented two 3-bedroom units for a family group of 10 ranging in age from 6 to 50+ and everybody was happy. The adults had plenty of room to spend quiet time together and the kids loved the rooms with the twin beds. The pool was clean, resort quality salt water and an excellent end to our busy days in the theme parks. We had rental cars and were able to easily navigate ourselves in and out of three Disney parks, Universal Studios and a day trip over to Coco Beach as well. I almost hate to share the good news about this place! We would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimmy31
Reviews.Content: great hotel 3 bedroom condo was perfect staff was great location perfect to disney jim,holden , mass

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - not fantastic”
Reviews.Author: famlyplanner
Reviews.Content: We just finished a 3 day stay at World Quest. Our 2 BR "condo" unit was just right for 4 of us. No fold-out couch so you couldn't add a 5th person, though they do offer 3 BR units. All the units are uniformly decorated in what I would call 'sparse mediterranean.' It's a great place for those with allergies as most of the flooring is tile and all bedding is foam/cotton, not down. Unfortunately the beds were not comfortable, but that may vary by unit. The complex was a little too out in nowhere for my taste. It looks like it was built on a newly created road where intentions were to have alot of development, but then plans were scaled back and now there's nothing within a mile of the structure. They did offer a free shuttle service to the nearby LBV factory store outlet center, departing every 60 - 90 minutes. Continental breakfast only consisted of bagels, muffins and juice. We wished there was a hot breakfast available as there weren't any other breakfast places within walking distance. But for those that stay longer than just a couple of days, there's a full kitchen where breakfast could be cooked by yourselves in your unit. Although the rooms weren't equipped for wi-fi, we had no problem connecting. Our ice maker in our freezer didn't work, but we didn't need it enough to say anything to the front desk. The TV remote didn't work, but a maintenance person was up within minutes to fix the problem. The best thing about this complex is that after the stimulation of all-day Disney, it's a relaxing quiet place to rest and relax poolside. Having experienced other bright "happy" loud busy Disney hotels with my children, this would be a definite benefit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Units but not Problem Free”
Reviews.Author: Cosmosis
Reviews.Content: Check in was an easy affair. The clerk was very polite. We had a two bedroom unit. It was in the newer section (buildings 5,6 & 7). It was clean and nicely furnished with two bathrooms. The bedrooms are on the smallish size, especially the bedroom with the two twin beds but you really don't spend much time in the bedrooms. We had one television in the master bedroom and one in the living room. I wish that the second bedroom had a television because the tv in the living room was right off the master bedroom and it was a bit noisy when I wanted to sleep and my older kids wanted to watch tv. The master bathroom was very large with a shower, two sinks, and a jacuzzi. The unit had a full kitchen with utensils, dishes, pots, pans,coffee maker, toaster, etc., a dining area and a living room area plus a very nice screened in terrace. A washer and dryer is provided. I loved this as I like to come home with clean clothing. Every morning there is a continental breakfast provided at the clubhouse. It consisted of muffins, pastries, bagels, bread, cereals, juice and coffee. Sometimes there were apples and bananas but I think that once they ran out, they were not replaced. I didn't use the pool but the pool and the pool area looked very nice. I wish that I could have given this property a higher rating but there were some problems that I feel are not acceptable for a property that is supposed to be a higher end resort. 1. Limited housekeeping. Housekeeping consisted of the beds being made and garbage removal. I believe the sheets were changed every couple of days. You can pay to have full cleaning service - I think it was about $30 a day. No clean towels, etc. I don't recall the hotel's website mentioning this. Some people who work hard all year might prefer not to have to clean up after a long day at the park or wash towels every night. Others might like to know of this policy prior to arrival so that they can bring some light cleaning supplies from home like laundry detergent, softener and fantastik for the kitchen so as not to have to run to the local market or have to buy overpriced cleaning supplies at the hotel. 2. Towels - the towels provided were not the best quality. I didn't expect that they would be but the were pretty dingy looking and one was even ripped. Some clean, fresh looking towels would have been much more pleasant. 3. Bedding - Two of our sheets had holes in them. The sheets were on the thin side. Also, the blankets were made of a very thin woven cotton. 4. No hot water - I was really anxious to use the lovely jacuzzi in the master bath. Unfortunately, once the tub was 1/4 full the hot water turned luke warm at best and bath time was over. Taking a shower caused the same problem. Bathing or showering in coldish water was no fun at all. 5. Noisy pipes - there was a constant banging coming from my bathroom. I can only assume it came from the pipes as I couldn't figure out any other source. This property has a lot of potential and I think most of the problems I encountered could be easily corrected. I hope that in the future they are.

Reviews.Title: “Very Dirty Resort”
Reviews.Author: HONESTY001
Reviews.Content: The resort was very nice in the overall appearance, as in the outside. We were excited to see that the villas were spacious and nicely decorated. However, the problem was that the entire suite was filthy starting in the kitchen, where there was a sticky film on the counter, the floors were also sticky and dirty. The living room sofas were too filthy to even sit on. We reported it all to the clerk who told us that they would do a complete cleaning. They cleaned it alright, when we returned back to the room, it was still in the same manner as before. The maid left her dirty cloth and sponge on the kitchen's counter and forgot to clean. They replaced our towels and gave us stained towels. If this is how they clean and maintain the facilities I wouldn't want to see how they live!!!! This was the nastiest resort ever.!!!! If they were to keep it clean then it would be a great place unfortunately it's NOT!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: hartherd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at World Quest for 4 nights in a 3 BR condo. Very spacious, clean and tastefully decorated. Staff was very helpful. Although we didn't get a chance to use the pool, it was very nice. Serves continental breakfast every morning. Each BR had its own bath and lots of closet space. Master BR was beautiful with a door leading out to the lanai. All BR were of good size. Kitchen had nice size appliances and all dishes/cookware/utensils very clean. In a very private area, but only 2 miles from WDW. Would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at WorldQuest”
Reviews.Author: HHICNSAND
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 just returned from a trip to Orlando which included accomodations at WorldQuest resort. The resort was very close to perfect. First of all, we booked the reservation on expedia for $129/night. We booked a two bedroom but there was a promotion for an upgrade to 3 br for no additional fee. The upgrade was honored upon early 3 PM check in. The front desk staff was always helpful and very friendly. The three bedroom condo is fairly new construction which of course makes for a cleaner appearance. We had plenty of space and all kitchen utensils were provided. Every room had a tv. There is a washer and dryer. Our only minor complaints are as follows. Although the beds are adequate now, in a year or so I would not want to be sleeping on the cheap mattresses that are in each room. The mattress pad and sheets were slipping around and popping off the corners. Also, my fitted sheet had a hole in it. I didn't point it out to the front desk because it didn't bother me enough. I know they would have addressed it immediately. Next, we saw tiny ants intermittenly throughout the condo. They were in the living room on the floor, in one of the kitchen cabinets, by the entrance to the front door and on the nightstand in the master bedroom. Again, they were such a minor thing, barely visible, that we just mentioned it to the front desk upon check out. The cover on the flourescent light in the kitchen was hanging open during our stay. The two bedrooms in the front were a little cramped with furniture but that didn't bother us much either as we only slept in the rooms at night after long days at the parks. We loved the proximity to the Disney parks. Also, as other reviewers have mentioned Super Walmart is right down the street and in the other direction you can find lots of major restaurant chains like Red Lobster, Olive Garden, Chili's, Macaroni Grill, Chick-fil-a and finally Starbucks. Just ask the front desk and they'll give you directions. We did not utilize the resorts shuttle service as we did not want to be constricted by the departure and return times. So we paid $12/day for parking at the parks. The resort provided breakfast each morning. We did not get to use the pool as we experienced a cold front on the third day of our trip. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at WorldQuest and think it was an EXCEPTIONAL value for $129/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: joeharper
Reviews.Content: We arrived about midnight and it was therefore dark and very difficult to find hotel entrance. Fortunately we knew it was behind the Nickelodeon Hotel so we eventually found it but they could do with some more lighting at their signage. There was security in the booth when we arrived and that was the only time we seen anyone there. The rooms are lovely and clean and well equipped, lots of room. I was disappointed to find that if I wanted any cleaning done then we had to pay $30. I don't go on holiday to buy cleaning products, cloths etc and then clean the room. The housekeeping will make beds and empty bins every day and anything else has to be paid for. This would put me off returning which is a shame as apart from that , it was fab! The pool was great and very quiet! Check-in/out was quick and efficient. Very quiet resort, on-site shop poor and expensive but Walmart is just 5 mins away. The location is excellent with Disney 10 mins away and Universal 20 mins away. Premium outlets and Buena Vista Outlets just around the corner also.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: recman15
Reviews.Content: Our family has traveled to Orlando on many occasions. World Quest by far was the nicest, cleanest family friendly resort we have ever stayed. Most condo units are tired and pools are crowded. World Quest was top of the line and the 3 bedroom units were beautiful. We will definitely go back in 2009!

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: TaraCC
Reviews.Content: My family has always stayed in Disney resorts but this August we vacationed at Worldquest Resorts, and it was spectacular. The three bedroom condo was immaculate and so spacious. Our family of six had so much room! My three kids loved the tv in each bedroom. The adults loved the huge kitchen, and the washer/dryer. The staff were wonderful. The pool and landscaping were beautiful, and each day it took us less than ten minutes drive door to door to get to Walt Disney World! We will definately return. The price was a third of what we have spent in the past at the Disney Resorts. I would recommend Worldquest Resorts to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic.....”
Reviews.Author: Richardacc
Reviews.Content: This place is fantastic. Booked 2 room and asked for upgrade to 3 bed, which they were happy to offer on check in. Apartments are spacious , clean , nicely furnished, very upmarket. The price is also excellent paying just 99 US (Was 119 whenI booked but as the price had dropped as a special they held the new rate for us even though we had already booked at the higher rate.) Staff were great, pool and surroundings lovely and well kept. Good postion just off I drive. If we go back to Orlando will be back to stay again. A+++++++

Reviews.Title: “This is truly a beautiful spacious hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Guayaco36
Reviews.Content: Ok let me start by saying that this is a great hotel, the rooms are roomy, really really spacious(I got the 3 bedroom suite). You got a family of 5 or more then this is the hotel you want to stay at, please do yourself a favor and don't pay for an overpriced hotel, this was really cheap and I have never stayed at a hotel that was clean and with brand new rooms. I was thinking of booking a hotel at downtown disney for the transportation but I glad I didn't because all they give you is a two beds and a separate room with a pull out couch, in this hotel you get three separate rooms and two bathroom and a washer and dryer, nice air conditioners all new! I rented a car and didn't use their transportation so I really don't know how that goes, all I know is that while you eat their complimentary breakfast there is someone asking who needs a bus to go to the parks. The complimentary breakfast was ok, it had bagels, muffins, cheese danish, only two toasters, there was apple juice and orange juice, coffee, hot chocolate, tea, it was a money saver! Oh yeah before I forget you get free detergent in your room, another money saver. There is security at the entrance. Ok enough about the positives what are the negatives? well let me tell you that their customer service sucks! really really sucks! the staff is not respectful, they don't even smile. Cleaning services only takes out garbage and places dishes in dishwasher and replaces towels and toilet paper but that's about it, you need to clean your own floor, mop, sweep, they won't do it for you! so if this really bothers you then a hotel with those small rooms might be better for you. The pool is huge and not crowded but......(i only went once) it had a salty taste, now what that was I don't know. My whole family didn't like the pool and how horribly salty the water was....Check in is not easy they will try to accommodate you but you will probably need to wait 2 hours to get something closer to the pool. I arrived at 1:00pm they told me a room will be ready by 3:00pm, I didn't mind because I need it to do some food shopping came back at 3:00pm and the room they gave me was on the first floor which I didn't like because you can't enjoy the balcony so I waited 1 more hours and finally decided on a room which had like a half view of the pool but was near it. Let me just finish by telling you that this hotel has more pros than cons, its a great hotel to stay with your family of 5 or more, the cost is worth it(remember there is a fee of 11.99 per night). I have paid twice as much in other hotels but have left unpleased with this hotel I want to go back, you won't regret it, if you rent your car and wake up early for complimentary breakfast this is your hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!!!”
Reviews.Author: pvkannan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the resort for a couple of days last week and only one word would describe the condo -- EXCELLENT. It was absolutely neat and well maintained. My wife is terribly allergic to dust mites and she had no problems during the stay. The hotel staff upgraded our reservation to a 3 BD condo. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Grandma's condo”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter7777777
Reviews.Content: However, we had a few problems... They began when contacting the resort with questions regarding the room before making reservations online. My husband called the 877-987-8378 number and spoke to a gentleman. Clearly, English was not his first language. Traveling with two teenage boys it was imperative to ensure that the 2-bedroom accommodation had two bathrooms with 2 showers. The man insisted there is one shower and a Jacuzzi in the other bathroom (but no 2nd shower). Thinking that it was odd that there only one shower (and perhaps the gentleman didn't understand the question), my husband called back in hopes of speaking to another representative. The same representative answered the call. My husband tried again with the fellow by phrasing the question a different way, same result - one shower in the entire 2 bedroom suite. He gave up. I tried calling about 30 minutes later hoping to speak to someone else, anyone else. I called Housekeeping, Accounting, Maintenance, Security, etc. All calls went to voicemail. Frustrated I called back yet again and dialed '0' and spoke with the operator (the only human being I could speak with in the middle of a weekday afternoon!). She assured me that the 2 bedroom suite has 2 showers (the Jacuzzi has a shower in it). The resort itself is in a remote location. It is almost in Lake Buena Vista near the Nickelodeon Hotel. The closest park is Epcot. When we arrived, we felt very put off by Hanna, the very unfriendly front desk clerk. The $11.95 "resort fee" is hardly recognizable on the website and took us by surprise upon check in. Instead of being nice about it, Hanna seemed to have a take it or leave type attitude -- almost hostile. The fee includes the following: - Wired Internet access via your laptop (NO WIRELESS) - USA Today (NO delivery on weekends) - Local calls - Use of fitness center - One fax per day - Daily shuttle to Disney (only to EPCOT twice a day to/from) - Continental breakfast (no protein or fruit) Obviously the 'resort fee' is tacked on so that the rate can be advertised at a lower rate than the competition. I get the marketing strategy but it still pisses people off. Having two teens anxious to get to Universal, we decided to stay. Although the Superior 3-bedroom suite is advertised to be furnished with one king bed, one queen bed, and two double beds, our Superior 3-bedroom suite (we were upgraded) was furnished with one king bed, one DOUBLE bed, and two TWIN beds. The full size kitchen with all dishes and utensils was nice. The washer/dryer also came in handy as we had rain each day of our stay. Because the clubhouse was so far away, we did feel separate and isolated. Although the suite was nicely appointed, the cobwebs and silk/plastic flowers (we were constantly moving them to get them out of the way) made us feel like we were staying at grandma's condo for the weekend. Although the suite didn't smell funny. The internet connection worked intermittently and the blackout curtains did not cover the windows completely. For the seasoned Orlando traveler, this may be an ideal accommodation for the price especially if you have kids. If you are new to the area, you will want a resort whereby the staff is more accommodating and helpful. Will we stay here again? Most likely not. The fact is, Orlando is second only to New York in hotel room availability. Ah, but World Quest Resort has taught me a very valuable lesson...always check for hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “I love World Quest”
Reviews.Author: sandraD26
Reviews.Content: World Quest is just lovely. It was a wonderful place to relax after along day at the park. Our condo was fabulous, we had a three bedroom/ three bath. We saved tons of money by cooking in their kitchen that is stocked full of plates and dishes. I would definetly return. Just a tip...you will need a car!! The condo is in the middle of nowhere and their is no food or bar on the premises and only two shuttles a day. All and all loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Will Return”
Reviews.Author: Igotboys
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this resort the first week of August and were absolutely pleased with the accomodations. The condo was very clean, nice and spacious, and the attitudes of the employees were outstanding. We have already discussed returning in 2009.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: jelh
Reviews.Content: Great location really nice resort would book again, great rates when booking directly with the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Literaly a hidden gem...”
Reviews.Author: Gamxiated
Reviews.Content: Worldquest Resort is literaly a hidden gem in the middle of Disney World. The best way to get there is to take the first right once you get off I-4 and see Nickelodeon Hotel on your right. You will drive through the side street and see infront of you the entrance to WorldQuest at the end of this road. At the entrance there is a security gate, which is manned by a guard up until 9pm. After that, the gate is usually open. However, the area is so secluded and safe. Our condo was in building 600, which definately was a walk to the main clubhouse, pool, and gym. There is a continental breakfast offered in the morning, which was limited to cereal, bagel, danish, juice, and milk. We stayed for 3 nights in a 3 bedroom condo, which was a great value for the space. The room includes 3 bathrooms, screened patio, kitchen, dining room, and living room. The kitchen had all utensils needed to cook including plates and silverwear. The sofa in the living room had a pullout bed. Overall, the cleanliness of the room, space, and service was EXCELLENT. The employees were also very friendly and accomodating. Regarding the $12 resort fee, it is stated on a brochure given to you at the time of check-in. Many people have complained about this, but it is per diem and not per person. So essentially if you had 4 people in your party, you are only paying $12 for everyone. Another negative opinion I have read regards the distance of some condos from the pool. This is a small inconvenience as most people staying there are probably in Orlando to visit the parks and not the pool. Worldquest is located in an area where there is limited eating places. However, there is a Super Wal-Mart close by and Downtown Disney is literally on the otherside of I-4, which offers restaurant, shopping, and nightlife. The resort is close to Disneyworld and a 10 minute drive to Universal Studio, Sea World, and Wet N' Wild. On the next exit from WorldQuest going east on I-4 is the famous Premium Outlet where you can save alot on high end designers and treated to an amazing shopping experience. My tip to all vacationer is to book your reservation on their website www.worldquestorlando.com. It was less than booking it on Expedia, Travelocity, or other travel sites. Also, rooms that may not be available on the travel sites is actually available on the home site for Worldquest. However, booking on the weekends can fill up quickly as we saw the place increase with guests by Saturday. The price for a 3 bedroom condo at the time of booking was $159 a night versus almost $200 when compared with Expedia and Travelocity for a 2 bedroom condo at Worldquest. We definately had a great time in Orlando during our trip in July '08 and would have never accomplished this without the great value, friendly employees, and proximity to the parks from Worldquest Resort. BON VOYAGE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, very nice!”
Reviews.Author: tannerSpartanburg_SC
Reviews.Content: Just finished spending the week at WQR. Pros: Very close to Disney. Very friendly people working there. Very nice rooms. Beautiful pool area. A good value. Cons: $12 resort fee Crowded breakfast area, with a limited selection. Is not close by any restaurants. Very overpriced food market. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, lovely condo, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: Bogeyw
Reviews.Content: Very nice, new property and you can't beat the nightly rate of $139 (Florida resident rate). We were there July 9-12 and chose this resort based on reviews here on TA and the proximity to Disney. We were very pleased with the 3 bed/3 bath unit in Bldg 5. Our building was a little bit of a haul to the clubhouse and pool, stay in building 1-3 if you want to be near the action. The pool area was great. Plenty of cushioned chaise lounges and a tiki bar with a limited but satisfactory food and drink menu. We had the continental breakfast each morning at the clubhouse. It was always fairly crowded, but they did a great job keeping the food coming. This was a big savings for us with 2 adults and 5 kids! The unit had laundry facilities and they even provided detergent. The only minor detail that could have been better was the A/C. It was very humid in the unit when we got there and through our first night, it was a little warm, despite turning the a/c lower. By the second day it felt much better. We drove to the parks and got to Magic Kingdom parking lot within 20 minutes and Disney Studios within 5 minutes. The location is right down the road from the Nick Hotel, so if you can't find WorldQuest on mapquest, just look for the Nick hotel and keep going! We loved the value, space and location and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to stay with Family”
Reviews.Author: Ranger00
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 bed/3bath suite for our family gathering & vacation for 8 people for 1 week. Kids loved the place. Lots of space, nice kitchen. Beautiful view to lake from patio. TV's in all bedrooms and living rooms are good. Good continetal breakfast. Only problem is internet is not working.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: shrek9
Reviews.Content: really nice place to stay and worthy of a much higher star rating. the grounds and room where spotlessly clean, the staff where very friendly. Worldquest is surrounded by trees so very quite area and only 1 mile from disney, loads of restaurants within a short distance, what more could you ask for !! This resort is " THE " place to stay in orlando and will be my choice for future visits.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Will Return Again!”
Reviews.Author: Beantowngal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in April'08 during peak school vacation time and this place was a perfect getaway from the craziness of other resorts around Disney. I have to say it was the most quiet and peaceful location I've ever stayed in Orlando - ESPECIALLY in view of the popular vacation week. Instead of taking time here to reiterate all the positive reviews I read before me (and agree to all), I thought I'd provide some information not mentioned in the previous reviews. You should be aware that WQ provides BOTH $free$ internet access using an internet cable (if you have your own laptop) and TV Internet Access (for a fee). Don't confuse the two. When you check in, your room key envelope indicates an automatic daily charge of $11.95 Resort Fee in addition to your room fee. This includes daily delivery of the USA Today Newspaper, Internet access for your own laptop, all local calls, use of fitness center, in-room coffee supplies, one fax per day, daily transportation to Disney and continental breakfast. Personally I think that's a great deal for basically $12/day in addion to the already inexpensive daily room rates! I also highly recommend your asking for Building 1 or 2 upon checkin (or even see if you can pre-reserve before arrival!). Those buildings are the closest to the pool area. I included with my review, a picture of their site map - indicating how the resort is layed out. I was lucky enough to stay in Unit 107 - PERFECT location and I will ask for again when I return! The Security Gate always had a guard every time I came in and out - and I was on the go every day as I was in Orlando on business. I always used the Marriott Towers and the Nickelodeon hotels as landmarks when finding my way back. Another outstanding feature I personally appreciated - was the many many electrical outlets in the unit. Something that was quite useful for me with all my business PDAs etc, but I'm sure would be helpful for families trying to recharge multiple cell phones, digital cameras and video cams!!! Air conditioning worked perfectly!! Kids will also get a kick out of all the little geccos (mini-lizards) sunbathing around the resort. Completely harmless creatures but are found EVERYWHERE in Florida! I even had a mommy racoon waddle past my screened porch one night with a little baby close behind! In closing, I simply don't understand what some of the fuss is about with some of the previous reviews. This place is GREAT FOR THE RATE and I'll certainly be returning either on business or with friends/family! You'll certainly enjoy it too!

Reviews.Title: “Even better suite than last year”
Reviews.Author: demigrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at WorldQuest last June for our Honeymoon, liked it so much we booked it again this year for another Orlando visit (same great deal through Expedia as last time). This time we were in building 6 in a two bedroom condo--and it was even nicer than last years. The bed was more comfortable, the furnishings were nicer, and the TVs were better. We were not within easy walking distance of the pool this time--buildings 1-4 are pretty much the only ones that are. No construction this time, though that may be temporary (a lot more buildings are planned). The free breakfast was improved from last time--they listened to feedback and spread the food and toasters out more. The crowd was bigger too both for breakfast and in the pool, but still quite reasonable. Parking was ample, even near the pool entrance. I got no calls trying to sell me a timeshare, which surprised me. The location is excellent for Disney--literally a 2 minute drive to Epcot. They improved the sign on International Drive S a little since last year, but it is still hard to see. Just remember it is next to the Nickelodian hotel (which is impossible to miss) and it is easy to find. Only downside was the distance to the pool from our building, other than that a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice for the price!”
Reviews.Author: mlbandanza
Reviews.Content: If you have read the other reviews, they are correct about the GPS. We had some difficulty finding the resort because it's not in the GPS; be sure to contact them for the cross-street before travelling - it will make finding the hotel a much better experience than we had! Upon arriving we were very surprised about how very nice the grounds and buildings looked - everything was new and clean! We were upgraded at the front desk from a 2 bedroom to a 3 bedroom suite, and although we didn't really need it, it was nice. Other travelers are correct about the distance to the pool from some buildings - we were at building 5 and it is quite a haul to the pool. The pool and hot tub were clean and fairly large and had nice chairs/tables/umbrellas and generally plenty of towels. The one disappointment was the unpredictable hours of the 'Tiki Bar' which we found closed around seven - and as the parents of 2 teens after a long day at the park we really needed a cocktail! The next evening we brought our own drinks to the pool and nobody bothered us. The 'Fitness Center' is pretty non-existent, with only a few cardio machines and basic free-weights. We also had trouble with wireless internet service which was down during our entire trip. The amenities of the suites were great. There were full kitchens including large fridge, stove, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, dishwasher, garbage disposal, dishes / silverware / cookware / glasses, washer/dryer. Master bath was perfect, with decent size stall shower, 2 sinks, and jacuzzi tub. Screened in porch had entrances from living room and master suite. Hopefully if we return we would like to see more/expanded dining options on the premises, a larger fitness center, better internet service and possibly a shortcut from further buildings to the pool area. However, if we choose to visit Orlando again, this would not inhibit our family from returning to this resort! I would absolutely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms at WorldQuest”
Reviews.Author: viridis
Reviews.Content: As far as I'm concerned, WorldQuest resort in Orlando is a tremendous value for the money. However, before you book your stay, you should realize that this is not a typical hotel. You won't find a doorman, a bellhop, or a concierge on the premises as you would for a nice hotel. There is no real on-site restaurant, unless you count the tiki bar and the continental breakfast. If you're looking for a full-service hotel, you should look into other choices. With that out of the way, let me explain the main reason you would want to stay at WorldQuest: the rooms. No, wait, that's incorrect - they're really condos, and they're large and beautiful. My family of four stayed here once before in a two bedroom unit; it had a full kitchen, a generous living/dining area, two relatively spacious bedrooms, and two full bathrooms. The master bath had both a stand-up shower and a whirlpool tub. Everything was modern, well-constructed, and tastefully appointed. This time we also booked a two bedroom unit, but since our room was not ready by check-in, they upgraded us to a three bedroom unit at the same cost. Just as beautiful, but even more spacious with three full bathrooms as well. The units even have a washer and dryer in case you need to do a load of clothes, and the kitchen cabinets and drawers have all the dishes and utensils you'll need. Each bedroom has its own television, and the living room had a nice flat-panel TV. Housekeeping did an excellent job each day - the place was always immaculate when we returned, and any used items (shampoo, etc.) were replenished on a daily basis. The resort has a small fitness room, with two treadmills, two elliptical trainers, an exercise bike, and free weights (dumbbells in various sizes). Also in the fitness room you'll find complimentary towels, and each exercise machine has a small video screen with basic cable. You have to plug headphones in to listen to the programs, but those are also supplied in the room (in sealed packages, so I would assume they're sanitary). The pool area is nice, with a tiki bar that serves drinks, snacks and sandwiches I believe, and a separate whirlpool. The pool itself is large, with fountain-type jets shooting out from the sides. Other than that, it's rather plain - don't look for water slides here. For that you would want the Nickelodeon hotel, which is across the street. In the morning there is a complimentary continental breakfast in a small dining area near the "lobby" (or rather, the rather small area where you check in). Breakfast consists of cold cereals, milk, coffee, bagels, danishes, and fruit if you get there early. Rooms have complimentary internet access; though I couldn't seem to get the wireless to work, the room did have an ethernet cord and a data plug. Once I plugged in the cord to my laptop, no problem. Oh, one other thing - did I say all of this was complimentary? Well, sort of. Be aware that there is a $12 a day resort fee added on to your rate (it is not included in the advertised rate). Location is another benefit of this resort. Disney parks are extremely close - you just have to study the map a little to make sure you don't get lost. I would estimate it's only about 10 minutes to any of the Disney parks, and maybe 15-20 to Universal. The resort offers a bus to some of the parks, but we did not use this service, as it forces you to adhere to the bus schedule. So, here are my final thoughts. We've stayed at many of the Disney resorts (from value to deluxe), and while you get the nice Disney service and a themed pool, the rooms are generally on the small side. We always end up spending our days in the parks anyhow, so the themed pool never really was a big attraction. For the same amount of money (or less), you can get a huge condo that is a hundred times nicer than a Disney room. I would definitely stay at the WorldQuest resort again - I love the space and comfort after coming back from a long day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Just Getting Better”
Reviews.Author: Blueboro
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Worldquest. We also stayed in November 2007. We were a party of 4 adults and no children. This time we booked through VRBO where we rented directly with the owner of the unit and paid less than we would have paid for a Hampton Inn. Last year we had a 2 BR unit but this time we rented a 3 BR / 3 BA unit and it was wonderful. We were in Building 1 on the 4th floor overlooking the pool. Since we booked directly with the owner we did not have housekeeping but not a big deal. We could have paid extra to receive it but how much trouble is it to make your bed and put dishes in the dishwasher? We also checked in at another resort a couple of miles away. Worldquest is in a great location. Just 3 miles from the Epcot entrance and 2 miles from Downtown Disney. The pool area is very nice and the pool is large. They have a "Tiki Hut" where you can order drinks and sandwiches and it stayed open until 9 PM. Just a couple of things to be aware of. They have free high-speed internet but it was not very dependable. Some days it worked and other days it did not. And, unless you want to drive or have a LONG walk to the pool, you need to be in Buildings 1,2 or 3. I was thinking I would not post a review because I want this place to stay uncrowded with reasonable rates. If too many find out about Worldquest it is sure to get crowded and expensive. For now it is one of the best deals in the Disney area and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “WorldQuest was good with one catch”
Reviews.Author: FiveOsKatie
Reviews.Content: We rented a three bedroom condo at WQ over Memorial day weekend (we were there for 8 days). The condo was beyond what we expected- three bathrooms! It worked out perfectly for our party of six... each of us had our own bed/bath area. The kids loved the pool and the place was very quiet. The grounds were kept up very well, and, overall WQ was clean and very nice. The continental breakfast worked out well for us and our kids... they loved the muffins. We had an issue with our room being left open (presumably by the cleaning staff) which was not dealt with the way we would have expected. Overall, I would rate this hotel ok and would recommend it... just make sure you use the in room safe and keep valuables at home. They need to learn that a problem should be dealt with and not ignored; which is why I rated the experience as average.

Reviews.Title: “Here's another A+ review”
Reviews.Author: tablefor3
Reviews.Content: First of all, before I forget, let me say that the place is SO easy to get to - it's just that the roads coming out of the parks are so confusing, it's very easy to get lost coming home, especially if it's dark. It's easiest to do with a GPS and probably worth it to rent one if you don't have it. Do not try to enter the WorldQuest address into your GPS. I did and it took me on a half hour drive to nowhere. The very helpful staff at the front desk confirmed that for some reason the resort doesn't show up on the GPS, but suggested using the Nick Hotel address across the street. Voila! No problems and a 5 minute ride home from the parks every night from then on. Secondly, I will admit that I am picky and kind of a snob about where I stay on vacation and I have to say that this place is incredible for the money. I don't know how they can afford it. We booked a 3BR/3BA for $219 a night and I thought even that sounded too good to be true, but went with it because we were traveling with a group and needed the space and because of the good reviews. A few weeks after I booked, I got a random email from the resort advertising a lower rate. I thought I had missed out since I had already booked at the higher rate, but when I called, they cheerfully gave me the promo rate of $149 a night! WorldQuest is just as nice as a place you would pay triple the money for, I am not kidding. It IS brand new, so it will be interesting to see how they keep it up over the next couple of years. If they keep it well maintained it will be one of the great value secrets of going to Disney sshhhhhhhh! P.S. There is an adorable pair of mallards that spend a lot of time in the pool. They are so used to people that they paddle right up looking for handouts. The kids loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: JennaVallejo_CA
Reviews.Content: I read some of the review about this resort. And some wrote terrible reviews. I just want to share that I had a great experience with them. The most striking for me is how honest the staff has been. All throughout our one week stay, we left all our electronic gadgets in this hotel, namely laptop, playstation and nintendo. Nothing got stolen! Internet connection is free and secure (using internet cable to attach). Breakfast is great, although no eggs or any meat. But what they have in the resort is fine. Free shuttle to destinations. You just have to be aware of the departure and arrival time of the shuttle. The view is great. It is very near Disney World. It's clean enough. Staff are friendly. In your room, you have all the cooking utensils you will need, plus a sponge and soap for dishwashing. For doing the laundry, they also supply the soap and softener. They did not have any frying pan though. We bought one liitle small frying pan for ourselves. For anything else you might need, Super Walmart may be the nearest.

Reviews.Title: “A complete gem”
Reviews.Author: Heatherbelle_13
Reviews.Content: Firstly, let me say that I am astonished by the negative reviews on this site about this stunning, newly built, immaculate, well run set of condos. I have never made the effort to post a review before, but I feel compelled to share my personal opinion in order to reassure people who are lucky enough to have booked already. - World Quest REALLY IS easy to find; use the garish green and orange Nick Hotel and the huge Marriot as your markers. Just beware the labyrinth-like Disney roads! - When we stayed (first 2 week of April '08) there were no queues, no trouble, no noise whatsoever. There were plenty of free sun loungers and free towels around the quiet, heated pool. - The condo was the cleanest, brightest, most modern and spacious I have ever stayed in. At no time were we ever asked if we'd like to purchase one. - Our condo was serviced every day; bins emptied, beds made, towels replaced, dishwasher loaded /started and extra detergent left for the dishwasher and the washing machine. If the floor became dusty/dirty there is a broom and hoover or you could contact reception to arrrange extra cleaning for a small fee. - The receptionists were incredibly helpful; on a daily basis they provided us with detailed printouts of the days' destination. - Breakfast did become a little repetitive. The solution? Two minutes down the road...Ponderosa's 'All You Care To Eat Breakfast' for $4.99 each. Myself and my husband stayed here with our two teenage sons. We absolutely loved this place and would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocked!”
Reviews.Author: roeshan
Reviews.Content: All I can say is that I'm so glad we didn't pay through the nose to stay in a Disney hotel. This place was the perfect place for our family. The resort is really beautiful. The rooms are modern (think sparkling granite countertops) and clean. The minute we walked in we knew we had scored. We stayed in a three-bedroom unit on the top floor. Each bedroom had a TV and the living room had an LCD tv with DVD player, which was fun to come back to after all day on our feet at the parks. The master bath was enormous and very luxurious with nice robes, a seperate shower , dual sinks and large jetted tub.. There was also a secondary bath, which was also very nice. I've read some of the issues with housekeeping, but honestly I don't get it. Their housekpeeing services are made clear, signs were in our room indicating what was included. I think this point is all about expectations. If you're expecting standard hotel housekeeping, then yes you'll be disappointed. Each day they never failed to remove the trash, make our beds, replace our towels, replace the toiletries, replace the laundry detergent (if you used it) and put the dirty dishes in the dish washer so we'd come home to clean dishes. I thought this was plenty adequate housekeeping, so I really don't know what all the fuss is about. I also never once smelled smoke while here, and we're very sensitive to smoke. The main advice I would give is to stay on a high floor, the top floor if you can. I can see how there might be some noise issues with folks passing by your room or even overhead foot traffic from other condos. We were in a corner on the top floor and never heard a thing (and I'm a really light sleeper). The pool area was fabulous, what I would expect at a nice resort. This place is perfect for a Disneyworld vacation. It's literally a 4-minute drive to Disney World, so don't even bother staying on-campus. Stay here for a fraction of the price. Our Disneyworld vacation was better than we could have imagined. And honestly I think our choice of accommodation had a lot to do with it. Having so much space allowed everyone to spread out and relax; we weren't on top of each other. All three of my children got plenty of sleep and so did we since everyone was spread out among three bedrooms. No crankies on this trip! And aside from the space it was a really beautiful place. We're planning to do WDW again in a few years and we'll definitely be returning to Worldquest.

Reviews.Title: “dont do it!!”
Reviews.Author: twinmommy1
Reviews.Content: First of all, be prepared to be rudely turned away until about 4PM for check in. Customers were lined up complaining about their rooms not being ready. Finally they gave into my complaints and sent me up to a room that the maid just began to clean. She called the desk and the moved us to another room. Five minutes after we got settled into this room, a family of five was using their key to get into our room. The same room was given to two guests. The floors were so filthy in these condos that we had to wear socks or shoes at all times. At the end of the day the bottom of your socks were completely black. The pool was nice, but not recommended for children under 4. The Floridays resort had a zero entry pool, this one was 3.5 feet and the kids had to all hang around the steps. The price and location was fabulous, and the gave you a free shuttle to Disney, but there were too many negatives to chang my rating. Oh, I don't want to forget the 2AM party on our floor by screaming, drunk teenagers. They were able to rent out rooms for their prom night. We had to call security and almost the cops.

Reviews.Title: “Non-smokers beware”
Reviews.Author: runnergirl1234
Reviews.Content: First, I would say that just about every review on this condo is accurate to a point. The place is clean, beautiful grounds, nice pool, etc. Housekeeping is okay - I mean I never really expect that much especially if you are renting a condo unit. The main reason I would not return to this complex is all the smoking. The ads claim this is a non-smoking resort and that is just not true. People smoke in the rooms (there are even ashtrays in the rooms), at the pool, in the pool, at the bar in the pool area - just about everywhere. Many times people were smoking in plain sight of Worldquest employees and nothing is said. It is completely unfair to guests who pick the accomdations based on the non-smoking policy. We could not even sit out on our screened porch at night because the people below us smoked like chimneys and the smoke came up and filled our porch and room. When I checked out I did mention the smoking as well as a few times throughout my stay - nothing done. So if this is an issue for you (I don't smoke and I don't want my kids to be around all this smoking either) then I would be wary about staying at this place. It is a shame though, because it was beautiful, spacious and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with worldquest”
Reviews.Author: jimmy1955
Reviews.Content: so glad we chose worldquest for our accomodation, much better than a cramped hotel room for the dollar. check in was a breeze the room we choose overlooking the pool was beautifull and spotlessly clean. the free continental breakfast was nice although limited in choice. The children loved the heated pool and jacuzzi. A very enjoyable stay was had by all, i highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Far better than some reviews lead you to believe...”
Reviews.Author: WorcesterWoman
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite at Worldquest for 4 nights in March, with 2 children aged 11 and 9. After reading some reviews I was a little nervous of what we would find, but we were very pleasantly surprised. Firstly location - from previous reviews, I was prepared to have trouble finding the property, but called reception on the way and was given very good directions. The hotel is across from the Nickelodeon Hotel, which is a huge and very easy to spot landmark - you really can't miss it - so I don't understand why people have any problems getting to World Quest. Parking is free. The property is very new and the neighbouring rooms to ours were not yet let out (still being furnished). We were in building 6, which is one of the furthest from the reception / breakfast area and the swimming pool. But we are not talking that far - you certainly do not need a car to get to the pool - it's a 5 minute walk along a completely flat path! There are towels provided at the pool, so you don't even have to carry anything with you! There was plenty of space for the 4 of us to spread out, a well fitted out kitchen, 2 bedrooms (master suite and twin room for the children) 2 bathrooms (huge master en-suite), living room, dining area, terrace - and in-room laundry facilities (including free detergent). The room had a safe, and we did not have any problem with valuables - just locked them away as you would always do in a hotel. The free continental breakfast was good - certainly adequate for our needs - cereal, toast, pastries, apples, oranges, juice, coffee. It was a bit crowded at peak times, but you could sit outside by the pool with your food which was a nice alternative to the rather more squashed indoor area. There was usually plenty of food available, but it was disappointing on our last day to see a family stocking up from the buffet with enough bread, fruit etc to feed an army - literally bags of fruit and loaves of bread being carried out to their car - such greediness isn't in the spirit of the complementary breakfast and spoils it for everyone. The pool area and sun beds were nice - a good way to relax after a day at the parks. The gym was small but adequate. I would recommend staying here to anyone looking for a nice spacious room / suite for a family - it has all the amenities you need, is new and well decorated, reasonably priced, and it's not far to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “beautifull resort, will be back”
Reviews.Author: honkydoryUk
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a superb 14 day vacation at world quest resort and have to say this is one of the most impressive accommodations I have stayed at for the price, everything about this hotel was perfect for our group of 5, I honestly cannot figure out some of the negative revues, housekeeping and free breakfast is basic but adequate. I expected trouble finding the place reading other guests comments and was surprised how easy it was to find, just look out for the nickelodeon and world quest is directly opposite !! We will definitely be returning and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Close To Disney”
Reviews.Author: TCBS
Reviews.Content: Probably the nicest and certainly the most expensive place we have stayed. Exceptionally clean which is important to us. There is an additional fee that I think the person checking us in said was mandatory. It was already included in the price we paid to Expedia. Internet service was included in this fee but it was not wireless. The breakfast was fine but it was Easter break so they stuggled to keep it stocked. The self serving room is small so there was a wait, esecially at key times. Room service was great for the most part. They put the dishes in the dishwasher for us, provided paper towels and laundy detergent. We did run out of toilet paper one day but were supplied a double portion the next day. The master bedroom was facing a main highway so there was a good bit of noise. The other rooms were fine.

Reviews.Title: “WorldClass Resort”
Reviews.Author: Big_BroLeuven
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weeks' stay at the WorldQuest Resort. After reading several reviews on this site, we were a bit apprehensive since they went from very good to poor over the months. None of such we experienced. After getting your bearings at the Nickolodeon hotel, it's really easy to find. Check-in is a breeze and very welcoming. The condo's are huge compared to a similar proced hotel room and all amenities are provided, including coffee, towels and even the odd box of Tide to do some washing. The "free" continental breakfast is a nice treat. Especially when you arrive late in the evening like we did and no groceries have been done yet. Although there is a little 24H grocery store next to the lobby. The breakfast provides hot and cold drinks, an array of toast, bagels and cakes and also cereals. Housekeeping are NOT obtrusive like described earlier on and are doing a good job. Sometimes I don't understand the other reviewers. If you don't like to get disturbed, just put the "don't disturb" sign on your door. There's also a safety deposit box in the bathroom, so no worry about valuables getting stolen. Use the options provided ! Overall a great stay, we even considered buying a condo for a while, we only renounced because of the distance (8h of flight).

Reviews.Title: “Loved Orlando's WorldQuest Resort!”
Reviews.Author: DCombs
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a week's stay at WorldQuest Resort in Orlando. We absolutely loved it! This was our first time in a condo resort. We were upgraded to a 3-bedroom condo upon check-in. My kids (ages 10 and 7) each had their own room and their own TV to relax in after a long day at the theme parks or the resort pool. The pool was never too crowded and the cushioned lounge chairs were outstanding. WorldQuest is in a great location to the major Orlando theme parks. We spent most of our trip at Universal. It was about a 15-minute drive. While it would have been convenient to stay at one of the hotels on Universal property, the price for WorldQuest ($139 per night) could not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but...........”
