Reviews.Author: lawheel
Reviews.Content: We just arrived back from our 6 night stay at the Worldquest Resort in Orlando. After reading all of the reviews I was a little nervous but was hoping for the best! I can see why people have problems finding the resort. You must turn at the Nickelodeon hotel. It doesn't look like a place to turn onto a street because it looks more like an entrance to Nickelodeon or something else. If you miss the turn you will end up in Disney and can't turn around for quite a while. We had been to Disney before and were familiar with the area so we never had a problem, but they should have a better sign up. However, you are very close to the disney entrance, within a mile which is great when you are going back and forth. We arrived at the resort at 4pm, and had to wait about 25 minutes to check in. The woman checking everyone in was alone and was also answering phones, she was going crazy jumping back and forth between the phone and people checking in. When I reached the front she was very pleasant, but informed me that housekeeping was behind schedule and didn't have rooms ready yet, even though check in is at 3pm. She found us a 3 bedroom and we went off to find the room. I had specifically asked for a 3 bdrm/3bth and wanted to be close to the clubhouse. However, our room was a 3bdrm/2bth in building 5 not close at all to the clubhouse or pool. You had to drive to get to them. I called the front desk and she told me that when you book the 3 bdrm you aren't guaranteed the 3bth, you only get it if it's available at check in. We really needed it with 2 teenagers and a tween! The woman at the front desk was polite and said she did have one available and would move us to building 2. Much better! The pool was right behind us, we could walk to the clubhouse for breakfast and the fitness center was very close. The fitness center isn't big but was very nice, had great equipment and each piece of equipment had its own tv built in. After settling in, we did notice that the door to our patio would not lock. We called the front desk and they sent someone to fix it. They sent someone immediately which was great since it was already night time. The next day we realized we couldn't get the lamps to turn on in the living room so again we called and someone came to fix them for us. Later that day we had problems with the lamp in the bedroom with the 2 twin beds and someone came right away to fix that. Some type of faulty switch. Although they came quickly and they were minor problems, it was a little frustrating to have to keep calling them to fix things. The room itself was nice. The three bedrooms were spacious & clean as well as the three bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable. The tile floors were cold and somewhat sticky, which we really disliked. The tv remote in the living room didn't work and we couldn't find one for my daughter who was in the third bedroom. The showers had plenty of hot water, but they don't drain well. All three showers in all three of our bathrooms filled up to your ankles or higher as you showered. The kitchen was fully equipped, although our refrigerator door didn't close well and you had to be sure to push it closed and hold it to make sure it stayed closed before walking away. We could have called the front desk about some of these things, but we had already called three other times as mentioned above so we didn't want to bother. Besides we weren't in the room that much. Housekeeping came and made the beds, gave you new towels and loaded the diswasher and took your garbage each day. One day we were there when they came (about 4:00pm), they just come in and clean and do what they need to do with you there. The pool was very nice and my daughter (10) loved it so much. It was a bit chilly this last week so she didn't get to go in much. It says it's heated but it still felt very cold to us! The tiki bar was good and the guy making the drinks was very nice, but his computer kept breaking down and he was working alone, so it took him 15 minutes to get me 2 drinks. The resort has a gated entrance, however, my husband and I noticed that no one was there when we came in at night, any night we were there. Isn't night time when you want someone there? The gate was just left opened when no attendant was present, strange. The continental breakfast was okay, but the area is very small. They had cereal, juice, coffee, bagels, danishes, & muffins. All in all we had a good visit, but we were a little disappointed with all the problems we encountered. They were little problems but when you are on vacation you don't want to have inconveniences like that, there are enough of those at home! When we go back we will probably stay at the Lake Buena Vista Resort Village and Spa. We stayed there 2 years ago and it was much better.

Reviews.Title: “Put a damper on our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Chenderson0720
Reviews.Content: Just recently, we went on our first Disney World vacation in three years. We were really excited and for the first three days, my husband, our son, and me all stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge (which, by the way, was awesome)! Then, my mom and sister flew in and we decided to stay at a different resort. We read reviews and saw that it was listed as one of "Expedia's Insider Selects" so we decided to book it. I guess the first thing that should have "tipped me off" that we were in for an awful stay was that it took over an hour to get into our hotel room. Although it was spacious and clean when we first got there, that was about the only time that it was cleaned. Maid service did not come in clean for over half of the time that we were there despite several phone calls to management. Then, on our last night there, maid service finally came in and cleaned sufficiently. They even gave us a rug for the master bathroom. I'm not sure why it wasn't there the entire time we were in the room, but whatever. I know that staying at this place put a damper on our stay. I am so upset about this stay and I would definitely not recommend anyone else to stay there. I still do not feel relaxed due to this stay and I am still furious. So, save yourself and your family the trouble and stay somewhere else. As my husband said, a lower end hotel would have been better than this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Terribly Run”
Reviews.Author: HowittFamily
Reviews.Content: For family vacations we regularly use VRBO to book our condos. We chose World Quest Resort due to it proximity to the Disney World Parks and it ability to easily accommodate a family of five. We also wanted a condo complex with a bit of a resort feel. I was already in town for a conference so I arrived at the location a day before my family. Stay USA managed the particular unit we had booked so I had to check-in at a location which was over three miles away from the resort. Check-in time was at 4pm and since I was an hour early the told me they could not check me in at 3pm without charging me for an additional day. I told them I would leave and come back at 4pm. When I got back I was informed that the computer was down and that they could not check me in until it came back up. After waiting in the lobby for an additional hour for the computer to begin working again they told me I would have to wait an additional hour since my room was not yet ready. Finally at 6pm I was given the key (singular) to the condo. I asked if I could have an additional key since there would be five people in the condo and I wanted to avoid a lockout situation. They told me that there was only one key per condo. I will say that upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised. Each of the three bedrooms had its own television and bathroom. The kitchen was well equipped with granite countertops and had a sufficient amount of utensils. The tile floors were nice, thought the carpets did seem a little dirty. The best feature was the patio door that could be retracted to expose the condo to a nicely screened patio. We also found the pool area to be a great feature. The pool was large and lightly heated for the cooler nights. There were ample towels and the hot tub was roomy. We also liked the Tiki Bar which had daily drink specials and a very reasonable happy hour. As predicted on our second to last day, the key was accidentally locked in the apartment when the wind blew the door shut. Unfortunately, the car keys were also trapped inside. We went to the front office and were told that they could not help us since our unit was run through a different management group. We called Stay USA and they told us it would be an hour before they could get someone out to us. After four additional phone calls and three additional hours a maintenance man finally showed up and asked us for our key to the unit so he could see what the problem was. We informed him that the key was locked in the unit and that was the problem. He looked at us dumbfounded and said if he had known that he would have brought the spare key. After an additional half hour of waiting he opened up the unit for us with the spare key. I called Stay USA the next morning to see if we could move our check-out from 10am to 10:30am. The told me that that would not be possible since they needed to get the room ready for the next guest. When I told them that I got the unit two hours late, could I get at least an half an hour of it back, the told me that policy required them to charge me one more day if I wanted to do that. All in all, it really is a lovely place. It is a great value for what you get and the pool is very nice and relaxing and not at all crowded. However, the customer service was so horrendous that I am not sure I would stay again. Hopefully Stay USA will get their act together because it could be the perfect place to stay for your trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definitely Go Back . . . . . .”
Reviews.Author: DawnBPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Worldquest Resort from February 15-23 - My husband, myself , and 3 boys. The rooms were beautiful and we had so much room - We requested 1st floor by the pool. We loved the location of the room. We went to the Super Walmart and bought snacks and drinks for our room. It was great to have 3 TV's in the room. The pool was beautiful - Never very crowded and there are plenty of lounge chairs for everyone. The bartender at the Tiki bar was crabby, so watch out for him. Speaking of the Tiki Bar - their hours are not very convenient. They open in the morning and close by 6 or 7 p.m. It would be nice for them to be open a little later so we could enjoy a drink after the park - who wants to drink before they go to one of the attractions? Ha! Ha! Another problem we had was most of the maids do not speak English and it was almost impossible to let them know what you need. The continental breakfast is wonderful if you are not too much of a big breakfast person. Bagels, danishes, toast, juice, milk, and coffee. We will definitely stay here again. Close to everything, very safe, quiet, and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Orlando!”
Reviews.Author: MissRis
Reviews.Content: We spent an extended midwinter break in Orlando, Feb 14-22. After extensive research via tripadvisor and the internet I happened upon WorldQuest with an incredible $179 a night web special price for a 1400+ square foot condo, with 3 rooms and 3 baths, full kitchen, washer and dryer. I have to admit I was pretty thrilled at the price considering you can stay at the Disney resorts for well over that for a one-bedroom. Upon arrival, any question about my choice was immediately gone! What a beautiful property - gorgeous. Check in was smooth, I had called prior to our arrival to make sure we would get the 3 bath option (some 3 bedrooms only have 2 baths) The gal at the desk tried to put us in building 5 (which I knew was removed from the pool area because I had read a review on tripadvisor about the resort layout). I mentioned that I wanted something closer to the pool and she found a spot in building 1 - which overlooked the pool. I was SO pleased! We had no complaints at all. The concierge helped us get tickets to Cirque (a must see) at Downtown Disney. They can also help you with Disney World tickets and many more. We rented a car so didn't use the shuttle. Their schedule is very limited - so if you want flexibility - don't plan on relying on the shuttle. However, the location of WorldQuest is only minutes away from DisneyWorld. Very handy. The continental breakfast was very ample. There are no restaurants on site, which wasn't a problem since we were out and about anyway and many dining options are close. The other hilights were Discovery Cover (the main event for us actually) swam with dolphins! A Midievil Times dinner and Epcot was a blast. The fireworks show took my breath away. Both of our kids are teens, and WorldQuest was ideal for us. They could swim, we could lounge and take advantage of the Tiki Bar which has drinks and a lunch-like menu. Josh provided great service! We will return to WordQuest.

Reviews.Title: “Great FAMILY Resort”
Reviews.Author: Super6
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a beautiful 5 day stay at this resort. The condos are new, clean, spacious and gorgeous. Our 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom condo had plenty of room for our family of 6. We have traveled extensively with our children and it always proves difficult to find condos that comfortably fit all of us at a reasonable rate. This was probably the best value we have come across over the past 15 years. The pool was beautiful and did not have the usual chair hogging morning ritual that you can find at many resorts. In fact the resort was very quiet. Our kids had the pool to themselves most of the time. The location is about 3 minutes from the entrance to Disney and about 8 minutes to Universal. Breakfast is not fancy by any means - cereal, bagels, danish, oranges, apples, juice, coffee but it is included in the price and certainly is convenient with children. We are early birds but I did notice a line up towards the end of breakfast (9am) one morning. This may be a daily problem which did not affect us. Our only complaint is that the bed sheets are not very comfortable. The resort needs to get premium bedding to really make this place perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Caution”
Reviews.Author: kitten50
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Worldquest Resort in Orlando Mar 1-4 2008...We had a beautiful 3 bedroom condo.The place was large, very clean and modern.We may have been the first to stay in this unit.Now..here's the bad stuff.He had brought his lap top so he could stay in touch with family and his office.First they don't have wireless so we went to the front desk to get a cord to use it.(Im not computer smart ,not sure what the terms are)We were on line then left it on the table to go for the day.Now we know were should have shut it down.When were returned the lap top had 800 searches going.Someone had hacked into the unit throught their server and was searching all his files...he shut everything down, contact the IT rep at our office started changed passwords and codes.He contacted the front desk and they said "Well we have been having server problems and have shut everything down." But for 3 days we couldnt get anyone from the resort to explain what happen...WeTHINK things are ok but who knows........NOW the rest of the story...yesterday we get a call from Visa....we had a charge for 1.00 got through our acct from the Worldquest Resort in Orlando..They said this is a test to see if the number is in use...then they charge huge amounts on the card...This was caught on time by the Visa people and all cards are now cancelled... Don't let the security guard at the gate fool you...THIS PLACE IS NOT SAFE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place in Orlando aea”
Reviews.Author: A1shopper
Reviews.Content: 4 kids, 2 adults and still tons of room in a 2 bedroom. We all loved this resort. It is quiet and off the beaten track. No rowdy pool crowd or free for all at the breakfast. People have complained about the breakfast but we were surprised you even get breakfast at most condos there is no free breakfast,snacks, drinks. We stocked up on water and oj and froze them to bring to the parks. It is not hard to find this hotel once you know it is right behind the HUGE Nick hotel. 5 minutes to Disney, and really close to a super walmart. As soon as you check in go to walmart and stock up. We cooked most meals and our kitchen was fully stocked. The pool is gorgeous and clean. We were in Building 2 , 2nd floor overlooking pool and hot tub. We experienced no construction noise or late night pool noise. One evening of 9 we had a loud group of people out on patio directly below our bedroom yelling and screaming we called the front desk twice and they sent security to rectify. One day our fridge shelf snapped out of place and the maintenance man came instantly and was very nice. Twice we had an issue with housekeeping once they never came and our garbage was overflowing and once they just came in while we were still there and didn't knock. Again in most condos you get no daily maid service and bring out your own garbage. The staff was great. We expected a computer to have access to and when we didn't they did our boarding passes for us the day before we left. The security gate staff knew us by day two and were very friendly!! Pool staff was also very friendly as he cleaned pool each morning and we sat and ate breakfast. We really loved this place would definitely stay again its gorgeous. Also, loved price $139 for 7 nights and $159 for the other two.

Reviews.Title: “Credit card #'s stolen”
Reviews.Author: massoth99
Reviews.Content: Stayed here and got our credit card information stolen by housekeeping. They do not take the cards anymore they scan your numbers and leave the cards so you don't know that they have gotten them.. Then after you leave they start to use the fake cards with your credit card numbers. Also housekeeping comes in your room with you in it that is when they do it your guard is down they come right in your room and you walk out and they are standing there. Also after day at Disney came back and found room door left open. Filed Police report and got no help also called property management group told them what happened and would never return calls. They make cards go to Home Depots, Lowes, and Best Buys and go through the self check out and buy loads of gift cards. If you look you will see that this is not the only bad review like this for this resort, they have a credit card theft issue at this resort.. DO NOT STAY HERE....They charged all together $15,000 on us....

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulwonderful
Reviews.Content: For my sons birthday, we rented a 3 bd/3 ba condo suite with a soothing view of the pool. Our other guests backed out last minute, so we were quite lonely in this very large space. It was clean, quiet, and comfortable. What more can you ask for, right? Well, they provide you with a continental breakfast, friendly staff, and daily housekeeping, too! The location is perfect for The Magic Kingdom and yes, the best landmark is the Nick hotel. Our navi system doesn't show this new development, yet. Let's see, I was very comfortable walking on the floors in barefeet. The washer and dryer were put to good use, but bring extra soap for more than 2 loads. They washed my dishes and were very prompt for additional requests. It looks like they have high-speed internet, although, we never had a chance to find out. Cable programming was OK, but please don't go there just to watch T.V. The pool is gorgeous for a standard resort-style pool and it offers towels and a tiki bar. I didn't realize about the towels until after I bought some at a Walgreens. Ooops. Everything worked as it should, in fact, I had NO complaints!! It was terrific! We were so tired after our arrival that we just picked up some frozen pizzas and snacks in their small grocery. I only wished there was someone manning a register there because you have to bring your items back to the concierge to ring them up. One more thing, the staff was so helpful, they just about held my hand in buying Disney tickets. I simply adore them, now, and hope to go back every 6 or 9 months. Now, where can I complain about the lines at Disney? haha Seriously, go to WorldQuest. It was so peaceful amongst the chaos that is Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “This was 100% not for us.”
Reviews.Author: Alice23Norway
Reviews.Content: The good things first: The apartments are OK, cleaning OK and the pool and pool area is wonderful. But - the place is in the middle of nowhere and there is abolutely nothing to do. Even the taxis could not find it. We (couple in their late fifties) did not have a car, did not want to, so we felt completely trapped. The "breakfast" was awful sweet, corn flakes, white bread with jam, orange juice and sweet cakes, things we never eat. The hotel shop did not have anything that could pass for bread or fiber cereals so we could make our own breakfast. People at the reception desk were nice, except for the day we left. We had to check out at 11 a.m., our flight to Europe was scheduled for 10 p.m. and I had the flue with fever so we asked if we could keep the room a little longer that day. They said they were fully booked and we had to pay for cleaning "overtime" if we kept the room longer. To us it looked like they had a lot of free apartments, but I cannot know for sure.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: LauraGCanton
Reviews.Content: This place was great. We have 4 children and were concerned about staying outside the park. We planned our trip spur of the moment and this is what I was able to get. I was very happy. A bit of advice: It IS hard to find, so look for the Nikolodean hotel. The shuttle service isn't worth it and not convenient at all. I suggest renting a car. (and if they let you pick one out, pick out a strange color to make it easier to find in the parking lot) Also --- My husband and I are world travelers and we never have trouble finding our way around foreign cities. We had so much trouble finding our way back to the condo every night. I wish that we had ordered a navigation system with our car, or taken one with us. The problem is that Disney tries to hard to make finding your way around. They mark destinations, but often do not mark streets on their property. This was very confusiong because the condo isn't far away from the parks. We ended up going way out of our way most of the time. The best evening that we had was when we left the park and had dinner on the Boardwalk at the Flying Fish after watching some magic shows outside with the kids. If you are buying your park-hopper tickets in advance, consider AAA. You can get discounts and preferred parking.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Amount for your Money”
Reviews.Author: reportingmom
Reviews.Content: Our famly of five stayed at WorldQuest in early November of 2007 for one week. We booked through our Entertainment Book and couldn't believe the deal. It was far cheaper than any suite hotel and the space we got just couldn't be beat. We stayed in a three-bedroom, three-bath condo not directly overlooking the pool but almost. Other than a few nit-picky things that aren't worth mentioning, it was a wonderful stay. Very quiet at night, clean grounds, clean units, etc. Our last evening there were a couple of groups of quite rowdy college-aged kids there for some marching band festival or football game, and they were pretty out of control, frankly, but I attributed the situation to the fact that this property isn't very near to completion yet and seems to be experiencing typical growing pains. Although we didn't call and complain, I was surprised that nothing was done to address their behavior. But that was a very isolated event, and the rest of the stay was just wonderful. The free breakfast was good and saved us at least $40 a day, plus a lot of time. The pool is HUGE and clean and seemed to be freshwater and not chlorinated heavily. But VERY clean. Our unit was great, lots of hot water (we needed it with three girls), wonderfully equipped kitchen, always enough paper products. Check-in/check-out was effortless and quick, and the gatehouse guys were so sweet. The property is incredibly close to all the parks. One chilly day, we had time to leave MGM early evening, get back and fix pasta to go, change into warmer clothes, not really hurry and got back to MGM in time for the Fantasmic show that evening. I have read other reviews on this property that seem parallel to mine, only a couple bad ones. As a family of five, it's very difficult to find a good place to stay with enough space for us all to relax and not be tripping over each other, without paying a small fortune. We got far more than what we paid for at WorldQuest and will definitely be back if we return to Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed by Worldquest Resort”
Reviews.Author: CBIDOG
Reviews.Content: I wish I could find something positive to say about my recent experience at Worldquest Resort. After arriving in the early evening, it was nearly impossible to find the "skimpy" sign directing us off of International Drive to the Resort. Upon arriving, the gates to enter were down and the guard gate apparently unoccupied. I pressed the call button....no answer. No guard and no answer, so I called the hotel and asked how can I get through the gate? About that time an older gentleman sheepishly poked his head out of the guard shack and proceeded to take down my information. Once in the lobby, I approached the desk and proceeded to check into our rooms (I was traveling with 3 other associates). The associate was by herself and began to check us in. The phone rang and she excused herself and took the call. Several minutes later she returned to complete our check-in.....that is until the phone rang again. Finally we had our two rooms and we headed to drop our luggage. My 2-bedroom suite was ok, however the 2 ladies we were traveling with were checked into a dirty room...dirty towels, dirty linens, etc. Of note is the 2 bedroom suite has one King bed and 2 twins...twin beds in a Resort? I called the Front Desk and explained what happened and was placed on hold.....for 10 minutes...until I eventually hung up and walked back down to the desk. Evidently if you call from your room you get put on hold, if you call from the outside you get serviced. I went back down to the desk and requested a new room and suggested it would be nice to have a 3-bedroom suite for the ladies since they were checked into a dirty room. This request was met with "I can't do that without creating a whole new reservation". I then asked to simply have a clean 2-bedroom suite and one was located.....in another building. I asked who the manager was the next morning and was told the desk associate would leave a note about the problem we experienced. The manager did call me back.....the next day at 2:53 PM. She offered to move us into another 2-bedroom suite....an odd gesture given the fact were already in a 2-bedroom suite. The next few days were met with no housekeeping service on one day, service on one day in which the towels were not replenished and no in-room coffee being replaced. Given the fact this resort charges a "Resort" fee, is it not too much to ask for a new coffee packet each day? The coffee pot sat half full for 3 days. Continental breakfast consisted of some pastries, bagels, Diet Pepsi and some other sodas. If you are expecting fruit, granola, juice of any kind, or anything resembling a Continental breakfast, you will be sorely disappointed. Check out came and our "Quest" for good service had come to an end......the journey will continue, but not at this Worldquest Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, Booked direct with Owner & got it for half price”
Reviews.Author: tennisstone
Reviews.Content: Just had a fantastic time with my husband and young son, loved the resort and how close it was to Disney Found the resort on a villa site and booked direct with a group of UK owners, we had to check in at another resort a couple of minutes away, but had my own key and no one could enter my apartment while we were out, They don’t offer daily cleaning but who needs it! I would rather save the money! Also with what has been mentioned with other reviews I felt a lot more secure without people coming and going in the apartment. You miss out on a few things like the breakfasts and papers, shuttle but again I was in a three bed Condo with full kitchen and we rented our own car. I was saving over $100 a day so I didn’t mind losing out on a few sodas and cakes, the unit I had must of been one of the best , top floor next to the clubhouse ,overlooking the pool and a view of the fireworks, my son loved the very large pool and I am glad we paid the extra $20 to use the facility Would highly recommend the place, if fact I wouldn’t stay anywhere else if I was visiting Disney again ( but if I was you I would try and track down the owners site for the best deal )

Reviews.Title: “OK but could have better”
Reviews.Author: Murrado
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at WQ in Jan 2008 for 12 nights so we have a pretty good read of the place. TIP: I was going to book a 3 bedroom condo at WQ off Expedia which listed at $375 per night. I booked directly with the hotel for $279 per night. A huge savings. Call the hotel directly and ask for specials! WorldQuest was a very economical solution, especially for a large group like ours (ie. 4 adults, 2 kids). Staying on Disney property would have bankrupted us so the value is definitely there. The three bedroom condo was spacious and well appointed. The property is newer, nice and has decent amenities. Our stay overall was satisfactory, however this resort fails on delivering on the small details. The devil is in the details! -When we checked in at midnight the room they sent us to had not been made up. The next room they sent us to was the same. And the third. We did not end up in our eventual room until 1:30am after a 14 hour drive that day. To add to the fun, the elevator on our buidling wasn't working and we had to haul luggage for 6 up 4 flights of stairs. Not fun. -Housekeeping did not thoroughly clean the rooms to a hotel standard. All they did was make the bed and replace towels. Any dirt that would accumulate in sinks, floors, carpet would just sit there until we cleaned it ourselves. -Many things in the room would not work. Room safe didn't work and needed engineering help. Batteries were dead in one TV remote and also on the keyboard for internet -We were missing basic kitchen items like a frying plan, towels, and other items. They were supplied after we called but it was an inconvenience nonetheless. -Cleanliness of the resort was spotty. For instance, the day after we arrived we noticed that someone spilled some Fruit Loops cereal in front of the entrance door in the landscaped area. We're talking like 8-10 pieces of cereal - hard to miss. It was obvious. 10 days later on our departure they were still there. It became a running joke when we would go for breakfast - "Are the fruit loops still there?" There are some positives: -The pool and spa are very nice and spacious. Contrary to another review I can assure you the pool is heated. -The Contintenal Brkft was fine and the fridge full of drinks was good to load up on cold water before heading out for the day. -Contrary to some other reviews I found the staff friendly and genuine when it came to addressing concerns. -If you are doing DIsney World the location is very convenient. You can drive to the themeparks from WQ in no time, even faster than most hotels on Disney Property. Plus the roads surrounding aren't very busy so there is no congestion. Everything you need is a couple of minute drive on US-192. You need a car as nothing is walking distance. Conclusion - if you have a large family or are staying for an extended period of time then this is a good option for you. If you are a family of two or four, and staying for only a few days I think there are better options out there.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Eijs
Reviews.Content: Late December we stayed for a week in the World Quest Resort. My family (5 in total) and my brother and his kids (three in total) in one spacious and clean 3 bedroom two badroom ground floor appartment. It also had a kitchen, washing machine, dryer, etc. which comes in very handy. Very good price, great location, only a few miles from Disney, SeaWorld, Discovery Cove, Outlet Malls, etc. What else do you need? Try to stay in building one or two, those are close to the pool. Only comments are that breakfast (which is included) is not as good as one would expect given the quality of the hotel (and gets a bit boring after a few days), there is no restaurant or room service (can get menus from delivery services though) and that a second pool should be build close to buildings 4 and 5. All in all definitely a great place where we would stay again next time we go to Orlando

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kylie71
Reviews.Content: My husband and two children spent a wonderful week at the World Quest Resort 8 - 15 Dec, 2007. The hotel and apartments are beautifully presented and the swimming pool is huge and was a big hit with the children. We stayed in a two bedroom ground floor apartment. It was nicely furnished and decorated. The apartment was equipped with a full size kitchen with dishwasher, microwave, oven cook top and fridge with icemaker and cold water. Having a large washing machine and dryer were very handy for our family to launder our clothes for our onward journey. The apartment was very nice to return to after our long days at theme parks and the surrounding areas. It felt very homely and was a great place to relax. The complimentary breakfast was lovely and was a real bonus. We have no hesitation whatsoever to recommend this fantastic resort to future visitors it is a great base from which you can explore all that Orlando has to offer. Enjoy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best for your buck”
Reviews.Author: ThichDiChoi
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay to visit the theme park. Lovely property. We stayed in building 1 of the 2 bedroom condo. Very convenient locate next to the breakfast area. Very nice pool. They have screen door wrap around the balcony which prevent mosquitos or insect fly to your room. It is beautiful room with fully furnish. If you need a sofa bed then don't stay in build 1, 2, or 3. Great housekeeping.

Reviews.Title: “Keep your money with you!”
Reviews.Author: winklewoman2000
Reviews.Content: I researched for months before we selected WorldQuest Resort. We had read reviews on Expedia and on TripAdvisor that were positive. It had everything we wanted and gated security. The room safe was not working and we "hid" my husband's wallet in our room for one day during our activities. The rest of the 9 day trip it was locked in our console in the truck. We discovered $160.00 missing from the wallet the night before we left. We reported it and still had to make several phone calls to the manager after we returned home. He agreed to get expedia to credit us $160.00 because of the faulty room safe. Expedia had not been contacted several days later and we had to call the WorldQuest manager again. He blamed his staff for not getting the task completed. He said he interviewed housekeeping without results. Ten days after we had returned home, our credit card company called to check unusual charges. The thief had taken our credit card numbers only and charged over $2,000.00 at a Best Buy in Orlando! We reported this to the manager to see what he had to say and he would not return our calls. The housekeeping staff ignored our "do not disturb" signs repeatedly and tried to come in one morning when we were still home. We tried to expain we did not need services. This was ignored daily. We know they came in daily because there was always something different. I hate feeling violated! Keep your money with you at all times! I wish we had been smart enough to know that a thief doesn't take the credit card anymore, all they need it the number!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation near Disney”
Reviews.Author: Mobo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom condo for 2 nights to do a couple of the Disney parks and were very impressed. It is just down the road from the Disney gates so very conveniently placed. It is very difficult to find but look out for the Nicolodean hotel which is on the left and take the road immediately on the left before it. If not you end up in the disney road network which is very difficult to get out of! All the rooms were very spacious, in particular the master bedroom. The kitchen was fitted with all mod cons including dishwasher, washing machine and dryer. We were in building 5 which was a short walk from the reception. We took advantage of the free breakfast (cereal, toast,bagels, fruit and danish pastries) and also the complimentary chips and dips late afternoon. They also provide cookies and hot chocolate in evening and free soft drinks and tea and coffee throughout the day. The pool area was lovely but the pool a little cool. There is some building work going on but we weren't aware of any noise as we were out most of the day. The only negative point is that it is built near a main road which isn't at all dangerous for kids but you are aware of quite a lot of traffic noise. We didn't get any time share sales people bothering us and the staff we dealt with were very friendly. We found the best price through octopustravel.com and I highly recommend it as a great alternative to hotel rooms.

Reviews.Title: “awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: lwalter1004
Reviews.Content: i stayed with my sister-in-law for 3 nights in a 2 bedroom condo & it was great!!!-very spacious, beautiful decor, and very quiet. It was alittle hard to find at first, but we manage!! Oh, and the twin size beds in the one bedroom aren't that great - I would definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice to look at!”
Reviews.Author: Bzulu
Reviews.Content: The grounds and rooms look very nice at first glance, but you can tell they are still in startup phase. Furnishings are adequate. We asked for trashcans numerous times, but never got any. Pool and hot tub area is nice. Pool is above average. Told the front desk that there was glass in the spa, but I don't think it registered. The breakfast was sparse but sufficient Internet access requires your own cable. Cooking supplies are provided. i think we may have been the first occupants of the room. Certainly, I believe we were the first to do any cooking. The location is excellent for access to all attractions, particularly Disney. Some may be bothered by the noise in the rear bedrooms from the adjacent highway.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Condo, but terrible service”
Reviews.Author: Petietunia
Reviews.Content: If I only had to rate this hotel on the condo itself, I would give a glowing review. But after dealing with the hotel staff several times with no resolution I would definitely think twice before booking here again. This place was recommended by my AAA travel agent. I read all the reviews and it seemed most people were happy with their stay. Upon check in I requested that our condo not be next to the A/C units I read about in the reviews. The girl behind the desk just smiled and gave me the keys. When I went inside the condo - I was impressed with how nice it was, but very dissappointed to see that the A/C units were right outside the Master Bdrm windows. I called the front desk to ask if I could be moved. They moved me to a condo in building 3 that wasn't next to the A/C units, but this condo seemed old and dingy (stains on carpet, outdated cabinets, stinky). I was disappointed. My husband decided to call the front desk and ask if we could get something like the first condo they gave us, but without the loud A/C units outside our windows. Although the place seemed empty we were told that they had nothing else and were unable to upgrade us to a three bedroom because another hotel had overbooked and was sending their guests here. My husband then asked the manager again "so even if we pay for the upgrade to a 3 bedroom, you still do not have anything?" Suddenly they had something and promised to send someone over with the key since we were already late for our dinner reservation and the kids were getting restless. After waiting at least 30 minutes, the person finally showed up with the key. We were quite frustrated that our plans were now ruined because it took them 1 1/2 hours to just check us in! The 3 bedroom condo was very nice, however it had no toilet paper and the jacuzzi jet tub did not work . Housekeeping also only came once during our 3-night stay and when they finally came they missed a ton of things (including giving us toilet paper). The heated pool was also not heated which made swimming in the evening after Disney impossible this time of year. We complained to the front desk about these things, but the general attitude of all was they could care less. We also tried to utilize the concierge for things to do besides Disney. The concierge barely knew anything (I knew more from my own research before we came). So if you are looking for a lot of room and a newer place to stay - it is nice in that regard, as long as you don't expect anything from the staff. As a side note, this hotel faces I-4, so expect to hear the traffic unless you turn on a fan!

Reviews.Title: “A very enjoyable resort”
Reviews.Author: SydneyHat
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids (8 & 11) had traveled from France to Orlando via Philadelphia. We had experienced long delays at Philie and arrived in Orlando around 12.30am and drove the 40 minutes or so to Worldquest Resort. We were exhausted but the 24 hour security gatesman and reception made us extremely welcome and got us to our apartment very quickly. We had a 2 bedroom apartment, with kitchen and all the comforts of home and yes, after 3 weeks in Europe, a washing machine. The resort offers a complimentary breakfast and a shuttle pickup to Disney. We used the shuttle the first day to find our way around but the resort is well situated. The shuttle has set return times that are a bit restrictive if you want to stay for the Disney night activies, so we drove the remaining times. We have nothing but compliments for the people, its location and facilities. For families we found the resort ideal and the kids gave it the 'tick' of approval. The gardens are beautifully maintained and the pool sparkling. They also followed up with an email on our arrival home to gather our views.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Value, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: graceleigh
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our vacation to Walt Disney World and we stayed at the World Quest resort. I had checked online and saw that overall it had wonderful reviews. I have to say if you are going with family or large group this has got to be the only way to do Disney. We were 1-1/2 from the disney gate. We were immediately upgraded to a 3 bedroom condo b/c the 2 bedroom condos were full- worked out great for us. My husband, 3 year old daughter and mother went so extra privacy was a plus. We heard no construction, the pool was beautiful, the condo was very clean and the free drinks at the clubhouse were a definite plus. We paid $159/night for 6 nights- this was truly a great value. We did run low on toilet paper and they did not replace (this was like our last day there) but overall housekeeping was pretty good. Check this place out- it's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Our Home Away From Home!!”
Reviews.Author: cindermom
Reviews.Content: We spent 17 nights at this resort in Sept. We stayed in a 3bdrm, 2bathroom. After reading all of the amazing reviews, I think I had my sights set a little high. It is not a sparkly brand-new fantasy-land. It is, however, a very nice, very functional alternative to overpriced, undersized hotel rooms! We (a family of 5) enjoyed the space that this resort gave us. The Master bdrm and bathroom were huge. The other two bedrooms (one queen, one with twins) were not large rooms, but they were great for the kids to either play some toys or watch cartoons. The king Bed in the Master was very comfortable and the room was huge! The Jacuzzi tub was enjoyed by all (plenty of hot water!) and the walk-in shower had alot of space and pressure. The kitchen was well equipped, right down to the corkscrew, cutting, board and bottle opener. Coffee packets, both decaf and regular, were supplied daily. Kitchen sponges. dish cloths, dish soap, and dishwasher soap was also supplied. The only downside to the kitchen was the colony of ants that resided on our counter, which was taken care of after a phone call to the front desk. (We were offered another room, but didn't see the need to move.) The Dining area was very tastefully decorated and served the 5 of us nicely. The Living Room was comfortable. However, another easy chair would have been nice. It was a tight fit for five on one couch and one easy chair. Overall, the resort was quiet (no construction noise) and well run. The pool area was huge, clean and nearly deserted. We sometimes had the whole area all to ourselves. The supplied breakfast was adequate. Muffins, Cereals, Danishes, Cinnamon Knots along with free juice, milk and pop. Chips and Salsa in the afternoon, and Brownies, cookies, or cupcakes in the evening. We were incredibly close to DisneyWorld, as well as many restaurants and shopping. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The common areas were always kept very clean, as were the grounds. The downsides were outrageous long distance charges, internet access the wasn't accessible, and a tv remote that had a mind of it's own. None of these were unbearable. We would definitely stay here again. It is a very tasteful, quiet alternative to some resorts or hotels that have neither the abundance of room or the comparative value.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Stay at the WorldQuest Resort”
Reviews.Author: Isanabel
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful 3 night stay at the WorldQuest Resort. Like other reviewers, we found it challenging to find at first, but once we found it, it's actually easy. The resort is off the main roads so use the Marriot and the Nickelodeon Hotel as your landmarks. The road that leads to Nickelodeon will lead you to the WorldQuest. WorldQuest is a gated community, very nice indeed. Check-in was easy, no wait and great service. Our room was a three bedroom, three bath condo which was excellent for our party. My mother-in-law basically had her own wing and we had the other (master bedroom suite) with a large bathroom and jacuzzi tub. The 1300 SF space with a screened in porch sure beat the usual (even upscale) hotel rooms. We had no problems whatsoever. While we would have preferred larger bath towels; brighter lighting in the rooms; and breakfast available after 9:30, but no matter - our stay was wonderful. Pool was really beautiful excellent, Jacuzzi really nice - never crowded. The resort is close to everything. The staff was very friendly; the rooms are spacious and clean. The pool is terrific- we enjoyed it day and night. The morning continental breakfast saved us time and money. The complex is quiet; a wonderful place to relax away from the crowds and noise of the parks. In the lobby's breakfast/snack area there is a refrigerator stocked with complimentary juice, milk and soda - how nice! WorlQuest does not have activities, no kid's pool (we have no children but for those who do...), no restaurants, no game room, no business center, etc. That was fine for us, but for those who may want more, it's good to know what is available. There was really nothing to do but relax by the pool or in your unit and enjoy the comfortable space. Overall, our stay at WorldQuest was great and we definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “This place is INCREDIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: HockeyAndTravel
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Labor Day holiday with my family (5 adults and 3 kids), and can't believe how perfect this place was for us. The three-bedroom unit was huge and we all had plenty of room to spread out. For about $200 per night on a holiday weekend, I am sure there was nothing else better out there. The beds were comfortable, the rooms were very clean. They have a nice continental breakfast, an evening snack, as well as one just before bedtime. The swimming pool is huge, and very clean. They also serve food and drinks out by the pool, which is so convenient. We ended up asking for late checkout on the last day just to hang out at the pool! The resort is quite close to Disney and SeaWorld. And while the units have full kitchens, if you want to eat a meal out, you will need to drive, there really isn't anything within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this place for your next stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as reviews would have you believe”
Reviews.Author: ripcurled1
Reviews.Content: Granted, this is a nice property, but the staff are a bit rude. Perhaps I caught them on a bad day, but I felt a bit alienated when I went to the front desk. I was in line for about 15 minutes, when I politely asked what the hold-up was, considering there were only 2 people in front of me. The front desk clerk said, "Excuse me, but we are busy!" So, I said, "Well, not really, there are only 3 of us!" Then the clerk gave me a dirty look and mubmled something to another employee and both looked at me. In any other place on the street, I would have knocked them out, but being the polite and savvy traveler that I am, I just said that they need not talk about me. There was no response. Room was okay. A bit musty. Overall, the room was okay, but the staff was miserable and some need to be replaced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...Can't beat the Value for Your Money!!!”
Reviews.Author: pkleinJersey
Reviews.Content: My three friends and I stayed at WorldQuest for five nights for our annual girlfriends' getaway. We are in our 50's & 60's and several have traveled extensively. We unanimously agreed that this is the nicest place we have ever stayed. We reserved a two bedroom unit but were upgraded to a three bedroom upon arrival as there were no two bedrooms available. The unit was roomy, clean and had three bathrooms...what more could four women want!!! Everything about this resort hotel was exactly as others have described it. The pool was exceptionally clean and was never crowded. The front desk personnel were friendly and helpful, and having rented other condo units, it was very, very nice to have daily housekeeping service. Shampoo, conditioner & lotion was provided in all bathrooms and the hotel provided one package of laundry detergent, fabric softener and dishwasher detergent. More was available at the small store in the clubhouse; however, we did not purchase any. I was told the price was only $1. We had an issue with one of the bathroom showers and it was promptly repaired. This place really knows about customer service! We were also very pleased with the continental breakfast. Each morning bagels, muffins, pastries, cinnamon rolls, cereal and fruit were available, as well as coffee, an assortment of teas, milk and orange juice. Each morning one of us would go to the clubhouse and bring back enough food for all of us. Additionally, the refrigerator in the clubhouse is always stocked with sodas, milk and juice and you can freely choose whatever you want whenever you want. We never checked out the afternoon snack but went down several evenings for the great brownies and cookies and decaf coffee which we brought back to the unit to enjoy. As previously mentioned, WorldQuest is very close to Disney property...just about 5 minutes from the Disney welcoming arch and, at the furthest distance, probably 15 minutes to Animal Kingdom. Getting to the parks was never a problem; however, getting back to WorldQuest always proved challenging. It seemed we hardly ever wound up back on Rt 536. I was glad I had been to the area many times before and knew numerous roads. I had checked out WorldQuest on Google Earth and knew exactly where the resort was, so we had no problem locating it initially. We always used the Nickolodean Resort as our landmark. Staying at WorldQuest made a great vacation a fabulous one! I am already trying to figure out when I can return! It isn't often one can say that they received the absolutely best value for their money, but at WorldQuest, it is definitely true!

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable”
Reviews.Author: Hockeyboy
Reviews.Content: A massive three bed suite on a virtually new complex lived up to everything we hoped for. The price we paid was outstanding value. Housekeeping was really good. Breakfast, afternoon nibbles and sunset snacks were a real bonus. Pool was large and clean. The building work is hardly noticeable (we were second floor, building 2). Its a great resort - near to all attractions - stay here! If I had the money I'd buy one!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place at an unbelievably low price”
Reviews.Author: IndianTourist
Reviews.Content: THis is one amazing place to stay when u r visiting Mickey Mouse. The suites are incredibly spacious and the quality of every thing is top class. the price is really value for money. you will have nothing to complain when u stay here. It is close to all the attractions and there is a big Walmart next doors - where we bought great swimwear. you really feel at home here!! we stayed two nights and is very relaxing. p.s.: when u check in, they will give u a gift certificate for a free drink at the pool-side bar - but it cannot be encashed on Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: tonyas1
Reviews.Content: This "hotel" far exceeded my expectations. For the price of a room at other hotels, I stayed in a 2-bedroom luxury "apartment". I only wish our stay had been longer and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: hairstylist1
Reviews.Content: I want to recommend this resort to everyone. Me and my husband found this resort online, and usually pictures are different when you actually see it in person. Everything that was on the internet was actually like that in person. The resort is a lot more relaxing than the other resorts that we stayed at. It is more of a family environment, my child was able to enjoy the pool without so many people in it. The only problem that we had was that our door had to be reprogrammed due to the key not working, we were advised that we should not put our key next to a cell phone or credit card... Staff was very friendly, my husband lost his cell phone and some nice gentleman found it and turned it in to the front desk they called us to let us know........how nice was that.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, perfect location & lovely unit”
Reviews.Author: girlpower_family
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit for eight days while we did Disney and Discovery Cove. Huge suite ... big enough that we turned the ensuite into a bedroom for the toddler in the crib. We stayed (2 adults) with our 3 kids (9 & 6 shared a bedroom with twin beds, toddler in ensuite ... see above) and my mom, with her own room with Queen bed. Master suite had King bed. Full size washer & dryer were very convenient. Every bedroom had its own television and lots of closet & drawer space. Huge pool area with hot tub and "tiki" bar. The best of all ... no sales pitch ... just a letter from the property owner on check in, offering more information if we were interested in buying. We booked through Expedia.ca and got a great deal for paying in advance. We really were impressed ... seemed really well staffed as well. Some have commented on the remoteness ... but its in a new development area. It was a five minute drive from WDW gates. The big landmarks nearby are the Nickelodeon hotel and the Marriott. Once you know where it is it’s not hard to find at all.

Reviews.Title: “Gem Of A Resort”
Reviews.Author: Taughy
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a fantastic stay at this resort. Great bargains available at present at this resort ,snap them up as the prices will get much higher when word gets out about all it has to offer. Wonderful rooms - loads of room. Really handy having washer and dryer in the suites - especially when you have kids with you. Super kitchen - huge cooker / fridge. Great pool, lovely grounds. The only negative we could find was that it is really quiet - don't go here if you want pool life or night life! There is no bar in the evenings - and even during the day service was patchy. However we were informed that one of the next building phases will incorporate a restaurant / bar - once that is finished it really will have it all. Previous posters commented on location - it is really handy for Disney - but I agree it can be hard to find but once there you will have no problem getting your bearings.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE! Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: debinct
Reviews.Content: We booked for 2 days, but within the first few hours, we knew we wanted to stay an extra day, so we booked it. Our family of 4 (2 teens) had a 2-room condo. It was the BEST we have ever stayed at. Everything was spotlessly clean and spacious. We loved the patio that overlooked the pool. There was plenty of room for everyone to have their own space. The teens liked having their own room and tv. The Master bedroom was perfect. The beds where comfy and there was more than enough storage throughout for all of our stuff. Loved, loved, loved, having the washer and dryer. So nice to not have to bring a bunch of dirties home. My husband thought we had 2 lights out in the bathroom. I called the front desk and someone was there within 15 min. It turned out my husband didn't realize the switch was under a towel. The tile floors in the main areas made it neccessary to turn the tv up as there was a small echo. We found that we had plenty of dishes. The water tasted bad, so we bought ice got bottled water from the kitchenette in the Clubhouse. The room staff was super about cleaning up each day. The front desk staff where very professional. The internet was down when we where there and they offered their computers for my daughter to submit her summer reading assignment. The guard at the front gate was very friendly and recognized us after the first day. The morning buffet is served out of the kitchenette in the Clubhouse. This is a VERY small room, so it resulted in a bottleneck of families getting their breakfast. I suggested that they set up the breakfast in the eating area in my survey. We only went to the afternoon snacks once, there was some nacho chips and salsa. My kids went to the eveing snacks twice, and there was cookies and brownies. Oh, a little advice, when you go to the pool, check your chair. they don't lay the chairs flat at night and condensation pools in the bend of the chair. If you are dressed, this results in a wet tush! (My dh's experience.) The pool is spotless, warm and well lit. We met some very nice people from all over. Orlando is very international with tourists. Each day at breakfast, we would try to figure out the languages we heard. All the local things where very close to the hotel, just give yourself a few extra minutes to get to Disney & Sea World because the Hwy. is ALWAYS busy! At this time of year, there is almost always a mid-afternoon shower. We usually went out in the am, afternoon at the pool, and if there was thunder, went up to the room for a bit.. The only solicitation from the hotel to purchase was a letter on the Master bedroom bed. I was very relieved because I have heard horror stories about some timeshare sales pitches. What you get for the $$$ is so good, I would come back again and agan to WorldQuest. This is SO much better than a hotel room. Deb in CT

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience at the WorldQuest Resort”
Reviews.Author: Imthequeen
Reviews.Content: My family of four (husband, myself, 5-year old, and 3-year old) just returned from a 5-day stay at the WorldQuest Resort. This resort is close to everything! The staff was exceptionally friendly and went out of their way to ask if we needed directions and if the housekeeping was to our satisfaction. The rooms are spacious and very clean. The pool is terrific- we enjoyed it day and night. The morning continental breakfast saved us time and money. There are also cookies and brownies at 9pm. The complex is quiet-we never heard any noise from any other rooms. This is a wonderful place to relax away from the bustle of the parks!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: Paisano3352
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for the price. Appeared new, very clean, and comfortable. We had five adults and one child in our group and truly enjoyed everything about the resort. Love the fact there was only tile and no carpeting, giving it a much cleaner feel. Gated and guarded entrance along with friendly staff.

HotelInfo.Name: WorldQuest Orlando Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 8849 Worldquest Blvd., Orlando, FL 32821
